verseText: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
mdText: In the beginning [God]([/person/god_1324) created the heaven and the earth.

verseText: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
mdText: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness _was_ upon the face of the deep. And the [Spirit]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) of [God]([/person/god_1324) moved upon the face of the waters.

verseText: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Let there be light: and there was light.

verseText: And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) saw the light, that _it_ _was_ good: and [God]([/person/god_1324) divided the light from the darkness.

verseText: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.

verseText: And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.

verseText: And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) made the firmament, and divided the waters which _were_ under the firmament from the waters which _were_ above the firmament: and it was so.

verseText: And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.

verseText: And God said, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry _land_ appear: and it was so.

verseText: And God called the dry land Earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he Seas: and God saw that it was good.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) called the dry _land_ Earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he Seas: and [God]([/person/god_1324) saw that _it_ _was_ good.

verseText: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, _and_ the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed _is_ in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.

verseText: And the earth brought forth grass, and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
mdText: And the earth brought forth grass, _and_ herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed _was_ in itself, after his kind: and [God]([/person/god_1324) saw that _it_ _was_ good.

verseText: And the evening and the morning were the third day.
mdText: And the evening and the morning were the third day.

verseText: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years:
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years:

verseText: And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.
mdText: And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.

verseText: And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: _he_ _made_ the stars also.

verseText: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,

verseText: And to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that it was good.
mdText: And to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and [God]([/person/god_1324) saw that _it_ _was_ good.

verseText: And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.
mdText: And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.

verseText: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl _that_ may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

verseText: And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and [God]([/person/god_1324) saw that _it_ _was_ good.

verseText: And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.

verseText: And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.
mdText: And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.

verseText: And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.

verseText: And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and [God]([/person/god_1324) saw that _it_ _was_ good.

verseText: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.

verseText: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
mdText: So [God]([/person/god_1324) created man in his _own_ image, in the image of [God]([/person/god_1324) created he him; male and female created he them.

verseText: And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) blessed them, and [God]([/person/god_1324) said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.

verseText: And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which _is_ upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which _is_ the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.

verseText: And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.
mdText: And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein _there_ _is_ life, _I_ _have_ _given_ every green herb for meat: and it was so.

verseText: And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, _it_ _was_ very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.

verseText: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.
mdText: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.

verseText: And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.
mdText: And on the seventh day [God]([/person/god_1324) ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.

verseText: And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which [God]([/person/god_1324) created and made.

verseText: These are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made the earth and the heavens,
mdText: These _are_ the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) made the earth and the heavens,

verseText: And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the LORD God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground.
mdText: And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and _there_ _was_ not a man to till the ground.

verseText: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.
mdText: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.

verseText: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) formed man _of_ the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

verseText: And the LORD God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.

verseText: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.
mdText: And out of the ground made the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

verseText: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.
mdText: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.

verseText: The name of the first is Pison: that is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
mdText: The name of the first _is_ Pison: that _is_ it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where _there_ _is_ gold;

verseText: And the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
mdText: And the gold of that land _is_ good: there _is_ bdellium and the onyx stone.

verseText: And the name of the second river is Gihon: the same is it that compasseth the whole land of Ethiopia.
mdText: And the name of the second river _is_ Gihon: the same _is_ it that compasseth the whole land of Ethiopia.

verseText: And the name of the third river is Hiddekel: that is it which goeth toward the east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.
mdText: And the name of the third river _is_ Hiddekel: that _is_ it which goeth toward the east of Assyria. And the fourth river _is_ Euphrates.

verseText: And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

verseText: And the LORD God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:

verseText: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.
mdText: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.

verseText: And the LORD God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) said, _It_ _is_ not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.

verseText: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.
mdText: And out of the ground the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought _them_ unto [Adam]([/person/adam_78) to see what he would call them: and whatsoever [Adam]([/person/adam_78) called every living creature, that _was_ the name thereof.

verseText: And Adam gave names to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air, and to every beast of the field; but for Adam there was not found an help meet for him.
mdText: And [Adam]([/person/adam_78) gave names to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air, and to every beast of the field; but for [Adam]([/person/adam_78) there was not found an help meet for him.

verseText: And the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam, and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) caused a deep sleep to fall upon [Adam,]([/person/adam_78) and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;

verseText: And the rib, which the LORD God had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.
mdText: And the rib, which the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.

verseText: And Adam said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.
mdText: And [Adam]([/person/adam_78) said, This _is_ now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.

verseText: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.
mdText: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.

verseText: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.
mdText: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.

verseText: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?
mdText: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?

verseText: And the woman said unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:
mdText: And the woman said unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:

verseText: But of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.
mdText: But of the fruit of the tree which _is_ in the midst of the garden, [God]([/person/god_1324) hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.

verseText: And the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die:
mdText: And the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die:

verseText: For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.
mdText: For [God]([/person/god_1324) doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.

verseText: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto her husband with her; and he did eat.
mdText: And when the woman saw that the tree _was_ good for food, and that it _was_ pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make _one_ wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto her husband with her; and he did eat.

verseText: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.
mdText: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they _were_ naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.

verseText: And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.
mdText: And they heard the voice of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and [Adam]([/person/adam_78) and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) amongst the trees of the garden.

verseText: And the LORD God called unto Adam, and said unto him, Where art thou?
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) called unto [Adam,]([/person/adam_78) and said unto him, Where _art_ thou?

verseText: And he said, I heard thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.
mdText: And he said, I heard thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I _was_ naked; and I hid myself.

verseText: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?
mdText: And he said, Who told thee that thou _wast_ naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?

verseText: And the man said, The woman whom thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I did eat.
mdText: And the man said, The woman whom thou gavest _to_ _be_ with me, she gave me of the tree, and I did eat.

verseText: And the LORD God said unto the woman, What is this that thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I did eat.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) said unto the woman, What _is_ this _that_ thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I did eat.

verseText: And the LORD God said unto the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) said unto the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou _art_ cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:

verseText: And I will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed; it shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.
mdText: And I will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed; it shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.

verseText: Unto the woman he said, I will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children; and thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.
mdText: Unto the woman he said, I will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children; and thy desire _shall_ _be_ to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.

verseText: And unto Adam he said, Because thou hast hearkened unto the voice of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree, of which I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt not eat of it: cursed is the ground for thy sake; in sorrow shalt thou eat of it all the days of thy life;
mdText: And unto [Adam]([/person/adam_78) he said, Because thou hast hearkened unto the voice of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree, of which I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt not eat of it: cursed _is_ the ground for thy sake; in sorrow shalt thou eat _of_ it all the days of thy life;

verseText: Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;
mdText: Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;

verseText: In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.
mdText: In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou _art,_ and unto dust shalt thou return.

verseText: And Adam called his wife’s name Eve; because she was the mother of all living.
mdText: And [Adam]([/person/adam_78) called his wife’s name [Eve;]([/person/eve_1231) because she was the mother of all living.

verseText: Unto Adam also and to his wife did the LORD God make coats of skins, and clothed them.
mdText: Unto [Adam]([/person/adam_78) also and to his wife did the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) make coats of skins, and clothed them.

verseText: And the LORD God said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil: and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever:
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil: and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever:

verseText: Therefore the LORD God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.
mdText: Therefore the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.

verseText: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.
mdText: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.

verseText: And Adam knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare Cain, and said, I have gotten a man from the LORD.
mdText: And [Adam]([/person/adam_78) knew [Eve]([/person/eve_1231) his wife; and she conceived, and bare [Cain,]([/person/cain_533) and said, I have gotten a man from the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
mdText: And she again bare his brother [Abel.]([/person/abel_13) And [Abel]([/person/abel_13) was a keeper of sheep, but [Cain]([/person/cain_533) was a tiller of the ground.

verseText: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.
mdText: And in process of time it came to pass, that [Cain]([/person/cain_533) brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the LORD had respect unto Abel and to his offering:
mdText: And [Abel,]([/person/abel_13) he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) had respect unto [Abel]([/person/abel_13) and to his offering:

verseText: But unto Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.
mdText: But unto [Cain]([/person/cain_533) and to his offering he had not respect. And [Cain]([/person/cain_533) was very wroth, and his countenance fell.

verseText: And the LORD said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said unto [Cain,]([/person/cain_533) Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?

verseText: If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And unto thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.
mdText: If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And unto thee _shall_ _be_ his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.

verseText: And Cain talked with Abel his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.
mdText: And [Cain]([/person/cain_533) talked with [Abel]([/person/abel_13) his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that [Cain]([/person/cain_533) rose up against [Abel]([/person/abel_13) his brother, and slew him.

verseText: And the LORD said unto Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not: Am I my brother’s keeper?
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said unto [Cain,]([/person/cain_533) Where _is_ [Abel]([/person/abel_13) thy brother? And he said, I know not: _Am_ I my brother’s keeper?

verseText: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother’s blood crieth unto me from the ground.
mdText: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother’s blood crieth unto me from the ground.

verseText: And now art thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother’s blood from thy hand;
mdText: And now _art_ thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother’s blood from thy hand;

verseText: When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.
mdText: When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.

verseText: And Cain said unto the LORD, My punishment is greater than I can bear.
mdText: And [Cain]([/person/cain_533) said unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) My punishment _is_ greater than I can bear.

verseText: Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass, that every one that findeth me shall slay me.
mdText: Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass, _that_ every one that findeth me shall slay me.

verseText: And the LORD said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the LORD set a mark upon Cain, lest any finding him should kill him.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth [Cain,]([/person/cain_533) vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) set a mark upon [Cain,]([/person/cain_533) lest any finding him should kill him.

verseText: And Cain went out from the presence of the LORD, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.
mdText: And [Cain]([/person/cain_533) went out from the presence of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.

verseText: And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.
mdText: And [Cain]([/person/cain_533) knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare [Enoch:]([/person/enoch_1191) and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, [Enoch.]([/person/enoch_1191)

verseText: And unto Enoch was born Irad: and Irad begat Mehujael: and Mehujael begat Methusael: and Methusael begat Lamech.
mdText: And unto [Enoch]([/person/enoch_1191) was born [Irad:]([/person/irad_611) and [Irad]([/person/irad_611) begat [Mehujael:]([/person/mehujael_1983) and [Mehujael]([/person/mehujael_1983) begat [Methusael:]([/person/methusael_2041) and [Methusael]([/person/methusael_2041) begat [Lamech.]([/person/lamech_1808)

verseText: And Lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
mdText: And [Lamech]([/person/lamech_1808) took unto him two wives: the name of the one _was_ [Adah,]([/person/adah_69) and the name of the other [Zillah.]([/person/zillah_3080)

verseText: And Adah bare Jabal: he was the father of such as dwell in tents, and of such as have cattle.
mdText: And [Adah]([/person/adah_69) bare [Jabal:]([/person/jabal_673) he was the father of such as dwell in tents, and _of_ _such_ _as_ _have_ cattle.

verseText: And his brother’s name was Jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.
mdText: And his brother’s name _was_ [Jubal:]([/person/jubal_1748) he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.

verseText: And Zillah, she also bare Tubalcain, an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of Tubalcain was Naamah.
mdText: And [Zillah,]([/person/zillah_3080) she also bare [Tubal-cain,]([/person/tubal-cain_2884) an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of [Tubal-cain]([/person/tubal-cain_2884) _was_ [Naamah.]([/person/naamah_2118)

verseText: And Lamech said unto his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice; ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech: for I have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt.
mdText: And [Lamech]([/person/lamech_1808) said unto his wives, [Adah]([/person/adah_69) and [Zillah,]([/person/zillah_3080) Hear my voice; ye wives of [Lamech,]([/person/lamech_1808) hearken unto my speech: for I have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt.

verseText: If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold.
mdText: If [Cain]([/person/cain_533) shall be avenged sevenfold, truly [Lamech]([/person/lamech_1808) seventy and sevenfold.

verseText: And Adam knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name Seth: For God, said she, hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel, whom Cain slew.
mdText: And [Adam]([/person/adam_78) knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name [Seth:]([/person/seth_2504) For [God,]([/person/god_1324) _said_ _she,_ hath appointed me another seed instead of [Abel,]([/person/abel_13) whom [Cain]([/person/cain_533) slew.

verseText: And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enos: then began men to call upon the name of the LORD.
mdText: And to [Seth,]([/person/seth_2504) to him also there was born a son; and he called his name [Enos:]([/person/enos_1193) then began men to call upon the name of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made he him;
mdText: This _is_ the book of the generations of [Adam.]([/person/adam_78) In the day that [God]([/person/god_1324) created man, in the likeness of [God]([/person/god_1324) made he him;

verseText: Male and female created he them; and blessed them, and called their name Adam, in the day when they were created.
mdText: Male and female created he them; and blessed them, and called their name [Adam,]([/person/adam_78) in the day when they were created.

verseText: And Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name Seth:
mdText: And [Adam]([/person/adam_78) lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat _a_ _son_ in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name [Seth:]([/person/seth_2504)

verseText: And the days of Adam after he had begotten Seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters:
mdText: And the days of [Adam]([/person/adam_78) after he had begotten [Seth]([/person/seth_2504) were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters:

verseText: And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.
mdText: And all the days that [Adam]([/person/adam_78) lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.

verseText: And Seth lived an hundred and five years, and begat Enos:
mdText: And [Seth]([/person/seth_2504) lived an hundred and five years, and begat [Enos:]([/person/enos_1193)

verseText: And Seth lived after he begat Enos eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters:
mdText: And [Seth]([/person/seth_2504) lived after he begat [Enos]([/person/enos_1193) eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters:

verseText: And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.
mdText: And all the days of [Seth]([/person/seth_2504) were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.

verseText: And Enos lived ninety years, and begat Cainan:
mdText: And [Enos]([/person/enos_1193) lived ninety years, and begat [Cainan:]([/person/cainan_534)

verseText: And Enos lived after he begat Cainan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters:
mdText: And [Enos]([/person/enos_1193) lived after he begat [Cainan]([/person/cainan_534) eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters:

verseText: And all the days of Enos were nine hundred and five years: and he died.
mdText: And all the days of [Enos]([/person/enos_1193) were nine hundred and five years: and he died.

verseText: And Cainan lived seventy years, and begat Mahalaleel:
mdText: And [Cainan]([/person/cainan_534) lived seventy years, and begat [Mahalaleel:]([/person/mahalaleel_1885)

verseText: And Cainan lived after he begat Mahalaleel eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters:
mdText: And [Cainan]([/person/cainan_534) lived after he begat [Mahalaleel]([/person/mahalaleel_1885) eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters:

verseText: And all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.
mdText: And all the days of [Cainan]([/person/cainan_534) were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.

verseText: And Mahalaleel lived sixty and five years, and begat Jared:
mdText: And [Mahalaleel]([/person/mahalaleel_1885) lived sixty and five years, and begat [Jared:]([/person/jared_730)

verseText: And Mahalaleel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:
mdText: And [Mahalaleel]([/person/mahalaleel_1885) lived after he begat [Jared]([/person/jared_730) eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:

verseText: And all the days of Mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.
mdText: And all the days of [Mahalaleel]([/person/mahalaleel_1885) were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.

verseText: And Jared lived an hundred sixty and two years, and he begat Enoch:
mdText: And [Jared]([/person/jared_730) lived an hundred sixty and two years, and he begat [Enoch:]([/person/enoch_1192)

verseText: And Jared lived after he begat Enoch eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
mdText: And [Jared]([/person/jared_730) lived after he begat [Enoch]([/person/enoch_1192) eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:

verseText: And all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died.
mdText: And all the days of [Jared]([/person/jared_730) were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died.

verseText: And Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat Methuselah:
mdText: And [Enoch]([/person/enoch_1192) lived sixty and five years, and begat [Methuselah:]([/person/methuselah_2042)

verseText: And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
mdText: And [Enoch]([/person/enoch_1192) walked with [God]([/person/god_1324) after he begat [Methuselah]([/person/methuselah_2042) three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:

verseText: And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years:
mdText: And all the days of [Enoch]([/person/enoch_1192) were three hundred sixty and five years:

verseText: And Enoch walked with God: and he was not; for God took him.
mdText: And [Enoch]([/person/enoch_1192) walked with [God:]([/person/god_1324) and he _was_ not; for [God]([/person/god_1324) took him.

verseText: And Methuselah lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat Lamech:
mdText: And [Methuselah]([/person/methuselah_2042) lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat [Lamech:]([/person/lamech_1809)

verseText: And Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters:
mdText: And [Methuselah]([/person/methuselah_2042) lived after he begat [Lamech]([/person/lamech_1809) seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters:

verseText: And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died.
mdText: And all the days of [Methuselah]([/person/methuselah_2042) were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died.

verseText: And Lamech lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son:
mdText: And [Lamech]([/person/lamech_1809) lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son:

verseText: And he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the LORD hath cursed.
mdText: And he called his name [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) saying, This _same_ shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath cursed.

verseText: And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:
mdText: And [Lamech]([/person/lamech_1809) lived after he begat [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:

verseText: And all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died.
mdText: And all the days of [Lamech]([/person/lamech_1809) were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died.

verseText: And Noah was five hundred years old: and Noah begat Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
mdText: And [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) was five hundred years old: and [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) begat [Shem,]([/person/shem_2613) [Ham,]([/person/ham_1359) and [Japheth.]([/person/japheth_726)

verseText: And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born unto them,
mdText: And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born unto them,
eventsDescribed: God decides to destroy every living thing

verseText: That the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives of all which they chose.
mdText: That the sons of [God]([/person/god_1324) saw the daughters of men that they _were_ fair; and they took them wives of all which they chose.
eventsDescribed: God decides to destroy every living thing

verseText: And the LORD said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also _is_ flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.
eventsDescribed: God decides to destroy every living thing

verseText: There were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, and they bare children to them, the same became mighty men which were of old, men of renown.
mdText: There were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when the sons of [God]([/person/god_1324) came in unto the daughters of men, and they bare _children_ to them, the same _became_ mighty men which _were_ of old, men of renown.
eventsDescribed: God decides to destroy every living thing

verseText: And GOD saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.
mdText: And [GOD]([/person/god_1324) saw that the wickedness of man _was_ great in the earth, and _that_ every imagination of the thoughts of his heart _was_ only evil continually.
eventsDescribed: God decides to destroy every living thing

verseText: And it repented the LORD that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.
mdText: And it repented the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.
eventsDescribed: God decides to destroy every living thing

verseText: And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth; both man, and beast, and the creeping thing, and the fowls of the air; for it repenteth me that I have made them.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth; both man, and beast, and the creeping thing, and the fowls of the air; for it repenteth me that I have made them.
eventsDescribed: God decides to destroy every living thing

verseText: But Noah found grace in the eyes of the LORD.
mdText: But [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) found grace in the eyes of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man and perfect in his generations, and Noah walked with God.
mdText: These _are_ the generations of [Noah:]([/person/noah_2210) [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) was a just man _and_ perfect in his generations, _and_ [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) walked with [God.]([/person/god_1324)
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
mdText: And [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) begat three sons, [Shem,]([/person/shem_2613) [Ham,]([/person/ham_1359) and [Japheth.]([/person/japheth_726)
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: The earth also was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.
mdText: The earth also was corrupt before [God,]([/person/god_1324) and the earth was filled with violence.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: And God looked upon the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) looked upon the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: And God said unto Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said unto [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) The end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.
mdText: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: And this is the fashion which thou shalt make it of: The length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.
mdText: And this _is_ _the_ _fashion_ which thou shalt make it _of:_ The length of the ark _shall_ _be_ three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: A window shalt thou make to the ark, and in a cubit shalt thou finish it above; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side thereof; with lower, second, and third stories shalt thou make it.
mdText: A window shalt thou make to the ark, and in a cubit shalt thou finish it above; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side thereof; _with_ lower, second, and third _stories_ shalt thou make it.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.
mdText: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein _is_ the breath of life, from under heaven; _and_ every thing that _is_ in the earth shall die.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: But with thee will I establish my covenant; and thou shalt come into the ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons’ wives with thee.
mdText: But with thee will I establish my covenant; and thou shalt come into the ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons’ wives with thee.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep them alive with thee; they shall be male and female.
mdText: And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every _sort_ shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep _them_ alive with thee; they shall be male and female.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: Of fowls after their kind, and of cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after his kind, two of every sort shall come unto thee, to keep them alive.
mdText: Of fowls after their kind, and of cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after his kind, two of every _sort_ shall come unto thee, to keep _them_ alive.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: And take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and thou shalt gather it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.
mdText: And take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and thou shalt gather _it_ to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he.
mdText: Thus did [Noah;]([/person/noah_2210) according to all that [God]([/person/god_1324) commanded him, so did he.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: And the LORD said unto Noah, Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before me in this generation.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said unto [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before me in this generation.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that are not clean by two, the male and his female.
mdText: Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that _are_ not clean by two, the male and his female.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: Of fowls also of the air by sevens, the male and the female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.
mdText: Of fowls also of the air by sevens, the male and the female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living substance that I have made will I destroy from off the face of the earth.
mdText: For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living substance that I have made will I destroy from off the face of the earth.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: And Noah did according unto all that the LORD commanded him.
mdText: And [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) did according unto all that the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) commanded him.
eventsDescribed: God instructs Noah to build the ark

verseText: And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.
mdText: And [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) _was_ six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.

verseText: And Noah went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.
mdText: And [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.

verseText: Of clean beasts, and of beasts that are not clean, and of fowls, and of every thing that creepeth upon the earth,
mdText: Of clean beasts, and of beasts that _are_ not clean, and of fowls, and of every thing that creepeth upon the earth,

verseText: There went in two and two unto Noah into the ark, the male and the female, as God had commanded Noah.
mdText: There went in two and two unto [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) into the ark, the male and the female, as [God]([/person/god_1324) had commanded [Noah.]([/person/noah_2210)

verseText: And it came to pass after seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.
mdText: And it came to pass after seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.

verseText: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.
mdText: In the six hundredth year of [Noah’s]([/person/noah_2210) life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.

verseText: And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
mdText: And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.

verseText: In the selfsame day entered Noah, and Shem, and Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah’s wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark;
mdText: In the selfsame day entered [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) and [Shem,]([/person/shem_2613) and [Ham,]([/person/ham_1359) and [Japheth,]([/person/japheth_726) the sons of [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) and [Noah’s]([/person/noah_2210) wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark;

verseText: They, and every beast after his kind, and all the cattle after their kind, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind, and every fowl after his kind, every bird of every sort.
mdText: They, and every beast after his kind, and all the cattle after their kind, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind, and every fowl after his kind, every bird of every sort.

verseText: And they went in unto Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh, wherein is the breath of life.
mdText: And they went in unto [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) into the ark, two and two of all flesh, wherein _is_ the breath of life.

verseText: And they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him: and the LORD shut him in.
mdText: And they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as [God]([/person/god_1324) had commanded him: and the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shut him in.

verseText: And the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the waters increased, and bare up the ark, and it was lift up above the earth.
mdText: And the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the waters increased, and bare up the ark, and it was lift up above the earth.

verseText: And the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.
mdText: And the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.

verseText: And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills, that were under the whole heaven, were covered.
mdText: And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills, that _were_ under the whole heaven, were covered.

verseText: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.
mdText: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.

verseText: And all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of beast, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, and every man:
mdText: And all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of beast, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, and every man:

verseText: All in whose nostrils was the breath of life, of all that was in the dry land, died.
mdText: All in whose nostrils _was_ the breath of life, of all that _was_ in the dry _land,_ died.

verseText: And every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and the creeping things, and the fowl of the heaven; and they were destroyed from the earth: and Noah only remained alive, and they that were with him in the ark.
mdText: And every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and the creeping things, and the fowl of the heaven; and they were destroyed from the earth: and [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) only remained _alive,_ and they that _were_ with him in the ark.

verseText: And the waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days.
mdText: And the waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days.

verseText: And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that was with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters asswaged;
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) remembered [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) and every living thing, and all the cattle that _was_ with him in the ark: and [God]([/person/god_1324) made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters asswaged;

verseText: The fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;
mdText: The fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;

verseText: And the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.
mdText: And the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.

verseText: And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.
mdText: And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of [Ararat.](/place/ararat_86)

verseText: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.
mdText: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth _month,_ on the first _day_ of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.

verseText: And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made:
mdText: And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) opened the window of the ark which he had made:

verseText: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.
mdText: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.

verseText: Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;
mdText: Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;

verseText: But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark, for the waters were on the face of the whole earth: then he put forth his hand, and took her, and pulled her in unto him into the ark.
mdText: But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark, for the waters _were_ on the face of the whole earth: then he put forth his hand, and took her, and pulled her in unto him into the ark.

verseText: And he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark;
mdText: And he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark;

verseText: And the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth was an olive leaf pluckt off: so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.
mdText: And the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth _was_ an olive leaf pluckt off: so [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.

verseText: And he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; which returned not again unto him any more.
mdText: And he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; which returned not again unto him any more.

verseText: And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth: and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and, behold, the face of the ground was dry.
mdText: And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first _month,_ the first _day_ of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth: and [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and, behold, the face of the ground was dry.

verseText: And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.
mdText: And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.

verseText: And God spake unto Noah, saying,
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) spake unto [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) saying,

verseText: Go forth of the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons’ wives with thee.
mdText: Go forth of the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons’ wives with thee.

verseText: Bring forth with thee every living thing that is with thee, of all flesh, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.
mdText: Bring forth with thee every living thing that _is_ with thee, of all flesh, _both_ of fowl, and of cattle, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.

verseText: And Noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him:
mdText: And [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him:

verseText: Every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl, and whatsoever creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went forth out of the ark.
mdText: Every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl, _and_ whatsoever creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went forth out of the ark.

verseText: And Noah builded an altar unto the LORD; and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.
mdText: And [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) builded an altar unto the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.

verseText: And the LORD smelled a sweet savour; and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man’s sake; for the imagination of man’s heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) smelled a sweet savour; and the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man’s sake; for the imagination of man’s heart _is_ evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.

verseText: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.
mdText: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.

verseText: And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) blessed [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) and his sons, and said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.

verseText: And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the air, upon all that moveth upon the earth, and upon all the fishes of the sea; into your hand are they delivered.
mdText: And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the air, upon all that moveth _upon_ the earth, and upon all the fishes of the sea; into your hand are they delivered.

verseText: Every moving thing that liveth shall be meat for you; even as the green herb have I given you all things.
mdText: Every moving thing that liveth shall be meat for you; even as the green herb have I given you all things.

verseText: But flesh with the life thereof, which is the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.
mdText: But flesh with the life thereof, _which_ _is_ the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.

verseText: And surely your blood of your lives will I require; at the hand of every beast will I require it, and at the hand of man; at the hand of every man’s brother will I require the life of man.
mdText: And surely your blood of your lives will I require; at the hand of every beast will I require it, and at the hand of man; at the hand of every man’s brother will I require the life of man.

verseText: Whoso sheddeth man’s blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of God made he man.
mdText: Whoso sheddeth man’s blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of [God]([/person/god_1324) made he man.

verseText: And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.
mdText: And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.

verseText: And God spake unto Noah, and to his sons with him, saying,
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) spake unto [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) and to his sons with him, saying,

verseText: And I, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you;
mdText: And I, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you;

verseText: And with every living creature that is with you, of the fowl, of the cattle, and of every beast of the earth with you; from all that go out of the ark, to every beast of the earth.
mdText: And with every living creature that _is_ with you, of the fowl, of the cattle, and of every beast of the earth with you; from all that go out of the ark, to every beast of the earth.

verseText: And I will establish my covenant with you; neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of a flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.
mdText: And I will establish my covenant with you; neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of a flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.

verseText: And God said, This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said, This _is_ the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that _is_ with you, for perpetual generations:

verseText: I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.
mdText: I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.

verseText: And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud:
mdText: And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud:

verseText: And I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.
mdText: And I will remember my covenant, which _is_ between me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.

verseText: And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth.
mdText: And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between [God]([/person/god_1324) and every living creature of all flesh that _is_ upon the earth.

verseText: And God said unto Noah, This is the token of the covenant, which I have established between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) said unto [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) This _is_ the token of the covenant, which I have established between me and all flesh that _is_ upon the earth.

verseText: And the sons of Noah, that went forth of the ark, were Shem, and Ham, and Japheth: and Ham is the father of Canaan.
mdText: And the sons of [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) that went forth of the ark, were [Shem,]([/person/shem_2613) and [Ham,]([/person/ham_1359) and [Japheth:]([/person/japheth_726) and [Ham]([/person/ham_1359) _is_ the father of [Canaan.]([/person/canaan_914)

verseText: These are the three sons of Noah: and of them was the whole earth overspread.
mdText: These _are_ the three sons of [Noah:]([/person/noah_2210) and of them was the whole earth overspread.

verseText: And Noah began to be an husbandman, and he planted a vineyard:
mdText: And [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) began _to_ _be_ an husbandman, and he planted a vineyard:
eventsDescribed: Noah gets drunk and Canaan is cursed

verseText: And he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.
mdText: And he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.
eventsDescribed: Noah gets drunk and Canaan is cursed

verseText: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brethren without.
mdText: And [Ham,]([/person/ham_1359) the father of [Canaan,]([/person/canaan_914) saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brethren without.
eventsDescribed: Noah gets drunk and Canaan is cursed

verseText: And Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it upon both their shoulders, and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their faces were backward, and they saw not their father’s nakedness.
mdText: And [Shem]([/person/shem_2613) and [Japheth]([/person/japheth_726) took a garment, and laid _it_ upon both their shoulders, and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their faces _were_ backward, and they saw not their father’s nakedness.
eventsDescribed: Noah gets drunk and Canaan is cursed

verseText: And Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him.
mdText: And [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) awoke from his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him.
eventsDescribed: Noah gets drunk and Canaan is cursed

verseText: And he said, Cursed be Canaan; a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.
mdText: And he said, Cursed _be_ [Canaan;]([/person/canaan_914) a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.
eventsDescribed: Noah gets drunk and Canaan is cursed

verseText: And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.
mdText: And he said, Blessed _be_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Shem;]([/person/shem_2613) and [Canaan]([/person/canaan_914) shall be his servant.
eventsDescribed: Noah gets drunk and Canaan is cursed

verseText: God shall enlarge Japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) shall enlarge [Japheth,]([/person/japheth_726) and he shall dwell in the tents of [Shem;]([/person/shem_2613) and [Canaan]([/person/canaan_914) shall be his servant.
eventsDescribed: Noah gets drunk and Canaan is cursed

verseText: And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.
mdText: And [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.

verseText: And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years: and he died.
mdText: And all the days of [Noah]([/person/noah_2210) were nine hundred and fifty years: and he died.

verseText: Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth: and unto them were sons born after the flood.
mdText: Now these _are_ the generations of the sons of [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) [Shem,]([/person/shem_2613) [Ham,]([/person/ham_1359) and [Japheth:]([/person/japheth_726) and unto them were sons born after the flood.

verseText: The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
mdText: The sons of [Japheth;]([/person/japheth_726) [Gomer,]([/person/gomer_1328) and [Magog,]([/person/magog_1882) and [Madai,]([/person/madai_1880) and [Javan,]([/person/javan_744) and [Tubal,]([/person/tubal_2883) and [Meshech,]([/person/meshech_2012) and [Tiras.]([/person/tiras_2864)

verseText: And the sons of Gomer; Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
mdText: And the sons of [Gomer;]([/person/gomer_1328) [Ashkenaz,]([/person/ashkenaz_338) and [Riphath,]([/person/riphath_2443) and [Togarmah.]([/person/togarmah_2875)

verseText: And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
mdText: And the sons of [Javan;]([/person/javan_744) [Elishah,]([/person/elishah_1154) and [Tarshish,]([/person/tarshish_2828) [Kittim,]([/person/kittim_1789) and [Dodanim.]([/person/dodanim_1018)

verseText: By these were the isles of the Gentiles divided in their lands; every one after his tongue, after their families, in their nations.
mdText: By these were the isles of the Gentiles divided in their lands; every one after his tongue, after their families, in their nations.

verseText: And the sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, and Phut, and Canaan.
mdText: And the sons of [Ham;]([/person/ham_1359) [Cush,]([/person/cush_962) and [Mizraim,]([/person/mizraim_2100) and [Phut,]([/person/phut_2354) and [Canaan.]([/person/canaan_914)

verseText: And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabtecha: and the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.
mdText: And the sons of [Cush;]([/person/cush_962) [Seba,]([/person/seba_2481) and [Havilah,]([/person/havilah_1461) and [Sabtah,]([/person/sabtah_2451) and [Raamah,]([/person/raamah_2380) and [Sabtecha:]([/person/sabtecha_2452) and the sons of [Raamah;]([/person/raamah_2380) [Sheba,]([/person/sheba_2567) and [Dedan.]([/person/dedan_998)

verseText: And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
mdText: And [Cush]([/person/cush_962) begat [Nimrod:]([/person/nimrod_2206) he began to be a mighty one in the earth.

verseText: He was a mighty hunter before the LORD: wherefore it is said, Even as Nimrod the mighty hunter before the LORD.
mdText: He was a mighty hunter before the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) wherefore it is said, Even as [Nimrod]([/person/nimrod_2206) the mighty hunter before the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
mdText: And the beginning of his kingdom was [Babel,](/place/babel_150) and [Erech,](/place/erech_407) and [Accad,](/place/accad_14) and [Calneh,](/place/calneh_269) in the land of [Shinar.](/place/shinar_1084)

verseText: Out of that land went forth Asshur, and builded Nineveh, and the city Rehoboth, and Calah,
mdText: Out of that land went forth [Asshur,]([/person/asshur_349) and builded [Nineveh,](/place/nineveh_899) and the city [Rehoboth,](/place/rehoboth-ir_992) and [Calah,](/place/calah_268)

verseText: And Resen between Nineveh and Calah: the same is a great city.
mdText: And [Resen](/place/resen_997) between [Nineveh](/place/nineveh_899) and [Calah:](/place/calah_268) the same _is_ a great city.

verseText: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
mdText: And [Mizraim]([/person/mizraim_2100) begat [Ludim,]([/person/ludim_1835) and [Anamim,]([/person/anamim_253) and [Lehabim,]([/person/lehabim_1816) and [Naphtuhim,]([/person/naphtuhim_2150)

verseText: And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (out of whom came Philistim,) and Caphtorim.
mdText: And [Pathrusim,]([/person/pathrusim_2288) and [Casluhim,]([/person/casluhim_923) (out of whom came Philistim,) and [Caphtorim.]([/person/caphthorim_917)

verseText: And Canaan begat Sidon his firstborn, and Heth,
mdText: And [Canaan]([/person/canaan_914) begat [Sidon]([/person/zidon_2738) his firstborn, and [Heth,]([/person/heth_1510)

verseText: And the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgasite,
mdText: And the [Jebusite,]([/person/jebusite_748) and the [Amorite,]([/person/amorite_237) and the [Girgasite,]([/person/girgasite_1322)

verseText: And the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
mdText: And the [Hivite,]([/person/hivite_1534) and the [Arkite,]([/person/arkite_308) and the [Sinite,]([/person/sinite_2755)

verseText: And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite: and afterward were the families of the Canaanites spread abroad.
mdText: And the [Arvadite,]([/person/arvadite_316) and the [Zemarite,]([/person/zemarite_3036) and the [Hamathite:]([/person/hamathite_1361) and afterward were the families of the Canaanites spread abroad.

verseText: And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as thou comest to Gerar, unto Gaza; as thou goest, unto Sodom, and Gomorrah, and Admah, and Zeboim, even unto Lasha.
mdText: And the border of the Canaanites was from [Sidon,](/place/sidon_1093) as thou comest to [Gerar,](/place/gerar_459) unto [Gaza;](/place/gaza_446) as thou goest, unto [Sodom,](/place/sodom_1107) and [Gomorrah,](/place/gomorrah_489) and [Admah,](/place/admah_27) and [Zeboim,](/place/zeboiim_1244) even unto [Lasha.](/place/lasha_718)

verseText: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their tongues, in their countries, and in their nations.
mdText: These _are_ the sons of [Ham,]([/person/ham_1359) after their families, after their tongues, in their countries, _and_ in their nations.

verseText: Unto Shem also, the father of all the children of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder, even to him were children born.
mdText: Unto [Shem]([/person/shem_2613) also, the father of all the children of [Eber,]([/person/eber_1030) the brother of [Japheth]([/person/japheth_726) the elder, even to him were _children_ born.

verseText: The children of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram.
mdText: The children of [Shem;]([/person/shem_2613) [Elam,]([/person/elam_1049) and [Asshur,]([/person/asshur_349) and [Arphaxad,]([/person/arphaxad_312) and [Lud,]([/person/lud_1834) and [Aram.]([/person/aram_285)

verseText: And the children of Aram; Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Mash.
mdText: And the children of [Aram;]([/person/aram_285) [Uz,]([/person/uz_2908) and [Hul,]([/person/hul_1566) and [Gether,]([/person/gether_1308) and [Mash.]([/person/mash_1944)

verseText: And Arphaxad begat Salah; and Salah begat Eber.
mdText: And [Arphaxad]([/person/arphaxad_312) begat [Salah;]([/person/salah_2455) and [Salah]([/person/salah_2455) begat [Eber.]([/person/eber_1030)

verseText: And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of one was Peleg; for in his days was the earth divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
mdText: And unto [Eber]([/person/eber_1030) were born two sons: the name of one _was_ [Peleg;]([/person/peleg_2308) for in his days was the earth divided; and his brother’s name _was_ [Joktan.]([/person/joktan_1686)

verseText: And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
mdText: And [Joktan]([/person/joktan_1686) begat [Almodad,]([/person/almodad_191) and [Sheleph,]([/person/sheleph_2602) and [Hazarmaveth,]([/person/hazarmaveth_1465) and [Jerah,]([/person/jerah_842)

verseText: And Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,
mdText: And [Hadoram,]([/person/hadoram_1345) and [Uzal,]([/person/uzal_2911) and [Diklah,]([/person/diklah_1011)

verseText: And Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,
mdText: And [Obal,]([/person/ebal_2227) and [Abimael,]([/person/abimael_39) and [Sheba,]([/person/sheba_2568)

verseText: And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab: all these were the sons of Joktan.
mdText: And [Ophir,]([/person/ophir_2253) and [Havilah,]([/person/havilah_1462) and [Jobab:]([/person/jobab_1640) all these _were_ the sons of [Joktan.]([/person/joktan_1686)

verseText: And their dwelling was from Mesha, as thou goest unto Sephar a mount of the east.
mdText: And their dwelling was from [Mesha,](/place/mesha_787) as thou goest unto [Sephar](/place/sephar_1048) a mount of the east.

verseText: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, after their nations.
mdText: These _are_ the sons of [Shem,]([/person/shem_2613) after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, after their nations.
