verseText: These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations, in their nations: and by these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.
mdText: These _are_ the families of the sons of [Noah,]([/person/noah_2210) after their generations, in their nations: and by these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.

verseText: And the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech.
mdText: And the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech.

verseText: And it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.
mdText: And it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of [Shinar;](/place/shinar_1084) and they dwelt there.

verseText: And they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick, and burn them throughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for morter.
mdText: And they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick, and burn them throughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for morter.

verseText: And they said, Go to, let us build us a city and a tower, whose top may reach unto heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
mdText: And they said, Go to, let us build us a city and a tower, whose top _may_ _reach_ unto heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.

verseText: And the LORD came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.

verseText: And the LORD said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said, Behold, the people _is_ one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.

verseText: Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.
mdText: Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.

verseText: So the LORD scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.
mdText: So the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.

verseText: Therefore is the name of it called Babel; because the LORD did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did the LORD scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.
mdText: Therefore is the name of it called [Babel;](/place/babel_150) because the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.

verseText: These are the generations of Shem: Shem was an hundred years old, and begat Arphaxad two years after the flood:
mdText: These _are_ the generations of [Shem:]([/person/shem_2613) [Shem]([/person/shem_2613) _was_ an hundred years old, and begat [Arphaxad]([/person/arphaxad_312) two years after the flood:

verseText: And Shem lived after he begat Arphaxad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
mdText: And [Shem]([/person/shem_2613) lived after he begat [Arphaxad]([/person/arphaxad_312) five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.

verseText: And Arphaxad lived five and thirty years, and begat Salah:
mdText: And [Arphaxad]([/person/arphaxad_312) lived five and thirty years, and begat [Salah:]([/person/salah_2455)

verseText: And Arphaxad lived after he begat Salah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
mdText: And [Arphaxad]([/person/arphaxad_312) lived after he begat [Salah]([/person/salah_2455) four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.

verseText: And Salah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:
mdText: And [Salah]([/person/salah_2455) lived thirty years, and begat [Eber:]([/person/eber_1030)

verseText: And Salah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
mdText: And [Salah]([/person/salah_2455) lived after he begat [Eber]([/person/eber_1030) four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.

verseText: And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg:
mdText: And [Eber]([/person/eber_1030) lived four and thirty years, and begat [Peleg:]([/person/peleg_2308)

verseText: And Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
mdText: And [Eber]([/person/eber_1030) lived after he begat [Peleg]([/person/peleg_2308) four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.

verseText: And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:
mdText: And [Peleg]([/person/peleg_2308) lived thirty years, and begat [Reu:]([/person/reu_2428)

verseText: And Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.
mdText: And [Peleg]([/person/peleg_2308) lived after he begat [Reu]([/person/reu_2428) two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.

verseText: And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug:
mdText: And [Reu]([/person/reu_2428) lived two and thirty years, and begat [Serug:]([/person/serug_2503)

verseText: And Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
mdText: And [Reu]([/person/reu_2428) lived after he begat [Serug]([/person/serug_2503) two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.

verseText: And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:
mdText: And [Serug]([/person/serug_2503) lived thirty years, and begat [Nahor:]([/person/nahor_2142)

verseText: And Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
mdText: And [Serug]([/person/serug_2503) lived after he begat [Nahor]([/person/nahor_2142) two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.

verseText: And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah:
mdText: And [Nahor]([/person/nahor_2142) lived nine and twenty years, and begat [Terah:]([/person/terah_2841)

verseText: And Nahor lived after he begat Terah an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.
mdText: And [Nahor]([/person/nahor_2142) lived after he begat [Terah]([/person/terah_2841) an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.

verseText: And Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
mdText: And [Terah]([/person/terah_2841) lived seventy years, and begat [Abram,]([/person/abraham_58) [Nahor,]([/person/nahor_2143) and [Haran.]([/person/haran_1407)

verseText: Now these are the generations of Terah: Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begat Lot.
mdText: Now these _are_ the generations of [Terah:]([/person/terah_2841) [Terah]([/person/terah_2841) begat [Abram,]([/person/abraham_58) [Nahor,]([/person/nahor_2143) and [Haran;]([/person/haran_1407) and [Haran]([/person/haran_1407) begat [Lot.]([/person/lot_1830)

verseText: And Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his nativity, in Ur of the Chaldees.
mdText: And [Haran]([/person/haran_1407) died before his father [Terah]([/person/terah_2841) in the land of his nativity, in [Ur](/place/ur_1189) of the Chaldees.

verseText: And Abram and Nahor took them wives: the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor’s wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.
mdText: And [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) and [Nahor]([/person/nahor_2143) took them wives: the name of [Abram’s]([/person/abraham_58) wife _was_ [Sarai;]([/person/sarah_2473) and the name of [Nahor’s]([/person/nahor_2143) wife, [Milcah,]([/person/milcah_2082) the daughter of [Haran,]([/person/haran_1407) the father of [Milcah,]([/person/milcah_2082) and the father of [Iscah.]([/person/iscah_618)

verseText: But Sarai was barren; she had no child.
mdText: But [Sarai]([/person/sarah_2473) was barren; she _had_ no child.

verseText: And Terah took Abram his son, and Lot the son of Haran his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter in law, his son Abram’s wife; and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan; and they came unto Haran, and dwelt there.
mdText: And [Terah]([/person/terah_2841) took [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) his son, and [Lot]([/person/lot_1830) the son of [Haran]([/person/haran_1407) his son’s son, and [Sarai]([/person/sarah_2473) his daughter in law, his son [Abram’s]([/person/abraham_58) wife; and they went forth with them from [Ur](/place/ur_1189) of the Chaldees, to go into the land of [Canaan;]([/person/canaan_914) and they came unto [Haran,]([/person/haran_1407) and dwelt there.

verseText: And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years: and Terah died in Haran.
mdText: And the days of [Terah]([/person/terah_2841) were two hundred and five years: and [Terah]([/person/terah_2841) died in [Haran.](/place/haran_527)

verseText: Now the LORD had said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father’s house, unto a land that I will shew thee:
mdText: Now the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) had said unto [Abram,]([/person/abraham_58) Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father’s house, unto a land that I will shew thee:

verseText: And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing:
mdText: And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing:

verseText: And I will bless them that bless thee, and curse him that curseth thee: and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.
mdText: And I will bless them that bless thee, and curse him that curseth thee: and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.

verseText: So Abram departed, as the LORD had spoken unto him; and Lot went with him: and Abram was seventy and five years old when he departed out of Haran.
mdText: So [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) departed, as the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) had spoken unto him; and [Lot]([/person/lot_1830) went with him: and [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) _was_ seventy and five years old when he departed out of [Haran.](/place/haran_527)

verseText: And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother’s son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.
mdText: And [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) took [Sarai]([/person/sarah_2473) his wife, and [Lot]([/person/lot_1830) his brother’s son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in [Haran;](/place/haran_527) and they went forth to go into the land of [Canaan;]([/person/canaan_914) and into the land of [Canaan]([/person/canaan_914) they came.

verseText: And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Sichem, unto the plain of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land.
mdText: And [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) passed through the land unto the place of [Sichem,](/place/shechem_1069) unto the plain of [Moreh.](/place/moreh_817) And the Canaanite _was_ then in the land.

verseText: And the LORD appeared unto Abram, and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land: and there builded he an altar unto the LORD, who appeared unto him.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) appeared unto [Abram,]([/person/abraham_58) and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land: and there builded he an altar unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) who appeared unto him.

verseText: And he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Hai on the east: and there he builded an altar unto the LORD, and called upon the name of the LORD.
mdText: And he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of [Beth-el,](/place/bethel_202) and pitched his tent, _having_ [Beth-el](/place/bethel_202) on the west, and [Hai](/place/ai_36) on the east: and there he builded an altar unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and called upon the name of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the south.
mdText: And [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) journeyed, going on still toward the [south.](/place/negeb_885)

verseText: And there was a famine in the land: and Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there; for the famine was grievous in the land.
mdText: And there was a famine in the land: and [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) went down into [Egypt](/place/egypt_362) to sojourn there; for the famine _was_ grievous in the land.

verseText: And it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into Egypt, that he said unto Sarai his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon:
mdText: And it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) that he said unto [Sarai]([/person/sarah_2473) his wife, Behold now, I know that thou _art_ a fair woman to look upon:

verseText: Therefore it shall come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee, that they shall say, This is his wife: and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.
mdText: Therefore it shall come to pass, when the [Egyptians](/place/egypt_362) shall see thee, that they shall say, This _is_ his wife: and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.

verseText: Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.
mdText: Say, I pray thee, thou _art_ my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.

verseText: And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.
mdText: And it came to pass, that, when [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) was come into [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) the Egyptians beheld the woman that she _was_ very fair.

verseText: The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.
mdText: The princes also of [Pharaoh]([/person/pharaoh_2328) saw her, and commended her before [Pharaoh:]([/person/pharaoh_2328) and the woman was taken into [Pharaoh’s]([/person/pharaoh_2331) house.

verseText: And he entreated Abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses, and camels.
mdText: And he entreated [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) well for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses, and camels.

verseText: And the LORD plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai Abram’s wife.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) plagued [Pharaoh]([/person/pharaoh_2328) and his house with great plagues because of [Sarai]([/person/sarah_2473) [Abram’s]([/person/abraham_58) wife.

verseText: And Pharaoh called Abram, and said, What is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife?
mdText: And [Pharaoh]([/person/pharaoh_2328) called [Abram,]([/person/abraham_58) and said, What _is_ this _that_ thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she _was_ thy wife?

verseText: Why saidst thou, She is my sister? so I might have taken her to me to wife: now therefore behold thy wife, take her, and go thy way.
mdText: Why saidst thou, She _is_ my sister? so I might have taken her to me to wife: now therefore behold thy wife, take _her,_ and go thy way.

verseText: And Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his wife, and all that he had.
mdText: And [Pharaoh]([/person/pharaoh_2328) commanded _his_ men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his wife, and all that he had.

verseText: And Abram went up out of Egypt, he, and his wife, and all that he had, and Lot with him, into the south.
mdText: And [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) went up out of [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) he, and his wife, and all that he had, and [Lot]([/person/lot_1830) with him, into the [south.](/place/negeb_885)

verseText: And Abram was very rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.
mdText: And [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) _was_ very rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.

verseText: And he went on his journeys from the south even to Bethel, unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Hai;
mdText: And he went on his journeys from the [south](/place/negeb_885) even to [Beth-el,](/place/bethel_202) unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between [Beth-el](/place/bethel_202) and [Hai;](/place/ai_36)

verseText: Unto the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first: and there Abram called on the name of the LORD.
mdText: Unto the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first: and there [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) called on the name of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And Lot also, which went with Abram, had flocks, and herds, and tents.
mdText: And [Lot]([/person/lot_1830) also, which went with [Abram,]([/person/abraham_58) had flocks, and herds, and tents.

verseText: And the land was not able to bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together.
mdText: And the land was not able to bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together.

verseText: And there was a strife between the herdmen of Abram’s cattle and the herdmen of Lot’s cattle: and the Canaanite and the Perizzite dwelled then in the land.
mdText: And there was a strife between the herdmen of [Abram’s]([/person/abraham_58) cattle and the herdmen of [Lot’s]([/person/lot_1830) cattle: and the Canaanite and the Perizzite dwelled then in the land.

verseText: And Abram said unto Lot, Let there be no strife, I pray thee, between me and thee, and between my herdmen and thy herdmen; for we be brethren.
mdText: And [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) said unto [Lot,]([/person/lot_1830) Let there be no strife, I pray thee, between me and thee, and between my herdmen and thy herdmen; for we _be_ brethren.

verseText: Is not the whole land before thee? separate thyself, I pray thee, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right; or if thou depart to the right hand, then I will go to the left.
mdText: _Is_ not the whole land before thee? separate thyself, I pray thee, from me: if _thou_ _wilt_ _take_ the left hand, then I will go to the right; or if _thou_ _depart_ to the right hand, then I will go to the left.

verseText: And Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered every where, before the LORD destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, even as the garden of the LORD, like the land of Egypt, as thou comest unto Zoar.
mdText: And [Lot]([/person/lot_1830) lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of [Jordan,](/place/plain_of_jordan_654) that it _was_ well watered every where, before the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) destroyed [Sodom](/place/sodom_1107) and [Gomorrah,](/place/gomorrah_489) _even_ as the garden of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) like the land of [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) as thou comest unto [Zoar.](/place/zoar_1271)

verseText: Then Lot chose him all the plain of Jordan; and Lot journeyed east: and they separated themselves the one from the other.
mdText: Then [Lot]([/person/lot_1830) chose him all the plain of [Jordan;](/place/plain_of_jordan_654) and [Lot]([/person/lot_1830) journeyed east: and they separated themselves the one from the other.

verseText: Abram dwelled in the land of Canaan, and Lot dwelled in the cities of the plain, and pitched his tent toward Sodom.
mdText: [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) dwelled in the land of [Canaan,]([/person/canaan_914) and [Lot]([/person/lot_1830) dwelled in the cities of the plain, and pitched _his_ tent toward [Sodom.](/place/sodom_1107)

verseText: But the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the LORD exceedingly.
mdText: But the men of [Sodom](/place/sodom_1107) _were_ wicked and sinners before the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) exceedingly.

verseText: And the LORD said unto Abram, after that Lot was separated from him, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward:
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said unto [Abram,]([/person/abraham_58) after that [Lot]([/person/lot_1830) was separated from him, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward:

verseText: For all the land which thou seest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed for ever.
mdText: For all the land which thou seest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed for ever.

verseText: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed also be numbered.
mdText: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, _then_ shall thy seed also be numbered.

verseText: Arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for I will give it unto thee.
mdText: Arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for I will give it unto thee.

verseText: Then Abram removed his tent, and came and dwelt in the plain of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and built there an altar unto the LORD.
mdText: Then [Abram]([/person/abraham_58) removed _his_ tent, and came and dwelt in the plain of Mamre, which _is_ in [Hebron,](/place/hebron_551) and built there an altar unto the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful.
mdText: Blessed _is_ the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful.

verseText: But his delight is in the law of the LORD; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.
mdText: But his delight _is_ in the law of the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and in his law doth he meditate day and night.

verseText: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.
mdText: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.

verseText: The ungodly are not so: but are like the chaff which the wind driveth away.
mdText: The ungodly _are_ not so: but _are_ like the chaff which the wind driveth away.

verseText: Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.
mdText: Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

verseText: For the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.

verseText: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?
mdText: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?

verseText: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the LORD, and against his anointed, saying,
mdText: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and against his anointed, _saying,_

verseText: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.
mdText: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.

verseText: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.
mdText: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) shall have them in derision.

verseText: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.
mdText: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.

verseText: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.
mdText: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of [Zion.](/place/zion_1263)

verseText: I will declare the decree: the LORD hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.
mdText: I will declare the decree: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath said unto me, Thou _art_ my [Son;]([/person/jesus_905) this day have I begotten thee.

verseText: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.
mdText: Ask of me, and I shall give _thee_ the heathen _for_ thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth _for_ thy possession.

verseText: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.
mdText: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.

verseText: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.
mdText: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.

verseText: Serve the LORD with fear, and rejoice with trembling.
mdText: Serve the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

verseText: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.
mdText: Kiss the [Son,]([/person/jesus_905) lest he be angry, and ye perish _from_ the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed _are_ all they that put their trust in him.

verseText: LORD, how are they increased that trouble me! many are they that rise up against me.
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) how are they increased that trouble me! many _are_ they that rise up against me.

verseText: Many there be which say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.
mdText: Many _there_ _be_ which say of my soul, _There_ _is_ no help for him in [God.]([/person/god_1324) Selah.

verseText: But thou, O LORD, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.
mdText: But thou, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _art_ a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.

verseText: I cried unto the LORD with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.
mdText: I cried unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.

verseText: I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the LORD sustained me.
mdText: I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) sustained me.

verseText: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me round about.
mdText: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set _themselves_ against me round about.

verseText: Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
mdText: Arise, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) save me, O my [God:]([/person/god_1324) for thou hast smitten all mine enemies _upon_ the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.

verseText: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.
mdText: Salvation _belongeth_ unto the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) thy blessing _is_ upon thy people. Selah.

verseText: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.
mdText: Hear me when I call, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me _when_ _I_ _was_ in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.

verseText: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame? how long will ye love vanity, and seek after leasing? Selah.
mdText: O ye sons of men, how long _will_ _ye_ _turn_ my glory into shame? _how_ _long_ will ye love vanity, _and_ seek after leasing? Selah.

verseText: But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the LORD will hear when I call unto him.
mdText: But know that the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will hear when I call unto him.

verseText: Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
mdText: Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.

verseText: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the LORD.
mdText: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: There be many that say, Who will shew us any good? LORD, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.
mdText: _There_ _be_ many that say, Who will shew us _any_ good? [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.

verseText: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time that their corn and their wine increased.
mdText: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time _that_ their corn and their wine increased.

verseText: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, LORD, only makest me dwell in safety.
mdText: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) only makest me dwell in safety.

verseText: Give ear to my words, O LORD, consider my meditation.
mdText: Give ear to my words, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) consider my meditation.

verseText: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.
mdText: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my [God:]([/person/god_1324) for unto thee will I pray.

verseText: My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O LORD; in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.
mdText: My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) in the morning will I direct _my_ _prayer_ unto thee, and will look up.

verseText: For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.
mdText: For thou _art_ not a [God]([/person/god_1324) that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.

verseText: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.
mdText: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.

verseText: Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the LORD will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.
mdText: Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.

verseText: But as for me, I will come into thy house in the multitude of thy mercy: and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.
mdText: But as for me, I will come _into_ thy house in the multitude of thy mercy: _and_ in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.

verseText: Lead me, O LORD, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.
mdText: Lead me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.

verseText: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part is very wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.
mdText: For _there_ _is_ no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part _is_ very wickedness; their throat _is_ an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.

verseText: Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.
mdText: Destroy thou them, O [God;]([/person/god_1324) let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.

verseText: But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.
mdText: But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.

verseText: For thou, LORD, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as with a shield.
mdText: For thou, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as _with_ a shield.

verseText: O LORD, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
mdText: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

verseText: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; for I am weak: O LORD, heal me; for my bones are vexed.
mdText: Have mercy upon me, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for I _am_ weak: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) heal me; for my bones are vexed.

verseText: My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O LORD, how long?
mdText: My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) how long?

verseText: Return, O LORD, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies’ sake.
mdText: Return, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies’ sake.

verseText: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?
mdText: For in death _there_ _is_ no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?

verseText: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.
mdText: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.

verseText: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.
mdText: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.

verseText: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the LORD hath heard the voice of my weeping.
mdText: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath heard the voice of my weeping.

verseText: The LORD hath heard my supplication; the LORD will receive my prayer.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath heard my supplication; the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will receive my prayer.

verseText: Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return and be ashamed suddenly.
mdText: Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return _and_ be ashamed suddenly.

verseText: O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my [God,]([/person/god_1324) in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

verseText: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
mdText: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending _it_ in pieces, while _there_ _is_ none to deliver.

verseText: O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my [God,]([/person/god_1324) if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

verseText: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)
mdText: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

verseText: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.
mdText: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take _it;_ yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.

verseText: Arise, O LORD, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.
mdText: Arise, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me _to_ the judgment _that_ thou hast commanded.

verseText: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.
mdText: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.

verseText: The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall judge the people: judge me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity _that_ _is_ in me.

verseText: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.
mdText: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous [God]([/person/god_1324) trieth the hearts and reins.

verseText: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.
mdText: My defence _is_ of [God,]([/person/god_1324) which saveth the upright in heart.

verseText: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) judgeth the righteous, and [God]([/person/god_1324) is angry _with_ _the_ _wicked_ every day.

verseText: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
mdText: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

verseText: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.
mdText: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

verseText: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.
mdText: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

verseText: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.
mdText: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch _which_ he made.

verseText: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.
mdText: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

verseText: I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.
mdText: I will praise the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) most high.

verseText: O LORD our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth! who hast set thy glory above the heavens.
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) how excellent _is_ thy name in all the earth! who hast set thy glory above the heavens.

verseText: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.
mdText: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.

verseText: When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers, the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained;
mdText: When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers, the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained;

verseText: What is man, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man, that thou visitest him?
mdText: What is man, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man, that thou visitest him?

verseText: For thou hast made him a little lower than the angels, and hast crowned him with glory and honour.
mdText: For thou hast made him a little lower than the angels, and hast crowned him with glory and honour.

verseText: Thou madest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands; thou hast put all things under his feet:
mdText: Thou madest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands; thou hast put all _things_ under his feet:

verseText: All sheep and oxen, yea, and the beasts of the field;
mdText: All sheep and oxen, yea, and the beasts of the field;

verseText: The fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatsoever passeth through the paths of the seas.
mdText: The fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, _and_ _whatsoever_ passeth through the paths of the seas.

verseText: O LORD our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth!
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) how excellent _is_ thy name in all the earth!

verseText: I will praise thee, O LORD, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.
mdText: I will praise _thee,_ O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.

verseText: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.
mdText: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.

verseText: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.
mdText: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

verseText: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.
mdText: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.

verseText: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.
mdText: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

verseText: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.
mdText: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.

verseText: But the LORD shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.
mdText: But the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.

verseText: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.
mdText: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.

verseText: The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.

verseText: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, LORD, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.
mdText: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) hast not forsaken them that seek thee.

verseText: Sing praises to the LORD, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.
mdText: Sing praises to the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) which dwelleth in [Zion:](/place/zion_1263) declare among the people his doings.

verseText: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.
mdText: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.

verseText: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:
mdText: Have mercy upon me, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) consider my trouble _which_ _I_ _suffer_ of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:

verseText: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.
mdText: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of [Zion:](/place/zion_1263) I will rejoice in thy salvation.

verseText: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.
mdText: The heathen are sunk down in the pit _that_ they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.

verseText: The LORD is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) is known _by_ the judgment _which_ he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

verseText: The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.
mdText: The wicked shall be turned into hell, _and_ all the nations that forget [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.
mdText: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall _not_ perish for ever.

verseText: Arise, O LORD; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.
mdText: Arise, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

verseText: Put them in fear, O LORD: that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah.
mdText: Put them in fear, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) _that_ the nations may know themselves _to_ _be_ _but_ men. Selah.

verseText: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?
mdText: Why standest thou afar off, O [LORD?]([/person/god_1324) _why_ hidest thou _thyself_ in times of trouble?

verseText: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
mdText: The wicked in _his_ pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.

verseText: For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the LORD abhorreth.
mdText: For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth the covetous, _whom_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) abhorreth.

verseText: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.
mdText: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek _after_ _[God:]([/person/god_1324)_ [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ not in all his thoughts.

verseText: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
mdText: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments _are_ far above out of his sight: _as_ _for_ all his enemies, he puffeth at them.

verseText: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.
mdText: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for _I_ _shall_ never _be_ in adversity.

verseText: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.
mdText: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue _is_ mischief and vanity.

verseText: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.
mdText: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.

verseText: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
mdText: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.

verseText: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.
mdText: He croucheth, _and_ humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.

verseText: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.
mdText: He hath said in his heart, [God]([/person/god_1324) hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see _it._

verseText: Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.
mdText: Arise, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) O [God,]([/person/god_1324) lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.

verseText: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.
mdText: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn [God?]([/person/god_1324) he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require _it._

verseText: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.
mdText: Thou hast seen _it;_ for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite _it_ with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.

verseText: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.
mdText: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil _man:_ seek out his wickedness _till_ thou find none.

verseText: The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.

verseText: LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:

verseText: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
mdText: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.

verseText: In the LORD put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?
mdText: In the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee _as_ a bird to your mountain?

verseText: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.
mdText: For, lo, the wicked bend _their_ bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.

verseText: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?
mdText: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?

verseText: The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORD’S throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ in his holy temple, the [LORD’S]([/person/god_1324) throne _is_ in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.

verseText: The LORD trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.

verseText: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.
mdText: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: _this_ _shall_ _be_ the portion of their cup.

verseText: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.
mdText: For the righteous [LORD]([/person/god_1324) loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.

verseText: Help, LORD; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.
mdText: Help, [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.

verseText: They speak vanity every one with his neighbour: with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.
mdText: They speak vanity every one with his neighbour: _with_ flattering lips _and_ with a double heart do they speak.

verseText: The LORD shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall cut off all flattering lips, _and_ the tongue that speaketh proud things:

verseText: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?
mdText: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips _are_ our own: who _is_ lord over us?

verseText: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the LORD; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.
mdText: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) I will set _him_ in safety _from_ _him_ _that_ puffeth at him.

verseText: The words of the LORD are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.
mdText: The words of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _are_ pure words: _as_ silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.

verseText: Thou shalt keep them, O LORD, thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.
mdText: Thou shalt keep them, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.

verseText: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.
mdText: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.

verseText: How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
mdText: How long wilt thou forget me, O [LORD?]([/person/god_1324) for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?

verseText: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?
mdText: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, _having_ sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?

verseText: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God: lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;
mdText: Consider _and_ hear me, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my [God:]([/person/god_1324) lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the _sleep_ _of_ death;

verseText: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
mdText: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; _and_ those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.

verseText: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
mdText: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.

verseText: I will sing unto the LORD, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
mdText: I will sing unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) because he hath dealt bountifully with me.

verseText: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is none that doeth good.
mdText: The fool hath said in his heart, _There_ _is_ no [God.]([/person/god_1324) They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, _there_ _is_ none that doeth good.

verseText: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, and seek God.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, _and_ seek [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy: there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
mdText: They are all gone aside, they are _all_ together become filthy: _there_ _is_ none that doeth good, no, not one.

verseText: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread, and call not upon the LORD.
mdText: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people _as_ they eat bread, and call not upon the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: There were they in great fear: for God is in the generation of the righteous.
mdText: There were they in great fear: for [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ in the generation of the righteous.

verseText: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the LORD is his refuge.
mdText: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ his refuge.

verseText: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! when the LORD bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
mdText: Oh that the salvation of Israel _were_ _come_ out of [Zion!](/place/zion_1263) when the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) bringeth back the captivity of his people, [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) shall rejoice, _and_ Israel shall be glad.

verseText: LORD, who shall abide in thy tabernacle? who shall dwell in thy holy hill?
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) who shall abide in thy tabernacle? who shall dwell in thy holy hill?

verseText: He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart.
mdText: He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart.

verseText: He that backbiteth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbour, nor taketh up a reproach against his neighbour.
mdText: _He_ _that_ backbiteth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbour, nor taketh up a reproach against his neighbour.

verseText: In whose eyes a vile person is contemned; but he honoureth them that fear the LORD. He that sweareth to his own hurt, and changeth not.
mdText: In whose eyes a vile person is contemned; but he honoureth them that fear the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) _He_ _that_ sweareth to _his_ _own_ hurt, and changeth not.

verseText: He that putteth not out his money to usury, nor taketh reward against the innocent. He that doeth these things shall never be moved.
mdText: _He_ _that_ putteth not out his money to usury, nor taketh reward against the innocent. He that doeth these _things_ shall never be moved.

verseText: Preserve me, O God: for in thee do I put my trust.
mdText: Preserve me, O [God:]([/person/god_1324) for in thee do I put my trust.

verseText: O my soul, thou hast said unto the LORD, Thou art my Lord: my goodness extendeth not to thee;
mdText: _O_ _my_ _soul,_ thou hast said unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) Thou _art_ my [Lord:]([/person/god_1324) my goodness _extendeth_ not to thee;

verseText: But to the saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.
mdText: _But_ to the saints that _are_ in the earth, and _to_ the excellent, in whom _is_ all my delight.

verseText: Their sorrows shall be multiplied that hasten after another god: their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take up their names into my lips.
mdText: Their sorrows shall be multiplied _that_ hasten _after_ another _god:_ their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take up their names into my lips.

verseText: The LORD is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.

verseText: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea, I have a goodly heritage.
mdText: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant _places;_ yea, I have a goodly heritage.

verseText: I will bless the LORD, who hath given me counsel: my reins also instruct me in the night seasons.
mdText: I will bless the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) who hath given me counsel: my reins also instruct me in the night seasons.

verseText: I have set the LORD always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
mdText: I have set the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) always before me: because _he_ _is_ at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

verseText: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.
mdText: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.

verseText: For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
mdText: For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine [Holy]([/person/jesus_905) One to see corruption.

verseText: Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is fulness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.
mdText: Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence _is_ fulness of joy; at thy right hand _there_ _are_ pleasures for evermore.

verseText: Hear the right, O LORD, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.
mdText: Hear the right, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, _that_ _goeth_ not out of feigned lips.

verseText: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.
mdText: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.

verseText: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.
mdText: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited _me_ in the night; thou hast tried me, _and_ shalt find nothing; I am purposed _that_ my mouth shall not transgress.

verseText: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.
mdText: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept _me_ _from_ the paths of the destroyer.

verseText: Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.
mdText: Hold up my goings in thy paths, _that_ my footsteps slip not.

verseText: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.
mdText: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O [God:]([/person/god_1324) incline thine ear unto me, _and_ _hear_ my speech.

verseText: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.
mdText: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust _in_ _thee_ from those that rise up _against_ _them._

verseText: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,
mdText: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,

verseText: From the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about.
mdText: From the wicked that oppress me, _from_ my deadly enemies, _who_ compass me about.

verseText: They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.
mdText: They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.

verseText: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;
mdText: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;

verseText: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
mdText: Like as a lion _that_ is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.

verseText: Arise, O LORD, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, which is thy sword:
mdText: Arise, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, _which_ _is_ thy sword:

verseText: From men which are thy hand, O LORD, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.
mdText: From men _which_ _are_ thy hand, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) from men of the world, _which_ _have_ their portion in _this_ life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid _treasure:_ they are full of children, and leave the rest of their _substance_ to their babes.

verseText: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.
mdText: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.

verseText: I will love thee, O LORD, my strength.
mdText: I will love thee, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) my strength.

verseText: The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my [God,]([/person/god_1324) my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, _and_ my high tower.

verseText: I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.
mdText: I will call upon the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _who_ _is_ _worthy_ to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.

verseText: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.
mdText: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.

verseText: The sorrows of hell compassed me about: the snares of death prevented me.
mdText: The sorrows of hell compassed me about: the snares of death prevented me.

verseText: In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.
mdText: In my distress I called upon the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and cried unto my [God:]([/person/god_1324) he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, _even_ into his ears.

verseText: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken, because he was wroth.
mdText: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken, because he was wroth.

verseText: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.
mdText: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.

verseText: He bowed the heavens also, and came down: and darkness was under his feet.
mdText: He bowed the heavens also, and came down: and darkness _was_ under his feet.

verseText: And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: yea, he did fly upon the wings of the wind.
mdText: And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: yea, he did fly upon the wings of the wind.

verseText: He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion round about him were dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.
mdText: He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion round about him _were_ dark waters _and_ thick clouds of the skies.

verseText: At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.
mdText: At the brightness _that_ _was_ before him his thick clouds passed, hail _stones_ and coals of fire.

verseText: The LORD also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice; hail stones and coals of fire.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice; hail _stones_ and coals of fire.

verseText: Yea, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them; and he shot out lightnings, and discomfited them.
mdText: Yea, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them; and he shot out lightnings, and discomfited them.

verseText: Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.
mdText: Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.

verseText: He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.
mdText: He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.

verseText: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hated me: for they were too strong for me.
mdText: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hated me: for they were too strong for me.

verseText: They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the LORD was my stay.
mdText: They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) was my stay.

verseText: He brought me forth also into a large place; he delivered me, because he delighted in me.
mdText: He brought me forth also into a large place; he delivered me, because he delighted in me.

verseText: The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.

verseText: For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
mdText: For I have kept the ways of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and have not wickedly departed from my [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: For all his judgments were before me, and I did not put away his statutes from me.
mdText: For all his judgments _were_ before me, and I did not put away his statutes from me.

verseText: I was also upright before him, and I kept myself from mine iniquity.
mdText: I was also upright before him, and I kept myself from mine iniquity.

verseText: Therefore hath the LORD recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.
mdText: Therefore hath the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.

verseText: With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful; with an upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright;
mdText: With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful; with an upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright;

verseText: With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself froward.
mdText: With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself froward.

verseText: For thou wilt save the afflicted people; but wilt bring down high looks.
mdText: For thou wilt save the afflicted people; but wilt bring down high looks.

verseText: For thou wilt light my candle: the LORD my God will enlighten my darkness.
mdText: For thou wilt light my candle: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my [God]([/person/god_1324) will enlighten my darkness.

verseText: For by thee I have run through a troop; and by my God have I leaped over a wall.
mdText: For by thee I have run through a troop; and by my [God]([/person/god_1324) have I leaped over a wall.

verseText: As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the LORD is tried: he is a buckler to all those that trust in him.
mdText: _As_ _for_ [God,]([/person/god_1324) his way _is_ perfect: the word of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) is tried: he _is_ a buckler to all those that trust in him.

verseText: For who is God save the LORD? or who is a rock save our God?
mdText: For who _is_ [God]([/person/god_1324) save the [LORD?]([/person/god_1324) or who _is_ a rock save our [God?]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: It is God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.
mdText: _It_ _is_ [God]([/person/god_1324) that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.

verseText: He maketh my feet like hinds’ feet, and setteth me upon my high places.
mdText: He maketh my feet like hinds’ _feet,_ and setteth me upon my high places.

verseText: He teacheth my hands to war, so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.
mdText: He teacheth my hands to war, so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.

verseText: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath holden me up, and thy gentleness hath made me great.
mdText: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath holden me up, and thy gentleness hath made me great.

verseText: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, that my feet did not slip.
mdText: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, that my feet did not slip.

verseText: I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them: neither did I turn again till they were consumed.
mdText: I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them: neither did I turn again till they were consumed.

verseText: I have wounded them that they were not able to rise: they are fallen under my feet.
mdText: I have wounded them that they were not able to rise: they are fallen under my feet.

verseText: For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle: thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.
mdText: For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle: thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.

verseText: Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies; that I might destroy them that hate me.
mdText: Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies; that I might destroy them that hate me.

verseText: They cried, but there was none to save them: even unto the LORD, but he answered them not.
mdText: They cried, but _there_ _was_ none to save _them:_ _even_ unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) but he answered them not.

verseText: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind: I did cast them out as the dirt in the streets.
mdText: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind: I did cast them out as the dirt in the streets.

verseText: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; and thou hast made me the head of the heathen: a people whom I have not known shall serve me.
mdText: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; _and_ thou hast made me the head of the heathen: a people _whom_ I have not known shall serve me.

verseText: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me: the strangers shall submit themselves unto me.
mdText: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me: the strangers shall submit themselves unto me.

verseText: The strangers shall fade away, and be afraid out of their close places.
mdText: The strangers shall fade away, and be afraid out of their close places.

verseText: The LORD liveth; and blessed be my rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) liveth; and blessed _be_ my rock; and let the [God]([/person/god_1324) of my salvation be exalted.

verseText: It is God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me.
mdText: _It_ _is_ [God]([/person/god_1324) that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me.

verseText: He delivereth me from mine enemies: yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.
mdText: He delivereth me from mine enemies: yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.

verseText: Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the heathen, and sing praises unto thy name.
mdText: Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) among the heathen, and sing praises unto thy name.

verseText: Great deliverance giveth he to his king; and sheweth mercy to his anointed, to David, and to his seed for evermore.
mdText: Great deliverance giveth he to his king; and sheweth mercy to his anointed, to [David,]([/person/david_994) and to his seed for evermore.

verseText: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.
mdText: The heavens declare the glory of [God;]([/person/god_1324) and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

verseText: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge.
mdText: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge.

verseText: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.
mdText: _There_ _is_ no speech nor language, _where_ their voice is not heard.

verseText: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,
mdText: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,

verseText: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.
mdText: Which _is_ as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, _and_ rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.

verseText: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.
mdText: His going forth _is_ from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

verseText: The law of the LORD is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the LORD is sure, making wise the simple.
mdText: The law of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ sure, making wise the simple.

verseText: The statutes of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart: the commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes.
mdText: The statutes of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _are_ right, rejoicing the heart: the commandment of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ pure, enlightening the eyes.

verseText: The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring for ever: the judgments of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.
mdText: The fear of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ clean, enduring for ever: the judgments of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _are_ true _and_ righteous altogether.

verseText: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.
mdText: More to be desired _are_ _they_ than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.

verseText: Moreover by them is thy servant warned: and in keeping of them there is great reward.
mdText: Moreover by them is thy servant warned: _and_ in keeping of them _there_ _is_ great reward.

verseText: Who can understand his errors? cleanse thou me from secret faults.
mdText: Who can understand _his_ errors? cleanse thou me from secret _faults._

verseText: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.
mdText: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous _sins;_ let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.

verseText: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.
mdText: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) my strength, and my redeemer.

verseText: The LORD hear thee in the day of trouble; the name of the God of Jacob defend thee;
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hear thee in the day of trouble; the name of the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) defend thee;

verseText: Send thee help from the sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of Zion;
mdText: Send thee help from the sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of [Zion;](/place/zion_1263)

verseText: Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.
mdText: Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.

verseText: Grant thee according to thine own heart, and fulfil all thy counsel.
mdText: Grant thee according to thine own heart, and fulfil all thy counsel.

verseText: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners: the LORD fulfil all thy petitions.
mdText: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our [God]([/person/god_1324) we will set up _our_ banners: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) fulfil all thy petitions.

verseText: Now know I that the LORD saveth his anointed; he will hear him from his holy heaven with the saving strength of his right hand.
mdText: Now know I that the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) saveth his anointed; he will hear him from his holy heaven with the saving strength of his right hand.

verseText: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will remember the name of the LORD our God.
