mdText: Some _trust_ in chariots, and some in horses: but we will remember the name of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: They are brought down and fallen: but we are risen, and stand upright.
mdText: They are brought down and fallen: but we are risen, and stand upright.

verseText: Save, LORD: let the king hear us when we call.
mdText: Save, [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) let the king hear us when we call.

verseText: The king shall joy in thy strength, O LORD; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
mdText: The king shall joy in thy strength, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!

verseText: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.
mdText: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.

verseText: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.
mdText: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.

verseText: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.
mdText: He asked life of thee, _and_ thou gavest _it_ him, _even_ length of days for ever and ever.

verseText: His glory is great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.
mdText: His glory _is_ great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.

verseText: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.
mdText: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.

verseText: For the king trusteth in the LORD, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.
mdText: For the king trusteth in the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

verseText: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.
mdText: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.

verseText: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the LORD shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.
mdText: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.

verseText: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.
mdText: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

verseText: For they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.
mdText: For they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device, _which_ they are not able _to_ _perform._

verseText: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back, when thou shalt make ready thine arrows upon thy strings against the face of them.
mdText: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back, _when_ thou shalt make ready _thine_ _arrows_ upon thy strings against the face of them.

verseText: Be thou exalted, LORD, in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.
mdText: Be thou exalted, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) in thine own strength: _so_ will we sing and praise thy power.

verseText: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?
mdText: My [God,]([/person/god_1324) my [God,]([/person/god_1324) why hast thou forsaken me? _why_ _art_ _thou_ _so_ far from helping me, _and_ _from_ the words of my roaring?

verseText: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.
mdText: O my [God,]([/person/god_1324) I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.

verseText: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.
mdText: But thou _art_ holy, _O_ _thou_ that inhabitest the praises of Israel.

verseText: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.
mdText: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.

verseText: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.
mdText: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

verseText: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.
mdText: But I _am_ a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.

verseText: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,
mdText: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, _saying,_

verseText: He trusted on the LORD that he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.
mdText: He trusted on the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _that_ he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.

verseText: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother’s breasts.
mdText: But thou _art_ he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope _when_ _I_ _was_ upon my mother’s breasts.

verseText: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother’s belly.
mdText: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou _art_ my [God]([/person/god_1324) from my mother’s belly.

verseText: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.
mdText: Be not far from me; for trouble _is_ near; for _there_ _is_ none to help.

verseText: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.
mdText: Many bulls have compassed me: strong _bulls_ of [Bashan](/place/bashan_159) have beset me round.

verseText: They gaped upon me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.
mdText: They gaped upon me _with_ their mouths, _as_ a ravening and a roaring lion.

verseText: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.
mdText: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.

verseText: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.
mdText: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.

verseText: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.
mdText: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.

verseText: I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.
mdText: I may tell all my bones: they look _and_ stare upon me.

verseText: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.
mdText: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.

verseText: But be not thou far from me, O LORD: O my strength, haste thee to help me.
mdText: But be not thou far from me, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) O my strength, haste thee to help me.

verseText: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.
mdText: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.

verseText: Save me from the lion’s mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.
mdText: Save me from the lion’s mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.

verseText: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.
mdText: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

verseText: Ye that fear the LORD, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.
mdText: Ye that fear the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) praise him; all ye the seed of [Jacob,]([/person/israel_682) glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.

verseText: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.
mdText: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.

verseText: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.
mdText: My praise _shall_ _be_ of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.

verseText: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the LORD that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.
mdText: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.

verseText: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the LORD: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.
mdText: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.

verseText: For the kingdom is the LORD’S: and he is the governor among the nations.
mdText: For the kingdom _is_ the [LORD’S:]([/person/god_1324) and he _is_ the governor among the nations.

verseText: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.
mdText: All _they_ _that_ _be_ fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.

verseText: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.
mdText: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) for a generation.

verseText: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.
mdText: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done _this._

verseText: The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ my shepherd; I shall not want.

verseText: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters.
mdText: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters.

verseText: He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name’s sake.
mdText: He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name’s sake.

verseText: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.
mdText: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou _art_ with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

verseText: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.
mdText: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.

verseText: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the LORD for ever.
mdText: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) for ever.

verseText: The earth is the LORD’S, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.
mdText: The earth _is_ the [LORD’S,]([/person/god_1324) and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.

verseText: For he hath founded it upon the seas, and established it upon the floods.
mdText: For he hath founded it upon the seas, and established it upon the floods.

verseText: Who shall ascend into the hill of the LORD? or who shall stand in his holy place?
mdText: Who shall ascend into the hill of the [LORD?]([/person/god_1324) or who shall stand in his holy place?

verseText: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.
mdText: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.

verseText: He shall receive the blessing from the LORD, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
mdText: He shall receive the blessing from the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and righteousness from the [God]([/person/god_1324) of his salvation.

verseText: This is the generation of them that seek him, that seek thy face, O Jacob. Selah.
mdText: This _is_ the generation of them that seek him, that seek thy face, O [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682) Selah.

verseText: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.
mdText: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

verseText: Who is this King of glory? The LORD strong and mighty, the LORD mighty in battle.
mdText: Who _is_ this King of glory? The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) strong and mighty, the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) mighty in battle.

verseText: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; even lift them up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.
mdText: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; even lift _them_ up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

verseText: Who is this King of glory? The LORD of hosts, he is the King of glory. Selah.
mdText: Who is this King of glory? The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) of hosts, he _is_ the King of glory. Selah.

verseText: Unto thee, O LORD, do I lift up my soul.
mdText: Unto thee, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) do I lift up my soul.

verseText: O my God, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine enemies triumph over me.
mdText: O my [God,]([/person/god_1324) I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine enemies triumph over me.

verseText: Yea, let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be ashamed which transgress without cause.
mdText: Yea, let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be ashamed which transgress without cause.

verseText: Shew me thy ways, O LORD; teach me thy paths.
mdText: Shew me thy ways, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) teach me thy paths.

verseText: Lead me in thy truth, and teach me: for thou art the God of my salvation; on thee do I wait all the day.
mdText: Lead me in thy truth, and teach me: for thou _art_ the [God]([/person/god_1324) of my salvation; on thee do I wait all the day.

verseText: Remember, O LORD, thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindnesses; for they have been ever of old.
mdText: Remember, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindnesses; for they _have_ _been_ ever of old.

verseText: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions: according to thy mercy remember thou me for thy goodness’ sake, O LORD.
mdText: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions: according to thy mercy remember thou me for thy goodness’ sake, O [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Good and upright is the LORD: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.
mdText: Good and upright _is_ the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) therefore will he teach sinners in the way.

verseText: The meek will he guide in judgment: and the meek will he teach his way.
mdText: The meek will he guide in judgment: and the meek will he teach his way.

verseText: All the paths of the LORD are mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.
mdText: All the paths of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _are_ mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.

verseText: For thy name’s sake, O LORD, pardon mine iniquity; for it is great.
mdText: For thy name’s sake, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) pardon mine iniquity; for it _is_ great.

verseText: What man is he that feareth the LORD? him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.
mdText: What man _is_ he that feareth the [LORD?]([/person/god_1324) him shall he teach in the way _that_ he shall choose.

verseText: His soul shall dwell at ease; and his seed shall inherit the earth.
mdText: His soul shall dwell at ease; and his seed shall inherit the earth.

verseText: The secret of the LORD is with them that fear him; and he will shew them his covenant.
mdText: The secret of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ with them that fear him; and he will shew them his covenant.

verseText: Mine eyes are ever toward the LORD; for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.
mdText: Mine eyes _are_ ever toward the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.

verseText: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me; for I am desolate and afflicted.
mdText: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me; for I _am_ desolate and afflicted.

verseText: The troubles of my heart are enlarged: O bring thou me out of my distresses.
mdText: The troubles of my heart are enlarged: _O_ bring thou me out of my distresses.

verseText: Look upon mine affliction and my pain; and forgive all my sins.
mdText: Look upon mine affliction and my pain; and forgive all my sins.

verseText: Consider mine enemies; for they are many; and they hate me with cruel hatred.
mdText: Consider mine enemies; for they are many; and they hate me with cruel hatred.

verseText: O keep my soul, and deliver me: let me not be ashamed; for I put my trust in thee.
mdText: O keep my soul, and deliver me: let me not be ashamed; for I put my trust in thee.

verseText: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me; for I wait on thee.
mdText: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me; for I wait on thee.

verseText: Redeem Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.
mdText: Redeem Israel, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) out of all his troubles.

verseText: Judge me, O LORD; for I have walked in mine integrity: I have trusted also in the LORD; therefore I shall not slide.
mdText: Judge me, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for I have walked in mine integrity: I have trusted also in the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) _therefore_ I shall not slide.

verseText: Examine me, O LORD, and prove me; try my reins and my heart.
mdText: Examine me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and prove me; try my reins and my heart.

verseText: For thy lovingkindness is before mine eyes: and I have walked in thy truth.
mdText: For thy lovingkindness _is_ before mine eyes: and I have walked in thy truth.

verseText: I have not sat with vain persons, neither will I go in with dissemblers.
mdText: I have not sat with vain persons, neither will I go in with dissemblers.

verseText: I have hated the congregation of evil doers; and will not sit with the wicked.
mdText: I have hated the congregation of evil doers; and will not sit with the wicked.

verseText: I will wash mine hands in innocency: so will I compass thine altar, O LORD:
mdText: I will wash mine hands in innocency: so will I compass thine altar, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: That I may publish with the voice of thanksgiving, and tell of all thy wondrous works.
mdText: That I may publish with the voice of thanksgiving, and tell of all thy wondrous works.

verseText: LORD, I have loved the habitation of thy house, and the place where thine honour dwelleth.
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) I have loved the habitation of thy house, and the place where thine honour dwelleth.

verseText: Gather not my soul with sinners, nor my life with bloody men:
mdText: Gather not my soul with sinners, nor my life with bloody men:

verseText: In whose hands is mischief, and their right hand is full of bribes.
mdText: In whose hands _is_ mischief, and their right hand is full of bribes.

verseText: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity: redeem me, and be merciful unto me.
mdText: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity: redeem me, and be merciful unto me.

verseText: My foot standeth in an even place: in the congregations will I bless the LORD.
mdText: My foot standeth in an even place: in the congregations will I bless the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

verseText: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.
mdText: When the wicked, _even_ mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.

verseText: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.
mdText: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this _will_ I _be_ confident.

verseText: One thing have I desired of the LORD, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the LORD, and to enquire in his temple.
mdText: One _thing_ have I desired of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and to enquire in his temple.

verseText: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.
mdText: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.

verseText: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the LORD.
mdText: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Hear, O LORD, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.
mdText: Hear, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _when_ I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.

verseText: When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, LORD, will I seek.
mdText: _When_ _thou_ _saidst,_ Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) will I seek.

verseText: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
mdText: Hide not thy face _far_ from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of my salvation.

verseText: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the LORD will take me up.
mdText: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will take me up.

verseText: Teach me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.
mdText: Teach me thy way, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.

verseText: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.
mdText: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.

verseText: I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
mdText: _I_ _had_ _fainted,_ unless I had believed to see the goodness of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) in the land of the living.

verseText: Wait on the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the LORD.
mdText: Wait on the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Unto thee will I cry, O LORD my rock; be not silent to me: lest, if thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.
mdText: Unto thee will I cry, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my rock; be not silent to me: lest, _if_ thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.

verseText: Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands toward thy holy oracle.
mdText: Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands toward thy holy oracle.

verseText: Draw me not away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity, which speak peace to their neighbours, but mischief is in their hearts.
mdText: Draw me not away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity, which speak peace to their neighbours, but mischief _is_ in their hearts.

verseText: Give them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render to them their desert.
mdText: Give them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render to them their desert.

verseText: Because they regard not the works of the LORD, nor the operation of his hands, he shall destroy them, and not build them up.
mdText: Because they regard not the works of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) nor the operation of his hands, he shall destroy them, and not build them up.

verseText: Blessed be the LORD, because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.
mdText: Blessed _be_ the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.

verseText: The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.

verseText: The LORD is their strength, and he is the saving strength of his anointed.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ their strength, and he _is_ the saving strength of his anointed.

verseText: Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance: feed them also, and lift them up for ever.
mdText: Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance: feed them also, and lift them up for ever.

verseText: Give unto the LORD, O ye mighty, give unto the LORD glory and strength.
mdText: Give unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O ye mighty, give unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) glory and strength.

verseText: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name; worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.
mdText: Give unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) the glory due unto his name; worship the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) in the beauty of holiness.

verseText: The voice of the LORD is upon the waters: the God of glory thundereth: the LORD is upon many waters.
mdText: The voice of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ upon the waters: the [God]([/person/god_1324) of glory thundereth: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ upon many waters.

verseText: The voice of the LORD is powerful; the voice of the LORD is full of majesty.
mdText: The voice of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ powerful; the voice of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ full of majesty.

verseText: The voice of the LORD breaketh the cedars; yea, the LORD breaketh the cedars of Lebanon.
mdText: The voice of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) breaketh the cedars; yea, the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) breaketh the cedars of [Lebanon.](/place/lebanon_720)

verseText: He maketh them also to skip like a calf; Lebanon and Sirion like a young unicorn.
mdText: He maketh them also to skip like a calf; [Lebanon](/place/lebanon_720) and [Sirion](/place/sirion_1101) like a young unicorn.

verseText: The voice of the LORD divideth the flames of fire.
mdText: The voice of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) divideth the flames of fire.

verseText: The voice of the LORD shaketh the wilderness; the LORD shaketh the wilderness of Kadesh.
mdText: The voice of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shaketh the wilderness; the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shaketh the wilderness of [Kadesh.](/place/kadesh_661)

verseText: The voice of the LORD maketh the hinds to calve, and discovereth the forests: and in his temple doth every one speak of his glory.
mdText: The voice of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) maketh the hinds to calve, and discovereth the forests: and in his temple doth every one speak of _his_ glory.

verseText: The LORD sitteth upon the flood; yea, the LORD sitteth King for ever.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) sitteth upon the flood; yea, the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) sitteth King for ever.

verseText: The LORD will give strength unto his people; the LORD will bless his people with peace.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will give strength unto his people; the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will bless his people with peace.

verseText: I will extol thee, O LORD; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
mdText: I will extol thee, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.

verseText: O LORD my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my [God,]([/person/god_1324) I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.

verseText: O LORD, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
mdText: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.

verseText: Sing unto the LORD, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
mdText: Sing unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

verseText: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.
mdText: For his anger _endureth_ _but_ a moment; in his favour _is_ life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy _cometh_ in the morning.

verseText: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.
mdText: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.

verseText: LORD, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, _and_ I was troubled.

verseText: I cried to thee, O LORD; and unto the LORD I made supplication.
mdText: I cried to thee, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) I made supplication.

verseText: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?
mdText: What profit _is_ _there_ in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

verseText: Hear, O LORD, and have mercy upon me: LORD, be thou my helper.
mdText: Hear, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and have mercy upon me: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) be thou my helper.

verseText: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;
mdText: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;

verseText: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
mdText: To the end that _my_ glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my [God,]([/person/god_1324) I will give thanks unto thee for ever.

verseText: In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.
mdText: In thee, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.

verseText: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.
mdText: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.

verseText: For thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name’s sake lead me, and guide me.
mdText: For thou _art_ my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name’s sake lead me, and guide me.

verseText: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.
mdText: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou _art_ my strength.

verseText: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O LORD God of truth.
mdText: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God of truth.

verseText: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the LORD.
mdText: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;
mdText: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;

verseText: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.
mdText: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.

verseText: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.
mdText: Have mercy upon me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, _yea,_ my soul and my belly.

verseText: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.
mdText: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.

verseText: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.
mdText: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.

verseText: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.
mdText: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.

verseText: For I have heard the slander of many: fear was on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.
mdText: For I have heard the slander of many: fear _was_ on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.

verseText: But I trusted in thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my God.
mdText: But I trusted in thee, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) I said, Thou _art_ my [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.
mdText: My times _are_ in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.

verseText: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies’ sake.
mdText: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies’ sake.

verseText: Let me not be ashamed, O LORD; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.
mdText: Let me not be ashamed, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, _and_ let them be silent in the grave.

verseText: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.
mdText: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.

verseText: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!
mdText: _Oh_ how great _is_ thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; _which_ thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!

verseText: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.
mdText: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.

verseText: Blessed be the LORD: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.
mdText: Blessed _be_ the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.

verseText: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
mdText: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.

verseText: O love the LORD, all ye his saints: for the LORD preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.
mdText: O love the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) all ye his saints: _for_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.

verseText: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the LORD.
mdText: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
mdText: Blessed _is_ _he_ _whose_ transgression _is_ forgiven, _whose_ sin _is_ covered.

verseText: Blessed is the man unto whom the LORD imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.
mdText: Blessed _is_ the man unto whom the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit _there_ _is_ no guile.

verseText: When I kept silence, my bones waxed old through my roaring all the day long.
mdText: When I kept silence, my bones waxed old through my roaring all the day long.

verseText: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: my moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.
mdText: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: my moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.

verseText: I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the LORD; and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
mdText: I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.

verseText: For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come nigh unto him.
mdText: For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come nigh unto him.

verseText: Thou art my hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble; thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance. Selah.
mdText: Thou _art_ my hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble; thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance. Selah.

verseText: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.
mdText: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.

verseText: Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding: whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, lest they come near unto thee.
mdText: Be ye not as the horse, _or_ as the mule, _which_ have no understanding: whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, lest they come near unto thee.

verseText: Many sorrows shall be to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the LORD, mercy shall compass him about.
mdText: Many sorrows _shall_ _be_ to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) mercy shall compass him about.

verseText: Be glad in the LORD, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.
mdText: Be glad in the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all _ye_ _that_ _are_ upright in heart.

verseText: Rejoice in the LORD, O ye righteous: for praise is comely for the upright.
mdText: Rejoice in the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O ye righteous: _for_ praise is comely for the upright.

verseText: Praise the LORD with harp: sing unto him with the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings.
mdText: Praise the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with harp: sing unto him with the psaltery _and_ an instrument of ten strings.

verseText: Sing unto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud noise.
mdText: Sing unto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud noise.

verseText: For the word of the LORD is right; and all his works are done in truth.
mdText: For the word of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ right; and all his works _are_ _done_ in truth.

verseText: He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the LORD.
mdText: He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.
mdText: By the word of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.

verseText: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as an heap: he layeth up the depth in storehouses.
mdText: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as an heap: he layeth up the depth in storehouses.

verseText: Let all the earth fear the LORD: let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.
mdText: Let all the earth fear the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.

verseText: For he spake, and it was done; he commanded, and it stood fast.
mdText: For he spake, and it was _done;_ he commanded, and it stood fast.

verseText: The LORD bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought: he maketh the devices of the people of none effect.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought: he maketh the devices of the people of none effect.

verseText: The counsel of the LORD standeth for ever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.
mdText: The counsel of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) standeth for ever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.

verseText: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD; and the people whom he hath chosen for his own inheritance.
mdText: Blessed _is_ the nation whose [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) _and_ the people _whom_ he hath chosen for his own inheritance.

verseText: The LORD looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the sons of men.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the sons of men.

verseText: From the place of his habitation he looketh upon all the inhabitants of the earth.
mdText: From the place of his habitation he looketh upon all the inhabitants of the earth.

verseText: He fashioneth their hearts alike; he considereth all their works.
mdText: He fashioneth their hearts alike; he considereth all their works.

verseText: There is no king saved by the multitude of an host: a mighty man is not delivered by much strength.
mdText: There is no king saved by the multitude of an host: a mighty man is not delivered by much strength.

verseText: An horse is a vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliver any by his great strength.
mdText: An horse _is_ a vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliver _any_ by his great strength.

verseText: Behold, the eye of the LORD is upon them that fear him, upon them that hope in his mercy;
mdText: Behold, the eye of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ upon them that fear him, upon them that hope in his mercy;

verseText: To deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.
mdText: To deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.

verseText: Our soul waiteth for the LORD: he is our help and our shield.
mdText: Our soul waiteth for the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) he _is_ our help and our shield.

verseText: For our heart shall rejoice in him, because we have trusted in his holy name.
mdText: For our heart shall rejoice in him, because we have trusted in his holy name.

verseText: Let thy mercy, O LORD, be upon us, according as we hope in thee.
mdText: Let thy mercy, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) be upon us, according as we hope in thee.

verseText: I will bless the LORD at all times: his praise shall continually be in my mouth.
mdText: I will bless the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) at all times: his praise _shall_ continually _be_ in my mouth.

verseText: My soul shall make her boast in the LORD: the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.
mdText: My soul shall make her boast in the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) the humble shall hear _thereof,_ and be glad.

verseText: O magnify the LORD with me, and let us exalt his name together.
mdText: O magnify the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with me, and let us exalt his name together.

verseText: I sought the LORD, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.
mdText: I sought the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.

verseText: They looked unto him, and were lightened: and their faces were not ashamed.
mdText: They looked unto him, and were lightened: and their faces were not ashamed.

verseText: This poor man cried, and the LORD heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.
mdText: This poor man cried, and the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) heard _him,_ and saved him out of all his troubles.

verseText: The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.
mdText: The angel of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.

verseText: O taste and see that the LORD is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
mdText: O taste and see that the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ good: blessed _is_ the man _that_ trusteth in him.

verseText: O fear the LORD, ye his saints: for there is no want to them that fear him.
mdText: O fear the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) ye his saints: for _there_ _is_ no want to them that fear him.

verseText: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek the LORD shall not want any good thing.
mdText: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall not want any good _thing._

verseText: Come, ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
mdText: Come, ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: What man is he that desireth life, and loveth many days, that he may see good?
mdText: What man _is_ _he_ _that_ desireth life, _and_ loveth _many_ days, that he may see good?

verseText: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
mdText: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.

verseText: Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.
mdText: Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.

verseText: The eyes of the LORD are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
mdText: The eyes of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _are_ upon the righteous, and his ears _are_ _open_ unto their cry.

verseText: The face of the LORD is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
mdText: The face of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.

verseText: The righteous cry, and the LORD heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
mdText: _The_ _righteous_ cry, and the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.

verseText: The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.

verseText: Many are the afflictions of the righteous: but the LORD delivereth him out of them all.
mdText: Many _are_ the afflictions of the righteous: but the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) delivereth him out of them all.

verseText: He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
mdText: He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.

verseText: Evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.
mdText: Evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.

verseText: The LORD redeemeth the soul of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall be desolate.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) redeemeth the soul of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall be desolate.

verseText: Plead my cause, O LORD, with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.
mdText: Plead _my_ _cause,_ O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.

verseText: Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.
mdText: Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.

verseText: Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.
mdText: Draw out also the spear, and stop _the_ _way_ against them that persecute me: say unto my soul, I _am_ thy salvation.

verseText: Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul: let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.
mdText: Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul: let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.

verseText: Let them be as chaff before the wind: and let the angel of the LORD chase them.
mdText: Let them be as chaff before the wind: and let the angel of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) chase _them._

verseText: Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the LORD persecute them.
mdText: Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) persecute them.

verseText: For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit, which without cause they have digged for my soul.
mdText: For without cause have they hid for me their net _in_ a pit, _which_ without cause they have digged for my soul.

verseText: Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he hath hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall.
mdText: Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he hath hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall.

verseText: And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
mdText: And my soul shall be joyful in the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) it shall rejoice in his salvation.

verseText: All my bones shall say, LORD, who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?
mdText: All my bones shall say, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) who _is_ like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?

verseText: False witnesses did rise up; they laid to my charge things that I knew not.
mdText: False witnesses did rise up; they laid to my charge _things_ that I knew not.

verseText: They rewarded me evil for good to the spoiling of my soul.
mdText: They rewarded me evil for good _to_ the spoiling of my soul.

verseText: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom.
mdText: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing _was_ sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom.

verseText: I behaved myself as though he had been my friend or brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.
mdText: I behaved myself as though _he_ _had_ _been_ my friend _or_ brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth _for_ _his_ mother.

verseText: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: yea, the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceased not:
mdText: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: _yea,_ the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew _it_ not; they did tear _me,_ and ceased not:

verseText: With hypocritical mockers in feasts, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.
mdText: With hypocritical mockers in feasts, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.

verseText: Lord, how long wilt thou look on? rescue my soul from their destructions, my darling from the lions.
mdText: [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) how long wilt thou look on? rescue my soul from their destructions, my darling from the lions.

verseText: I will give thee thanks in the great congregation: I will praise thee among much people.
mdText: I will give thee thanks in the great congregation: I will praise thee among much people.

verseText: Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.
mdText: Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: _neither_ let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.

verseText: For they speak not peace: but they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.
mdText: For they speak not peace: but they devise deceitful matters against _them_ _that_ _are_ quiet in the land.

verseText: Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me, and said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it.
mdText: Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me, _and_ said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen _it._

verseText: This thou hast seen, O LORD: keep not silence: O Lord, be not far from me.
mdText: _This_ thou hast seen, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) keep not silence: O [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) be not far from me.

verseText: Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.
mdText: Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment, _even_ unto my cause, my [God]([/person/god_1324) and my [Lord.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.
mdText: Judge me, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my [God,]([/person/god_1324) according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.

verseText: Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it: let them not say, We have swallowed him up.
mdText: Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it: let them not say, We have swallowed him up.

verseText: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.
mdText: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify _themselves_ against me.

verseText: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the LORD be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
mdText: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.

verseText: And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.
mdText: And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness _and_ of thy praise all the day long.

verseText: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.
mdText: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, _that_ _there_ _is_ no fear of [God]([/person/god_1324) before his eyes.

verseText: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.
mdText: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.

verseText: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, and to do good.
mdText: The words of his mouth _are_ iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, _and_ to do good.

verseText: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.
mdText: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way _that_ _is_ not good; he abhorreth not evil.

verseText: Thy mercy, O LORD, is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.
mdText: Thy mercy, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _is_ in the heavens; _and_ thy faithfulness _reacheth_ unto the clouds.

verseText: Thy righteousness is like the great mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: O LORD, thou preservest man and beast.
mdText: Thy righteousness _is_ like the great mountains; thy judgments _are_ a great deep: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) thou preservest man and beast.

verseText: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.
mdText: How excellent _is_ thy lovingkindness, O [God!]([/person/god_1324) therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

verseText: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.
mdText: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.

verseText: For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.
mdText: For with thee _is_ the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.

verseText: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.
mdText: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.

verseText: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.
mdText: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.

verseText: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
mdText: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.

verseText: Fret not thyself because of evildoers, neither be thou envious against the workers of iniquity.
mdText: Fret not thyself because of evildoers, neither be thou envious against the workers of iniquity.

verseText: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the green herb.
mdText: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the green herb.

verseText: Trust in the LORD, and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.
mdText: Trust in the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and do good; _so_ shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.

verseText: Delight thyself also in the LORD; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
mdText: Delight thyself also in the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.

verseText: Commit thy way unto the LORD; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.
mdText: Commit thy way unto the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) trust also in him; and he shall bring _it_ to pass.

verseText: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.
mdText: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.

verseText: Rest in the LORD, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.
mdText: Rest in the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.

verseText: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath: fret not thyself in any wise to do evil.
mdText: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath: fret not thyself in any wise to do evil.

verseText: For evildoers shall be cut off: but those that wait upon the LORD, they shall inherit the earth.
mdText: For evildoers shall be cut off: but those that wait upon the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) they shall inherit the earth.

verseText: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be: yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place, and it shall not be.
mdText: For yet a little while, and the wicked _shall_ not _be:_ yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place, and it _shall_ not _be._

verseText: But the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
mdText: But the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

verseText: The wicked plotteth against the just, and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.
mdText: The wicked plotteth against the just, and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.

verseText: The Lord shall laugh at him: for he seeth that his day is coming.
mdText: The [Lord]([/person/god_1324) shall laugh at him: for he seeth that his day is coming.

verseText: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be of upright conversation.
mdText: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, _and_ to slay such as be of upright conversation.

verseText: Their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.
mdText: Their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.

verseText: A little that a righteous man hath is better than the riches of many wicked.
mdText: A little that a righteous man hath _is_ better than the riches of many wicked.

verseText: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken: but the LORD upholdeth the righteous.
mdText: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken: but the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) upholdeth the righteous.

verseText: The LORD knoweth the days of the upright: and their inheritance shall be for ever.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) knoweth the days of the upright: and their inheritance shall be for ever.

verseText: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time: and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
mdText: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time: and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.

verseText: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD shall be as the fat of lambs: they shall consume; into smoke shall they consume away.
mdText: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _shall_ _be_ as the fat of lambs: they shall consume; into smoke shall they consume away.

verseText: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again: but the righteous sheweth mercy, and giveth.
mdText: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again: but the righteous sheweth mercy, and giveth.

verseText: For such as be blessed of him shall inherit the earth; and they that be cursed of him shall be cut off.
mdText: For _such_ _as_ _be_ blessed of him shall inherit the earth; and _they_ _that_ _be_ cursed of him shall be cut off.

verseText: The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD: and he delighteth in his way.
mdText: The steps of a _good_ man are ordered by the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) and he delighteth in his way.

verseText: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down: for the LORD upholdeth him with his hand.
mdText: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down: for the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) upholdeth _him_ _with_ his hand.

verseText: I have been young, and now am old; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.
mdText: I have been young, and _now_ am old; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.

verseText: He is ever merciful, and lendeth; and his seed is blessed.
mdText: _He_ _is_ ever merciful, and lendeth; and his seed _is_ blessed.

verseText: Depart from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.
mdText: Depart from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.

verseText: For the LORD loveth judgment, and forsaketh not his saints; they are preserved for ever: but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) loveth judgment, and forsaketh not his saints; they are preserved for ever: but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.

verseText: The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.
mdText: The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.

verseText: The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom, and his tongue talketh of judgment.
mdText: The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom, and his tongue talketh of judgment.

verseText: The law of his God is in his heart; none of his steps shall slide.
mdText: The law of his [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ in his heart; none of his steps shall slide.

verseText: The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.
mdText: The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.

verseText: The LORD will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.

verseText: Wait on the LORD, and keep his way, and he shall exalt thee to inherit the land: when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.
mdText: Wait on the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and keep his way, and he shall exalt thee to inherit the land: when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see _it._

verseText: I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a green bay tree.
mdText: I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a green bay tree.

verseText: Yet he passed away, and, lo, he was not: yea, I sought him, but he could not be found.
mdText: Yet he passed away, and, lo, he _was_ not: yea, I sought him, but he could not be found.

verseText: Mark the perfect man, and behold the upright: for the end of that man is peace.
mdText: [Mark]([/person/mark_1679) the perfect _man,_ and behold the upright: for the end of _that_ man _is_ peace.

verseText: But the transgressors shall be destroyed together: the end of the wicked shall be cut off.
mdText: But the transgressors shall be destroyed together: the end of the wicked shall be cut off.

verseText: But the salvation of the righteous is of the LORD: he is their strength in the time of trouble.
mdText: But the salvation of the righteous _is_ of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) _he_ _is_ their strength in the time of trouble.

verseText: And the LORD shall help them, and deliver them: he shall deliver them from the wicked, and save them, because they trust in him.
mdText: And the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall help them, and deliver them: he shall deliver them from the wicked, and save them, because they trust in him.

verseText: O LORD, rebuke me not in thy wrath: neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
mdText: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) rebuke me not in thy wrath: neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

verseText: For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presseth me sore.
mdText: For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presseth me sore.

verseText: There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin.
mdText: _There_ _is_ no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither _is_ _there_ _any_ rest in my bones because of my sin.

verseText: For mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
mdText: For mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me.

verseText: My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.
mdText: My wounds stink _and_ are corrupt because of my foolishness.

verseText: I am troubled; I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.
mdText: I am troubled; I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.

verseText: For my loins are filled with a loathsome disease: and there is no soundness in my flesh.
mdText: For my loins are filled with a loathsome _disease:_ and _there_ _is_ no soundness in my flesh.

verseText: I am feeble and sore broken: I have roared by reason of the disquietness of my heart.
mdText: I am feeble and sore broken: I have roared by reason of the disquietness of my heart.

verseText: Lord, all my desire is before thee; and my groaning is not hid from thee.
mdText: [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) all my desire _is_ before thee; and my groaning is not hid from thee.

verseText: My heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.
mdText: My heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.

verseText: My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore; and my kinsmen stand afar off.
mdText: My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore; and my kinsmen stand afar off.

verseText: They also that seek after my life lay snares for me: and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and imagine deceits all the day long.
mdText: They also that seek after my life lay snares _for_ _me:_ and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and imagine deceits all the day long.

verseText: But I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I was as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.
mdText: But I, as a deaf _man,_ heard not; and _I_ _was_ as a dumb man _that_ openeth not his mouth.

verseText: Thus I was as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
mdText: Thus I was as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth _are_ no reproofs.

verseText: For in thee, O LORD, do I hope: thou wilt hear, O Lord my God.
mdText: For in thee, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) do I hope: thou wilt hear, O [Lord]([/person/god_1324) my [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: For I said, Hear me, lest otherwise they should rejoice over me: when my foot slippeth, they magnify themselves against me.
mdText: For I said, _Hear_ _me,_ lest _otherwise_ they should rejoice over me: when my foot slippeth, they magnify _themselves_ against me.

verseText: For I am ready to halt, and my sorrow is continually before me.
mdText: For I _am_ ready to halt, and my sorrow _is_ continually before me.

verseText: For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.
mdText: For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.

verseText: But mine enemies are lively, and they are strong: and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.
mdText: But mine enemies _are_ lively, _and_ they are strong: and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.

verseText: They also that render evil for good are mine adversaries; because I follow the thing that good is.
mdText: They also that render evil for good are mine adversaries; because I follow _the_ _thing_ _that_ good _is._

verseText: Forsake me not, O LORD: O my God, be not far from me.
mdText: Forsake me not, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) O my [God,]([/person/god_1324) be not far from me.

verseText: Make haste to help me, O Lord my salvation.
mdText: Make haste to help me, O [Lord]([/person/god_1324) my salvation.

verseText: I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me.
mdText: I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me.

verseText: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good; and my sorrow was stirred.
mdText: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, _even_ from good; and my sorrow was stirred.

verseText: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: then spake I with my tongue,
mdText: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: _then_ spake I with my tongue,

verseText: LORD, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is; that I may know how frail I am.
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it _is;_ _that_ I may know how frail I _am._

verseText: Behold, thou hast made my days as an handbreadth; and mine age is as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.
mdText: Behold, thou hast made my days _as_ an handbreadth; and mine age _is_ as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state _is_ altogether vanity. Selah.

verseText: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.
mdText: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up _riches,_ and knoweth not who shall gather them.

verseText: And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.
mdText: And now, [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) what wait I for? my hope _is_ in thee.

verseText: Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.
mdText: Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.

verseText: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst it.
mdText: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst _it._

verseText: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.
mdText: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.

verseText: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.
mdText: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man _is_ vanity. Selah.

verseText: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
mdText: Hear my prayer, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I _am_ a stranger with thee, _and_ a sojourner, as all my fathers _were._

verseText: O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.
mdText: O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.

verseText: I waited patiently for the LORD; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
mdText: I waited patiently for the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.

verseText: He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.
mdText: He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, _and_ established my goings.

verseText: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God: many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the LORD.
mdText: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, _even_ praise unto our [God:]([/person/god_1324) many shall see _it,_ and fear, and shall trust in the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Blessed is that man that maketh the LORD his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
mdText: Blessed _is_ that man that maketh the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

verseText: Many, O LORD my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.
mdText: Many, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my [God,]([/person/god_1324) _are_ thy wonderful works _which_ thou hast done, and thy thoughts _which_ _are_ to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: _if_ I would declare and speak _of_ _them,_ they are more than can be numbered.

verseText: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.
mdText: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.

verseText: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,
mdText: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book _it_ _is_ written of me,

verseText: I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
mdText: I delight to do thy will, O my [God:]([/person/god_1324) yea, thy law _is_ within my heart.

verseText: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O LORD, thou knowest.
mdText: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) thou knowest.

verseText: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.
mdText: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.

verseText: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O LORD: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.
mdText: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.

verseText: For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.
mdText: For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.

verseText: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me: O LORD, make haste to help me.
mdText: Be pleased, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) to deliver me: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) make haste to help me.

verseText: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.
mdText: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.

verseText: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.
mdText: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.

verseText: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The LORD be magnified.
mdText: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) be magnified.

verseText: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.
mdText: But I _am_ poor and needy; _yet_ the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) thinketh upon me: thou _art_ my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: the LORD will deliver him in time of trouble.
