mdText: Blessed _is_ he that considereth the poor: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will deliver him in time of trouble.

verseText: The LORD will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will preserve him, and keep him alive; _and_ he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.

verseText: The LORD will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.

verseText: I said, LORD, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.
mdText: I said, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.

verseText: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?
mdText: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?

verseText: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.
mdText: And if he come to see _me,_ he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; _when_ he goeth abroad, he telleth _it._

verseText: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.
mdText: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.

verseText: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that he lieth he shall rise up no more.
mdText: An evil disease, _say_ _they,_ cleaveth fast unto him: and _now_ that he lieth he shall rise up no more.

verseText: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.
mdText: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up _his_ heel against me.

verseText: But thou, O LORD, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.
mdText: But thou, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

verseText: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.
mdText: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

verseText: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.
mdText: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.

verseText: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
mdText: Blessed _be_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.

verseText: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.
mdText: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: when shall I come and appear before God?
mdText: My soul thirsteth for [God,]([/person/god_1324) for the living [God:]([/person/god_1324) when shall I come and appear before [God?]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: My tears have been my meat day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where is thy God?
mdText: My tears have been my meat day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where _is_ thy [God?]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: When I remember these things, I pour out my soul in me: for I had gone with the multitude, I went with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with a multitude that kept holyday.
mdText: When I remember these _things,_ I pour out my soul in me: for I had gone with the multitude, I went with them to the house of [God,]([/person/god_1324) with the voice of joy and praise, with a multitude that kept holyday.

verseText: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him for the help of his countenance.
mdText: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and _why_ art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in [God:]([/person/god_1324) for I shall yet praise him _for_ the help of his countenance.

verseText: O my God, my soul is cast down within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermonites, from the hill Mizar.
mdText: O my [God,]([/person/god_1324) my soul is cast down within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of [Jordan,](/place/jordan_653) and of the [Hermonites,](/place/hermon_564) from the hill [Mizar.](/place/hill_mizar_847)

verseText: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.
mdText: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.

verseText: Yet the LORD will command his lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night his song shall be with me, and my prayer unto the God of my life.
mdText: _Yet_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will command his lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night his song _shall_ _be_ with me, _and_ my prayer unto the [God]([/person/god_1324) of my life.

verseText: I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
mdText: I will say unto [God]([/person/god_1324) my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

verseText: As with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where is thy God?
mdText: _As_ with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where _is_ thy [God?]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.
mdText: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope thou in [God:]([/person/god_1324) for I shall yet praise him, _who_ _is_ the health of my countenance, and my [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation: O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.
mdText: Judge me, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) and plead my cause against an ungodly nation: O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.

verseText: For thou art the God of my strength: why dost thou cast me off? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
mdText: For thou _art_ the [God]([/person/god_1324) of my strength: why dost thou cast me off? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

verseText: O send out thy light and thy truth: let them lead me; let them bring me unto thy holy hill, and to thy tabernacles.
mdText: O send out thy light and thy truth: let them lead me; let them bring me unto thy holy hill, and to thy tabernacles.

verseText: Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto God my exceeding joy: yea, upon the harp will I praise thee, O God my God.
mdText: Then will I go unto the altar of [God,]([/person/god_1324) unto [God]([/person/god_1324) my exceeding joy: yea, upon the harp will I praise thee, O [God]([/person/god_1324) my [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.
mdText: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope in [God:]([/person/god_1324) for I shall yet praise him, _who_ _is_ the health of my countenance, and my [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.
mdText: We have heard with our ears, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) our fathers have told us, _what_ work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.

verseText: How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.
mdText: _How_ thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; _how_ thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

verseText: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.
mdText: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.

verseText: Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.
mdText: Thou art my King, O [God:]([/person/god_1324) command deliverances for [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.
mdText: Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.

verseText: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.
mdText: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

verseText: But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.
mdText: But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.

verseText: In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.
mdText: In [God]([/person/god_1324) we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.

verseText: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.
mdText: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.

verseText: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.
mdText: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.

verseText: Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.
mdText: Thou hast given us like sheep _appointed_ for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.

verseText: Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.
mdText: Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase _thy_ _wealth_ by their price.

verseText: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.
mdText: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.

verseText: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.
mdText: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.

verseText: My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
mdText: My confusion _is_ continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

verseText: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.
mdText: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.

verseText: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.
mdText: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.

verseText: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;
mdText: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;

verseText: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.
mdText: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.

verseText: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;
mdText: If we have forgotten the name of our [God,]([/person/god_1324) or stretched out our hands to a strange god;

verseText: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
mdText: Shall not [God]([/person/god_1324) search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.

verseText: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
mdText: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

verseText: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.
mdText: Awake, why sleepest thou, O [Lord?]([/person/god_1324) arise, cast _us_ not off for ever.

verseText: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?
mdText: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, _and_ forgettest our affliction and our oppression?

verseText: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.
mdText: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.

verseText: Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.
mdText: Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.

verseText: My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
mdText: My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue _is_ the pen of a ready writer.

verseText: Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.
mdText: Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into thy lips: therefore [God]([/person/god_1324) hath blessed thee for ever.

verseText: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, with thy glory and thy majesty.
mdText: Gird thy sword upon _thy_ thigh, O _most_ mighty, with thy glory and thy majesty.

verseText: And in thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.
mdText: And in thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness _and_ righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

verseText: Thine arrows are sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies; whereby the people fall under thee.
mdText: Thine arrows _are_ sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies; _whereby_ the people fall under thee.

verseText: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.
mdText: Thy throne, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) _is_ for ever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom _is_ a right sceptre.

verseText: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
mdText: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefore [God,]([/person/god_1324) thy [God,]([/person/god_1324) hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

verseText: All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia, out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.
mdText: All thy garments _smell_ of myrrh, and aloes, _and_ cassia, out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.

verseText: Kings’ daughters were among thy honourable women: upon thy right hand did stand the queen in gold of Ophir.
mdText: Kings’ daughters _were_ among thy honourable women: upon thy right hand did stand the queen in gold of [Ophir.](/place/ophir_911)

verseText: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father’s house;
mdText: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father’s house;

verseText: So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.
mdText: So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he _is_ thy [Lord;]([/person/god_1324) and worship thou him.

verseText: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall intreat thy favour.
mdText: And the daughter of [Tyre](/place/tyre_1184) _shall_ _be_ _there_ with a gift; _even_ the rich among the people shall intreat thy favour.

verseText: The king’s daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of wrought gold.
mdText: The king’s daughter _is_ all glorious within: her clothing _is_ of wrought gold.

verseText: She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.
mdText: She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.

verseText: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought: they shall enter into the king’s palace.
mdText: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought: they shall enter into the king’s palace.

verseText: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.
mdText: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.

verseText: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.
mdText: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.

verseText: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

verseText: Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;
mdText: Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;

verseText: Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled, though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.
mdText: _Though_ the waters thereof roar _and_ be troubled, _though_ the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.

verseText: There is a river, the streams whereof shall make glad the city of God, the holy place of the tabernacles of the most High.
mdText: _There_ _is_ a river, the streams whereof shall make glad the city of [God,]([/person/god_1324) the holy _place_ of the tabernacles of the most High.

verseText: God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: God shall help her, and that right early.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: [God]([/person/god_1324) shall help her, _and_ _that_ right early.

verseText: The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice, the earth melted.
mdText: The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice, the earth melted.

verseText: The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) of hosts _is_ with us; the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) _is_ our refuge. Selah.

verseText: Come, behold the works of the LORD, what desolations he hath made in the earth.
mdText: Come, behold the works of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) what desolations he hath made in the earth.

verseText: He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariot in the fire.
mdText: He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariot in the fire.

verseText: Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.
mdText: Be still, and know that I _am_ [God:]([/person/god_1324) I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.

verseText: The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) of hosts _is_ with us; the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) _is_ our refuge. Selah.

verseText: O clap your hands, all ye people; shout unto God with the voice of triumph.
mdText: O clap your hands, all ye people; shout unto [God]([/person/god_1324) with the voice of triumph.

verseText: For the LORD most high is terrible; he is a great King over all the earth.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) most high _is_ terrible; _he_ _is_ a great King over all the earth.

verseText: He shall subdue the people under us, and the nations under our feet.
mdText: He shall subdue the people under us, and the nations under our feet.

verseText: He shall choose our inheritance for us, the excellency of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
mdText: He shall choose our inheritance for us, the excellency of [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) whom he loved. Selah.

verseText: God is gone up with a shout, the LORD with the sound of a trumpet.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) is gone up with a shout, the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with the sound of a trumpet.

verseText: Sing praises to God, sing praises: sing praises unto our King, sing praises.
mdText: Sing praises to [God,]([/person/god_1324) sing praises: sing praises unto our King, sing praises.

verseText: For God is the King of all the earth: sing ye praises with understanding.
mdText: For [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the King of all the earth: sing ye praises with understanding.

verseText: God reigneth over the heathen: God sitteth upon the throne of his holiness.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) reigneth over the heathen: [God]([/person/god_1324) sitteth upon the throne of his holiness.

verseText: The princes of the people are gathered together, even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong unto God: he is greatly exalted.
mdText: The princes of the people are gathered together, _even_ the people of the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Abraham:]([/person/abraham_58) for the shields of the earth _belong_ unto [God:]([/person/god_1324) he is greatly exalted.

verseText: Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, in the mountain of his holiness.
mdText: Great _is_ the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and greatly to be praised in the city of our [God,]([/person/god_1324) _in_ the mountain of his holiness.

verseText: Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion, on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.
mdText: Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth, _is_ mount [Zion,](/place/mount_zion_860) _on_ the sides of the north, the city of the great King.

verseText: God is known in her palaces for a refuge.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) is known in her palaces for a refuge.

verseText: For, lo, the kings were assembled, they passed by together.
mdText: For, lo, the kings were assembled, they passed by together.

verseText: They saw it, and so they marvelled; they were troubled, and hasted away.
mdText: They saw _it,_ _and_ so they marvelled; they were troubled, _and_ hasted away.

verseText: Fear took hold upon them there, and pain, as of a woman in travail.
mdText: Fear took hold upon them there, _and_ pain, as of a woman in travail.

verseText: Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish with an east wind.
mdText: Thou breakest the ships of [Tarshish](/place/tarshish_1139) with an east wind.

verseText: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the LORD of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it for ever. Selah.
mdText: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) of hosts, in the city of our [God:]([/person/god_1324) [God]([/person/god_1324) will establish it for ever. Selah.

verseText: We have thought of thy lovingkindness, O God, in the midst of thy temple.
mdText: We have thought of thy lovingkindness, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) in the midst of thy temple.

verseText: According to thy name, O God, so is thy praise unto the ends of the earth: thy right hand is full of righteousness.
mdText: According to thy name, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) so _is_ thy praise unto the ends of the earth: thy right hand is full of righteousness.

verseText: Let mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.
mdText: Let mount [Zion](/place/mount_zion_860) rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad, because of thy judgments.

verseText: Walk about Zion, and go round about her: tell the towers thereof.
mdText: Walk about [Zion,](/place/zion_1263) and go round about her: tell the towers thereof.

verseText: Mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces; that ye may tell it to the generation following.
mdText: [Mark]([/person/mark_1679) ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces; that ye may tell _it_ to the generation following.

verseText: For this God is our God for ever and ever: he will be our guide even unto death.
mdText: For this [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ our [God]([/person/god_1324) for ever and ever: he will be our guide _even_ unto death.

verseText: Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:
mdText: Hear this, all _ye_ people; give ear, all _ye_ inhabitants of the world:

verseText: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.
mdText: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.

verseText: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
mdText: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart _shall_ _be_ of understanding.

verseText: I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.
mdText: I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.

verseText: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?
mdText: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, _when_ the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?

verseText: They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;
mdText: They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;

verseText: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:
mdText: None _of_ _them_ can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to [God]([/person/god_1324) a ransom for him:

verseText: For the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)
mdText: (For the redemption of their soul _is_ precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)

verseText: That he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.
mdText: That he should still live for ever, _and_ not see corruption.

verseText: For he seeth that wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.
mdText: For he seeth _that_ wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.

verseText: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.
mdText: Their inward thought _is,_ _that_ their houses _shall_ _continue_ for ever, _and_ their dwelling places to all generations; they call _their_ lands after their own names.

verseText: Nevertheless man being in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.
mdText: Nevertheless man _being_ in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts _that_ perish.

verseText: This their way is their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.
mdText: This their way _is_ their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.

verseText: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.
mdText: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.

verseText: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.
mdText: But [God]([/person/god_1324) will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.

verseText: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;
mdText: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;

verseText: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.
mdText: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.

verseText: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and men will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.
mdText: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and _men_ will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.

verseText: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.
mdText: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.

verseText: Man that is in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts that perish.
mdText: Man _that_ _is_ in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts _that_ perish.

verseText: The mighty God, even the LORD, hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.
mdText: The mighty [God,]([/person/god_1324) _even_ the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.

verseText: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.
mdText: Out of [Zion,](/place/zion_1263) the perfection of beauty, [God]([/person/god_1324) hath shined.

verseText: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.
mdText: Our [God]([/person/god_1324) shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.

verseText: He shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people.
mdText: He shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people.

verseText: Gather my saints together unto me; those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.
mdText: Gather my saints together unto me; those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.

verseText: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.
mdText: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ judge himself. Selah.

verseText: Hear, O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I am God, even thy God.
mdText: Hear, O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I _am_ [God,]([/person/god_1324) _even_ thy [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt offerings, to have been continually before me.
mdText: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt offerings, _to_ _have_ _been_ continually before me.

verseText: I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he goats out of thy folds.
mdText: I will take no bullock out of thy house, _nor_ he goats out of thy folds.

verseText: For every beast of the forest is mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.
mdText: For every beast of the forest _is_ mine, _and_ the cattle upon a thousand hills.

verseText: I know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field are mine.
mdText: I know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field _are_ mine.

verseText: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.
mdText: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world _is_ mine, and the fulness thereof.

verseText: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
mdText: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?

verseText: Offer unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:
mdText: Offer unto [God]([/person/god_1324) thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:

verseText: And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
mdText: And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.

verseText: But unto the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?
mdText: But unto the wicked [God]([/person/god_1324) saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or _that_ thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?

verseText: Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee.
mdText: Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee.

verseText: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.
mdText: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.

verseText: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
mdText: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.

verseText: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother’s son.
mdText: Thou sittest _and_ speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother’s son.

verseText: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether such an one as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.
mdText: These _things_ hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether _such_ _an_ _one_ as thyself: _but_ I will reprove thee, and set _them_ in order before thine eyes.

verseText: Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver.
mdText: Now consider this, ye that forget [God,]([/person/god_1324) lest I tear _you_ in pieces, and _there_ _be_ none to deliver.

verseText: Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth his conversation aright will I shew the salvation of God.
mdText: Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth _his_ conversation _aright_ will I shew the salvation of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.
mdText: Have mercy upon me, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.

verseText: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
mdText: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

verseText: For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.
mdText: For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin _is_ ever before me.

verseText: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.
mdText: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done _this_ evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, _and_ be clear when thou judgest.

verseText: Behold, I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.
mdText: Behold, I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.

verseText: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.
mdText: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden _part_ thou shalt make me to know wisdom.

verseText: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
mdText: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

verseText: Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.
mdText: Make me to hear joy and gladness; _that_ the bones _which_ thou hast broken may rejoice.

verseText: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.
mdText: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.

verseText: Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.
mdText: Create in me a clean heart, O [God;]([/person/god_1324) and renew a right spirit within me.

verseText: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.
mdText: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.

verseText: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.
mdText: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me _with_ _thy_ free spirit.

verseText: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
mdText: _Then_ will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.

verseText: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
mdText: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) thou [God]([/person/god_1324) of my salvation: _and_ my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.

verseText: O Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.
mdText: O [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.

verseText: For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.
mdText: For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give _it:_ thou delightest not in burnt offering.

verseText: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
mdText: The sacrifices of [God]([/person/god_1324) _are_ a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) thou wilt not despise.

verseText: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.
mdText: Do good in thy good pleasure unto [Zion:](/place/zion_1263) build thou the walls of [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.
mdText: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.

verseText: Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? the goodness of God endureth continually.
mdText: Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? the goodness of [God]([/person/god_1324) _endureth_ continually.

verseText: Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
mdText: Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.

verseText: Thou lovest evil more than good; and lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.
mdText: Thou lovest evil more than good; _and_ lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.

verseText: Thou lovest all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.
mdText: Thou lovest all devouring words, O _thou_ deceitful tongue.

verseText: God shall likewise destroy thee for ever, he shall take thee away, and pluck thee out of thy dwelling place, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) shall likewise destroy thee for ever, he shall take thee away, and pluck thee out of _thy_ dwelling place, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.

verseText: The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:
mdText: The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:

verseText: Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength; but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.
mdText: Lo, _this_ _is_ the man _that_ made not [God]([/person/god_1324) his strength; but trusted in the abundance of his riches, _and_ strengthened himself in his wickedness.

verseText: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God: I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.
mdText: But I _am_ like a green olive tree in the house of [God:]([/person/god_1324) I trust in the mercy of [God]([/person/god_1324) for ever and ever.

verseText: I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done it: and I will wait on thy name; for it is good before thy saints.
mdText: I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done _it:_ and I will wait on thy name; for _it_ _is_ good before thy saints.

verseText: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity: there is none that doeth good.
mdText: The fool hath said in his heart, _There_ _is_ no [God.]([/person/god_1324) Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity: _there_ _is_ none that doeth good.

verseText: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were _any_ that did understand, that did seek [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
mdText: Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy; _there_ _is_ none that doeth good, no, not one.

verseText: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread: they have not called upon God.
mdText: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people _as_ they eat bread: they have not called upon [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: There were they in great fear, where no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee: thou hast put them to shame, because God hath despised them.
mdText: There were they in great fear, _where_ no fear was: for [God]([/person/god_1324) hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth _against_ thee: thou hast put _them_ to shame, because [God]([/person/god_1324) hath despised them.

verseText: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! When God bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
mdText: Oh that the salvation of Israel _were_ _come_ out of [Zion!](/place/zion_1263) When [God]([/person/god_1324) bringeth back the captivity of his people, [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) shall rejoice, _and_ Israel shall be glad.

verseText: Save me, O God, by thy name, and judge me by thy strength.
mdText: Save me, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) by thy name, and judge me by thy strength.

verseText: Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.
mdText: Hear my prayer, O [God;]([/person/god_1324) give ear to the words of my mouth.

verseText: For strangers are risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my soul: they have not set God before them. Selah.
mdText: For strangers are risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my soul: they have not set [God]([/person/god_1324) before them. Selah.

verseText: Behold, God is mine helper: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.
mdText: Behold, [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ mine helper: the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) _is_ with them that uphold my soul.

verseText: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies: cut them off in thy truth.
mdText: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies: cut them off in thy truth.

verseText: I will freely sacrifice unto thee: I will praise thy name, O LORD; for it is good.
mdText: I will freely sacrifice unto thee: I will praise thy name, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for _it_ _is_ good.

verseText: For he hath delivered me out of all trouble: and mine eye hath seen his desire upon mine enemies.
mdText: For he hath delivered me out of all trouble: and mine eye hath seen _his_ _desire_ upon mine enemies.

verseText: Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.
mdText: Give ear to my prayer, O [God;]([/person/god_1324) and hide not thyself from my supplication.

verseText: Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;
mdText: Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;

verseText: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.
mdText: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.

verseText: My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
mdText: My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.

verseText: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.
mdText: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.

verseText: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then would I fly away, and be at rest.
mdText: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! _for_ _then_ would I fly away, and be at rest.

verseText: Lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.
mdText: Lo, _then_ would I wander far off, _and_ remain in the wilderness. Selah.

verseText: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.
mdText: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm _and_ tempest.

verseText: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
mdText: Destroy, O [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) _and_ divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

verseText: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.
mdText: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow _are_ in the midst of it.

verseText: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.
mdText: Wickedness _is_ in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.

verseText: For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:
mdText: For _it_ _was_ not an enemy _that_ reproached me; then I could have borne _it:_ neither _was_ _it_ he that hated me _that_ did magnify _himself_ against me; then I would have hid myself from him:

verseText: But it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.
mdText: But _it_ _was_ thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.

verseText: We took sweet counsel together, and walked unto the house of God in company.
mdText: We took sweet counsel together, _and_ walked unto the house of [God]([/person/god_1324) in company.

verseText: Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.
mdText: Let death seize upon them, _and_ let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness _is_ in their dwellings, _and_ among them.

verseText: As for me, I will call upon God; and the LORD shall save me.
mdText: As for me, I will call upon [God;]([/person/god_1324) and the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall save me.

verseText: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.
mdText: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.

verseText: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.
mdText: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle _that_ _was_ against me: for there were many with me.

verseText: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.
mdText: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.

verseText: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.
mdText: _The_ _words_ of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war _was_ in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet _were_ they drawn swords.

verseText: Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
mdText: Cast thy burden upon the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.

verseText: But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.
mdText: But thou, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.

verseText: Be merciful unto me, O God: for man would swallow me up; he fighting daily oppresseth me.
mdText: Be merciful unto me, O [God:]([/person/god_1324) for man would swallow me up; he fighting daily oppresseth me.

verseText: Mine enemies would daily swallow me up: for they be many that fight against me, O thou most High.
mdText: Mine enemies would daily swallow _me_ up: for _they_ _be_ many that fight against me, O thou most High.

verseText: What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.
mdText: What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.

verseText: In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust; I will not fear what flesh can do unto me.
mdText: In [God]([/person/god_1324) I will praise his word, in [God]([/person/god_1324) I have put my trust; I will not fear what flesh can do unto me.

verseText: Every day they wrest my words: all their thoughts are against me for evil.
mdText: Every day they wrest my words: all their thoughts _are_ against me for evil.

verseText: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, they mark my steps, when they wait for my soul.
mdText: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, they mark my steps, when they wait for my soul.

verseText: Shall they escape by iniquity? in thine anger cast down the people, O God.
mdText: Shall they escape by iniquity? in _thine_ anger cast down the people, O [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Thou tellest my wanderings: put thou my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?
mdText: Thou tellest my wanderings: put thou my tears into thy bottle: _are_ _they_ not in thy book?

verseText: When I cry unto thee, then shall mine enemies turn back: this I know; for God is for me.
mdText: When I cry _unto_ _thee,_ then shall mine enemies turn back: this I know; for [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ for me.

verseText: In God will I praise his word: in the LORD will I praise his word.
mdText: In [God]([/person/god_1324) will I praise _his_ word: in the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will I praise _his_ word.

verseText: In God have I put my trust: I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.
mdText: In [God]([/person/god_1324) have I put my trust: I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.

verseText: Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee.
mdText: Thy vows _are_ upon me, O [God:]([/person/god_1324) I will render praises unto thee.

verseText: For thou hast delivered my soul from death: wilt not thou deliver my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living?
mdText: For thou hast delivered my soul from death: _wilt_ not _thou_ _deliver_ my feet from falling, that I may walk before [God]([/person/god_1324) in the light of the living?

verseText: Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me: for my soul trusteth in thee: yea, in the shadow of thy wings will I make my refuge, until these calamities be overpast.
mdText: Be merciful unto me, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) be merciful unto me: for my soul trusteth in thee: yea, in the shadow of thy wings will I make my refuge, until _these_ calamities be overpast.

verseText: I will cry unto God most high; unto God that performeth all things for me.
mdText: I will cry unto [God]([/person/god_1324) most high; unto [God]([/person/god_1324) that performeth _all_ _things_ for me.

verseText: He shall send from heaven, and save me from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.
mdText: He shall send from heaven, and save me _from_ the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. [God]([/person/god_1324) shall send forth his mercy and his truth.

verseText: My soul is among lions: and I lie even among them that are set on fire, even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.
mdText: My soul _is_ among lions: _and_ I lie _even_ _among_ them that are set on fire, _even_ the sons of men, whose teeth _are_ spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

verseText: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; let thy glory be above all the earth.
mdText: Be thou exalted, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) above the heavens; _let_ thy glory _be_ above all the earth.

verseText: They have prepared a net for my steps; my soul is bowed down: they have digged a pit before me, into the midst whereof they are fallen themselves. Selah.
mdText: They have prepared a net for my steps; my soul is bowed down: they have digged a pit before me, into the midst whereof they are fallen _themselves._ Selah.

verseText: My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed: I will sing and give praise.
mdText: My heart is fixed, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) my heart is fixed: I will sing and give praise.

verseText: Awake up, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.
mdText: Awake up, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp: I _myself_ will awake early.

verseText: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: I will sing unto thee among the nations.
mdText: I will praise thee, O [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) among the people: I will sing unto thee among the nations.

verseText: For thy mercy is great unto the heavens, and thy truth unto the clouds.
mdText: For thy mercy _is_ great unto the heavens, and thy truth unto the clouds.

verseText: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: let thy glory be above all the earth.
mdText: Be thou exalted, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) above the heavens: _let_ thy glory _be_ above all the earth.

verseText: Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?
mdText: Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?

verseText: Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.
mdText: Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.

verseText: The wicked are estranged from the womb: they go astray as soon as they be born, speaking lies.
mdText: The wicked are estranged from the womb: they go astray as soon as they be born, speaking lies.

verseText: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ear;
mdText: Their poison _is_ like the poison of a serpent: _they_ _are_ like the deaf adder _that_ stoppeth her ear;

verseText: Which will not hearken to the voice of charmers, charming never so wisely.
mdText: Which will not hearken to the voice of charmers, charming never so wisely.

verseText: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth: break out the great teeth of the young lions, O LORD.
mdText: Break their teeth, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) in their mouth: break out the great teeth of the young lions, O [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Let them melt away as waters which run continually: when he bendeth his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.
mdText: Let them melt away as waters _which_ run continually: _when_ he bendeth _his_ _bow_ _to_ _shoot_ his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.

verseText: As a snail which melteth, let every one of them pass away: like the untimely birth of a woman, that they may not see the sun.
mdText: As a snail _which_ melteth, let _every_ _one_ _of_ _them_ pass away: _like_ the untimely birth of a woman, _that_ they may not see the sun.

verseText: Before your pots can feel the thorns, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in his wrath.
mdText: Before your pots can feel the thorns, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in _his_ wrath.

verseText: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance: he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
mdText: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance: he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.

verseText: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous: verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.
mdText: So that a man shall say, Verily _there_ _is_ a reward for the righteous: verily he is a [God]([/person/god_1324) that judgeth in the earth.

verseText: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.
mdText: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my [God:]([/person/god_1324) defend me from them that rise up against me.

verseText: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.
mdText: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.

verseText: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O LORD.
mdText: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not _for_ my transgression, nor _for_ my sin, O [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.
mdText: They run and prepare themselves without _my_ fault: awake to help me, and behold.

verseText: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.
mdText: Thou therefore, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God of hosts, the [God]([/person/god_1324) of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

verseText: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
mdText: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

verseText: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
mdText: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords _are_ in their lips: for who, _say_ _they,_ doth hear?

verseText: But thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.
mdText: But thou, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.

verseText: Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.
mdText: _Because_ _of_ his strength will I wait upon thee: for [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ my defence.

verseText: The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
mdText: The [God]([/person/god_1324) of my mercy shall prevent me: [God]([/person/god_1324) shall let me see _my_ _desire_ upon mine enemies.

verseText: Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.
mdText: Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O [Lord]([/person/god_1324) our shield.

verseText: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.
mdText: _For_ the sin of their mouth _and_ the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying _which_ they speak.

verseText: Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
mdText: Consume _them_ in wrath, consume _them,_ that they _may_ not _be:_ and let them know that [God]([/person/god_1324) ruleth in [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) unto the ends of the earth. Selah.

verseText: And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
mdText: And at evening let them return; _and_ let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

verseText: Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.
mdText: Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.

verseText: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.
mdText: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.

verseText: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.
mdText: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ my defence, _and_ the [God]([/person/god_1324) of my mercy.

verseText: O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.

verseText: Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.
mdText: Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.

verseText: Thou hast shewed thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.
mdText: Thou hast shewed thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.

verseText: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
mdText: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.

verseText: That thy beloved may be delivered; save with thy right hand, and hear me.
mdText: That thy beloved may be delivered; save _with_ thy right hand, and hear me.

verseText: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide [Shechem,](/place/shechem_1069) and mete out the valley of [Succoth.](/place/valesuccoth_1194)

verseText: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;
mdText: [Gilead](/place/gilead_475) _is_ mine, and [Manasseh]([/person/manasseh_1928) _is_ mine; [Ephraim]([/person/ephraim_1206) also _is_ the strength of mine head; Judah _is_ my lawgiver;

verseText: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.
mdText: [Moab]([/person/moab_2103) _is_ my washpot; over [Edom]([/person/esau_1216) will I cast out my shoe: [Philistia,](/place/philistia_943) triumph thou because of me.

verseText: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
mdText: Who will bring me _into_ the strong city? who will lead me into [Edom?]([/person/esau_1216)

verseText: Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off? and thou, O God, which didst not go out with our armies?
mdText: _Wilt_ not thou, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) _which_ hadst cast us off? and _thou,_ O [God,]([/person/god_1324) _which_ didst not go out with our armies?

verseText: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.
mdText: Give us help from trouble: for vain _is_ the help of man.

verseText: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.
mdText: Through [God]([/person/god_1324) we shall do valiantly: for he _it_ _is_ _that_ shall tread down our enemies.

verseText: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.
mdText: Hear my cry, O [God;]([/person/god_1324) attend unto my prayer.

verseText: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
mdText: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock _that_ is higher than I.

verseText: For thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from the enemy.
mdText: For thou hast been a shelter for me, _and_ a strong tower from the enemy.

verseText: I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.
mdText: I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.

verseText: For thou, O God, hast heard my vows: thou hast given me the heritage of those that fear thy name.
mdText: For thou, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) hast heard my vows: thou hast given _me_ the heritage of those that fear thy name.

verseText: Thou wilt prolong the king’s life: and his years as many generations.
mdText: Thou wilt prolong the king’s life: _and_ his years as many generations.

verseText: He shall abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him.
mdText: He shall abide before [God]([/person/god_1324) for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, _which_ may preserve him.

verseText: So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.
mdText: So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.

verseText: Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.
mdText: Truly my soul waiteth upon [God:]([/person/god_1324) from him _cometh_ my salvation.

verseText: He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.
mdText: He only _is_ my rock and my salvation; _he_ _is_ my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.

verseText: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.
mdText: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall _shall_ _ye_ _be,_ _and_ _as_ a tottering fence.

verseText: They only consult to cast him down from his excellency: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.
mdText: They only consult to cast _him_ down from his excellency: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.

verseText: My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
mdText: My soul, wait thou only upon [God;]([/person/god_1324) for my expectation _is_ from him.

verseText: He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall not be moved.
mdText: He only _is_ my rock and my salvation: _he_ _is_ my defence; I shall not be moved.

verseText: In God is my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.
mdText: In [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, _and_ my refuge, _is_ in [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.
mdText: Trust in him at all times; _ye_ people, pour out your heart before him: [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ a refuge for us. Selah.

verseText: Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.
mdText: Surely men of low degree _are_ vanity, _and_ men of high degree _are_ a lie: to be laid in the balance, they _are_ altogether _lighter_ than vanity.

verseText: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.
mdText: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart _upon_ _them._

verseText: God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth unto God.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power _belongeth_ unto [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.
mdText: Also unto thee, O [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) _belongeth_ mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.

verseText: O God, thou art my God; early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) thou _art_ my [God;]([/person/god_1324) early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;

verseText: To see thy power and thy glory, so as I have seen thee in the sanctuary.
mdText: To see thy power and thy glory, so _as_ I have seen thee in the sanctuary.

verseText: Because thy lovingkindness is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.
mdText: Because thy lovingkindness _is_ better than life, my lips shall praise thee.

verseText: Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.
mdText: Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.

verseText: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:
mdText: My soul shall be satisfied as _with_ marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise _thee_ with joyful lips:

verseText: When I remember thee upon my bed, and meditate on thee in the night watches.
mdText: When I remember thee upon my bed, _and_ meditate on thee in the _night_ watches.

verseText: Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
mdText: Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.

verseText: My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.
mdText: My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.

verseText: But those that seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
mdText: But those _that_ seek my soul, to destroy _it,_ shall go into the lower parts of the earth.

verseText: They shall fall by the sword: they shall be a portion for foxes.
mdText: They shall fall by the sword: they shall be a portion for foxes.

verseText: But the king shall rejoice in God; every one that sweareth by him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.
mdText: But the king shall rejoice in [God;]([/person/god_1324) every one that sweareth by him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.

verseText: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
mdText: Hear my voice, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

verseText: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:
mdText: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:

verseText: Who whet their tongue like a sword, and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words:
mdText: Who whet their tongue like a sword, _and_ bend _their_ _bows_ _to_ _shoot_ their arrows, _even_ bitter words:

verseText: That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.
mdText: That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.

verseText: They encourage themselves in an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who shall see them?
mdText: They encourage themselves _in_ an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who shall see them?

verseText: They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward thought of every one of them, and the heart, is deep.
mdText: They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward _thought_ of every one _of_ _them,_ and the heart, _is_ deep.

verseText: But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.
mdText: But [God]([/person/god_1324) shall shoot at them _with_ an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.

verseText: So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.
mdText: So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.

verseText: And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.
mdText: And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of [God;]([/person/god_1324) for they shall wisely consider of his doing.

verseText: The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.
mdText: The righteous shall be glad in the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.

verseText: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Sion: and unto thee shall the vow be performed.
mdText: Praise waiteth for thee, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) in [Sion:](/place/zion_1263) and unto thee shall the vow be performed.

verseText: O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.
mdText: O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.

verseText: Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.
mdText: Iniquities prevail against me: _as_ _for_ our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.

verseText: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.
mdText: Blessed _is_ _the_ _man_ _whom_ thou choosest, and causest to approach _unto_ _thee,_ _that_ he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, _even_ of thy holy temple.

verseText: By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation; who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off upon the sea:
mdText: _By_ terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of our salvation; _who_ _art_ the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off _upon_ the sea:

verseText: Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains; being girded with power:
mdText: Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains; _being_ girded with power:

verseText: Which stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.
mdText: Which stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.

verseText: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.
mdText: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.

verseText: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.
mdText: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of [God,]([/person/god_1324) _which_ is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.

verseText: Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: thou settlest the furrows thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing thereof.
mdText: Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: thou settlest the furrows thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing thereof.

verseText: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.
mdText: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.

verseText: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.
mdText: They drop _upon_ the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.

verseText: The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.
mdText: The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.

verseText: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:
mdText: Make a joyful noise unto [God,]([/person/god_1324) all ye lands:

verseText: Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.
mdText: Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.

verseText: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.
mdText: Say unto [God,]([/person/god_1324) How terrible _art_ _thou_ _in_ thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.

verseText: All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.
mdText: All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee; they shall sing _to_ thy name. Selah.

verseText: Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doing toward the children of men.
mdText: Come and see the works of [God:]([/person/god_1324) _he_ _is_ terrible _in_ _his_ doing toward the children of men.

verseText: He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there did we rejoice in him.
mdText: He turned the sea into dry _land:_ they went through the flood on foot: there did we rejoice in him.

verseText: He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
mdText: He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.

verseText: O bless our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:
mdText: O bless our [God,]([/person/god_1324) ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:

verseText: Which holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.
mdText: Which holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.

verseText: For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.
mdText: For thou, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.

verseText: Thou broughtest us into the net; thou laidst affliction upon our loins.
mdText: Thou broughtest us into the net; thou laidst affliction upon our loins.

verseText: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.
mdText: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy _place._

verseText: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,
mdText: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,

verseText: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.
mdText: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.

verseText: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.
mdText: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.

verseText: Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.
mdText: Come _and_ hear, all ye that fear [God,]([/person/god_1324) and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.

verseText: I cried unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.
mdText: I cried unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.

verseText: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:
mdText: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) will not hear _me:_

verseText: But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
mdText: _But_ verily [God]([/person/god_1324) hath heard _me;_ he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

verseText: Blessed be God, which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.
