mdText: Blessed _be_ [God,]([/person/god_1324) which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.

verseText: God be merciful unto us, and bless us; and cause his face to shine upon us; Selah.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) be merciful unto us, and bless us; _and_ cause his face to shine upon us; Selah.

verseText: That thy way may be known upon earth, thy saving health among all nations.
mdText: That thy way may be known upon earth, thy saving health among all nations.

verseText: Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.
mdText: Let the people praise thee, O [God;]([/person/god_1324) let all the people praise thee.

verseText: O let the nations be glad and sing for joy: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon earth. Selah.
mdText: O let the nations be glad and sing for joy: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon earth. Selah.

verseText: Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.
mdText: Let the people praise thee, O [God;]([/person/god_1324) let all the people praise thee.

verseText: Then shall the earth yield her increase; and God, even our own God, shall bless us.
mdText: _Then_ shall the earth yield her increase; _and_ [God,]([/person/god_1324) _even_ our own [God,]([/person/god_1324) shall bless us.

verseText: God shall bless us; and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) shall bless us; and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.

verseText: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.
mdText: Let [God]([/person/god_1324) arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.

verseText: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
mdText: As smoke is driven away, _so_ drive _them_ away: as wax melteth before the fire, _so_ let the wicked perish at the presence of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.
mdText: But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before [God:]([/person/god_1324) yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.

verseText: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.
mdText: Sing unto [God,]([/person/god_1324) sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.

verseText: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
mdText: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, _is_ [God]([/person/god_1324) in his holy habitation.

verseText: God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry _land._

verseText: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:

verseText: The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God: even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
mdText: The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of [God:]([/person/god_1324) _even_ Sinai itself _was_ _moved_ at the presence of [God,]([/person/god_1324) the [God]([/person/god_1324) of Israel.

verseText: Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.
mdText: Thou, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) didst send a plentiful rain, whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.

verseText: Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.
mdText: Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.

verseText: The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.
mdText: The [Lord]([/person/god_1324) gave the word: great _was_ the company of those that published _it._

verseText: Kings of armies did flee apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.
mdText: Kings of armies did flee apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.

verseText: Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.
mdText: Though ye have lien among the pots, _yet_ _shall_ _ye_ _be_ _as_ the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.

verseText: When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as snow in Salmon.
mdText: When the [Almighty]([/person/god_1324) scattered kings in it, it was _white_ as snow in [Salmon.](/place/zalmon_1237)

verseText: The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan; an high hill as the hill of Bashan.
mdText: The hill of [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ _as_ the hill of [Bashan;](/place/bashan_159) an high hill _as_ the hill of [Bashan.](/place/bashan_159)

verseText: Why leap ye, ye high hills? this is the hill which God desireth to dwell in; yea, the LORD will dwell in it for ever.
mdText: Why leap ye, ye high hills? _this_ _is_ the hill _which_ [God]([/person/god_1324) desireth to dwell in; yea, the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will dwell _in_ _it_ for ever.

verseText: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels: the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.
mdText: The chariots of [God]([/person/god_1324) _are_ twenty thousand, _even_ thousands of angels: the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) _is_ among them, _as_ _in_ [Sinai,](/place/sinai_1098) in the holy _place._

verseText: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yea, for the rebellious also, that the LORD God might dwell among them.
mdText: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yea, _for_ the rebellious also, that the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God might dwell _among_ _them._

verseText: Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.
mdText: Blessed _be_ the [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) _who_ daily loadeth us _with_ _benefits,_ _even_ the [God]([/person/god_1324) of our salvation. Selah.

verseText: He that is our God is the God of salvation; and unto GOD the Lord belong the issues from death.
mdText: _He_ _that_ _is_ our [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the [God]([/person/god_1324) of salvation; and unto [GOD]([/person/god_1324) the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) _belong_ the issues from death.

verseText: But God shall wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such an one as goeth on still in his trespasses.
mdText: But [God]([/person/god_1324) shall wound the head of his enemies, _and_ the hairy scalp of such an one as goeth on still in his trespasses.

verseText: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:
mdText: The [Lord]([/person/god_1324) said, I will bring again from [Bashan,](/place/bashan_159) I will bring _my_ _people_ again from the depths of the sea:

verseText: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies, and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.
mdText: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of _thine_ enemies, _and_ the tongue of thy dogs in the same.

verseText: They have seen thy goings, O God; even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.
mdText: They have seen thy goings, O [God;]([/person/god_1324) _even_ the goings of my [God,]([/person/god_1324) my King, in the sanctuary.

verseText: The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.
mdText: The singers went before, the players on instruments _followed_ after; among _them_ _were_ the damsels playing with timbrels.

verseText: Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.
mdText: Bless ye [God]([/person/god_1324) in the congregations, _even_ the [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) from the fountain of Israel.

verseText: There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their council, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
mdText: There _is_ little [Benjamin]([/person/benjamin_463) _with_ their ruler, the princes of Judah _and_ their council, the princes of [Zebulun,]([/person/zebulun_3002) _and_ the princes of [Naphtali.]([/person/naphtali_2149)

verseText: Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.
mdText: Thy [God]([/person/god_1324) hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) that which thou hast wrought for us.

verseText: Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.
mdText: Because of thy temple at [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) shall kings bring presents unto thee.

verseText: Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, till every one submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people that delight in war.
mdText: Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, _till_ _every_ _one_ submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people _that_ delight in war.

verseText: Princes shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.
mdText: Princes shall come out of [Egypt;](/place/egypt_362) [Ethiopia](/place/cush_312) shall soon stretch out her hands unto [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah:
mdText: Sing unto [God,]([/person/god_1324) ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the [Lord;]([/person/god_1324) Selah:

verseText: To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.
mdText: To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, _which_ _were_ of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, _and_ _that_ a mighty voice.

verseText: Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.
mdText: Ascribe ye strength unto [God:]([/person/god_1324) his excellency _is_ over Israel, and his strength _is_ in the clouds.

verseText: O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto his people. Blessed be God.
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) _thou_ _art_ terrible out of thy holy places: the [God]([/person/god_1324) of Israel _is_ he that giveth strength and power unto _his_ people. Blessed _be_ [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.
mdText: Save me, O [God;]([/person/god_1324) for the waters are come in unto _my_ soul.

verseText: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
mdText: I sink in deep mire, where _there_ _is_ no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.

verseText: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.
mdText: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.
mdText: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, _being_ mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored _that_ which I took not away.

verseText: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.

verseText: Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord GOD of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.
mdText: Let not them that wait on thee, O [Lord]([/person/god_1324) GOD of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of Israel.

verseText: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.
mdText: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.

verseText: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s children.
mdText: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s children.

verseText: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.
mdText: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.

verseText: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.
mdText: When I wept, _and_ _chastened_ my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.

verseText: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.
mdText: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.

verseText: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.
mdText: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I _was_ the song of the drunkards.

verseText: But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O LORD, in an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.
mdText: But as for me, my prayer _is_ unto thee, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _in_ an acceptable time: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.

verseText: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
mdText: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

verseText: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
mdText: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

verseText: Hear me, O LORD; for thy lovingkindness is good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.
mdText: Hear me, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for thy lovingkindness _is_ good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

verseText: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.
mdText: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.

verseText: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.
mdText: Draw nigh unto my soul, _and_ redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.

verseText: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.
mdText: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries _are_ all before thee.

verseText: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.
mdText: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked _for_ _some_ to take pity, but _there_ _was_ none; and for comforters, but I found none.

verseText: They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
mdText: They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

verseText: Let their table become a snare before them: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.
mdText: Let their table become a snare before them: and _that_ _which_ _should_ _have_ _been_ for _their_ welfare, _let_ _it_ _become_ a trap.

verseText: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.
mdText: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.

verseText: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.
mdText: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

verseText: Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their tents.
mdText: Let their habitation be desolate; _and_ let none dwell in their tents.

verseText: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.
mdText: For they persecute _him_ whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.

verseText: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.
mdText: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.

verseText: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.
mdText: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.

verseText: But I am poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.
mdText: But I _am_ poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) set me up on high.

verseText: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.
mdText: I will praise the name of [God]([/person/god_1324) with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.

verseText: This also shall please the LORD better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.
mdText: _This_ also shall please the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) better than an ox _or_ bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

verseText: The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.
mdText: The humble shall see _this,_ _and_ be glad: and your heart shall live that seek [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: For the LORD heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.

verseText: Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.
mdText: Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.

verseText: For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.
mdText: For [God]([/person/god_1324) will save [Zion,](/place/zion_1263) and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.

verseText: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.
mdText: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.

verseText: Make haste, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help me, O LORD.
mdText: _Make_ _haste,_ O [God,]([/person/god_1324) to deliver me; make haste to help me, O [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul: let them be turned backward, and put to confusion, that desire my hurt.
mdText: Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul: let them be turned backward, and put to confusion, that desire my hurt.

verseText: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.
mdText: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.

verseText: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified.
mdText: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let [God]([/person/god_1324) be magnified.

verseText: But I am poor and needy: make haste unto me, O God: thou art my help and my deliverer; O LORD, make no tarrying.
mdText: But I _am_ poor and needy: make haste unto me, O [God:]([/person/god_1324) thou _art_ my help and my deliverer; O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) make no tarrying.

verseText: In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.
mdText: In thee, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.

verseText: Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thine ear unto me, and save me.
mdText: Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

verseText: Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.
mdText: Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou _art_ my rock and my fortress.

verseText: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
mdText: Deliver me, O my [God,]([/person/god_1324) out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

verseText: For thou art my hope, O Lord GOD: thou art my trust from my youth.
mdText: For thou _art_ my hope, O [Lord]([/person/god_1324) GOD: _thou_ _art_ my trust from my youth.

verseText: By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my mother’s bowels: my praise shall be continually of thee.
mdText: By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my mother’s bowels: my praise _shall_ _be_ continually of thee.

verseText: I am as a wonder unto many; but thou art my strong refuge.
mdText: I am as a wonder unto many; but thou _art_ my strong refuge.

verseText: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honour all the day.
mdText: Let my mouth be filled _with_ thy praise _and_ _with_ thy honour all the day.

verseText: Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.
mdText: Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.

verseText: For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,
mdText: For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,

verseText: Saying, God hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for there is none to deliver him.
mdText: Saying, [God]([/person/god_1324) hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for _there_ _is_ none to deliver _him._

verseText: O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) be not far from me: O my [God,]([/person/god_1324) make haste for my help.

verseText: Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.
mdText: Let them be confounded _and_ consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered _with_ reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.

verseText: But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.
mdText: But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.

verseText: My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.
mdText: My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness _and_ thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers _thereof._

verseText: I will go in the strength of the Lord GOD: I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.
mdText: I will go in the strength of the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) GOD: I will make mention of thy righteousness, _even_ of thine only.

verseText: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.

verseText: Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not; until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to every one that is to come.
mdText: Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) forsake me not; until I have shewed thy strength unto _this_ generation, _and_ thy power to every one _that_ is to come.

verseText: Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, who hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee!
mdText: Thy righteousness also, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) _is_ very high, who hast done great things: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) who _is_ like unto thee!

verseText: Thou, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
mdText: _Thou,_ which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.

verseText: Thou shalt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.
mdText: Thou shalt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.

verseText: I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God: unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.
mdText: I will also praise thee with the psaltery, _even_ thy truth, O my [God:]([/person/god_1324) unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou [Holy]([/person/god_1324) One of Israel.

verseText: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.
mdText: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.

verseText: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long: for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my hurt.
mdText: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long: for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my hurt.

verseText: Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness unto the king’s son.
mdText: Give the king thy judgments, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) and thy righteousness unto the king’s son.

verseText: He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.
mdText: He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.

verseText: The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the little hills, by righteousness.
mdText: The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the little hills, by righteousness.

verseText: He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children of the needy, and shall break in pieces the oppressor.
mdText: He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children of the needy, and shall break in pieces the oppressor.

verseText: They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure, throughout all generations.
mdText: They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure, throughout all generations.

verseText: He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers that water the earth.
mdText: He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers _that_ water the earth.

verseText: In his days shall the righteous flourish; and abundance of peace so long as the moon endureth.
mdText: In his days shall the righteous flourish; and abundance of peace so long as the moon endureth.

verseText: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.
mdText: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the [river](/place/river_1010) unto the ends of the earth.

verseText: They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him; and his enemies shall lick the dust.
mdText: They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him; and his enemies shall lick the dust.

verseText: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.
mdText: The kings of [Tarshish](/place/tarshish_1139) and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings of [Sheba](/place/sheba_1067) and [Seba](/place/seba_1037) shall offer gifts.

verseText: Yea, all kings shall fall down before him: all nations shall serve him.
mdText: Yea, all kings shall fall down before him: all nations shall serve him.

verseText: For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.
mdText: For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and _him_ that hath no helper.

verseText: He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy.
mdText: He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy.

verseText: He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence: and precious shall their blood be in his sight.
mdText: He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence: and precious shall their blood be in his sight.

verseText: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba: prayer also shall be made for him continually; and daily shall he be praised.
mdText: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of [Sheba:](/place/sheba_1067) prayer also shall be made for him continually; _and_ daily shall he be praised.

verseText: There shall be an handful of corn in the earth upon the top of the mountains; the fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon: and they of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.
mdText: There shall be an handful of corn in the earth upon the top of the mountains; the fruit thereof shall shake like [Lebanon:](/place/lebanon_720) and _they_ of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.

verseText: His name shall endure for ever: his name shall be continued as long as the sun: and men shall be blessed in him: all nations shall call him blessed.
mdText: His name shall endure for ever: his name shall be continued as long as the sun: and _men_ shall be blessed in him: all nations shall call him blessed.

verseText: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things.
mdText: Blessed _be_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God, the [God]([/person/god_1324) of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things.

verseText: And blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen, and Amen.
mdText: And blessed _be_ his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled _with_ his glory; Amen, and Amen.

verseText: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
mdText: The prayers of [David]([/person/david_994) the son of [Jesse]([/person/jesse_903) are ended.

verseText: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.
mdText: Truly [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ good to Israel, _even_ to such as are of a clean heart.

verseText: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.
mdText: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.

verseText: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
mdText: For I was envious at the foolish, _when_ I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

verseText: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.
mdText: For _there_ _are_ no bands in their death: but their strength _is_ firm.

verseText: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.
mdText: They _are_ not in trouble _as_ _other_ men; neither are they plagued like _other_ men.

verseText: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.
mdText: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them _as_ a garment.

verseText: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.
mdText: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.

verseText: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.
mdText: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly _concerning_ oppression: they speak loftily.

verseText: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
mdText: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

verseText: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
mdText: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full _cup_ are wrung out to them.

verseText: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?
mdText: And they say, How doth [God]([/person/god_1324) know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

verseText: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.
mdText: Behold, these _are_ the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase _in_ riches.

verseText: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.
mdText: Verily I have cleansed my heart _in_ vain, and washed my hands in innocency.

verseText: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.
mdText: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.

verseText: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.
mdText: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend _against_ the generation of thy children.

verseText: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;
mdText: When I thought to know this, it _was_ too painful for me;

verseText: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.
mdText: Until I went into the sanctuary of [God;]([/person/god_1324) _then_ understood I their end.

verseText: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.
mdText: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.

verseText: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.
mdText: How are they _brought_ into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

verseText: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.
mdText: As a dream when _one_ awaketh; _so,_ O [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.

verseText: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.
mdText: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.

verseText: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.
mdText: So foolish _was_ I, and ignorant: I was _as_ a beast before thee.

verseText: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.
mdText: Nevertheless I _am_ continually with thee: thou hast holden _me_ by my right hand.

verseText: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
mdText: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me _to_ glory.

verseText: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.
mdText: Whom have I in heaven _but_ _thee?_ and _there_ _is_ none upon earth _that_ I desire beside thee.

verseText: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
mdText: My flesh and my heart faileth: _but_ [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

verseText: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.
mdText: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.

verseText: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.
mdText: But _it_ _is_ good for me to draw near to [God:]([/person/god_1324) I have put my trust in the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) GOD, that I may declare all thy works.

verseText: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) why hast thou cast _us_ off for ever? _why_ doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?

verseText: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old; the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.
mdText: Remember thy congregation, _which_ thou hast purchased of old; the rod of thine inheritance, _which_ thou hast redeemed; this mount [Zion,](/place/mount_zion_860) wherein thou hast dwelt.

verseText: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations; even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.
mdText: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations; _even_ all _that_ the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.

verseText: Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns for signs.
mdText: Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns _for_ signs.

verseText: A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.
mdText: _A_ _man_ was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.

verseText: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.
mdText: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.

verseText: They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled by casting down the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.
mdText: They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled _by_ _casting_ _down_ the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.

verseText: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.
mdText: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of [God]([/person/god_1324) in the land.

verseText: We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.
mdText: We see not our signs: _there_ _is_ no more any prophet: neither _is_ _there_ among us any that knoweth how long.

verseText: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?

verseText: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.
mdText: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck _it_ out of thy bosom.

verseText: For God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
mdText: For [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.

verseText: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.
mdText: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.

verseText: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
mdText: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces, _and_ gavest him _to_ _be_ meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.

verseText: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up mighty rivers.
mdText: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up mighty rivers.

verseText: The day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.
mdText: The day _is_ thine, the night also _is_ thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.

verseText: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.
mdText: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.

verseText: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O LORD, and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.
mdText: Remember this, _that_ the enemy hath reproached, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and _that_ the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.

verseText: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the wicked: forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.
mdText: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude _of_ _the_ _wicked:_ forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.

verseText: Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.
mdText: Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.

verseText: O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.
mdText: O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.

verseText: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.
mdText: Arise, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.

verseText: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: the tumult of those that rise up against thee increaseth continually.
mdText: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: the tumult of those that rise up against thee increaseth continually.

verseText: Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks, unto thee do we give thanks: for that thy name is near thy wondrous works declare.
mdText: Unto thee, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) do we give thanks, _unto_ _thee_ do we give thanks: for _that_ thy name is near thy wondrous works declare.

verseText: When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.
mdText: When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.

verseText: The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: I bear up the pillars of it. Selah.
mdText: The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: I bear up the pillars of it. Selah.

verseText: I said unto the fools, Deal not foolishly: and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:
mdText: I said unto the fools, Deal not foolishly: and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:

verseText: Lift not up your horn on high: speak not with a stiff neck.
mdText: Lift not up your horn on high: speak _not_ _with_ a stiff neck.

verseText: For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the south.
mdText: For promotion _cometh_ neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the south.

verseText: But God is the judge: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.
mdText: But [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the judge: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.

verseText: For in the hand of the LORD there is a cup, and the wine is red; it is full of mixture; and he poureth out of the same: but the dregs thereof, all the wicked of the earth shall wring them out, and drink them.
mdText: For in the hand of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _there_ _is_ a cup, and the wine is red; it is full of mixture; and he poureth out of the same: but the dregs thereof, all the wicked of the earth shall wring _them_ out, _and_ drink _them._

verseText: But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
mdText: But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
mdText: All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; _but_ the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

verseText: In Judah is God known: his name is great in Israel.
mdText: In Judah _is_ [God]([/person/god_1324) known: his name _is_ great in Israel.

verseText: In Salem also is his tabernacle, and his dwelling place in Zion.
mdText: In [Salem](/place/salem_1018) also is his tabernacle, and his dwelling place in [Zion.](/place/zion_1263)

verseText: There brake he the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah.
mdText: There brake he the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah.

verseText: Thou art more glorious and excellent than the mountains of prey.
mdText: Thou _art_ more glorious _and_ excellent than the mountains of prey.

verseText: The stouthearted are spoiled, they have slept their sleep: and none of the men of might have found their hands.
mdText: The stouthearted are spoiled, they have slept their sleep: and none of the men of might have found their hands.

verseText: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both the chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.
mdText: At thy rebuke, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob,]([/person/israel_682) both the chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.

verseText: Thou, even thou, art to be feared: and who may stand in thy sight when once thou art angry?
mdText: Thou, _even_ thou, _art_ to be feared: and who may stand in thy sight when once thou art angry?

verseText: Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from heaven; the earth feared, and was still,
mdText: Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from heaven; the earth feared, and was still,

verseText: When God arose to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.
mdText: When [God]([/person/god_1324) arose to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.

verseText: Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee: the remainder of wrath shalt thou restrain.
mdText: Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee: the remainder of wrath shalt thou restrain.

verseText: Vow, and pay unto the LORD your God: let all that be round about him bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.
mdText: Vow, and pay unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) your [God:]([/person/god_1324) let all that be round about him bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.

verseText: He shall cut off the spirit of princes: he is terrible to the kings of the earth.
mdText: He shall cut off the spirit of princes: _he_ _is_ terrible to the kings of the earth.

verseText: I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.
mdText: I cried unto [God]([/person/god_1324) with my voice, _even_ unto [God]([/person/god_1324) with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.

verseText: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.
mdText: In the day of my trouble I sought the [Lord:]([/person/god_1324) my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.

verseText: I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.
mdText: I remembered [God,]([/person/god_1324) and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.

verseText: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
mdText: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

verseText: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.
mdText: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.

verseText: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.
mdText: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.

verseText: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?
mdText: Will the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?

verseText: Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth his promise fail for evermore?
mdText: Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth _his_ promise fail for evermore?

verseText: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.
mdText: Hath [God]([/person/god_1324) forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.

verseText: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.
mdText: And I said, This _is_ my infirmity: _but_ _I_ _will_ _remember_ the years of the right hand of the most High.

verseText: I will remember the works of the LORD: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.
mdText: I will remember the works of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) surely I will remember thy wonders of old.

verseText: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.
mdText: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.

verseText: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a God as our God?
mdText: Thy way, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) _is_ in the sanctuary: who _is_ _so_ great a [God]([/person/god_1324) as _our_ [God?]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.
mdText: Thou _art_ the [God]([/person/god_1324) that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.

verseText: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
mdText: Thou hast with _thine_ arm redeemed thy people, the sons of [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) and [Joseph.]([/person/joseph_1710) Selah.

verseText: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.
mdText: The waters saw thee, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.

verseText: The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine arrows also went abroad.
mdText: The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine arrows also went abroad.

verseText: The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.
mdText: The voice of thy thunder _was_ in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.

verseText: Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.
mdText: Thy way _is_ in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.

verseText: Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
mdText: Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) and [Aaron.]([/person/aaron_1)

verseText: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
mdText: Give ear, O my people, _to_ my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

verseText: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:
mdText: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:

verseText: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
mdText: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

verseText: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.
mdText: We will not hide _them_ from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.

verseText: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:
mdText: For he established a testimony in [Jacob,]([/person/israel_682) and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:

verseText: That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:
mdText: That the generation to come might know _them,_ _even_ the children _which_ should be born; _who_ should arise and declare _them_ to their children:

verseText: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:
mdText: That they might set their hope in [God,]([/person/god_1324) and not forget the works of [God,]([/person/god_1324) but keep his commandments:

verseText: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.
mdText: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation _that_ set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.
mdText: The children of [Ephraim,]([/person/ephraim_1206) _being_ armed, _and_ carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.

verseText: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;
mdText: They kept not the covenant of [God,]([/person/god_1324) and refused to walk in his law;

verseText: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.
mdText: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.

verseText: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
mdText: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) _in_ the field of [Zoan.](/place/zoan_1270)

verseText: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.
mdText: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.

verseText: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.
mdText: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.

verseText: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.
mdText: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave _them_ drink as _out_ _of_ the great depths.

verseText: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.
mdText: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

verseText: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.
mdText: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.

verseText: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.
mdText: And they tempted [God]([/person/god_1324) in their heart by asking meat for their lust.

verseText: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
mdText: Yea, they spake against [God;]([/person/god_1324) they said, Can [God]([/person/god_1324) furnish a table in the wilderness?

verseText: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?
mdText: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?

verseText: Therefore the LORD heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;
mdText: Therefore the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) heard _this,_ and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against [Jacob,]([/person/israel_682) and anger also came up against Israel;

verseText: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:
mdText: Because they believed not in [God,]([/person/god_1324) and trusted not in his salvation:

verseText: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,
mdText: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,

verseText: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.
mdText: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.

verseText: Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.
mdText: Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.

verseText: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.
mdText: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.

verseText: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:
mdText: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:

verseText: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.
mdText: And he let _it_ fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.

verseText: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;
mdText: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;

verseText: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,
mdText: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat _was_ yet in their mouths,

verseText: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.
mdText: The wrath of [God]([/person/god_1324) came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen _men_ of Israel.

verseText: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.
mdText: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.

verseText: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.
mdText: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.

verseText: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after God.
mdText: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.
mdText: And they remembered that [God]([/person/god_1324) _was_ their rock, and the high [God]([/person/god_1324) their redeemer.

verseText: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.
mdText: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.

verseText: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.
mdText: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.

verseText: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.
mdText: But he, _being_ full of compassion, forgave _their_ iniquity, and destroyed _them_ not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.

verseText: For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.
mdText: For he remembered that they _were_ _but_ flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

verseText: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!
mdText: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, _and_ grieve him in the desert!

verseText: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.
mdText: Yea, they turned back and tempted [God,]([/person/god_1324) and limited the [Holy]([/person/god_1324) One of Israel.

verseText: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.
mdText: They remembered not his hand, _nor_ the day when he delivered them from the enemy.

verseText: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:
mdText: How he had wrought his signs in [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) and his wonders in the field of [Zoan:](/place/zoan_1270)

verseText: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.
mdText: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.

verseText: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.
mdText: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.

verseText: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.
mdText: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.

verseText: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.
mdText: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.

verseText: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
mdText: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

verseText: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.
mdText: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels _among_ _them._

verseText: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;
mdText: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

verseText: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:
mdText: And smote all the firstborn in [Egypt;](/place/egypt_362) the chief of _their_ strength in the tabernacles of [Ham:]([/person/ham_1359)

verseText: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
mdText: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

verseText: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
mdText: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

verseText: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.
mdText: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, _even_ _to_ this mountain, _which_ his right hand had purchased.

verseText: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
mdText: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

verseText: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:
mdText: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high [God,]([/person/god_1324) and kept not his testimonies:

verseText: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
mdText: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

verseText: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.
mdText: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

verseText: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:
mdText: When [God]([/person/god_1324) heard _this,_ he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

verseText: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;
mdText: So that he forsook the tabernacle of [Shiloh,](/place/shiloh_1081) the tent _which_ he placed among men;

verseText: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.
mdText: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.

verseText: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.
mdText: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.

verseText: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.
mdText: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

verseText: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.
mdText: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.

verseText: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.
mdText: Then the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) awaked as one out of sleep, _and_ like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.

verseText: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.
mdText: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.

verseText: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
mdText: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of [Joseph,]([/person/joseph_1710) and chose not the tribe of [Ephraim:]([/person/ephraim_1206)

verseText: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.
mdText: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount [Zion](/place/mount_zion_860) which he loved.

verseText: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.
mdText: And he built his sanctuary like high _palaces,_ like the earth which he hath established for ever.

verseText: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:
mdText: He chose [David]([/person/david_994) also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:

verseText: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.
mdText: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) his people, and Israel his inheritance.

verseText: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.
mdText: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.

verseText: O God, the heathen are come into thine inheritance; thy holy temple have they defiled; they have laid Jerusalem on heaps.
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) the heathen are come into thine inheritance; thy holy temple have they defiled; they have laid [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) on heaps.

verseText: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowls of the heaven, the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth.
mdText: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given _to_ _be_ meat unto the fowls of the heaven, the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth.

verseText: Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem; and there was none to bury them.
mdText: Their blood have they shed like water round about [Jerusalem;](/place/jerusalem_636) and _there_ _was_ none to bury _them._

verseText: We are become a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.
mdText: We are become a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.

verseText: How long, LORD? wilt thou be angry for ever? shall thy jealousy burn like fire?
mdText: How long, [LORD?]([/person/god_1324) wilt thou be angry for ever? shall thy jealousy burn like fire?

verseText: Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name.
mdText: Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name.

verseText: For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his dwelling place.
mdText: For they have devoured [Jacob,]([/person/israel_682) and laid waste his dwelling place.

verseText: O remember not against us former iniquities: let thy tender mercies speedily prevent us: for we are brought very low.
mdText: O remember not against us former iniquities: let thy tender mercies speedily prevent us: for we are brought very low.

verseText: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name: and deliver us, and purge away our sins, for thy name’s sake.
mdText: Help us, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of our salvation, for the glory of thy name: and deliver us, and purge away our sins, for thy name’s sake.

verseText: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is their God? let him be known among the heathen in our sight by the revenging of the blood of thy servants which is shed.
mdText: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where _is_ their [God?]([/person/god_1324) let him be known among the heathen in our sight _by_ the revenging of the blood of thy servants _which_ _is_ shed.

verseText: Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee; according to the greatness of thy power preserve thou those that are appointed to die;
mdText: Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee; according to the greatness of thy power preserve thou those that are appointed to die;

verseText: And render unto our neighbours sevenfold into their bosom their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.
mdText: And render unto our neighbours sevenfold into their bosom their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O [Lord.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks for ever: we will shew forth thy praise to all generations.
mdText: So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks for ever: we will shew forth thy praise to all generations.

verseText: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; thou that dwellest between the cherubims, shine forth.
mdText: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest [Joseph]([/person/joseph_1710) like a flock; thou that dwellest _between_ the cherubims, shine forth.

verseText: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength, and come and save us.
mdText: Before [Ephraim]([/person/ephraim_1206) and [Benjamin]([/person/benjamin_463) and [Manasseh]([/person/manasseh_1928) stir up thy strength, and come _and_ save us.

verseText: Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
mdText: Turn us again, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

verseText: O LORD God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?

verseText: Thou feedest them with the bread of tears; and givest them tears to drink in great measure.
mdText: Thou feedest them with the bread of tears; and givest them tears to drink in great measure.

verseText: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours: and our enemies laugh among themselves.
mdText: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours: and our enemies laugh among themselves.

verseText: Turn us again, O God of hosts, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
mdText: Turn us again, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of hosts, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

verseText: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.
mdText: Thou hast brought a vine out of [Egypt:](/place/egypt_362) thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.

verseText: Thou preparedst room before it, and didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the land.
mdText: Thou preparedst _room_ before it, and didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the land.

verseText: The hills were covered with the shadow of it, and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedars.
mdText: The hills were covered with the shadow of it, and the boughs thereof _were_ _like_ the goodly cedars.

verseText: She sent out her boughs unto the sea, and her branches unto the river.
mdText: She sent out her boughs unto the sea, and her branches unto the [river.](/place/river_1010)

verseText: Why hast thou then broken down her hedges, so that all they which pass by the way do pluck her?
mdText: Why hast thou _then_ broken down her hedges, so that all they which pass by the way do pluck her?

verseText: The boar out of the wood doth waste it, and the wild beast of the field doth devour it.
mdText: The boar out of the wood doth waste it, and the wild beast of the field doth devour it.

verseText: Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: look down from heaven, and behold, and visit this vine;
mdText: Return, we beseech thee, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of hosts: look down from heaven, and behold, and visit this vine;

verseText: And the vineyard which thy right hand hath planted, and the branch that thou madest strong for thyself.
mdText: And the vineyard which thy right hand hath planted, and the branch _that_ thou madest strong for thyself.

verseText: It is burned with fire, it is cut down: they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
mdText: _It_ _is_ burned with fire, _it_ _is_ cut down: they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.

verseText: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man whom thou madest strong for thyself.
mdText: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man _whom_ thou madest strong for thyself.

verseText: So will not we go back from thee: quicken us, and we will call upon thy name.
mdText: So will not we go back from thee: quicken us, and we will call upon thy name.

verseText: Turn us again, O LORD God of hosts, cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
mdText: Turn us again, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God of hosts, cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.

verseText: Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.
mdText: Sing aloud unto [God]([/person/god_1324) our strength: make a joyful noise unto the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.
mdText: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.

verseText: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.
mdText: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.

verseText: For this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.
mdText: For this _was_ a statute for Israel, _and_ a law of the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.
mdText: This he ordained in [Joseph]([/person/joseph_1710) _for_ a testimony, when he went out through the land of [Egypt:](/place/egypt_362) _where_ I heard a language _that_ I understood not.

verseText: I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.
mdText: I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.

verseText: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
mdText: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of [Meribah.](/place/meribah_782) Selah.

verseText: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;
mdText: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;

verseText: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.
mdText: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.

verseText: I am the LORD thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
mdText: I _am_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) thy [God,]([/person/god_1324) which brought thee out of the land of [Egypt:](/place/egypt_362) open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

verseText: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
mdText: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.

verseText: So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust: and they walked in their own counsels.
mdText: So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust: _and_ they walked in their own counsels.

verseText: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!
mdText: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, _and_ Israel had walked in my ways!

verseText: I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.
mdText: I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.

verseText: The haters of the LORD should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.
mdText: The haters of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.

verseText: He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.
mdText: He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.

verseText: God standeth in the congregation of the mighty; he judgeth among the gods.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) standeth in the congregation of the mighty; he judgeth among the gods.

verseText: How long will ye judge unjustly, and accept the persons of the wicked? Selah.
mdText: How long will ye judge unjustly, and accept the persons of the wicked? Selah.

verseText: Defend the poor and fatherless: do justice to the afflicted and needy.
mdText: Defend the poor and fatherless: do justice to the afflicted and needy.

verseText: Deliver the poor and needy: rid them out of the hand of the wicked.
mdText: Deliver the poor and needy: rid _them_ out of the hand of the wicked.

verseText: They know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.
mdText: They know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.

verseText: I have said, Ye are gods; and all of you are children of the most High.
mdText: I have said, Ye _are_ gods; and all of you _are_ children of the most High.

verseText: But ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.
mdText: But ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.

verseText: Arise, O God, judge the earth: for thou shalt inherit all nations.
mdText: Arise, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) judge the earth: for thou shalt inherit all nations.

verseText: Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.
mdText: Keep not thou silence, O [God:]([/person/god_1324) hold not thy peace, and be not still, O [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.
mdText: For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.

verseText: They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones.
mdText: They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones.

verseText: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
mdText: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from _being_ a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.

verseText: For they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee:
mdText: For they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee:

verseText: The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites; of Moab, and the Hagarenes;
mdText: The tabernacles of [Edom,]([/person/esau_1216) and the Ishmaelites; of [Moab,]([/person/moab_2103) and the Hagarenes;

verseText: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;
mdText: [Gebal,](/place/gebal_449) and [Ammon,](/place/ammon_58) and [Amalek;](/place/amalek_53) the Philistines with the inhabitants of [Tyre;](/place/tyre_1184)

verseText: Assur also is joined with them: they have holpen the children of Lot. Selah.
mdText: [Assur](/place/asshur_109) also is joined with them: they have holpen the children of [Lot.]([/person/lot_1830) Selah.

verseText: Do unto them as unto the Midianites; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kison:
mdText: Do unto them as _unto_ the [Midianites;](/place/midian_796) as _to_ [Sisera,]([/person/sisera_2757) as _to_ [Jabin,]([/person/jabin_677) at the brook of Kison:

verseText: Which perished at Endor: they became as dung for the earth.
mdText: _Which_ perished at [En-dor:](/place/en-dor_385) they became _as_ dung for the earth.
