verseText: Make their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb: yea, all their princes as Zebah, and as Zalmunna:
mdText: Make their nobles like [Oreb,]([/person/oreb_2255) and like [Zeeb:]([/person/zeeb_3033) yea, all their princes as [Zebah,]([/person/zebah_2997) and as [Zalmunna:]([/person/zalmunna_2983)

verseText: Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.
mdText: Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of [God]([/person/god_1324) in possession.

verseText: O my God, make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the wind.
mdText: O my [God,]([/person/god_1324) make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the wind.

verseText: As the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire;
mdText: As the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire;

verseText: So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.
mdText: So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.

verseText: Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name, O LORD.
mdText: Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name, O [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; yea, let them be put to shame, and perish:
mdText: Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; yea, let them be put to shame, and perish:

verseText: That men may know that thou, whose name alone is JEHOVAH, art the most high over all the earth.
mdText: That _men_ may know that thou, whose name alone _is_ [JEHOVAH,]([/person/god_1324) _art_ the most high over all the earth.

verseText: How amiable are thy tabernacles, O LORD of hosts!
mdText: How amiable _are_ thy tabernacles, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) of hosts!

verseText: My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the LORD: my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.
mdText: My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, even thine altars, O LORD of hosts, my King, and my God.
mdText: Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, _even_ thine altars, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) of hosts, my King, and my [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.
mdText: Blessed _are_ they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.

verseText: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.
mdText: Blessed _is_ the man whose strength _is_ in thee; in whose heart _are_ the ways _of_ _them._

verseText: Who passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.
mdText: _Who_ passing through the valley of [Baca](/place/valley_of_baca_1199) make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.

verseText: They go from strength to strength, every one of them in Zion appeareth before God.
mdText: They go from strength to strength, _every_ _one_ _of_ _them_ in [Zion](/place/zion_1263) appeareth before [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682) Selah.

verseText: Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.
mdText: Behold, O [God]([/person/god_1324) our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.

verseText: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
mdText: For a day in thy courts _is_ better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my [God,]([/person/god_1324) than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

verseText: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God _is_ a sun and shield: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will give grace and glory: no good _thing_ will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

verseText: O LORD of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) of hosts, blessed _is_ the man that trusteth in thee.

verseText: LORD, thou hast been favourable unto thy land: thou hast brought back the captivity of Jacob.
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) thou hast been favourable unto thy land: thou hast brought back the captivity of [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.
mdText: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.

verseText: Thou hast taken away all thy wrath: thou hast turned thyself from the fierceness of thine anger.
mdText: Thou hast taken away all thy wrath: thou hast turned _thyself_ from the fierceness of thine anger.

verseText: Turn us, O God of our salvation, and cause thine anger toward us to cease.
mdText: Turn us, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of our salvation, and cause thine anger toward us to cease.

verseText: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine anger to all generations?
mdText: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine anger to all generations?

verseText: Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?
mdText: Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?

verseText: Shew us thy mercy, O LORD, and grant us thy salvation.
mdText: Shew us thy mercy, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and grant us thy salvation.

verseText: I will hear what God the LORD will speak: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.
mdText: I will hear what [God]([/person/god_1324) the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will speak: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.

verseText: Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him; that glory may dwell in our land.
mdText: Surely his salvation _is_ nigh them that fear him; that glory may dwell in our land.

verseText: Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
mdText: Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed _each_ _other._

verseText: Truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look down from heaven.
mdText: Truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look down from heaven.

verseText: Yea, the LORD shall give that which is good; and our land shall yield her increase.
mdText: Yea, the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall give _that_ _which_ _is_ good; and our land shall yield her increase.

verseText: Righteousness shall go before him; and shall set us in the way of his steps.
mdText: Righteousness shall go before him; and shall set _us_ in the way of his steps.

verseText: Bow down thine ear, O LORD, hear me: for I am poor and needy.
mdText: Bow down thine ear, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) hear me: for I _am_ poor and needy.

verseText: Preserve my soul; for I am holy: O thou my God, save thy servant that trusteth in thee.
mdText: Preserve my soul; for I _am_ holy: O thou my [God,]([/person/god_1324) save thy servant that trusteth in thee.

verseText: Be merciful unto me, O Lord: for I cry unto thee daily.
mdText: Be merciful unto me, O [Lord:]([/person/god_1324) for I cry unto thee daily.

verseText: Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
mdText: Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) do I lift up my soul.

verseText: For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.
mdText: For thou, [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) _art_ good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.

verseText: Give ear, O LORD, unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.
mdText: Give ear, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.

verseText: In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.
mdText: In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.

verseText: Among the gods there is none like unto thee, O Lord; neither are there any works like unto thy works.
mdText: Among the gods _there_ _is_ none like unto thee, O [Lord;]([/person/god_1324) neither _are_ _there_ _any_ _works_ like unto thy works.

verseText: All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord; and shall glorify thy name.
mdText: All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O [Lord;]([/person/god_1324) and shall glorify thy name.

verseText: For thou art great, and doest wondrous things: thou art God alone.
mdText: For thou _art_ great, and doest wondrous things: thou _art_ [God]([/person/god_1324) alone.

verseText: Teach me thy way, O LORD; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.
mdText: Teach me thy way, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.

verseText: I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart: and I will glorify thy name for evermore.
mdText: I will praise thee, O [Lord]([/person/god_1324) my [God,]([/person/god_1324) with all my heart: and I will glorify thy name for evermore.

verseText: For great is thy mercy toward me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell.
mdText: For great _is_ thy mercy toward me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell.

verseText: O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assemblies of violent men have sought after my soul; and have not set thee before them.
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) the proud are risen against me, and the assemblies of violent _men_ have sought after my soul; and have not set thee before them.

verseText: But thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion, and gracious, longsuffering, and plenteous in mercy and truth.
mdText: But thou, O [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) _art_ a [God]([/person/god_1324) full of compassion, and gracious, longsuffering, and plenteous in mercy and truth.

verseText: O turn unto me, and have mercy upon me; give thy strength unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.
mdText: O turn unto me, and have mercy upon me; give thy strength unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.

verseText: Shew me a token for good; that they which hate me may see it, and be ashamed: because thou, LORD, hast holpen me, and comforted me.
mdText: Shew me a token for good; that they which hate me may see _it,_ and be ashamed: because thou, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) hast holpen me, and comforted me.

verseText: His foundation is in the holy mountains.
mdText: His foundation _is_ in the holy mountains.

verseText: The LORD loveth the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) loveth the gates of [Zion](/place/zion_1263) more than all the dwellings of [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.
mdText: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of [God.]([/person/god_1324) Selah.

verseText: I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon to them that know me: behold Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia; this man was born there.
mdText: I will make mention of [Rahab](/place/rahab_969) and [Babylon](/place/babylon_151) to them that know me: behold [Philistia,](/place/philistia_943) and [Tyre,](/place/tyre_1184) with [Ethiopia;](/place/cush_312) this _man_ was born there.

verseText: And of Zion it shall be said, This and that man was born in her: and the highest himself shall establish her.
mdText: And of [Zion](/place/zion_1263) it shall be said, This and that man was born in her: and the highest himself shall establish her.

verseText: The LORD shall count, when he writeth up the people, that this man was born there. Selah.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall count, when he writeth up the people, _that_ this _man_ was born there. Selah.

verseText: As well the singers as the players on instruments shall be there: all my springs are in thee.
mdText: As well the singers as the players on instruments _shall_ _be_ _there:_ all my springs _are_ in thee.

verseText: O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee:
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God of my salvation, I have cried day _and_ night before thee:

verseText: Let my prayer come before thee: incline thine ear unto my cry;
mdText: Let my prayer come before thee: incline thine ear unto my cry;

verseText: For my soul is full of troubles: and my life draweth nigh unto the grave.
mdText: For my soul is full of troubles: and my life draweth nigh unto the grave.

verseText: I am counted with them that go down into the pit: I am as a man that hath no strength:
mdText: I am counted with them that go down into the pit: I am as a man _that_ _hath_ no strength:

verseText: Free among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave, whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thy hand.
mdText: Free among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave, whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thy hand.

verseText: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.
mdText: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.

verseText: Thy wrath lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah.
mdText: Thy wrath lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted _me_ with all thy waves. Selah.

verseText: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me; thou hast made me an abomination unto them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.
mdText: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me; thou hast made me an abomination unto them: _I_ _am_ shut up, and I cannot come forth.

verseText: Mine eye mourneth by reason of affliction: LORD, I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched out my hands unto thee.
mdText: Mine eye mourneth by reason of affliction: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched out my hands unto thee.

verseText: Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead? shall the dead arise and praise thee? Selah.
mdText: Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead? shall the dead arise _and_ praise thee? Selah.

verseText: Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave? or thy faithfulness in destruction?
mdText: Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave? _or_ thy faithfulness in destruction?

verseText: Shall thy wonders be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
mdText: Shall thy wonders be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

verseText: But unto thee have I cried, O LORD; and in the morning shall my prayer prevent thee.
mdText: But unto thee have I cried, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and in the morning shall my prayer prevent thee.

verseText: LORD, why castest thou off my soul? why hidest thou thy face from me?
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) why castest thou off my soul? _why_ hidest thou thy face from me?

verseText: I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up: while I suffer thy terrors I am distracted.
mdText: I _am_ afflicted and ready to die from _my_ youth up: _while_ I suffer thy terrors I am distracted.

verseText: Thy fierce wrath goeth over me; thy terrors have cut me off.
mdText: Thy fierce wrath goeth over me; thy terrors have cut me off.

verseText: They came round about me daily like water; they compassed me about together.
mdText: They came round about me daily like water; they compassed me about together.

verseText: Lover and friend hast thou put far from me, and mine acquaintance into darkness.
mdText: Lover and friend hast thou put far from me, _and_ mine acquaintance into darkness.

verseText: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.
mdText: I will sing of the mercies of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.

verseText: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.
mdText: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.

verseText: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,
mdText: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto [David]([/person/david_994) my servant,

verseText: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.
mdText: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.

verseText: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.
mdText: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

verseText: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the LORD?
mdText: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the [LORD?]([/person/god_1324) _who_ among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the [LORD?]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them that are about him.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all _them_ _that_ _are_ about him.

verseText: O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God of hosts, who _is_ a strong [LORD]([/person/god_1324) like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?

verseText: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.
mdText: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.

verseText: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.
mdText: Thou hast broken [Rahab](/place/rahab_969) in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.

verseText: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.
mdText: The heavens _are_ thine, the earth also _is_ thine: _as_ _for_ the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.

verseText: The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.
mdText: The north and the south thou hast created them: [Tabor](/place/tabor_1128) and [Hermon](/place/hermon_564) shall rejoice in thy name.

verseText: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
mdText: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, _and_ high is thy right hand.

verseText: Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
mdText: Justice and judgment _are_ the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

verseText: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O LORD, in the light of thy countenance.
mdText: Blessed _is_ the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) in the light of thy countenance.

verseText: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
mdText: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.

verseText: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.
mdText: For thou _art_ the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.

verseText: For the LORD is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ our defence; and the [Holy]([/person/god_1324) One of Israel _is_ our king.

verseText: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
mdText: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon _one_ _that_ _is_ mighty; I have exalted _one_ chosen out of the people.

verseText: I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:
mdText: I have found [David]([/person/david_994) my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:

verseText: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.
mdText: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.

verseText: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
mdText: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

verseText: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.
mdText: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.

verseText: But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.
mdText: But my faithfulness and my mercy _shall_ _be_ with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

verseText: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.
mdText: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.

verseText: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
mdText: He shall cry unto me, Thou _art_ my father, my [God,]([/person/god_1324) and the rock of my salvation.

verseText: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.
mdText: Also I will make him _my_ firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.

verseText: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.
mdText: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

verseText: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
mdText: His seed also will I make _to_ _endure_ for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

verseText: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;
mdText: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;

verseText: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;
mdText: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;

verseText: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.
mdText: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

verseText: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.
mdText: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

verseText: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
mdText: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.

verseText: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.
mdText: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto [David.]([/person/david_994)

verseText: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.
mdText: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.

verseText: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.
mdText: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and _as_ a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.

verseText: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.
mdText: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.

verseText: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
mdText: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown _by_ _casting_ _it_ to the ground.

verseText: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.
mdText: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.

verseText: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.
mdText: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.

verseText: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
mdText: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.

verseText: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.
mdText: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.

verseText: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.
mdText: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.

verseText: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.
mdText: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.

verseText: How long, LORD? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?
mdText: How long, [LORD?]([/person/god_1324) wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?

verseText: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?
mdText: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?

verseText: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.
mdText: What man _is_ _he_ _that_ liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

verseText: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?
mdText: [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) where _are_ thy former lovingkindnesses, _which_ thou swarest unto [David]([/person/david_994) in thy truth?

verseText: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;
mdText: Remember, [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) the reproach of thy servants; _how_ I do bear in my bosom _the_ _reproach_ _of_ all the mighty people;

verseText: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O LORD; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.
mdText: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.

verseText: Blessed be the LORD for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
mdText: Blessed _be_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) for evermore. Amen, and Amen.

verseText: Lord, thou hast been our dwelling place in all generations.
mdText: [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) thou hast been our dwelling place in all generations.

verseText: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God.
mdText: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou _art_ [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Thou turnest man to destruction; and sayest, Return, ye children of men.
mdText: Thou turnest man to destruction; and sayest, Return, ye children of men.

verseText: For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.
mdText: For a thousand years in thy sight _are_ _but_ as yesterday when it is past, and _as_ a watch in the night.

verseText: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep: in the morning they are like grass which groweth up.
mdText: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are _as_ a sleep: in the morning _they_ _are_ like grass _which_ groweth up.

verseText: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down, and withereth.
mdText: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down, and withereth.

verseText: For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy wrath are we troubled.
mdText: For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy wrath are we troubled.

verseText: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
mdText: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret _sins_ in the light of thy countenance.

verseText: For all our days are passed away in thy wrath: we spend our years as a tale that is told.
mdText: For all our days are passed away in thy wrath: we spend our years as a tale _that_ _is_ _told._

verseText: The days of our years are threescore years and ten; and if by reason of strength they be fourscore years, yet is their strength labour and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.
mdText: The days of our years _are_ threescore years and ten; and if by reason of strength _they_ _be_ fourscore years, yet _is_ their strength labour and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.

verseText: Who knoweth the power of thine anger? even according to thy fear, so is thy wrath.
mdText: Who knoweth the power of thine anger? even according to thy fear, _so_ _is_ thy wrath.

verseText: So teach us to number our days, that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
mdText: So teach _us_ to number our days, that we may apply _our_ hearts unto wisdom.

verseText: Return, O LORD, how long? and let it repent thee concerning thy servants.
mdText: Return, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) how long? and let it repent thee concerning thy servants.

verseText: O satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
mdText: O satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.

verseText: Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us, and the years wherein we have seen evil.
mdText: Make us glad according to the days _wherein_ thou hast afflicted us, _and_ the years _wherein_ we have seen evil.

verseText: Let thy work appear unto thy servants, and thy glory unto their children.
mdText: Let thy work appear unto thy servants, and thy glory unto their children.

verseText: And let the beauty of the LORD our God be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.
mdText: And let the beauty of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God]([/person/god_1324) be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.

verseText: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
mdText: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the [Almighty.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: I will say of the LORD, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.
mdText: I will say of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _He_ _is_ my refuge and my fortress: my [God;]([/person/god_1324) in him will I trust.

verseText: Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the noisome pestilence.
mdText: Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, _and_ from the noisome pestilence.

verseText: He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.
mdText: He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust: his truth _shall_ _be_ _thy_ shield and buckler.

verseText: Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; nor for the arrow that flieth by day;
mdText: Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; _nor_ for the arrow _that_ flieth by day;

verseText: Nor for the pestilence that walketh in darkness; nor for the destruction that wasteth at noonday.
mdText: _Nor_ for the pestilence _that_ walketh in darkness; _nor_ for the destruction _that_ wasteth at noonday.

verseText: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; but it shall not come nigh thee.
mdText: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; _but_ it shall not come nigh thee.

verseText: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.
mdText: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.

verseText: Because thou hast made the LORD, which is my refuge, even the most High, thy habitation;
mdText: Because thou hast made the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _which_ _is_ my refuge, _even_ the most High, thy habitation;

verseText: There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.
mdText: There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.

verseText: For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.
mdText: For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.

verseText: They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.
mdText: They shall bear thee up in _their_ hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

verseText: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under feet.
mdText: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under feet.

verseText: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him: I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.
mdText: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him: I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.

verseText: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him: I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and honour him.
mdText: He shall call upon me, and I will answer him: I _will_ _be_ with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and honour him.

verseText: With long life will I satisfy him, and shew him my salvation.
mdText: With long life will I satisfy him, and shew him my salvation.

verseText: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD, and to sing praises unto thy name, O most High:
mdText: _It_ _is_ _a_ good _thing_ to give thanks unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and to sing praises unto thy name, O most High:

verseText: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,
mdText: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,

verseText: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.
mdText: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.

verseText: For thou, LORD, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.
mdText: For thou, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.

verseText: O LORD, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.
mdText: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) how great are thy works! _and_ thy thoughts are very deep.

verseText: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.
mdText: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.

verseText: When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:
mdText: When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; _it_ _is_ that they shall be destroyed for ever:

verseText: But thou, LORD, art most high for evermore.
mdText: But thou, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _art_ _most_ high for evermore.

verseText: For, lo, thine enemies, O LORD, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
mdText: For, lo, thine enemies, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

verseText: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
mdText: But my horn shalt thou exalt like _the_ _horn_ _of_ an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.

verseText: Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.
mdText: Mine eye also shall see _my_ _desire_ on mine enemies, _and_ mine ears shall hear _my_ _desire_ of the wicked that rise up against me.

verseText: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
mdText: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in [Lebanon.](/place/lebanon_720)

verseText: Those that be planted in the house of the LORD shall flourish in the courts of our God.
mdText: Those that be planted in the house of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall flourish in the courts of our [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;
mdText: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;

verseText: To shew that the LORD is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
mdText: To shew that the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ upright: _he_ _is_ my rock, and _there_ _is_ no unrighteousness in him.

verseText: The LORD reigneth, he is clothed with majesty; the LORD is clothed with strength, wherewith he hath girded himself: the world also is stablished, that it cannot be moved.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) reigneth, he is clothed with majesty; the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) is clothed with strength, _wherewith_ he hath girded himself: the world also is stablished, that it cannot be moved.

verseText: Thy throne is established of old: thou art from everlasting.
mdText: Thy throne _is_ established of old: thou _art_ from everlasting.

verseText: The floods have lifted up, O LORD, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their waves.
mdText: The floods have lifted up, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their waves.

verseText: The LORD on high is mightier than the noise of many waters, yea, than the mighty waves of the sea.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) on high _is_ mightier than the noise of many waters, _yea,_ _than_ the mighty waves of the sea.

verseText: Thy testimonies are very sure: holiness becometh thine house, O LORD, for ever.
mdText: Thy testimonies are very sure: holiness becometh thine house, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) for ever.

verseText: O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.
mdText: O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O [God,]([/person/god_1324) to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.

verseText: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.
mdText: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.

verseText: LORD, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?

verseText: How long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?
mdText: _How_ _long_ shall they utter _and_ speak hard things? _and_ all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?

verseText: They break in pieces thy people, O LORD, and afflict thine heritage.
mdText: They break in pieces thy people, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and afflict thine heritage.

verseText: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.
mdText: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.

verseText: Yet they say, The LORD shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.
mdText: Yet they say, The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall not see, neither shall the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) regard _it._

verseText: Understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?
mdText: Understand, ye brutish among the people: and _ye_ fools, when will ye be wise?

verseText: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
mdText: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?

verseText: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he know?
mdText: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, _shall_ _not_ _he_ _know?_

verseText: The LORD knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) knoweth the thoughts of man, that they _are_ vanity.

verseText: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD, and teachest him out of thy law;
mdText: Blessed _is_ the man whom thou chastenest, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and teachest him out of thy law;

verseText: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.
mdText: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.

verseText: For the LORD will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.

verseText: But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
mdText: But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.

verseText: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
mdText: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? _or_ who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?

verseText: Unless the LORD had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.
mdText: Unless the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _had_ _been_ my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.

verseText: When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O LORD, held me up.
mdText: When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) held me up.

verseText: In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.
mdText: In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.

verseText: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?
mdText: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?

verseText: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.
mdText: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.

verseText: But the LORD is my defence; and my God is the rock of my refuge.
mdText: But the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) is my defence; and my [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the rock of my refuge.

verseText: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the LORD our God shall cut them off.
mdText: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; _yea,_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God]([/person/god_1324) shall cut them off.

verseText: O come, let us sing unto the LORD: let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.
mdText: O come, let us sing unto the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.

verseText: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving, and make a joyful noise unto him with psalms.
mdText: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving, and make a joyful noise unto him with psalms.

verseText: For the LORD is a great God, and a great King above all gods.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ a great [God,]([/person/god_1324) and a great King above all gods.

verseText: In his hand are the deep places of the earth: the strength of the hills is his also.
mdText: In his hand _are_ the deep places of the earth: the strength of the hills _is_ his also.

verseText: The sea is his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry land.
mdText: The sea _is_ his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry _land._

verseText: O come, let us worship and bow down: let us kneel before the LORD our maker.
mdText: O come, let us worship and bow down: let us kneel before the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our maker.

verseText: For he is our God; and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To day if ye will hear his voice,
mdText: For he _is_ our [God;]([/person/god_1324) and we _are_ the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To day if ye will hear his voice,

verseText: Harden not your heart, as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness:
mdText: Harden not your heart, as in the provocation, _and_ as _in_ the day of temptation in the [wilderness:](/place/meribah_783)

verseText: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.
mdText: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.

verseText: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said, It is a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known my ways:
mdText: Forty years long was I grieved with _this_ generation, and said, It _is_ a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known my ways:

verseText: Unto whom I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest.
mdText: Unto whom I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest.

verseText: O sing unto the LORD a new song: sing unto the LORD, all the earth.
mdText: O sing unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) a new song: sing unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) all the earth.

verseText: Sing unto the LORD, bless his name; shew forth his salvation from day to day.
mdText: Sing unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) bless his name; shew forth his salvation from day to day.

verseText: Declare his glory among the heathen, his wonders among all people.
mdText: Declare his glory among the heathen, his wonders among all people.

verseText: For the LORD is great, and greatly to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ great, and greatly to be praised: he _is_ to be feared above all gods.

verseText: For all the gods of the nations are idols: but the LORD made the heavens.
mdText: For all the gods of the nations _are_ idols: but the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) made the heavens.

verseText: Honour and majesty are before him: strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
mdText: Honour and majesty _are_ before him: strength and beauty _are_ in his sanctuary.

verseText: Give unto the LORD, O ye kindreds of the people, give unto the LORD glory and strength.
mdText: Give unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O ye kindreds of the people, give unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) glory and strength.

verseText: Give unto the LORD the glory due unto his name: bring an offering, and come into his courts.
mdText: Give unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) the glory _due_ _unto_ his name: bring an offering, and come into his courts.

verseText: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness: fear before him, all the earth.
mdText: O worship the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) in the beauty of holiness: fear before him, all the earth.

verseText: Say among the heathen that the LORD reigneth: the world also shall be established that it shall not be moved: he shall judge the people righteously.
mdText: Say among the heathen _that_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) reigneth: the world also shall be established that it shall not be moved: he shall judge the people righteously.

verseText: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof.
mdText: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof.

verseText: Let the field be joyful, and all that is therein: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice
mdText: Let the field be joyful, and all that _is_ therein: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice

verseText: Before the LORD: for he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth: he shall judge the world with righteousness, and the people with his truth.
mdText: Before the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) for he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth: he shall judge the world with righteousness, and the people with his truth.

verseText: The LORD reigneth; let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of isles be glad thereof.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) reigneth; let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of isles be glad _thereof._

verseText: Clouds and darkness are round about him: righteousness and judgment are the habitation of his throne.
mdText: Clouds and darkness _are_ round about him: righteousness and judgment _are_ the habitation of his throne.

verseText: A fire goeth before him, and burneth up his enemies round about.
mdText: A fire goeth before him, and burneth up his enemies round about.

verseText: His lightnings enlightened the world: the earth saw, and trembled.
mdText: His lightnings enlightened the world: the earth saw, and trembled.

verseText: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the LORD, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
mdText: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) at the presence of the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) of the whole earth.

verseText: The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the people see his glory.
mdText: The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the people see his glory.

verseText: Confounded be all they that serve graven images, that boast themselves of idols: worship him, all ye gods.
mdText: Confounded be all they that serve graven images, that boast themselves of idols: worship him, all _ye_ gods.

verseText: Zion heard, and was glad; and the daughters of Judah rejoiced because of thy judgments, O LORD.
mdText: [Zion](/place/zion_1263) heard, and was glad; and the daughters of Judah rejoiced because of thy judgments, O [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: For thou, LORD, art high above all the earth: thou art exalted far above all gods.
mdText: For thou, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _art_ high above all the earth: thou art exalted far above all gods.

verseText: Ye that love the LORD, hate evil: he preserveth the souls of his saints; he delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked.
mdText: Ye that love the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) hate evil: he preserveth the souls of his saints; he delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked.

verseText: Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.
mdText: Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.

verseText: Rejoice in the LORD, ye righteous; and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
mdText: Rejoice in the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) ye righteous; and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

verseText: O sing unto the LORD a new song; for he hath done marvellous things: his right hand, and his holy arm, hath gotten him the victory.
mdText: O sing unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) a new song; for he hath done marvellous things: his right hand, and his holy arm, hath gotten him the victory.

verseText: The LORD hath made known his salvation: his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the heathen.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath made known his salvation: his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the heathen.

verseText: He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel: all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
mdText: He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel: all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Make a joyful noise unto the LORD, all the earth: make a loud noise, and rejoice, and sing praise.
mdText: Make a joyful noise unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) all the earth: make a loud noise, and rejoice, and sing praise.

verseText: Sing unto the LORD with the harp; with the harp, and the voice of a psalm.
mdText: Sing unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with the harp; with the harp, and the voice of a psalm.

verseText: With trumpets and sound of cornet make a joyful noise before the LORD, the King.
mdText: With trumpets and sound of cornet make a joyful noise before the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) the King.

verseText: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.
mdText: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.

verseText: Let the floods clap their hands: let the hills be joyful together
mdText: Let the floods clap _their_ hands: let the hills be joyful together

verseText: Before the LORD; for he cometh to judge the earth: with righteousness shall he judge the world, and the people with equity.
mdText: Before the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for he cometh to judge the earth: with righteousness shall he judge the world, and the people with equity.

verseText: The LORD reigneth; let the people tremble: he sitteth between the cherubims; let the earth be moved.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) reigneth; let the people tremble: he sitteth _between_ the cherubims; let the earth be moved.

verseText: The LORD is great in Zion; and he is high above all the people.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ great in [Zion;](/place/zion_1263) and he _is_ high above all the people.

verseText: Let them praise thy great and terrible name; for it is holy.
mdText: Let them praise thy great and terrible name; _for_ it _is_ holy.

verseText: The king’s strength also loveth judgment; thou dost establish equity, thou executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.
mdText: The king’s strength also loveth judgment; thou dost establish equity, thou executest judgment and righteousness in [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: Exalt ye the LORD our God, and worship at his footstool; for he is holy.
mdText: Exalt ye the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God,]([/person/god_1324) and worship at his footstool; _for_ he _is_ holy.

verseText: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among them that call upon his name; they called upon the LORD, and he answered them.
mdText: [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) and [Aaron]([/person/aaron_1) among his priests, and [Samuel]([/person/samuel_2469) among them that call upon his name; they called upon the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and he answered them.

verseText: He spake unto them in the cloudy pillar: they kept his testimonies, and the ordinance that he gave them.
mdText: He spake unto them in the cloudy pillar: they kept his testimonies, and the ordinance _that_ he gave them.

verseText: Thou answeredst them, O LORD our God: thou wast a God that forgavest them, though thou tookest vengeance of their inventions.
mdText: Thou answeredst them, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God:]([/person/god_1324) thou wast a [God]([/person/god_1324) that forgavest them, though thou tookest vengeance of their inventions.

verseText: Exalt the LORD our God, and worship at his holy hill; for the LORD our God is holy.
mdText: Exalt the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God,]([/person/god_1324) and worship at his holy hill; for the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ holy.

verseText: Make a joyful noise unto the LORD, all ye lands.
mdText: Make a joyful noise unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) all ye lands.

verseText: Serve the LORD with gladness: come before his presence with singing.
mdText: Serve the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with gladness: come before his presence with singing.

verseText: Know ye that the LORD he is God: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
mdText: Know ye that the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) he _is_ [God:]([/person/god_1324) _it_ _is_ he _that_ hath made us, and not we ourselves; _we_ _are_ his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

verseText: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise: be thankful unto him, and bless his name.
mdText: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, _and_ into his courts with praise: be thankful unto him, _and_ bless his name.

verseText: For the LORD is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endureth to all generations.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ good; his mercy _is_ everlasting; and his truth _endureth_ to all generations.

verseText: I will sing of mercy and judgment: unto thee, O LORD, will I sing.
mdText: I will sing of mercy and judgment: unto thee, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) will I sing.

verseText: I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. O when wilt thou come unto me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.
mdText: I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. O when wilt thou come unto me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.

verseText: I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside; it shall not cleave to me.
mdText: I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside; _it_ shall not cleave to me.

verseText: A froward heart shall depart from me: I will not know a wicked person.
mdText: A froward heart shall depart from me: I will not know a wicked _person._

verseText: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour, him will I cut off: him that hath an high look and a proud heart will not I suffer.
mdText: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour, him will I cut off: him that hath an high look and a proud heart will not I suffer.

verseText: Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.
mdText: Mine eyes _shall_ _be_ upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serve me.

verseText: He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house: he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.
mdText: He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house: he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.

verseText: I will early destroy all the wicked of the land; that I may cut off all wicked doers from the city of the LORD.
mdText: I will early destroy all the wicked of the land; that I may cut off all wicked doers from the city of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and let my cry come unto thee.
mdText: Hear my prayer, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and let my cry come unto thee.

verseText: Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me: in the day when I call answer me speedily.
mdText: Hide not thy face from me in the day _when_ I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me: in the day _when_ I call answer me speedily.

verseText: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as an hearth.
mdText: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as an hearth.

verseText: My heart is smitten, and withered like grass; so that I forget to eat my bread.
mdText: My heart is smitten, and withered like grass; so that I forget to eat my bread.

verseText: By reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.
mdText: By reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.

verseText: I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.
mdText: I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.

verseText: I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.
mdText: I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.

verseText: Mine enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.
mdText: Mine enemies reproach me all the day; _and_ they that are mad against me are sworn against me.

verseText: For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,
mdText: For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,

verseText: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.
mdText: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.

verseText: My days are like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered like grass.
mdText: My days _are_ like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered like grass.

verseText: But thou, O LORD, shalt endure for ever; and thy remembrance unto all generations.
mdText: But thou, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) shalt endure for ever; and thy remembrance unto all generations.

verseText: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to favour her, yea, the set time, is come.
mdText: Thou shalt arise, _and_ have mercy upon [Zion:](/place/zion_1263) for the time to favour her, yea, the set time, is come.

verseText: For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour the dust thereof.
mdText: For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour the dust thereof.

verseText: So the heathen shall fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.
mdText: So the heathen shall fear the name of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and all the kings of the earth thy glory.

verseText: When the LORD shall build up Zion, he shall appear in his glory.
mdText: When the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall build up [Zion,](/place/zion_1263) he shall appear in his glory.

verseText: He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.
mdText: He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.

verseText: This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created shall praise the LORD.
mdText: This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created shall praise the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the LORD behold the earth;
mdText: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) behold the earth;

verseText: To hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;
mdText: To hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;

verseText: To declare the name of the LORD in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem;
mdText: To declare the name of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) in [Zion,](/place/zion_1263) and his praise in [Jerusalem;](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: When the people are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
mdText: When the people are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.
mdText: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.

verseText: I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are throughout all generations.
mdText: I said, O my [God,]([/person/god_1324) take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years _are_ throughout all generations.

verseText: Of old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.
mdText: Of old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth: and the heavens _are_ the work of thy hands.

verseText: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed:
mdText: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed:

verseText: But thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.
mdText: But thou _art_ the same, and thy years shall have no end.

verseText: The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.
mdText: The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.

verseText: Bless the LORD, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.
mdText: Bless the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O my soul: and all that is within me, _bless_ his holy name.

verseText: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:
mdText: Bless the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:

verseText: Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases;
mdText: Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases;

verseText: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;
mdText: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;

verseText: Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
mdText: Who satisfieth thy mouth with good _things;_ _so_ _that_ thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.

verseText: The LORD executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.

verseText: He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the children of Israel.
mdText: He made known his ways unto [Moses,]([/person/moses_2108) his acts unto the children of [Israel.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: The LORD is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.

verseText: He will not always chide: neither will he keep his anger for ever.
mdText: He will not always chide: neither will he keep _his_ _anger_ for ever.

verseText: He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
mdText: He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

verseText: For as the heaven is high above the earth, so great is his mercy toward them that fear him.
mdText: For as the heaven is high above the earth, _so_ great is his mercy toward them that fear him.

verseText: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
mdText: As far as the east is from the west, _so_ far hath he removed our transgressions from us.

verseText: Like as a father pitieth his children, so the LORD pitieth them that fear him.
mdText: Like as a father pitieth _his_ children, _so_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) pitieth them that fear him.

verseText: For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.
mdText: For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we _are_ dust.

verseText: As for man, his days are as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.
mdText: _As_ _for_ man, his days _are_ as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.

verseText: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.
mdText: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.

verseText: But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto children’s children;
mdText: But the mercy of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto children’s children;

verseText: To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.
mdText: To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.

verseText: The LORD hath prepared his throne in the heavens; and his kingdom ruleth over all.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath prepared his throne in the heavens; and his kingdom ruleth over all.

verseText: Bless the LORD, ye his angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.
mdText: Bless the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) ye his angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.

verseText: Bless ye the LORD, all ye his hosts; ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.
mdText: Bless ye the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) all _ye_ his hosts; _ye_ ministers of his, that do his pleasure.

verseText: Bless the LORD, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the LORD, O my soul.
mdText: Bless the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O my soul.

verseText: Bless the LORD, O my soul. O LORD my God, thou art very great; thou art clothed with honour and majesty.
mdText: Bless the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O my soul. O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my [God,]([/person/god_1324) thou art very great; thou art clothed with honour and majesty.

verseText: Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment: who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain:
mdText: Who coverest _thyself_ with light as _with_ a garment: who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain:

verseText: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters: who maketh the clouds his chariot: who walketh upon the wings of the wind:
mdText: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters: who maketh the clouds his chariot: who walketh upon the wings of the wind:

verseText: Who maketh his angels spirits; his ministers a flaming fire:
mdText: Who maketh his angels spirits; his ministers a flaming fire:

verseText: Who laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be removed for ever.
mdText: _Who_ laid the foundations of the earth, _that_ it should not be removed for ever.

verseText: Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the waters stood above the mountains.
mdText: Thou coveredst it with the deep as _with_ a garment: the waters stood above the mountains.

verseText: At thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away.
mdText: At thy rebuke they fled; at the voice of thy thunder they hasted away.

verseText: They go up by the mountains; they go down by the valleys unto the place which thou hast founded for them.
mdText: They go up by the mountains; they go down by the valleys unto the place which thou hast founded for them.

verseText: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; that they turn not again to cover the earth.
mdText: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; that they turn not again to cover the earth.

verseText: He sendeth the springs into the valleys, which run among the hills.
mdText: He sendeth the springs into the valleys, _which_ run among the hills.

verseText: They give drink to every beast of the field: the wild asses quench their thirst.
mdText: They give drink to every beast of the field: the wild asses quench their thirst.

verseText: By them shall the fowls of the heaven have their habitation, which sing among the branches.
mdText: By them shall the fowls of the heaven have their habitation, _which_ sing among the branches.

verseText: He watereth the hills from his chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.
mdText: He watereth the hills from his chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.

verseText: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the service of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;
mdText: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the service of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;

verseText: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face to shine, and bread which strengtheneth man’s heart.
mdText: And wine _that_ maketh glad the heart of man, _and_ oil to make _his_ face to shine, and bread _which_ strengtheneth man’s heart.

verseText: The trees of the LORD are full of sap; the cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;
mdText: The trees of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) are full _of_ _sap;_ the cedars of [Lebanon,](/place/lebanon_720) which he hath planted;

verseText: Where the birds make their nests: as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.
mdText: Where the birds make their nests: _as_ _for_ the stork, the fir trees _are_ her house.

verseText: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats; and the rocks for the conies.
mdText: The high hills _are_ a refuge for the wild goats; _and_ the rocks for the conies.

verseText: He appointed the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.
mdText: He appointed the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.

verseText: Thou makest darkness, and it is night: wherein all the beasts of the forest do creep forth.
mdText: Thou makest darkness, and it is night: wherein all the beasts of the forest do creep _forth._

verseText: The young lions roar after their prey, and seek their meat from God.
mdText: The young lions roar after their prey, and seek their meat from [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: The sun ariseth, they gather themselves together, and lay them down in their dens.
mdText: The sun ariseth, they gather themselves together, and lay them down in their dens.

verseText: Man goeth forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.
mdText: Man goeth forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.

verseText: O LORD, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.
mdText: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.

verseText: So is this great and wide sea, wherein are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.
mdText: _So_ _is_ this great and wide sea, wherein _are_ things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.

verseText: There go the ships: there is that leviathan, whom thou hast made to play therein.
mdText: There go the ships: _there_ _is_ that leviathan, _whom_ thou hast made to play therein.

verseText: These wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give them their meat in due season.
mdText: These wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give _them_ their meat in due season.

verseText: That thou givest them they gather: thou openest thine hand, they are filled with good.
mdText: _That_ thou givest them they gather: thou openest thine hand, they are filled with good.

verseText: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.
mdText: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.

verseText: Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created: and thou renewest the face of the earth.
mdText: Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created: and thou renewest the face of the earth.

verseText: The glory of the LORD shall endure for ever: the LORD shall rejoice in his works.
mdText: The glory of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall endure for ever: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall rejoice in his works.

verseText: He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the hills, and they smoke.
mdText: He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the hills, and they smoke.

verseText: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
mdText: I will sing unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) as long as I live: I will sing praise to my [God]([/person/god_1324) while I have my being.

verseText: My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the LORD.
mdText: My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the LORD, O my soul. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O my soul. Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: O give thanks unto the LORD; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.
mdText: O give thanks unto the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.

verseText: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.
mdText: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.

verseText: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.
mdText: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Seek the LORD, and his strength: seek his face evermore.
mdText: Seek the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and his strength: seek his face evermore.

verseText: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
mdText: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

verseText: O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.
mdText: O ye seed of [Abraham]([/person/abraham_58) his servant, ye children of [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) his chosen.

verseText: He is the LORD our God: his judgments are in all the earth.
mdText: He _is_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God:]([/person/god_1324) his judgments _are_ in all the earth.

verseText: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.
mdText: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word _which_ he commanded to a thousand generations.

verseText: Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;
mdText: Which _covenant_ he made with [Abraham,]([/person/abraham_58) and his oath unto [Isaac;]([/person/isaac_616)

verseText: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:
mdText: And confirmed the same unto [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) for a law, _and_ to Israel _for_ an everlasting covenant:

verseText: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:
mdText: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of [Canaan,]([/person/canaan_914) the lot of your inheritance:

verseText: When they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.
mdText: When they were _but_ a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.

verseText: When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;
mdText: When they went from one nation to another, from _one_ kingdom to another people;

verseText: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;
mdText: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;

verseText: Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.
mdText: _Saying,_ Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

verseText: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.
mdText: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.

verseText: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:
mdText: He sent a man before them, _even_ [Joseph,]([/person/joseph_1710) _who_ was sold for a servant:

verseText: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:
mdText: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:

verseText: Until the time that his word came: the word of the LORD tried him.
mdText: Until the time that his word came: the word of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) tried him.

verseText: The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.
mdText: The king sent and loosed him; _even_ the ruler of the people, and let him go free.

verseText: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:
mdText: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:

verseText: To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.
mdText: To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.

verseText: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
