mdText: Israel also came into [Egypt;](/place/egypt_362) and [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) sojourned in the land of [Ham.]([/person/ham_1359)

verseText: And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.
mdText: And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.

verseText: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.
mdText: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.

verseText: He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.
mdText: He sent [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) his servant; _and_ [Aaron]([/person/aaron_1) whom he had chosen.

verseText: They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.
mdText: They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of [Ham.]([/person/ham_1359)

verseText: He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.
mdText: He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.

verseText: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.
mdText: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

verseText: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.
mdText: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.

verseText: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their coasts.
mdText: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, _and_ lice in all their coasts.

verseText: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.
mdText: He gave them hail for rain, _and_ flaming fire in their land.

verseText: He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.
mdText: He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.

verseText: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,
mdText: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,

verseText: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.
mdText: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

verseText: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.
mdText: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.

verseText: He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.
mdText: He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and _there_ _was_ not one feeble _person_ among their tribes.

verseText: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.
mdText: [Egypt](/place/egypt_362) was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.

verseText: He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.
mdText: He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.

verseText: The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
mdText: _The_ _people_ asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

verseText: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.
mdText: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places _like_ a river.

verseText: For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.
mdText: For he remembered his holy promise, _and_ [Abraham]([/person/abraham_58) his servant.

verseText: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:
mdText: And he brought forth his people with joy, _and_ his chosen with gladness:

verseText: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;
mdText: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;

verseText: That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Praise ye the LORD. O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) O give thanks unto the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for _he_ _is_ good: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? who can shew forth all his praise?
mdText: Who can utter the mighty acts of the [LORD?]([/person/god_1324) _who_ can shew forth all his praise?

verseText: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.
mdText: Blessed _are_ they that keep judgment, _and_ he that doeth righteousness at all times.

verseText: Remember me, O LORD, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;
mdText: Remember me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) with the favour _that_ _thou_ _bearest_ _unto_ thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

verseText: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.
mdText: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

verseText: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.
mdText: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

verseText: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.
mdText: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in [Egypt;](/place/egypt_362) they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked _him_ at the [sea,](/place/red_sea_986) _even_ at the [Red](/place/red_sea_986) [sea.](/place/red_sea_986)

verseText: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.
mdText: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

verseText: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.
mdText: He rebuked the [Red](/place/red_sea_986) [sea](/place/red_sea_986) also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

verseText: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
mdText: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated _them,_ and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

verseText: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.
mdText: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

verseText: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.
mdText: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

verseText: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:
mdText: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

verseText: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.
mdText: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted [God]([/person/god_1324) in the desert.

verseText: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.
mdText: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

verseText: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.
mdText: They envied [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) also in the camp, _and_ [Aaron]([/person/aaron_1) the saint of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.
mdText: The earth opened and swallowed up [Dathan,]([/person/dathan_982) and covered the company of [Abiram.]([/person/abiram_47)

verseText: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.
mdText: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

verseText: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.
mdText: They made a calf in [Horeb,](/place/horeb_576) and worshipped the molten image.

verseText: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.
mdText: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

verseText: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;
mdText: They forgat [God]([/person/god_1324) their saviour, which had done great things in [Egypt;](/place/egypt_362)

verseText: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.
mdText: Wondrous works in the land of [Ham,]([/person/ham_1359) _and_ terrible things by the [Red](/place/red_sea_986) [sea.](/place/red_sea_986)

verseText: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.
mdText: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy _them._

verseText: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:
mdText: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

verseText: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.
mdText: But murmured in their tents, _and_ hearkened not unto the voice of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:
mdText: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

verseText: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.
mdText: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

verseText: They joined themselves also unto Baalpeor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.
mdText: They joined themselves also unto [Baal-peor,]([/person/baal_573) and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

verseText: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.
mdText: Thus they provoked _him_ to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

verseText: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.
mdText: Then stood up [Phinehas,]([/person/phinehas_2349) and executed judgment: and _so_ the plague was stayed.

verseText: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.
mdText: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

verseText: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:
mdText: They angered _him_ also at the [waters](/place/meribah_782) of strife, so that it went ill with [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) for their sakes:

verseText: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.
mdText: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

verseText: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:
mdText: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) commanded them:

verseText: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.
mdText: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

verseText: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.
mdText: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

verseText: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,
mdText: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

verseText: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.
mdText: And shed innocent blood, _even_ the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of [Canaan:]([/person/canaan_914) and the land was polluted with blood.

verseText: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.
mdText: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

verseText: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.
mdText: Therefore was the wrath of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

verseText: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.
mdText: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

verseText: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.
mdText: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

verseText: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.
mdText: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked _him_ with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

verseText: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:
mdText: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

verseText: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.
mdText: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

verseText: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.
mdText: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

verseText: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.
mdText: Save us, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God,]([/person/god_1324) and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, _and_ to triumph in thy praise.

verseText: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: Blessed _be_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: O give thanks unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) for _he_ _is_ good: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;
mdText: Let the redeemed of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) say _so,_ whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;

verseText: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.
mdText: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.

verseText: They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.
mdText: They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.

verseText: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
mdText: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

verseText: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.
mdText: Then they cried unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) in their trouble, _and_ he delivered them out of their distresses.

verseText: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.
mdText: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

verseText: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
mdText: Oh that _men_ would praise the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _for_ his goodness, and _for_ his wonderful works to the children of men!

verseText: For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.
mdText: For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

verseText: Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron;
mdText: Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, _being_ bound in affliction and iron;

verseText: Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the most High:
mdText: Because they rebelled against the words of [God,]([/person/god_1324) and contemned the counsel of the most High:

verseText: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was none to help.
mdText: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and _there_ _was_ none to help.

verseText: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.
mdText: Then they cried unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) in their trouble, _and_ he saved them out of their distresses.

verseText: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.
mdText: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.

verseText: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
mdText: Oh that _men_ would praise the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _for_ his goodness, and _for_ his wonderful works to the children of men!

verseText: For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.
mdText: For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.

verseText: Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.
mdText: Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.

verseText: Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.
mdText: Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.

verseText: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses.
mdText: Then they cry unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) in their trouble, _and_ he saveth them out of their distresses.

verseText: He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.
mdText: He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered _them_ from their destructions.

verseText: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
mdText: Oh that _men_ would praise the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _for_ his goodness, and _for_ his wonderful works to the children of men!

verseText: And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.
mdText: And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.

verseText: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;
mdText: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;

verseText: These see the works of the LORD, and his wonders in the deep.
mdText: These see the works of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and his wonders in the deep.

verseText: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.
mdText: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.

verseText: They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.
mdText: They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.

verseText: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits’ end.
mdText: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits’ end.

verseText: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.
mdText: Then they cry unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.

verseText: He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.
mdText: He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.

verseText: Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.
mdText: Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.

verseText: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
mdText: Oh that _men_ would praise the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _for_ his goodness, and _for_ his wonderful works to the children of men!

verseText: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
mdText: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.

verseText: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;
mdText: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;

verseText: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
mdText: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

verseText: He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.
mdText: He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.

verseText: And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;
mdText: And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;

verseText: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.
mdText: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

verseText: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.
mdText: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

verseText: Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.
mdText: Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.

verseText: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.
mdText: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, _where_ _there_ _is_ no way.

verseText: Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.
mdText: Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh _him_ families like a flock.

verseText: The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
mdText: The righteous shall see _it,_ and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

verseText: Whoso is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the LORD.
mdText: Whoso _is_ wise, and will observe these _things,_ even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
mdText: O [God,]([/person/god_1324) my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.

verseText: Awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.
mdText: Awake, psaltery and harp: I _myself_ will awake early.

verseText: I will praise thee, O LORD, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.
mdText: I will praise thee, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

verseText: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.
mdText: For thy mercy _is_ great above the heavens: and thy truth _reacheth_ unto the clouds.

verseText: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;
mdText: Be thou exalted, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;

verseText: That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.
mdText: That thy beloved may be delivered: save _with_ thy right hand, and answer me.

verseText: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide [Shechem,](/place/shechem_1069) and mete out the valley of [Succoth.](/place/valley_of_succoth_1221)

verseText: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;
mdText: [Gilead](/place/gilead_475) _is_ mine; [Manasseh]([/person/manasseh_1928) _is_ mine; [Ephraim]([/person/ephraim_1206) also _is_ the strength of mine head; Judah _is_ my lawgiver;

verseText: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.
mdText: [Moab]([/person/moab_2103) _is_ my washpot; over [Edom]([/person/esau_1216) will I cast out my shoe; over [Philistia](/place/philistia_943) will I triumph.

verseText: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
mdText: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into [Edom?]([/person/esau_1216)

verseText: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?
mdText: _Wilt_ not _thou,_ O [God,]([/person/god_1324) _who_ hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) go forth with our hosts?

verseText: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.
mdText: Give us help from trouble: for vain _is_ the help of man.

verseText: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.
mdText: Through [God]([/person/god_1324) we shall do valiantly: for he _it_ _is_ _that_ shall tread down our enemies.

verseText: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;
mdText: Hold not thy peace, O [God]([/person/god_1324) of my praise;

verseText: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
mdText: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

verseText: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.
mdText: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

verseText: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.
mdText: For my love they are my adversaries: but I _give_ _myself_ _unto_ prayer.

verseText: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
mdText: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

verseText: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.
mdText: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let [Satan]([/person/satan_2476) stand at his right hand.

verseText: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.
mdText: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

verseText: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.
mdText: Let his days be few; _and_ let another take his office.

verseText: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.
mdText: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

verseText: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.
mdText: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek _their_ _bread_ also out of their desolate places.

verseText: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.
mdText: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

verseText: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.
mdText: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

verseText: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
mdText: Let his posterity be cut off; _and_ in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

verseText: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
mdText: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

verseText: Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
mdText: Let them be before the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

verseText: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.
mdText: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

verseText: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.
mdText: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

verseText: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.
mdText: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

verseText: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.
mdText: Let it be unto him as the garment _which_ covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

verseText: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the LORD, and of them that speak evil against my soul.
mdText: _Let_ this _be_ the reward of mine adversaries from the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and of them that speak evil against my soul.

verseText: But do thou for me, O GOD the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.
mdText: But do thou for me, O [GOD]([/person/god_1324) the [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy _is_ good, deliver thou me.

verseText: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
mdText: For I _am_ poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

verseText: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.
mdText: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

verseText: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.
mdText: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

verseText: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.
mdText: I became also a reproach unto them: _when_ they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

verseText: Help me, O LORD my God: O save me according to thy mercy:
mdText: Help me, O [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my [God:]([/person/god_1324) O save me according to thy mercy:

verseText: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, LORD, hast done it.
mdText: That they may know that this _is_ thy hand; _that_ thou, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) hast done it.

verseText: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.
mdText: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

verseText: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.
mdText: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

verseText: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
mdText: I will greatly praise the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

verseText: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.
mdText: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save _him_ from those that condemn his soul.

verseText: The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said unto my [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.

verseText: The LORD shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion: rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall send the rod of thy strength out of [Zion:](/place/zion_1263) rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.

verseText: Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew of thy youth.
mdText: Thy people _shall_ _be_ willing in the day of thy power, in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew of thy youth.

verseText: The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou _art_ a priest for ever after the order of [Melchizedek.]([/person/melchisedec_1991)

verseText: The Lord at thy right hand shall strike through kings in the day of his wrath.
mdText: The [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) at thy right hand shall strike through kings in the day of his wrath.

verseText: He shall judge among the heathen, he shall fill the places with the dead bodies; he shall wound the heads over many countries.
mdText: He shall judge among the heathen, he shall fill _the_ _places_ with the dead bodies; he shall wound the heads over many countries.

verseText: He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.
mdText: He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.

verseText: Praise ye the LORD. I will praise the LORD with my whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and in the congregation.
mdText: Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) I will praise the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with _my_ whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and _in_ the congregation.

verseText: The works of the LORD are great, sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.
mdText: The works of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _are_ great, sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.

verseText: His work is honourable and glorious: and his righteousness endureth for ever.
mdText: His work _is_ honourable and glorious: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

verseText: He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered: the LORD is gracious and full of compassion.
mdText: He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ gracious and full of compassion.

verseText: He hath given meat unto them that fear him: he will ever be mindful of his covenant.
mdText: He hath given meat unto them that fear him: he will ever be mindful of his covenant.

verseText: He hath shewed his people the power of his works, that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.
mdText: He hath shewed his people the power of his works, that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.

verseText: The works of his hands are verity and judgment; all his commandments are sure.
mdText: The works of his hands _are_ verity and judgment; all his commandments _are_ sure.

verseText: They stand fast for ever and ever, and are done in truth and uprightness.
mdText: They stand fast for ever and ever, _and_ _are_ done in truth and uprightness.

verseText: He sent redemption unto his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and reverend is his name.
mdText: He sent redemption unto his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and reverend _is_ his name.

verseText: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.
mdText: The fear of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do _his_ _commandments:_ his praise endureth for ever.

verseText: Praise ye the LORD. Blessed is the man that feareth the LORD, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.
mdText: Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) Blessed _is_ the man _that_ feareth the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _that_ delighteth greatly in his commandments.

verseText: His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the upright shall be blessed.
mdText: His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the upright shall be blessed.

verseText: Wealth and riches shall be in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.
mdText: Wealth and riches _shall_ _be_ in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

verseText: Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: he is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.
mdText: Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: _he_ _is_ gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.

verseText: A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion.
mdText: A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion.

verseText: Surely he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.
mdText: Surely he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.

verseText: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.
mdText: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: His heart is established, he shall not be afraid, until he see his desire upon his enemies.
mdText: His heart _is_ established, he shall not be afraid, until he see _his_ _desire_ upon his enemies.

verseText: He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness endureth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.
mdText: He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness endureth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.

verseText: The wicked shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.
mdText: The wicked shall see _it,_ and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.

verseText: Praise ye the LORD. Praise, O ye servants of the LORD, praise the name of the LORD.
mdText: Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) Praise, O ye servants of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) praise the name of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for evermore.
mdText: Blessed be the name of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) from this time forth and for evermore.

verseText: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same the LORD’S name is to be praised.
mdText: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same the [LORD’S]([/person/god_1324) name _is_ to be praised.

verseText: The LORD is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ high above all nations, _and_ his glory above the heavens.

verseText: Who is like unto the LORD our God, who dwelleth on high,
mdText: Who _is_ like unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God,]([/person/god_1324) who dwelleth on high,

verseText: Who humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven, and in the earth!
mdText: Who humbleth _himself_ to behold _the_ _things_ _that_ _are_ in heaven, and in the earth!

verseText: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth the needy out of the dunghill;
mdText: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, _and_ lifteth the needy out of the dunghill;

verseText: That he may set him with princes, even with the princes of his people.
mdText: That he may set _him_ with princes, _even_ with the princes of his people.

verseText: He maketh the barren woman to keep house, and to be a joyful mother of children. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: He maketh the barren woman to keep house, _and_ _to_ _be_ a joyful mother of children. Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;
mdText: When Israel went out of [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) the house of [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) from a people of strange language;

verseText: Judah was his sanctuary, and Israel his dominion.
mdText: Judah was his sanctuary, _and_ Israel his dominion.

verseText: The sea saw it, and fled: Jordan was driven back.
mdText: The sea saw _it,_ and fled: [Jordan](/place/jordan_653) was driven back.

verseText: The mountains skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.
mdText: The mountains skipped like rams, _and_ the little hills like lambs.

verseText: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?
mdText: What _ailed_ thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou [Jordan,](/place/jordan_653) _that_ thou wast driven back?

verseText: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?
mdText: Ye mountains, _that_ ye skipped like rams; _and_ ye little hills, like lambs?

verseText: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;
mdText: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) at the presence of the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob;]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: Which turned the rock into a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.
mdText: Which turned the rock _into_ a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

verseText: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy, and for thy truth’s sake.
mdText: Not unto us, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy, _and_ for thy truth’s sake.

verseText: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is now their God?
mdText: Wherefore should the heathen say, Where _is_ now their [God?]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: But our God is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he hath pleased.
mdText: But our [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he hath pleased.

verseText: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
mdText: Their idols _are_ silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

verseText: They have mouths, but they speak not: eyes have they, but they see not:
mdText: They have mouths, but they speak not: eyes have they, but they see not:

verseText: They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:
mdText: They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:

verseText: They have hands, but they handle not: feet have they, but they walk not: neither speak they through their throat.
mdText: They have hands, but they handle not: feet have they, but they walk not: neither speak they through their throat.

verseText: They that make them are like unto them; so is every one that trusteth in them.
mdText: They that make them are like unto them; _so_ _is_ every one that trusteth in them.

verseText: O Israel, trust thou in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.
mdText: O Israel, trust thou in the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) he _is_ their help and their shield.

verseText: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.
mdText: O house of [Aaron,]([/person/aaron_1) trust in the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) he _is_ their help and their shield.

verseText: Ye that fear the LORD, trust in the LORD: he is their help and their shield.
mdText: Ye that fear the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) trust in the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) he _is_ their help and their shield.

verseText: The LORD hath been mindful of us: he will bless us; he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath been mindful of us: he will bless _us;_ he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of [Aaron.]([/person/aaron_1)

verseText: He will bless them that fear the LORD, both small and great.
mdText: He will bless them that fear the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _both_ small and great.

verseText: The LORD shall increase you more and more, you and your children.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall increase you more and more, you and your children.

verseText: Ye are blessed of the LORD which made heaven and earth.
mdText: Ye _are_ blessed of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) which made heaven and earth.

verseText: The heaven, even the heavens, are the LORD’S: but the earth hath he given to the children of men.
mdText: The heaven, _even_ the heavens, _are_ the [LORD’S:]([/person/god_1324) but the earth hath he given to the children of men.

verseText: The dead praise not the LORD, neither any that go down into silence.
mdText: The dead praise not the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) neither any that go down into silence.

verseText: But we will bless the LORD from this time forth and for evermore. Praise the LORD.
mdText: But we will bless the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) from this time forth and for evermore. Praise the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: I love the LORD, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.
mdText: I love the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) because he hath heard my voice _and_ my supplications.

verseText: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me, therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.
mdText: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me, therefore will I call upon _him_ as long as I live.

verseText: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the pains of hell gat hold upon me: I found trouble and sorrow.
mdText: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the pains of hell gat hold upon me: I found trouble and sorrow.

verseText: Then called I upon the name of the LORD; O LORD, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.
mdText: Then called I upon the name of the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

verseText: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yea, our God is merciful.
mdText: Gracious _is_ the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and righteous; yea, our [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ merciful.

verseText: The LORD preserveth the simple: I was brought low, and he helped me.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) preserveth the simple: I was brought low, and he helped me.

verseText: Return unto thy rest, O my soul; for the LORD hath dealt bountifully with thee.
mdText: Return unto thy rest, O my soul; for the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath dealt bountifully with thee.

verseText: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
mdText: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, _and_ my feet from falling.

verseText: I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.
mdText: I will walk before the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) in the land of the living.

verseText: I believed, therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:
mdText: I believed, therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:

verseText: I said in my haste, All men are liars.
mdText: I said in my haste, All men _are_ liars.

verseText: What shall I render unto the LORD for all his benefits toward me?
mdText: What shall I render unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _for_ all his benefits toward me?

verseText: I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the LORD.
mdText: I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people.
mdText: I will pay my vows unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) now in the presence of all his people.

verseText: Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.
mdText: Precious in the sight of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the death of his saints.

verseText: O LORD, truly I am thy servant; I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid: thou hast loosed my bonds.
mdText: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) truly I _am_ thy servant; I _am_ thy servant, _and_ the son of thine handmaid: thou hast loosed my bonds.

verseText: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the LORD.
mdText: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: I will pay my vows unto the LORD now in the presence of all his people,
mdText: I will pay my vows unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) now in the presence of all his people,

verseText: In the courts of the LORD’S house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: In the courts of the [LORD’S]([/person/god_1324) house, in the midst of thee, O [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636) Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: O praise the LORD, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.
mdText: O praise the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.

verseText: For his merciful kindness is great toward us: and the truth of the LORD endureth for ever. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: For his merciful kindness is great toward us: and the truth of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _endureth_ for ever. Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: O give thanks unto the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for _he_ _is_ good: because his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: Let Israel now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: Let Israel now say, that his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: Let the house of [Aaron]([/person/aaron_1) now say, that his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: Let them now that fear the LORD say, that his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: Let them now that fear the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) say, that his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: I called upon the LORD in distress: the LORD answered me, and set me in a large place.
mdText: I called upon the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) in distress: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) answered me, _and_ _set_ _me_ in a large place.

verseText: The LORD is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?

verseText: The LORD taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see _my_ _desire_ upon them that hate me.

verseText: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.
mdText: _It_ _is_ better to trust in the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) than to put confidence in man.

verseText: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.
mdText: _It_ _is_ better to trust in the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) than to put confidence in princes.

verseText: All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD will I destroy them.
mdText: All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will I destroy them.

verseText: They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
mdText: They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) I will destroy them.

verseText: They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
mdText: They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) I will destroy them.

verseText: Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the LORD helped me.
mdText: Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) helped me.

verseText: The LORD is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ my strength and song, and is become my salvation.

verseText: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
mdText: The voice of rejoicing and salvation _is_ in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) doeth valiantly.

verseText: The right hand of the LORD is exalted: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
mdText: The right hand of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) is exalted: the right hand of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) doeth valiantly.

verseText: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.
mdText: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: The LORD hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.

verseText: Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, and I will praise the LORD:
mdText: Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, _and_ I will praise the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: This gate of the LORD, into which the righteous shall enter.
mdText: This gate of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) into which the righteous shall enter.

verseText: I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.
mdText: I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.

verseText: The stone which the builders refused is become the head stone of the corner.
mdText: The stone _which_ the builders refused is become the head _stone_ of the corner.

verseText: This is the LORD’S doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.
mdText: This is the [LORD’S]([/person/god_1324) doing; it _is_ marvellous in our eyes.

verseText: This is the day which the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
mdText: This _is_ the day _which_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

verseText: Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD: O LORD, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.
mdText: Save now, I beseech thee, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) I beseech thee, send now prosperity.

verseText: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the LORD: we have blessed you out of the house of the LORD.
mdText: Blessed _be_ he that cometh in the name of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) we have blessed you out of the house of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: God is the LORD, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, _even_ unto the horns of the altar.

verseText: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.
mdText: Thou _art_ my [God,]([/person/god_1324) and I will praise thee: _thou_ _art_ my [God,]([/person/god_1324) I will exalt thee.

verseText: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: O give thanks unto the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for _he_ _is_ good: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: ALEPH. Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the LORD.
mdText: Blessed _are_ the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.
mdText: Blessed _are_ they that keep his testimonies, _and_ _that_ seek him with the whole heart.

verseText: They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.
mdText: They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.

verseText: Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.
mdText: Thou hast commanded _us_ to keep thy precepts diligently.

verseText: O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!
mdText: O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!

verseText: Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.
mdText: Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.

verseText: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.
mdText: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.

verseText: I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.
mdText: I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.

verseText: BETH. Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to thy word.
mdText: Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed _thereto_ according to thy word.

verseText: With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.
mdText: With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.

verseText: Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.
mdText: Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.

verseText: Blessed art thou, O LORD: teach me thy statutes.
mdText: Blessed _art_ thou, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) teach me thy statutes.

verseText: With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.
mdText: With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.

verseText: I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as much as in all riches.
mdText: I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as _much_ _as_ in all riches.

verseText: I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect unto thy ways.
mdText: I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect unto thy ways.

verseText: I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.
mdText: I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.

verseText: GIMEL. Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.
mdText: Deal bountifully with thy servant, _that_ I may live, and keep thy word.

verseText: Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.
mdText: Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.

verseText: I am a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.
mdText: I _am_ a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.

verseText: My soul breaketh for the longing that it hath unto thy judgments at all times.
mdText: My soul breaketh for the longing _that_ _it_ _hath_ unto thy judgments at all times.

verseText: Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed, which do err from thy commandments.
mdText: Thou hast rebuked the proud _that_ _are_ cursed, which do err from thy commandments.

verseText: Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.
mdText: Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.

verseText: Princes also did sit and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.
mdText: Princes also did sit _and_ speak against me: _but_ thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.

verseText: Thy testimonies also are my delight and my counsellors.
mdText: Thy testimonies also _are_ my delight _and_ my counsellors.

verseText: DALETH. My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me according to thy word.
mdText: My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me according to thy word.

verseText: I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.
mdText: I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.

verseText: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.
mdText: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

verseText: My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.
mdText: My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.

verseText: Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.
mdText: Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.

verseText: I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid before me.
mdText: I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid _before_ _me._

verseText: I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O LORD, put me not to shame.
mdText: I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) put me not to shame.

verseText: I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.
mdText: I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.

verseText: HE. Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it unto the end.
mdText: Teach me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it _unto_ the end.

verseText: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.
mdText: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with _my_ whole heart.

verseText: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.
mdText: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.

verseText: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.
mdText: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.

verseText: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; and quicken thou me in thy way.
mdText: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; _and_ quicken thou me in thy way.

verseText: Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.
mdText: Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who _is_ _devoted_ to thy fear.

verseText: Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments are good.
mdText: Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments _are_ good.

verseText: Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.
mdText: Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.

verseText: VAU. Let thy mercies come also unto me, O LORD, even thy salvation, according to thy word.
mdText: Let thy mercies come also unto me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _even_ thy salvation, according to thy word.

verseText: So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.
mdText: So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.

verseText: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.
mdText: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.

verseText: So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.
mdText: So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.

verseText: And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.
mdText: And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.

verseText: I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.
mdText: I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.

verseText: And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.
mdText: And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.

verseText: My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.
mdText: My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.

verseText: ZAIN. Remember the word unto thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.
mdText: Remember the word unto thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.

verseText: This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.
mdText: This _is_ my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.

verseText: The proud have had me greatly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy law.
mdText: The proud have had me greatly in derision: _yet_ have I not declined from thy law.

verseText: I remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD; and have comforted myself.
mdText: I remembered thy judgments of old, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and have comforted myself.

verseText: Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.
mdText: Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

verseText: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.
mdText: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.

verseText: I have remembered thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have kept thy law.
mdText: I have remembered thy name, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) in the night, and have kept thy law.

verseText: This I had, because I kept thy precepts.
mdText: This I had, because I kept thy precepts.

verseText: CHETH. Thou art my portion, O LORD: I have said that I would keep thy words.
mdText: _Thou_ _art_ my portion, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) I have said that I would keep thy words.

verseText: I intreated thy favour with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.
mdText: I intreated thy favour with _my_ whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.

verseText: I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.
mdText: I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

verseText: I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.
mdText: I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.

verseText: The bands of the wicked have robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy law.
mdText: The bands of the wicked have robbed me: _but_ I have not forgotten thy law.

verseText: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.
mdText: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.

verseText: I am a companion of all them that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.
mdText: I _am_ a companion of all _them_ that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.

verseText: The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.
mdText: The earth, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.

verseText: TETH. Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O LORD, according unto thy word.
mdText: Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) according unto thy word.

verseText: Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.
mdText: Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.

verseText: Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.
mdText: Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.

verseText: Thou art good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.
mdText: Thou _art_ good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.

verseText: The proud have forged a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.
mdText: The proud have forged a lie against me: _but_ I will keep thy precepts with _my_ whole heart.

verseText: Their heart is as fat as grease; but I delight in thy law.
mdText: Their heart is as fat as grease; _but_ I delight in thy law.

verseText: It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.
mdText: _It_ _is_ good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.

verseText: The law of thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.
mdText: The law of thy mouth _is_ better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.

verseText: JOD. Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.
mdText: Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

verseText: They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.
mdText: They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.

verseText: I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.
mdText: I know, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) that thy judgments _are_ right, and _that_ thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.

verseText: Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.
mdText: Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.

verseText: Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law is my delight.
mdText: Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law _is_ my delight.

verseText: Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: but I will meditate in thy precepts.
mdText: Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: _but_ I will meditate in thy precepts.

verseText: Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have known thy testimonies.
mdText: Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have known thy testimonies.

verseText: Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.
mdText: Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.

verseText: CAPH. My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.
mdText: My soul fainteth for thy salvation: _but_ I hope in thy word.

verseText: Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?
mdText: Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?

verseText: For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; yet do I not forget thy statutes.
mdText: For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; _yet_ do I not forget thy statutes.

verseText: How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?
mdText: How many _are_ the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

verseText: The proud have digged pits for me, which are not after thy law.
mdText: The proud have digged pits for me, which _are_ not after thy law.

verseText: All thy commandments are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.
mdText: All thy commandments _are_ faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.

verseText: They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.
mdText: They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.

verseText: Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.
mdText: Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.

verseText: LAMED. For ever, O LORD, thy word is settled in heaven.
mdText: For ever, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) thy word is settled in heaven.

verseText: Thy faithfulness is unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.
mdText: Thy faithfulness _is_ unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.

verseText: They continue this day according to thine ordinances: for all are thy servants.
mdText: They continue this day according to thine ordinances: for all _are_ thy servants.

verseText: Unless thy law had been my delights, I should then have perished in mine affliction.
mdText: Unless thy law _had_ _been_ my delights, I should then have perished in mine affliction.

verseText: I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast quickened me.
mdText: I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast quickened me.

verseText: I am thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.
mdText: I _am_ thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.

verseText: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.
mdText: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: _but_ I will consider thy testimonies.

verseText: I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.
mdText: I have seen an end of all perfection: _but_ thy commandment _is_ exceeding broad.

verseText: MEM. O how love I thy law! it is my meditation all the day.
mdText: O how love I thy law! it _is_ my meditation all the day.

verseText: Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.
mdText: Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they _are_ ever with me.

verseText: I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.
mdText: I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies _are_ my meditation.

verseText: I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.
mdText: I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.

verseText: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.
mdText: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.

verseText: I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.
mdText: I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.

verseText: How sweet are thy words unto my taste! yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
mdText: How sweet are thy words unto my taste! _yea,_ _sweeter_ than honey to my mouth!

verseText: Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.
mdText: Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.

verseText: NUN. Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
mdText: Thy word _is_ a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

verseText: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.
mdText: I have sworn, and I will perform _it,_ that I will keep thy righteous judgments.

verseText: I am afflicted very much: quicken me, O LORD, according unto thy word.
mdText: I am afflicted very much: quicken me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) according unto thy word.

verseText: Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O LORD, and teach me thy judgments.
mdText: Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and teach me thy judgments.

verseText: My soul is continually in my hand: yet do I not forget thy law.
mdText: My soul _is_ continually in my hand: yet do I not forget thy law.

verseText: The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.
mdText: The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.

verseText: Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
mdText: Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they _are_ the rejoicing of my heart.

verseText: I have inclined mine heart to perform thy statutes alway, even unto the end.
mdText: I have inclined mine heart to perform thy statutes alway, _even_ _unto_ the end.

verseText: SAMECH. I hate vain thoughts: but thy law do I love.
mdText: I hate _vain_ thoughts: but thy law do I love.

verseText: Thou art my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.
mdText: Thou _art_ my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.

verseText: Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.
mdText: Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.
mdText: Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.

verseText: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.
mdText: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.

verseText: Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit is falsehood.
mdText: Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit _is_ falsehood.

verseText: Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.
mdText: Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth _like_ dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.

verseText: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.
mdText: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.

verseText: AIN. I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.
mdText: I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.

verseText: Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.
mdText: Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.

verseText: Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.
mdText: Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.

verseText: Deal with thy servant according unto thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.
mdText: Deal with thy servant according unto thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.

verseText: I am thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.
mdText: I _am_ thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.

verseText: It is time for thee, LORD, to work: for they have made void thy law.
mdText: _It_ _is_ time for _thee,_ [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) to work: _for_ they have made void thy law.

verseText: Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold.
mdText: Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold.

verseText: Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right; and I hate every false way.
mdText: Therefore I esteem all _thy_ precepts _concerning_ all _things_ _to_ _be_ right; _and_ I hate every false way.

verseText: PE. Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.
mdText: Thy testimonies _are_ wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.

verseText: The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.
mdText: The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.

verseText: I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.
mdText: I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.

verseText: Look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.
mdText: Look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.

verseText: Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
mdText: Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

verseText: Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.
mdText: Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.

verseText: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy statutes.
mdText: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy statutes.

verseText: Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.
mdText: Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.

verseText: TZADDI. Righteous art thou, O LORD, and upright are thy judgments.
mdText: Righteous _art_ thou, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and upright _are_ thy judgments.

verseText: Thy testimonies that thou hast commanded are righteous and very faithful.
mdText: Thy testimonies _that_ thou hast commanded _are_ righteous and very faithful.

verseText: My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.
mdText: My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.

verseText: Thy word is very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.
mdText: Thy word _is_ very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.

verseText: I am small and despised: yet do not I forget thy precepts.
mdText: I _am_ small and despised: _yet_ do not I forget thy precepts.

verseText: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is the truth.
mdText: Thy righteousness _is_ an everlasting righteousness, and thy law _is_ the truth.

verseText: Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: yet thy commandments are my delights.
mdText: Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: _yet_ thy commandments _are_ my delights.
