verseText: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.
mdText: The righteousness of thy testimonies _is_ everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.

verseText: KOPH. I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O LORD: I will keep thy statutes.
mdText: I cried with _my_ whole heart; hear me, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) I will keep thy statutes.

verseText: I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.
mdText: I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

verseText: I prevented the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.
mdText: I prevented the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.

verseText: Mine eyes prevent the night watches, that I might meditate in thy word.
mdText: Mine eyes prevent the _night_ watches, that I might meditate in thy word.

verseText: Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O LORD, quicken me according to thy judgment.
mdText: Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) quicken me according to thy judgment.

verseText: They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.
mdText: They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.

verseText: Thou art near, O LORD; and all thy commandments are truth.
mdText: Thou _art_ near, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and all thy commandments _are_ truth.

verseText: Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.
mdText: Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.

verseText: RESH. Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.
mdText: Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.

verseText: Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.
mdText: Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.

verseText: Salvation is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.
mdText: Salvation _is_ far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.

verseText: Great are thy tender mercies, O LORD: quicken me according to thy judgments.
mdText: Great _are_ thy tender mercies, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) quicken me according to thy judgments.

verseText: Many are my persecutors and mine enemies; yet do I not decline from thy testimonies.
mdText: Many _are_ my persecutors and mine enemies; _yet_ do I not decline from thy testimonies.

verseText: I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.
mdText: I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.

verseText: Consider how I love thy precepts: quicken me, O LORD, according to thy lovingkindness.
mdText: Consider how I love thy precepts: quicken me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) according to thy lovingkindness.

verseText: Thy word is true from the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments endureth for ever.
mdText: Thy word _is_ true _from_ the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: SCHIN. Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.
mdText: Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

verseText: I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.
mdText: I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.

verseText: I hate and abhor lying: but thy law do I love.
mdText: I hate and abhor lying: _but_ thy law do I love.

verseText: Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.
mdText: Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.

verseText: Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.
mdText: Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.

verseText: LORD, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.

verseText: My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.
mdText: My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.

verseText: I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways are before thee.
mdText: I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways _are_ before thee.

verseText: TAU. Let my cry come near before thee, O LORD: give me understanding according to thy word.
mdText: Let my cry come near before thee, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) give me understanding according to thy word.

verseText: Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.
mdText: Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.

verseText: My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.
mdText: My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

verseText: My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteousness.
mdText: My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments _are_ righteousness.

verseText: Let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.
mdText: Let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.

verseText: I have longed for thy salvation, O LORD; and thy law is my delight.
mdText: I have longed for thy salvation, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and thy law _is_ my delight.

verseText: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.
mdText: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.

verseText: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.
mdText: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.

verseText: In my distress I cried unto the LORD, and he heard me.
mdText: In my distress I cried unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and he heard me.

verseText: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.
mdText: Deliver my soul, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) from lying lips, _and_ from a deceitful tongue.

verseText: What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?
mdText: What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?

verseText: Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.
mdText: Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.

verseText: Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!
mdText: Woe is me, that I sojourn in [Mesech,]([/person/meshech_2012) _that_ I dwell in the tents of [Kedar!]([/person/kedar_1769)

verseText: My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.
mdText: My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.

verseText: I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for war.
mdText: I _am_ _for_ peace: but when I speak, they _are_ for war.

verseText: I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.
mdText: I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.

verseText: My help cometh from the LORD, which made heaven and earth.
mdText: My help _cometh_ from the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) which made heaven and earth.

verseText: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee will not slumber.
mdText: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee will not slumber.

verseText: Behold, he that keepeth Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.
mdText: Behold, he that keepeth Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.

verseText: The LORD is thy keeper: the LORD is thy shade upon thy right hand.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ thy keeper: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ thy shade upon thy right hand.

verseText: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
mdText: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

verseText: The LORD shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.

verseText: The LORD shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.

verseText: I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of the LORD.
mdText: I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Our feet shall stand within thy gates, O Jerusalem.
mdText: Our feet shall stand within thy gates, O [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: Jerusalem is builded as a city that is compact together:
mdText: [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) is builded as a city that is compact together:

verseText: Whither the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, unto the testimony of Israel, to give thanks unto the name of the LORD.
mdText: Whither the tribes go up, the tribes of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) unto the testimony of Israel, to give thanks unto the name of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
mdText: For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of [David.]([/person/david_994)

verseText: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper that love thee.
mdText: Pray for the peace of [Jerusalem:](/place/jerusalem_636) they shall prosper that love thee.

verseText: Peace be within thy walls, and prosperity within thy palaces.
mdText: Peace be within thy walls, _and_ prosperity within thy palaces.

verseText: For my brethren and companions’ sakes, I will now say, Peace be within thee.
mdText: For my brethren and companions’ sakes, I will now say, Peace _be_ within thee.

verseText: Because of the house of the LORD our God I will seek thy good.
mdText: Because of the house of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God]([/person/god_1324) I will seek thy good.

verseText: Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.
mdText: Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

verseText: Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God, until that he have mercy upon us.
mdText: Behold, as the eyes of servants _look_ unto the hand of their masters, _and_ as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; so our eyes _wait_ upon the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) our [God,]([/person/god_1324) until that he have mercy upon us.

verseText: Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us: for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.
mdText: Have mercy upon us, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) have mercy upon us: for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.

verseText: Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud.
mdText: Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, _and_ with the contempt of the proud.

verseText: If it had not been the LORD who was on our side, now may Israel say;
mdText: If _it_ _had_ _not_ _been_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) who was on our side, now may Israel say;

verseText: If it had not been the LORD who was on our side, when men rose up against us:
mdText: If _it_ _had_ _not_ _been_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) who was on our side, when men rose up against us:

verseText: Then they had swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us:
mdText: Then they had swallowed us up quick, when their wrath was kindled against us:

verseText: Then the waters had overwhelmed us, the stream had gone over our soul:
mdText: Then the waters had overwhelmed us, the stream had gone over our soul:

verseText: Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.
mdText: Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.

verseText: Blessed be the LORD, who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth.
mdText: Blessed _be_ the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) who hath not given us _as_ a prey to their teeth.

verseText: Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we are escaped.
mdText: Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers: the snare is broken, and we are escaped.

verseText: Our help is in the name of the LORD, who made heaven and earth.
mdText: Our help _is_ in the name of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) who made heaven and earth.

verseText: They that trust in the LORD shall be as mount Zion, which cannot be removed, but abideth for ever.
mdText: They that trust in the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _shall_ _be_ as mount [Zion,](/place/mount_zion_860) _which_ cannot be removed, _but_ abideth for ever.

verseText: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the LORD is round about his people from henceforth even for ever.
mdText: As the mountains _are_ round about [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) so the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ round about his people from henceforth even for ever.

verseText: For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity.
mdText: For the rod of the wicked shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; lest the righteous put forth their hands unto iniquity.

verseText: Do good, O LORD, unto those that be good, and to them that are upright in their hearts.
mdText: Do good, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) unto _those_ _that_ _be_ good, and _to_ _them_ _that_ _are_ upright in their hearts.

verseText: As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the LORD shall lead them forth with the workers of iniquity: but peace shall be upon Israel.
mdText: As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall lead them forth with the workers of iniquity: _but_ peace _shall_ _be_ upon Israel.

verseText: When the LORD turned again the captivity of Zion, we were like them that dream.
mdText: When the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) turned again the captivity of [Zion,](/place/zion_1263) we were like them that dream.

verseText: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing: then said they among the heathen, The LORD hath done great things for them.
mdText: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing: then said they among the heathen, The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath done great things for them.

verseText: The LORD hath done great things for us; whereof we are glad.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath done great things for us; _whereof_ we are glad.

verseText: Turn again our captivity, O LORD, as the streams in the south.
mdText: Turn again our captivity, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) as the streams in the [south.](/place/negeb_885)

verseText: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.
mdText: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.

verseText: He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves with him.
mdText: He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing precious seed, shall doubtless come again with rejoicing, bringing his sheaves _with_ _him._

verseText: Except the LORD build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the LORD keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.
mdText: Except the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) keep the city, the watchman waketh _but_ in vain.

verseText: It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.
mdText: _It_ _is_ vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: _for_ so he giveth his beloved sleep.

verseText: Lo, children are an heritage of the LORD: and the fruit of the womb is his reward.
mdText: Lo, children _are_ an heritage of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) _and_ the fruit of the womb _is_ _his_ reward.

verseText: As arrows are in the hand of a mighty man; so are children of the youth.
mdText: As arrows _are_ in the hand of a mighty man; so _are_ children of the youth.

verseText: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.
mdText: Happy _is_ the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.

verseText: Blessed is every one that feareth the LORD; that walketh in his ways.
mdText: Blessed _is_ every one that feareth the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) that walketh in his ways.

verseText: For thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.
mdText: For thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happy _shalt_ thou _be,_ and _it_ _shall_ _be_ well with thee.

verseText: Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of thine house: thy children like olive plants round about thy table.
mdText: Thy wife _shall_ _be_ as a fruitful vine by the sides of thine house: thy children like olive plants round about thy table.

verseText: Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the LORD.
mdText: Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: The LORD shall bless thee out of Zion: and thou shalt see the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall bless thee out of [Zion:](/place/zion_1263) and thou shalt see the good of [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) all the days of thy life.

verseText: Yea, thou shalt see thy children’s children, and peace upon Israel.
mdText: Yea, thou shalt see thy children’s children, _and_ peace upon Israel.

verseText: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:
mdText: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:

verseText: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they have not prevailed against me.
mdText: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they have not prevailed against me.

verseText: The plowers plowed upon my back: they made long their furrows.
mdText: The plowers plowed upon my back: they made long their furrows.

verseText: The LORD is righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.

verseText: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.
mdText: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate [Zion.](/place/zion_1263)

verseText: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up:
mdText: Let them be as the grass _upon_ the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up:

verseText: Wherewith the mower filleth not his hand; nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom.
mdText: Wherewith the mower filleth not his hand; nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom.

verseText: Neither do they which go by say, The blessing of the LORD be upon you: we bless you in the name of the LORD.
mdText: Neither do they which go by say, The blessing of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _be_ upon you: we bless you in the name of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O LORD.
mdText: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
mdText: [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

verseText: If thou, LORD, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?
mdText: If thou, [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) shouldest mark iniquities, O [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) who shall stand?

verseText: But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.
mdText: But _there_ _is_ forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.

verseText: I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
mdText: I wait for the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.

verseText: My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.
mdText: My soul _waiteth_ for the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) more than they that watch for the morning: _I_ _say,_ _more_ _than_ they that watch for the morning.

verseText: Let Israel hope in the LORD: for with the LORD there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.
mdText: Let Israel hope in the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) for with the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _there_ _is_ mercy, and with him _is_ plenteous redemption.

verseText: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
mdText: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.

verseText: LORD, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty: neither do I exercise myself in great matters, or in things too high for me.
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty: neither do I exercise myself in great matters, or in things too high for me.

verseText: Surely I have behaved and quieted myself, as a child that is weaned of his mother: my soul is even as a weaned child.
mdText: Surely I have behaved and quieted myself, as a child that is weaned of his mother: my soul _is_ even as a weaned child.

verseText: Let Israel hope in the LORD from henceforth and for ever.
mdText: Let Israel hope in the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) from henceforth and for ever.

verseText: A Song of degrees. LORD, remember David, and all his afflictions:
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) remember [David,]([/person/david_994) _and_ all his afflictions:

verseText: How he sware unto the LORD, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;
mdText: How he sware unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _and_ vowed unto the mighty _[God]([/person/god_1324)_ of [Jacob;]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;
mdText: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;

verseText: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,
mdText: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, _or_ slumber to mine eyelids,

verseText: Until I find out a place for the LORD, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.
mdText: Until I find out a place for the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) an habitation for the mighty _[God]([/person/god_1324)_ of [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.
mdText: Lo, we heard of it at [Ephratah:]([/person/ephratah_1207) we found it in the fields of the [wood.](/place/jaar_608)

verseText: We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.
mdText: We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.

verseText: Arise, O LORD, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.
mdText: Arise, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.

verseText: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.
mdText: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.

verseText: For thy servant David’s sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.
mdText: For thy servant [David’s]([/person/david_994) sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.

verseText: The LORD hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath sworn _in_ truth unto [David;]([/person/david_994) he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.

verseText: If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.
mdText: If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.

verseText: For the LORD hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath chosen [Zion;](/place/zion_1263) he hath desired _it_ for his habitation.

verseText: This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.
mdText: This _is_ my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.

verseText: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.
mdText: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.

verseText: I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
mdText: I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

verseText: There will I make the horn of David to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.
mdText: There will I make the horn of [David]([/person/david_994) to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.

verseText: His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.
mdText: His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.

verseText: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!
mdText: Behold, how good and how pleasant _it_ _is_ for brethren to dwell together in unity!

verseText: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard, even Aaron’s beard: that went down to the skirts of his garments;
mdText: _It_ _is_ like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard, _even_ [Aaron’s]([/person/aaron_1) beard: that went down to the skirts of his garments;

verseText: As the dew of Hermon, and as the dew that descended upon the mountains of Zion: for there the LORD commanded the blessing, even life for evermore.
mdText: As the dew of [Hermon,](/place/hermon_564) _and_ _as_ _the_ _dew_ that descended upon the mountains of [Zion:](/place/zion_1263) for there the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) commanded the blessing, _even_ life for evermore.

verseText: Behold, bless ye the LORD, all ye servants of the LORD, which by night stand in the house of the LORD.
mdText: Behold, bless ye the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) all _ye_ servants of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) which by night stand in the house of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the LORD.
mdText: Lift up your hands _in_ the sanctuary, and bless the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: The LORD that made heaven and earth bless thee out of Zion.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) that made heaven and earth bless thee out of [Zion.](/place/zion_1263)

verseText: Praise ye the LORD. Praise ye the name of the LORD; praise him, O ye servants of the LORD.
mdText: Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) Praise ye the name of the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) praise _him,_ O ye servants of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Ye that stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God,
mdText: Ye that stand in the house of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) in the courts of the house of our [God,]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Praise the LORD; for the LORD is good: sing praises unto his name; for it is pleasant.
mdText: Praise the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ good: sing praises unto his name; for _it_ _is_ pleasant.

verseText: For the LORD hath chosen Jacob unto himself, and Israel for his peculiar treasure.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hath chosen [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) unto himself, _and_ Israel for his peculiar treasure.

verseText: For I know that the LORD is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.
mdText: For I know that the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ great, and _that_ our [Lord]([/person/god_1324) _is_ above all gods.

verseText: Whatsoever the LORD pleased, that did he in heaven, and in earth, in the seas, and all deep places.
mdText: Whatsoever the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) pleased, _that_ did he in heaven, and in earth, in the seas, and all deep places.

verseText: He causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain; he bringeth the wind out of his treasuries.
mdText: He causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain; he bringeth the wind out of his treasuries.

verseText: Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast.
mdText: Who smote the firstborn of [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) both of man and beast.

verseText: Who sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.
mdText: _Who_ sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) upon [Pharaoh,]([/person/pharaoh_2331) and upon all his servants.

verseText: Who smote great nations, and slew mighty kings;
mdText: Who smote great nations, and slew mighty kings;

verseText: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan:
mdText: [Sihon]([/person/sihon_2739) king of the Amorites, and [Og]([/person/og_2238) king of [Bashan,](/place/bashan_159) and all the kingdoms of [Canaan:]([/person/canaan_914)

verseText: And gave their land for an heritage, an heritage unto Israel his people.
mdText: And gave their land _for_ an heritage, an heritage unto Israel his people.

verseText: Thy name, O LORD, endureth for ever; and thy memorial, O LORD, throughout all generations.
mdText: Thy name, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _endureth_ for ever; _and_ thy memorial, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) throughout all generations.

verseText: For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.

verseText: The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
mdText: The idols of the heathen _are_ silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

verseText: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;
mdText: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;

verseText: They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouths.
mdText: They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there _any_ breath in their mouths.

verseText: They that make them are like unto them: so is every one that trusteth in them.
mdText: They that make them are like unto them: _so_ _is_ every one that trusteth in them.

verseText: Bless the LORD, O house of Israel: bless the LORD, O house of Aaron:
mdText: Bless the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O house of Israel: bless the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O house of [Aaron:]([/person/aaron_1)

verseText: Bless the LORD, O house of Levi: ye that fear the LORD, bless the LORD.
mdText: Bless the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O house of [Levi:]([/person/levi_1820) ye that fear the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) bless the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Blessed be the LORD out of Zion, which dwelleth at Jerusalem. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: Blessed be the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) out of [Zion,](/place/zion_1263) which dwelleth at [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636) Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: O give thanks unto the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) for _he_ _is_ good: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: O give thanks unto the God of gods: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: O give thanks unto the [God]([/person/god_1324) of gods: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: O give thanks to the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: O give thanks to the [Lord]([/person/god_1324) of lords: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: To him who alone doeth great wonders: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: To him who alone doeth great wonders: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: To him that by wisdom made the heavens: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: To him that by wisdom made the heavens: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: To him that made great lights: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: To him that made great lights: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: The sun to rule by day: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: The sun to rule by day: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: The moon and stars to rule by night: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: The moon and stars to rule by night: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: To him that smote Egypt in their firstborn: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: To him that smote [Egypt](/place/egypt_362) in their firstborn: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: And brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: And brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: With a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: With a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: To him which divided the Red sea into parts: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: To him which divided the [Red](/place/red_sea_986) [sea](/place/red_sea_986) into parts: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red sea: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: But overthrew [Pharaoh]([/person/pharaoh_2331) and his host in the [Red](/place/red_sea_986) [sea:](/place/red_sea_986) for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: To him which led his people through the wilderness: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: To him which led his people through the wilderness: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: To him which smote great kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: To him which smote great kings: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: And slew famous kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: And slew famous kings: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: Sihon king of the Amorites: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: [Sihon]([/person/sihon_2739) king of the Amorites: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: And Og the king of Bashan: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: And [Og]([/person/og_2238) the king of [Bashan:](/place/bashan_159) for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: And gave their land for an heritage: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: And gave their land for an heritage: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: Even an heritage unto Israel his servant: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: _Even_ an heritage unto Israel his servant: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: Who remembered us in our low estate: for his mercy endureth for ever:
mdText: Who remembered us in our low estate: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever:

verseText: And hath redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: And hath redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: Who giveth food to all flesh: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: Who giveth food to all flesh: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: O give thanks unto the God of heaven: for his mercy endureth for ever.
mdText: O give thanks unto the [God]([/person/god_1324) of heaven: for his mercy _endureth_ for ever.

verseText: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
mdText: By the rivers of [Babylon,](/place/babylon_151) there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered [Zion.](/place/zion_1263)

verseText: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
mdText: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.

verseText: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
mdText: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us _required_ _of_ _us_ mirth, _saying,_ Sing us _one_ of the songs of [Zion.](/place/zion_1263)

verseText: How shall we sing the LORD’S song in a strange land?
mdText: How shall we sing the [LORD’S]([/person/god_1324) song in a strange land?

verseText: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.
mdText: If I forget thee, O [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) let my right hand forget _her_ _cunning._

verseText: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
mdText: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) above my chief joy.

verseText: Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.
mdText: Remember, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) the children of [Edom]([/person/esau_1216) in the day of [Jerusalem;](/place/jerusalem_636) who said, Rase _it,_ rase _it,_ _even_ to the foundation thereof.

verseText: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.
mdText: O daughter of [Babylon,](/place/babylon_151) who art to be destroyed; happy _shall_ _he_ _be,_ that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.

verseText: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.
mdText: Happy _shall_ _he_ _be,_ that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.

verseText: I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods will I sing praise unto thee.
mdText: I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods will I sing praise unto thee.

verseText: I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.
mdText: I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.

verseText: In the day when I cried thou answeredst me, and strengthenedst me with strength in my soul.
mdText: In the day when I cried thou answeredst me, _and_ strengthenedst me _with_ strength in my soul.

verseText: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O LORD, when they hear the words of thy mouth.
mdText: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) when they hear the words of thy mouth.

verseText: Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the LORD: for great is the glory of the LORD.
mdText: Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) for great _is_ the glory of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Though the LORD be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off.
mdText: Though the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _be_ high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off.

verseText: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
mdText: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.

verseText: The LORD will perfect that which concerneth me: thy mercy, O LORD, endureth for ever: forsake not the works of thine own hands.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will perfect _that_ _which_ concerneth me: thy mercy, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) _endureth_ for ever: forsake not the works of thine own hands.

verseText: O LORD, thou hast searched me, and known me.
mdText: O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) thou hast searched me, and known _me._

verseText: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.
mdText: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

verseText: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.
mdText: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted _with_ all my ways.

verseText: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.
mdText: For _there_ _is_ not a word in my tongue, _but,_ lo, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) thou knowest it altogether.

verseText: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.
mdText: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.

verseText: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.
mdText: _Such_ knowledge _is_ too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot _attain_ unto it.

verseText: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
mdText: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

verseText: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.
mdText: If I ascend up into heaven, thou _art_ there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou _art_ _there._

verseText: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;
mdText: _If_ I take the wings of the morning, _and_ dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

verseText: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
mdText: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

verseText: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.
mdText: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

verseText: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
mdText: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light _are_ both alike _to_ _thee._

verseText: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.
mdText: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.

verseText: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.
mdText: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully _and_ wonderfully made: marvellous _are_ thy works; and _that_ my soul knoweth right well.

verseText: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
mdText: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, _and_ curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

verseText: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.
mdText: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all _my_ _members_ were written, _which_ in continuance were fashioned, when _as_ _yet_ _there_ _was_ none of them.

verseText: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!
mdText: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O [God!]([/person/god_1324) how great is the sum of them!

verseText: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.
mdText: _If_ I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

verseText: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.
mdText: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O [God:]([/person/god_1324) depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

verseText: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
mdText: For they speak against thee wickedly, _and_ thine enemies take _thy_ _name_ in vain.

verseText: Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
mdText: Do not I hate them, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

verseText: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.
mdText: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

verseText: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:
mdText: Search me, O [God,]([/person/god_1324) and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:

verseText: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
mdText: And see if _there_ _be_ _any_ wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

verseText: Deliver me, O LORD, from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;
mdText: Deliver me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;

verseText: Which imagine mischiefs in their heart; continually are they gathered together for war.
mdText: Which imagine mischiefs in _their_ heart; continually are they gathered together _for_ war.

verseText: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders’ poison is under their lips. Selah.
mdText: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders’ poison _is_ under their lips. Selah.

verseText: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.
mdText: Keep me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.

verseText: The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the wayside; they have set gins for me. Selah.
mdText: The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the wayside; they have set gins for me. Selah.

verseText: I said unto the LORD, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O LORD.
mdText: I said unto the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) Thou _art_ my [God:]([/person/god_1324) hear the voice of my supplications, O [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: O GOD the Lord, the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.
mdText: O [GOD]([/person/god_1324) the [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.

verseText: Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked: further not his wicked device; lest they exalt themselves. Selah.
mdText: Grant not, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) the desires of the wicked: further not his wicked device; _lest_ they exalt themselves. Selah.

verseText: As for the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
mdText: _As_ _for_ the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.

verseText: Let burning coals fall upon them: let them be cast into the fire; into deep pits, that they rise not up again.
mdText: Let burning coals fall upon them: let them be cast into the fire; into deep pits, that they rise not up again.

verseText: Let not an evil speaker be established in the earth: evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him.
mdText: Let not an evil speaker be established in the earth: evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow _him._

verseText: I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and the right of the poor.
mdText: I know that the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will maintain the cause of the afflicted, _and_ the right of the poor.

verseText: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name: the upright shall dwell in thy presence.
mdText: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name: the upright shall dwell in thy presence.

verseText: LORD, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.

verseText: Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense; and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
mdText: Let my prayer be set forth before thee _as_ incense; _and_ the lifting up of my hands _as_ the evening sacrifice.

verseText: Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
mdText: Set a watch, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.

verseText: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.
mdText: Incline not my heart to _any_ evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.

verseText: Let the righteous smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him reprove me; it shall be an excellent oil, which shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calamities.
mdText: Let the righteous smite me; _it_ _shall_ _be_ a kindness: and let him reprove me; _it_ _shall_ _be_ an excellent oil, _which_ shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also _shall_ _be_ in their calamities.

verseText: When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.
mdText: When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.

verseText: Our bones are scattered at the grave’s mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.
mdText: Our bones are scattered at the grave’s mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth _wood_ upon the earth.

verseText: But mine eyes are unto thee, O GOD the Lord: in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.
mdText: But mine eyes _are_ unto thee, O [GOD]([/person/god_1324) the [Lord:]([/person/god_1324) in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.

verseText: Keep me from the snares which they have laid for me, and the gins of the workers of iniquity.
mdText: Keep me from the snares _which_ they have laid for me, and the gins of the workers of iniquity.

verseText: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal escape.
mdText: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal escape.

verseText: I cried unto the LORD with my voice; with my voice unto the LORD did I make my supplication.
mdText: I cried unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with my voice; with my voice unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) did I make my supplication.

verseText: I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.
mdText: I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.

verseText: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.
mdText: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.

verseText: I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.
mdText: I looked on _my_ right hand, and beheld, but _there_ _was_ no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.

verseText: I cried unto thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.
mdText: I cried unto thee, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) I said, Thou _art_ my refuge _and_ my portion in the land of the living.

verseText: Attend unto my cry; for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.
mdText: Attend unto my cry; for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.

verseText: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the righteous shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bountifully with me.
mdText: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the righteous shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bountifully with me.

verseText: Hear my prayer, O LORD, give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.
mdText: Hear my prayer, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, _and_ in thy righteousness.

verseText: And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.
mdText: And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.

verseText: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.
mdText: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.

verseText: Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.
mdText: Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.

verseText: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all thy works; I muse on the work of thy hands.
mdText: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all thy works; I muse on the work of thy hands.

verseText: I stretch forth my hands unto thee: my soul thirsteth after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.
mdText: I stretch forth my hands unto thee: my soul _thirsteth_ after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.

verseText: Hear me speedily, O LORD: my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.
mdText: Hear me speedily, O [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

verseText: Cause me to hear thy lovingkindness in the morning; for in thee do I trust: cause me to know the way wherein I should walk; for I lift up my soul unto thee.
mdText: Cause me to hear thy lovingkindness in the morning; for in thee do I trust: cause me to know the way wherein I should walk; for I lift up my soul unto thee.

verseText: Deliver me, O LORD, from mine enemies: I flee unto thee to hide me.
mdText: Deliver me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) from mine enemies: I flee unto thee to hide me.

verseText: Teach me to do thy will; for thou art my God: thy spirit is good; lead me into the land of uprightness.
mdText: Teach me to do thy will; for thou _art_ my [God:]([/person/god_1324) thy spirit _is_ good; lead me into the land of uprightness.

verseText: Quicken me, O LORD, for thy name’s sake: for thy righteousness’ sake bring my soul out of trouble.
mdText: Quicken me, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) for thy name’s sake: for thy righteousness’ sake bring my soul out of trouble.

verseText: And of thy mercy cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them that afflict my soul: for I am thy servant.
mdText: And of thy mercy cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them that afflict my soul: for I _am_ thy servant.

verseText: Blessed be the LORD my strength, which teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight:
mdText: Blessed _be_ the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) my strength, which teacheth my hands to war, _and_ my fingers to fight:

verseText: My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.
mdText: My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and _he_ in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.

verseText: LORD, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him! or the son of man, that thou makest account of him!
mdText: [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) what _is_ man, that thou takest knowledge of him! _or_ the son of man, that thou makest account of him!

verseText: Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passeth away.
mdText: Man is like to vanity: his days _are_ as a shadow that passeth away.

verseText: Bow thy heavens, O LORD, and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
mdText: Bow thy heavens, O [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

verseText: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.
mdText: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.

verseText: Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;
mdText: Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;

verseText: Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
mdText: Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand _is_ a right hand of falsehood.

verseText: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.
mdText: I will sing a new song unto thee, O [God:]([/person/god_1324) upon a psaltery _and_ an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.

verseText: It is he that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth David his servant from the hurtful sword.
mdText: _It_ _is_ _he_ that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth [David]([/person/david_994) his servant from the hurtful sword.

verseText: Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:
mdText: Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand _is_ a right hand of falsehood:

verseText: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace:
mdText: That our sons _may_ _be_ as plants grown up in their youth; _that_ our daughters _may_ _be_ as corner stones, polished _after_ the similitude of a palace:

verseText: That our garners may be full, affording all manner of store: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:
mdText: _That_ our garners _may_ _be_ full, affording all manner of store: _that_ our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:

verseText: That our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no breaking in, nor going out; that there be no complaining in our streets.
mdText: _That_ our oxen _may_ _be_ strong to labour; _that_ _there_ _be_ no breaking in, nor going out; that _there_ _be_ no complaining in our streets.

verseText: Happy is that people, that is in such a case: yea, happy is that people, whose God is the LORD.
mdText: Happy _is_ _that_ people, that is in such a case: _yea,_ happy _is_ _that_ people, whose [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: I will extol thee, my God, O king; and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.
mdText: I will extol thee, my [God,]([/person/god_1324) O king; and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.

verseText: Every day will I bless thee; and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.
mdText: Every day will I bless thee; and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.

verseText: Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.
mdText: Great _is_ the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and greatly to be praised; and his greatness _is_ unsearchable.

verseText: One generation shall praise thy works to another, and shall declare thy mighty acts.
mdText: One generation shall praise thy works to another, and shall declare thy mighty acts.

verseText: I will speak of the glorious honour of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.
mdText: I will speak of the glorious honour of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.

verseText: And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and I will declare thy greatness.
mdText: And _men_ shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and I will declare thy greatness.

verseText: They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness, and shall sing of thy righteousness.
mdText: They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness, and shall sing of thy righteousness.

verseText: The LORD is gracious, and full of compassion; slow to anger, and of great mercy.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ gracious, and full of compassion; slow to anger, and of great mercy.

verseText: The LORD is good to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ good to all: and his tender mercies _are_ over all his works.

verseText: All thy works shall praise thee, O LORD; and thy saints shall bless thee.
mdText: All thy works shall praise thee, O [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) and thy saints shall bless thee.

verseText: They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom, and talk of thy power;
mdText: They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom, and talk of thy power;

verseText: To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, and the glorious majesty of his kingdom.
mdText: To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, and the glorious majesty of his kingdom.

verseText: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion endureth throughout all generations.
mdText: Thy kingdom _is_ an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion _endureth_ throughout all generations.

verseText: The LORD upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that be bowed down.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all _those_ _that_ _be_ bowed down.

verseText: The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their meat in due season.
mdText: The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their meat in due season.

verseText: Thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.
mdText: Thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.

verseText: The LORD is righteous in all his ways, and holy in all his works.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ righteous in all his ways, and holy in all his works.

verseText: The LORD is nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.

verseText: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him: he also will hear their cry, and will save them.
mdText: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him: he also will hear their cry, and will save them.

verseText: The LORD preserveth all them that love him: but all the wicked will he destroy.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) preserveth all them that love him: but all the wicked will he destroy.

verseText: My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD: and let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.
mdText: My mouth shall speak the praise of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) and let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.

verseText: Praise ye the LORD. Praise the LORD, O my soul.
mdText: Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) Praise the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O my soul.

verseText: While I live will I praise the LORD: I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being.
mdText: While I live will I praise the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) I will sing praises unto my [God]([/person/god_1324) while I have any being.

verseText: Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.
mdText: Put not your trust in princes, _nor_ in the son of man, in whom _there_ _is_ no help.

verseText: His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very day his thoughts perish.
mdText: His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very day his thoughts perish.

verseText: Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD his God:
mdText: Happy _is_ _he_ that _hath_ the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) for his help, whose hope _is_ in the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) his [God:]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Which made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that therein is: which keepeth truth for ever:
mdText: Which made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that therein _is:_ which keepeth truth for ever:

verseText: Which executeth judgment for the oppressed: which giveth food to the hungry. The LORD looseth the prisoners:
mdText: Which executeth judgment for the oppressed: which giveth food to the hungry. The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) looseth the prisoners:

verseText: The LORD openeth the eyes of the blind: the LORD raiseth them that are bowed down: the LORD loveth the righteous:
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) openeth _the_ _eyes_ _of_ the blind: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) raiseth them that are bowed down: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) loveth the righteous:

verseText: The LORD preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.

verseText: The LORD shall reign for ever, even thy God, O Zion, unto all generations. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall reign for ever, _even_ thy [God,]([/person/god_1324) O [Zion,](/place/zion_1263) unto all generations. Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Praise ye the LORD: for it is good to sing praises unto our God; for it is pleasant; and praise is comely.
mdText: Praise ye the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) for _it_ _is_ good to sing praises unto our [God;]([/person/god_1324) for _it_ _is_ pleasant; _and_ praise is comely.

verseText: The LORD doth build up Jerusalem: he gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) doth build up [Jerusalem:](/place/jerusalem_636) he gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.

verseText: He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.
mdText: He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

verseText: He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their names.
mdText: He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by _their_ names.

verseText: Great is our Lord, and of great power: his understanding is infinite.
mdText: Great _is_ our [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) and of great power: his understanding _is_ infinite.

verseText: The LORD lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked down to the ground.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked down to the ground.

verseText: Sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God:
mdText: Sing unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our [God:]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.
mdText: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.

verseText: He giveth to the beast his food, and to the young ravens which cry.
mdText: He giveth to the beast his food, _and_ to the young ravens which cry.

verseText: He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.
mdText: He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.

verseText: The LORD taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.

verseText: Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.
mdText: Praise the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) O [Jerusalem;](/place/jerusalem_636) praise thy [God,]([/person/god_1324) O [Zion.](/place/zion_1263)

verseText: For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee.
mdText: For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee.

verseText: He maketh peace in thy borders, and filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.
mdText: He maketh peace _in_ thy borders, _and_ filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.

verseText: He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth: his word runneth very swiftly.
mdText: He sendeth forth his commandment _upon_ earth: his word runneth very swiftly.

verseText: He giveth snow like wool: he scattereth the hoarfrost like ashes.
mdText: He giveth snow like wool: he scattereth the hoarfrost like ashes.

verseText: He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?
mdText: He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?

verseText: He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.
mdText: He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, _and_ the waters flow.

verseText: He sheweth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.
mdText: He sheweth his word unto [Jacob,]([/person/israel_682) his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.

verseText: He hath not dealt so with any nation: and as for his judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: He hath not dealt so with any nation: and _as_ _for_ _his_ judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Praise ye the LORD. Praise ye the LORD from the heavens: praise him in the heights.
mdText: Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) Praise ye the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) from the heavens: praise him in the heights.

verseText: Praise ye him, all his angels: praise ye him, all his hosts.
mdText: Praise ye him, all his angels: praise ye him, all his hosts.

verseText: Praise ye him, sun and moon: praise him, all ye stars of light.
mdText: Praise ye him, sun and moon: praise him, all ye stars of light.

verseText: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that be above the heavens.
mdText: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that _be_ above the heavens.

verseText: Let them praise the name of the LORD: for he commanded, and they were created.
mdText: Let them praise the name of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) for he commanded, and they were created.

verseText: He hath also stablished them for ever and ever: he hath made a decree which shall not pass.
mdText: He hath also stablished them for ever and ever: he hath made a decree which shall not pass.

verseText: Praise the LORD from the earth, ye dragons, and all deeps:
mdText: Praise the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) from the earth, ye dragons, and all deeps:

verseText: Fire, and hail; snow, and vapour; stormy wind fulfilling his word:
mdText: Fire, and hail; snow, and vapour; stormy wind fulfilling his word:

verseText: Mountains, and all hills; fruitful trees, and all cedars:
mdText: Mountains, and all hills; fruitful trees, and all cedars:

verseText: Beasts, and all cattle; creeping things, and flying fowl:
mdText: Beasts, and all cattle; creeping things, and flying fowl:

verseText: Kings of the earth, and all people; princes, and all judges of the earth:
mdText: Kings of the earth, and all people; princes, and all judges of the earth:

verseText: Both young men, and maidens; old men, and children:
mdText: Both young men, and maidens; old men, and children:

verseText: Let them praise the name of the LORD: for his name alone is excellent; his glory is above the earth and heaven.
mdText: Let them praise the name of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) for his name alone is excellent; his glory _is_ above the earth and heaven.

verseText: He also exalteth the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; even of the children of Israel, a people near unto him. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: He also exalteth the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; _even_ of the children of [Israel,]([/person/israel_682) a people near unto him. Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Praise ye the LORD. Sing unto the LORD a new song, and his praise in the congregation of saints.
mdText: Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) Sing unto the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) a new song, _and_ his praise in the congregation of saints.

verseText: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
mdText: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of [Zion](/place/zion_1263) be joyful in their King.

verseText: Let them praise his name in the dance: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.
mdText: Let them praise his name in the dance: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.

verseText: For the LORD taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.

verseText: Let the saints be joyful in glory: let them sing aloud upon their beds.
mdText: Let the saints be joyful in glory: let them sing aloud upon their beds.

verseText: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a twoedged sword in their hand;
mdText: _Let_ the high _praises_ of [God]([/person/god_1324) _be_ in their mouth, and a twoedged sword in their hand;

verseText: To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and punishments upon the people;
mdText: To execute vengeance upon the heathen, _and_ punishments upon the people;

verseText: To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;
mdText: To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;

verseText: To execute upon them the judgment written: this honour have all his saints. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: To execute upon them the judgment written: this honour have all his saints. Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Praise ye the LORD. Praise God in his sanctuary: praise him in the firmament of his power.
mdText: Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) Praise [God]([/person/god_1324) in his sanctuary: praise him in the firmament of his power.

verseText: Praise him for his mighty acts: praise him according to his excellent greatness.
mdText: Praise him for his mighty acts: praise him according to his excellent greatness.

verseText: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet: praise him with the psaltery and harp.
mdText: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet: praise him with the psaltery and harp.

verseText: Praise him with the timbrel and dance: praise him with stringed instruments and organs.
mdText: Praise him with the timbrel and dance: praise him with stringed instruments and organs.

verseText: Praise him upon the loud cymbals: praise him upon the high sounding cymbals.
mdText: Praise him upon the loud cymbals: praise him upon the high sounding cymbals.

verseText: Let every thing that hath breath praise the LORD. Praise ye the LORD.
mdText: Let every thing that hath breath praise the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324) Praise ye the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;
mdText: The proverbs of [Solomon]([/person/solomon_2762) the son of [David,]([/person/david_994) king of Israel;

verseText: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;
mdText: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;

verseText: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;
mdText: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;

verseText: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.
mdText: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.

verseText: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:
mdText: A wise _man_ will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:

verseText: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
mdText: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

verseText: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
mdText: The fear of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the beginning of knowledge: _but_ fools despise wisdom and instruction.

verseText: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
mdText: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

verseText: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.
mdText: For they _shall_ _be_ an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

verseText: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
mdText: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

verseText: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:
mdText: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:

verseText: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:
mdText: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:

verseText: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:
mdText: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

verseText: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:
mdText: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:

verseText: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:
mdText: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:

verseText: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.
mdText: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.

verseText: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.
mdText: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.

verseText: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.
mdText: And they lay wait for their _own_ blood; they lurk privily for their _own_ lives.

verseText: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
mdText: So _are_ the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; _which_ taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

verseText: Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:
mdText: Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:

verseText: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,
mdText: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, _saying,_

verseText: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
mdText: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

verseText: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.
mdText: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

verseText: Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;
mdText: Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;

verseText: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:
mdText: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

verseText: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;
mdText: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

verseText: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.
