mdText: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.

verseText: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:
mdText: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:

verseText: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the LORD:
mdText: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.
mdText: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.

verseText: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
mdText: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

verseText: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
mdText: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.

verseText: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
mdText: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.

verseText: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;
mdText: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

verseText: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;
mdText: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, _and_ apply thine heart to understanding;

verseText: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;
mdText: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, _and_ liftest up thy voice for understanding;

verseText: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;
mdText: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as _for_ hid treasures;

verseText: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.
mdText: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and find the knowledge of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) giveth wisdom: out of his mouth _cometh_ knowledge and understanding.

verseText: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
mdText: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: _he_ _is_ a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

verseText: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.
mdText: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.

verseText: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.
mdText: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; _yea,_ every good path.

verseText: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;
mdText: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;

verseText: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:
mdText: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:

verseText: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;
mdText: To deliver thee from the way of the evil _man,_ from the man that speaketh froward things;

verseText: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
mdText: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

verseText: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;
mdText: Who rejoice to do evil, _and_ delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

verseText: Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:
mdText: Whose ways _are_ crooked, and _they_ froward in their paths:

verseText: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;
mdText: To deliver thee from the strange woman, _even_ from the stranger _which_ flattereth with her words;

verseText: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.
mdText: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.
mdText: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.

verseText: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.
mdText: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

verseText: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.
mdText: That thou mayest walk in the way of good _men,_ and keep the paths of the righteous.

verseText: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
mdText: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

verseText: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
mdText: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.

verseText: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:
mdText: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:

verseText: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.
mdText: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

verseText: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:
mdText: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:

verseText: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
mdText: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of [God]([/person/god_1324) and man.

verseText: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.
mdText: Trust in the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

verseText: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
mdText: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

verseText: Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.
mdText: Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and depart from evil.

verseText: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.
mdText: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

verseText: Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
mdText: Honour the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

verseText: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.
mdText: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.

verseText: My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:
mdText: My son, despise not the chastening of the [LORD;]([/person/god_1324) neither be weary of his correction:

verseText: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.
mdText: For whom the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son _in_ _whom_ he delighteth.

verseText: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.
mdText: Happy _is_ the man _that_ findeth wisdom, and the man _that_ getteth understanding.

verseText: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.
mdText: For the merchandise of it _is_ better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

verseText: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.
mdText: She _is_ more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.

verseText: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.
mdText: Length of days _is_ in her right hand; _and_ in her left hand riches and honour.

verseText: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.
mdText: Her ways _are_ ways of pleasantness, and all her paths _are_ peace.

verseText: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.
mdText: She _is_ a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy _is_ _every_ _one_ that retaineth her.

verseText: The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.

verseText: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.
mdText: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

verseText: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:
mdText: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

verseText: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.
mdText: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

verseText: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.
mdText: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

verseText: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
mdText: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

verseText: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.
mdText: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.

verseText: For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
mdText: For the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.

verseText: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.
mdText: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do _it._

verseText: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.
mdText: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

verseText: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
mdText: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

verseText: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
mdText: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

verseText: Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.
mdText: Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

verseText: For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.
mdText: For the froward _is_ abomination to the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) but his secret _is_ with the righteous.

verseText: The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.
mdText: The curse of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.

verseText: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.
mdText: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

verseText: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
mdText: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.

verseText: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.
mdText: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.

verseText: For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.
mdText: For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.

verseText: For I was my father’s son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
mdText: For I was my father’s son, tender and only _beloved_ in the sight of my mother.

verseText: He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.
mdText: He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.

verseText: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
mdText: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget _it_ not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

verseText: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.
mdText: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.

verseText: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
mdText: Wisdom _is_ the principal thing; _therefore_ get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.

verseText: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.
mdText: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.

verseText: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.
mdText: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.

verseText: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.
mdText: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.

verseText: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.
mdText: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.

verseText: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
mdText: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

verseText: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.
mdText: Take fast hold of instruction; let _her_ not go: keep her; for she _is_ thy life.

verseText: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.
mdText: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil _men._

verseText: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.
mdText: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.

verseText: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.
mdText: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause _some_ to fall.

verseText: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
mdText: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.

verseText: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
mdText: But the path of the just _is_ as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

verseText: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.
mdText: The way of the wicked _is_ as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.

verseText: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.
mdText: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.

verseText: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.
mdText: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.

verseText: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.
mdText: For they _are_ life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.

verseText: Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.
mdText: Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it _are_ the issues of life.

verseText: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.
mdText: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.

verseText: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
mdText: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

verseText: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.
mdText: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.

verseText: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.
mdText: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.

verseText: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:
mdText: My son, attend unto my wisdom, _and_ bow thine ear to my understanding:

verseText: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.
mdText: That thou mayest regard discretion, and _that_ thy lips may keep knowledge.

verseText: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:
mdText: For the lips of a strange woman drop _as_ an honeycomb, and her mouth _is_ smoother than oil:

verseText: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.
mdText: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.

verseText: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.
mdText: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

verseText: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.
mdText: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, _that_ thou canst not know _them._

verseText: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
mdText: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

verseText: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:
mdText: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

verseText: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:
mdText: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:

verseText: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;
mdText: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours _be_ in the house of a stranger;

verseText: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
mdText: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

verseText: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;
mdText: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

verseText: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
mdText: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

verseText: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.
mdText: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

verseText: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
mdText: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

verseText: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.
mdText: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, _and_ rivers of waters in the streets.

verseText: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.
mdText: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.

verseText: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
mdText: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.

verseText: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.
mdText: _Let_ _her_ _be_ _as_ the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.

verseText: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
mdText: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

verseText: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings.
mdText: For the ways of man _are_ before the eyes of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) and he pondereth all his goings.

verseText: His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.
mdText: His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.

verseText: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
mdText: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.

verseText: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,
mdText: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, _if_ thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,

verseText: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
mdText: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.

verseText: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.
mdText: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.

verseText: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.
mdText: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.

verseText: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
mdText: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand _of_ _the_ _hunter,_ and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

verseText: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:
mdText: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

verseText: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,
mdText: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,

verseText: Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
mdText: Provideth her meat in the summer, _and_ gathereth her food in the harvest.

verseText: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
mdText: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

verseText: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
mdText: _Yet_ a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

verseText: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.
mdText: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.

verseText: A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.
mdText: A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.

verseText: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;
mdText: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;

verseText: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.
mdText: Frowardness _is_ in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.

verseText: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.
mdText: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.

verseText: These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:
mdText: These six _things_ doth the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) hate: yea, seven _are_ an abomination unto him:

verseText: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,
mdText: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

verseText: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,
mdText: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,

verseText: A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.
mdText: A false witness _that_ speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.

verseText: My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
mdText: My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

verseText: Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.
mdText: Bind them continually upon thine heart, _and_ tie them about thy neck.

verseText: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
mdText: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and _when_ thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

verseText: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
mdText: For the commandment _is_ a lamp; and the law _is_ light; and reproofs of instruction _are_ the way of life:

verseText: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
mdText: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.

verseText: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.
mdText: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.

verseText: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.
mdText: For by means of a whorish woman _a_ _man_ _is_ _brought_ to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.

verseText: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?
mdText: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?

verseText: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?
mdText: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?

verseText: So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.
mdText: So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.

verseText: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;
mdText: _Men_ do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

verseText: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.
mdText: But _if_ he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.

verseText: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.
mdText: _But_ whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he _that_ doeth it destroyeth his own soul.

verseText: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.
mdText: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

verseText: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
mdText: For jealousy _is_ the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

verseText: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
mdText: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.

verseText: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
mdText: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

verseText: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.
mdText: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

verseText: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.
mdText: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.

verseText: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:
mdText: Say unto wisdom, Thou _art_ my sister; and call understanding _thy_ kinswoman:

verseText: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.
mdText: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger _which_ flattereth with her words.

verseText: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,
mdText: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,

verseText: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,
mdText: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

verseText: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,
mdText: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

verseText: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:
mdText: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:

verseText: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.
mdText: And, behold, there met him a woman _with_ the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.

verseText: She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:
mdText: (She _is_ loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:

verseText: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)
mdText: Now _is_ _she_ without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)

verseText: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,
mdText: So she caught him, and kissed him, _and_ with an impudent face said unto him,

verseText: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.
mdText: _I_ _have_ peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.

verseText: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
mdText: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

verseText: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
mdText: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved _works,_ with fine linen of Egypt.

verseText: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
mdText: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

verseText: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.
mdText: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.

verseText: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:
mdText: For the goodman _is_ not at home, he is gone a long journey:

verseText: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.
mdText: He hath taken a bag of money with him, _and_ will come home at the day appointed.

verseText: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
mdText: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.

verseText: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;
mdText: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;

verseText: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.
mdText: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it _is_ for his life.

verseText: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
mdText: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.

verseText: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.
mdText: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

verseText: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.
mdText: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong _men_ have been slain by her.

verseText: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
mdText: Her house _is_ the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.

verseText: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?
mdText: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?

verseText: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.
mdText: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.

verseText: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.
mdText: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.

verseText: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.
mdText: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice _is_ to the sons of man.

verseText: O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.
mdText: O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.

verseText: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
mdText: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips _shall_ _be_ right things.

verseText: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
mdText: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness _is_ an abomination to my lips.

verseText: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.
mdText: All the words of my mouth _are_ in righteousness; _there_ _is_ nothing froward or perverse in them.

verseText: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.
mdText: They _are_ all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

verseText: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.
mdText: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.

verseText: For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
mdText: For wisdom _is_ better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.

verseText: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.
mdText: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.

verseText: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.
mdText: The fear of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

verseText: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.
mdText: Counsel _is_ mine, and sound wisdom: I _am_ understanding; I have strength.

verseText: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
mdText: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

verseText: By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
mdText: By me princes rule, and nobles, _even_ all the judges of the earth.

verseText: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.
mdText: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.

verseText: Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.
mdText: Riches and honour _are_ with me; _yea,_ durable riches and righteousness.

verseText: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.
mdText: My fruit _is_ better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

verseText: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:
mdText: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:

verseText: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.
mdText: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.

verseText: The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.

verseText: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.
mdText: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.

verseText: When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.
mdText: When _there_ _were_ no depths, I was brought forth; when _there_ _were_ no fountains abounding with water.

verseText: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:
mdText: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:

verseText: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.
mdText: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.

verseText: When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:
mdText: When he prepared the heavens, I _was_ there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:

verseText: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:
mdText: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

verseText: When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:
mdText: When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:

verseText: Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;
mdText: Then I was by him, _as_ one brought up _with_ _him:_ and I was daily _his_ delight, rejoicing always before him;

verseText: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.
mdText: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights _were_ with the sons of men.

verseText: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.
mdText: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed _are_ _they_ _that_ keep my ways.

verseText: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.
mdText: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.

verseText: Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.
mdText: Blessed _is_ the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

verseText: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the LORD.
mdText: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.
mdText: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.

verseText: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:
mdText: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:

verseText: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.
mdText: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.

verseText: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,
mdText: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,

verseText: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
mdText: Whoso _is_ simple, let him turn in hither: _as_ _for_ him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

verseText: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.
mdText: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine _which_ I have mingled.

verseText: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.
mdText: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

verseText: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.
mdText: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked _man_ _getteth_ himself a blot.

verseText: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
mdText: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.

verseText: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.
mdText: Give _instruction_ to a wise _man,_ and he will be yet wiser: teach a just _man,_ and he will increase in learning.

verseText: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
mdText: The fear of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy _is_ understanding.

verseText: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.
mdText: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.

verseText: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.
mdText: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but _if_ thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear _it._

verseText: A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.
mdText: A foolish woman _is_ clamorous: _she_ _is_ simple, and knoweth nothing.

verseText: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,
mdText: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

verseText: To call passengers who go right on their ways:
mdText: To call passengers who go right on their ways:

verseText: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
mdText: Whoso _is_ simple, let him turn in hither: and _as_ _for_ him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

verseText: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
mdText: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread _eaten_ in secret is pleasant.

verseText: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
mdText: But he knoweth not that the dead _are_ there; _and_ _that_ her guests _are_ in the depths of hell.

verseText: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.
mdText: The proverbs of [Solomon.]([/person/solomon_2762) A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son _is_ the heaviness of his mother.

verseText: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.
mdText: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.

verseText: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.

verseText: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
mdText: He becometh poor that dealeth _with_ a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

verseText: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.
mdText: He that gathereth in summer _is_ a wise son: _but_ he that sleepeth in harvest _is_ a son that causeth shame.

verseText: Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
mdText: Blessings _are_ upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

verseText: The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.
mdText: The memory of the just _is_ blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

verseText: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.
mdText: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.

verseText: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
mdText: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.

verseText: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.
mdText: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.

verseText: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
mdText: The mouth of a righteous _man_ _is_ a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

verseText: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.
mdText: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.

verseText: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
mdText: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod _is_ for the back of him that is void of understanding.

verseText: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
mdText: Wise _men_ lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish _is_ near destruction.

verseText: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.
mdText: The rich man’s wealth _is_ his strong city: the destruction of the poor _is_ their poverty.

verseText: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.
mdText: The labour of the righteous _tendeth_ to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

verseText: He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.
mdText: He _is_ _in_ the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.

verseText: He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.
mdText: He that hideth hatred _with_ lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, _is_ a fool.

verseText: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
mdText: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips _is_ wise.

verseText: The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.
mdText: The tongue of the just _is_ _as_ choice silver: the heart of the wicked _is_ little worth.

verseText: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.
mdText: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.

verseText: The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
mdText: The blessing of the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.

verseText: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.
mdText: _It_ _is_ as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.

verseText: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
mdText: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

verseText: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
mdText: As the whirlwind passeth, so _is_ the wicked no _more:_ but the righteous _is_ an everlasting foundation.

verseText: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
mdText: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so _is_ the sluggard to them that send him.

verseText: The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
mdText: The fear of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

verseText: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
mdText: The hope of the righteous _shall_ _be_ gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

verseText: The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
mdText: The way of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ strength to the upright: but destruction _shall_ _be_ to the workers of iniquity.

verseText: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.
mdText: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.

verseText: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
mdText: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.

verseText: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
mdText: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked _speaketh_ frowardness.

verseText: A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is his delight.
mdText: A false balance _is_ abomination to the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) but a just weight _is_ his delight.

verseText: When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
mdText: _When_ pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly _is_ wisdom.

verseText: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
mdText: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.

verseText: Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
mdText: Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.

verseText: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
mdText: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

verseText: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.
mdText: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in _their_ _own_ naughtiness.

verseText: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.
mdText: When a wicked man dieth, _his_ expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust _men_ perisheth.

verseText: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
mdText: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.

verseText: An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
mdText: An hypocrite with _his_ mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.

verseText: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
mdText: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, _there_ _is_ shouting.

verseText: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
mdText: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

verseText: He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
mdText: He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.

verseText: A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
mdText: A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.

verseText: Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
mdText: Where no counsel _is,_ the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors _there_ _is_ safety.

verseText: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.
mdText: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart _for_ _it:_ and he that hateth suretiship is sure.

verseText: A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.
mdText: A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong _men_ retain riches.

verseText: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.
mdText: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but _he_ _that_ _is_ cruel troubleth his own flesh.

verseText: The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.
mdText: The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness _shall_ _be_ a sure reward.

verseText: As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.
mdText: As righteousness _tendeth_ to life: so he that pursueth evil _pursueth_ _it_ to his own death.

verseText: They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the LORD: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.
mdText: They that are of a froward heart _are_ abomination to the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) but _such_ _as_ _are_ upright in _their_ way _are_ his delight.

verseText: Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
mdText: _Though_ hand _join_ in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.

verseText: As a jewel of gold in a swine’s snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.
mdText: _As_ a jewel of gold in a swine’s snout, _so_ _is_ a fair woman which is without discretion.

verseText: The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
mdText: The desire of the righteous _is_ only good: _but_ the expectation of the wicked _is_ wrath.

verseText: There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.
mdText: There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and _there_ _is_ that withholdeth more than is meet, but _it_ _tendeth_ to poverty.

verseText: The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
mdText: The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.

verseText: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.
mdText: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing _shall_ _be_ upon the head of him that selleth _it._

verseText: He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.
mdText: He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.

verseText: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
mdText: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.

verseText: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
mdText: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool _shall_ _be_ servant to the wise of heart.

verseText: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.
mdText: The fruit of the righteous _is_ a tree of life; and he that winneth souls _is_ wise.

verseText: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.
mdText: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.

verseText: Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is brutish.
mdText: Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof _is_ brutish.

verseText: A good man obtaineth favour of the LORD: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
mdText: A good _man_ obtaineth favour of the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.

verseText: A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
mdText: A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.

verseText: A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.
mdText: A virtuous woman _is_ a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed _is_ as rottenness in his bones.

verseText: The thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
mdText: The thoughts of the righteous _are_ right: _but_ the counsels of the wicked _are_ deceit.

verseText: The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
mdText: The words of the wicked _are_ to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.

verseText: The wicked are overthrown, and are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
mdText: The wicked are overthrown, and _are_ not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.

verseText: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
mdText: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.

verseText: He that is despised, and hath a servant, is better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.
mdText: _He_ _that_ _is_ despised, and hath a servant, _is_ better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.

verseText: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
mdText: A righteous _man_ regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked _are_ cruel.

verseText: He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.
mdText: He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain _persons_ _is_ void of understanding.

verseText: The wicked desireth the net of evil men: but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.
mdText: The wicked desireth the net of evil _men:_ but the root of the righteous yieldeth _fruit._

verseText: The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.
mdText: The wicked is snared by the transgression of _his_ lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.

verseText: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth: and the recompence of a man’s hands shall be rendered unto him.
mdText: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of _his_ mouth: and the recompence of a man’s hands shall be rendered unto him.

verseText: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.
mdText: The way of a fool _is_ right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel _is_ wise.

verseText: A fool’s wrath is presently known: but a prudent man covereth shame.
mdText: A fool’s wrath is presently known: but a prudent _man_ covereth shame.

verseText: He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.
mdText: _He_ _that_ speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.

verseText: There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise is health.
mdText: There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise _is_ health.

verseText: The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
mdText: The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue _is_ but for a moment.

verseText: Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counsellors of peace is joy.
mdText: Deceit _is_ in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counsellors of peace _is_ joy.

verseText: There shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.
mdText: There shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.

verseText: Lying lips are abomination to the LORD: but they that deal truly are his delight.
mdText: Lying lips _are_ abomination to the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) but they that deal truly _are_ his delight.

verseText: A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
mdText: A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.

verseText: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.
mdText: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.

verseText: Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.
mdText: Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.

verseText: The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.
mdText: The righteous _is_ more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.

verseText: The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
mdText: The slothful _man_ roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man _is_ precious.

verseText: In the way of righteousness is life; and in the pathway thereof there is no death.
mdText: In the way of righteousness _is_ life; and _in_ the pathway _thereof_ _there_ _is_ no death.

verseText: A wise son heareth his father’s instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.
mdText: A wise son _heareth_ his father’s instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.

verseText: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.
mdText: A man shall eat good by the fruit of _his_ mouth: but the soul of the transgressors _shall_ _eat_ violence.

verseText: He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
mdText: He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: _but_ he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.

verseText: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
mdText: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and _hath_ nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.

verseText: A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.
mdText: A righteous _man_ hateth lying: but a wicked _man_ is loathsome, and cometh to shame.

verseText: Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.
mdText: Righteousness keepeth _him_ _that_ _is_ upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.

verseText: There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: there is that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.
mdText: There is that maketh himself rich, yet _hath_ nothing: _there_ _is_ that maketh himself poor, yet _hath_ great riches.

verseText: The ransom of a man’s life are his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.
mdText: The ransom of a man’s life _are_ his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.

verseText: The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
mdText: The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

verseText: Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.
mdText: Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised _is_ wisdom.

verseText: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.
mdText: Wealth _gotten_ by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.

verseText: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.
mdText: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but _when_ the desire cometh, _it_ _is_ a tree of life.

verseText: Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.
mdText: Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.

verseText: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
mdText: The law of the wise _is_ a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

verseText: Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors is hard.
mdText: Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors _is_ hard.

verseText: Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open his folly.
mdText: Every prudent _man_ dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open _his_ folly.

verseText: A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.
mdText: A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador _is_ health.

verseText: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.
mdText: Poverty and shame _shall_ _be_ _to_ him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.

verseText: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.
mdText: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but _it_ _is_ abomination to fools to depart from evil.

verseText: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
mdText: He that walketh with wise _men_ shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.

verseText: Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.
mdText: Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.

verseText: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.
mdText: A good _man_ leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children: and the wealth of the sinner _is_ laid up for the just.

verseText: Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.
mdText: Much food _is_ _in_ the tillage of the poor: but there is _that_ _is_ destroyed for want of judgment.

verseText: He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.
mdText: He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.

verseText: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
mdText: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.

verseText: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
mdText: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.

verseText: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
mdText: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) but _he_ _that_ _is_ perverse in his ways despiseth him.

verseText: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
mdText: In the mouth of the foolish _is_ a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

verseText: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
mdText: Where no oxen _are,_ the crib _is_ clean: but much increase _is_ by the strength of the ox.

verseText: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.
mdText: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.

verseText: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.
mdText: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and _findeth_ _it_ not: but knowledge _is_ easy unto him that understandeth.

verseText: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.
mdText: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not _in_ _him_ the lips of knowledge.

verseText: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.
mdText: The wisdom of the prudent _is_ to understand his way: but the folly of fools _is_ deceit.

verseText: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.
mdText: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous _there_ _is_ favour.

verseText: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
mdText: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.

verseText: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.
mdText: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.

verseText: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
mdText: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof _are_ the ways of death.

verseText: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
mdText: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth _is_ heaviness.

verseText: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
mdText: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man _shall_ _be_ _satisfied_ from himself.

verseText: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
mdText: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent _man_ looketh well to his going.

verseText: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
mdText: A wise _man_ feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.

verseText: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
mdText: _He_ _that_ _is_ soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.

verseText: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
mdText: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

verseText: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
mdText: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

verseText: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.
mdText: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich _hath_ many friends.

verseText: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.
mdText: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy _is_ he.

verseText: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
mdText: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth _shall_ _be_ to them that devise good.

verseText: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
mdText: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips _tendeth_ only to penury.

verseText: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.
mdText: The crown of the wise _is_ their riches: _but_ the foolishness of fools _is_ folly.

verseText: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.
mdText: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful _witness_ speaketh lies.

verseText: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.
mdText: In the fear of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.

verseText: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
mdText: The fear of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

verseText: In the multitude of people is the king’s honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
mdText: In the multitude of people _is_ the king’s honour: but in the want of people _is_ the destruction of the prince.

verseText: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
mdText: _He_ _that_ _is_ slow to wrath _is_ of great understanding: but _he_ _that_ _is_ hasty of spirit exalteth folly.

verseText: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.
mdText: A sound heart _is_ the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.

verseText: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.
mdText: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.

verseText: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.
mdText: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.

verseText: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.
mdText: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but _that_ _which_ _is_ in the midst of fools is made known.

verseText: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.
mdText: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin _is_ a reproach to any people.

verseText: The king’s favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
mdText: The king’s favour _is_ toward a wise servant: but his wrath is _against_ him that causeth shame.

verseText: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
mdText: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.

verseText: The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.
mdText: The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.

verseText: The eyes of the LORD are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.
mdText: The eyes of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _are_ in every place, beholding the evil and the good.

verseText: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.
mdText: A wholesome tongue _is_ a tree of life: but perverseness therein _is_ a breach in the spirit.

verseText: A fool despiseth his father’s instruction: but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.
mdText: A fool despiseth his father’s instruction: but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.

verseText: In the house of the righteous is much treasure: but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.
mdText: In the house of the righteous _is_ much treasure: but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.

verseText: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge: but the heart of the foolish doeth not so.
mdText: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge: but the heart of the foolish _doeth_ not so.

verseText: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but the prayer of the upright is his delight.
mdText: The sacrifice of the wicked _is_ an abomination to the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) but the prayer of the upright _is_ his delight.

verseText: The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the LORD: but he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.
mdText: The way of the wicked _is_ an abomination unto the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) but he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.

verseText: Correction is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way: and he that hateth reproof shall die.
mdText: Correction _is_ grievous unto him that forsaketh the way: _and_ he that hateth reproof shall die.

verseText: Hell and destruction are before the LORD: how much more then the hearts of the children of men?
mdText: Hell and destruction _are_ before the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) how much more then the hearts of the children of men?

verseText: A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.
mdText: A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.

verseText: A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
mdText: A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.

verseText: The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.
mdText: The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.

verseText: All the days of the afflicted are evil: but he that is of a merry heart hath a continual feast.
mdText: All the days of the afflicted _are_ evil: but he that is of a merry heart _hath_ a continual feast.

verseText: Better is little with the fear of the LORD than great treasure and trouble therewith.
mdText: Better _is_ little with the fear of the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) than great treasure and trouble therewith.

verseText: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
mdText: Better _is_ a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.

verseText: A wrathful man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.
mdText: A wrathful man stirreth up strife: but _he_ _that_ _is_ slow to anger appeaseth strife.

verseText: The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.
mdText: The way of the slothful _man_ _is_ as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous _is_ made plain.

verseText: A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish man despiseth his mother.
mdText: A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish man despiseth his mother.

verseText: Folly is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding walketh uprightly.
mdText: Folly _is_ joy to _him_ _that_ _is_ destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding walketh uprightly.

verseText: Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.
mdText: Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.

verseText: A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth: and a word spoken in due season, how good is it!
mdText: A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth: and a word _spoken_ in due season, how good _is_ _it!_

verseText: The way of life is above to the wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.
mdText: The way of life _is_ above to the wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.

verseText: The LORD will destroy the house of the proud: but he will establish the border of the widow.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) will destroy the house of the proud: but he will establish the border of the widow.

verseText: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD: but the words of the pure are pleasant words.
mdText: The thoughts of the wicked _are_ an abomination to the [LORD:]([/person/god_1324) but _the_ _words_ of the pure _are_ pleasant words.

verseText: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.
mdText: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.

verseText: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.
mdText: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.

verseText: The LORD is far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.
mdText: The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) _is_ far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.

verseText: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart: and a good report maketh the bones fat.
