mdText: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.

verseText: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.
mdText: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.

verseText: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
mdText: In the transgression of an evil man _there_ _is_ a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

verseText: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.
mdText: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: _but_ the wicked regardeth not to know _it._

verseText: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.
mdText: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise _men_ turn away wrath.

verseText: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.
mdText: _If_ a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, _there_ _is_ no rest.

verseText: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.
mdText: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.

verseText: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
mdText: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise _man_ keepeth it in till afterwards.

verseText: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.
mdText: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants _are_ wicked.

verseText: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the LORD lighteneth both their eyes.
mdText: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) lighteneth both their eyes.

verseText: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.
mdText: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

verseText: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.
mdText: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left _to_ _himself_ bringeth his mother to shame.

verseText: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.
mdText: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.

verseText: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.
mdText: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.

verseText: Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.
mdText: Where _there_ _is_ no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy _is_ he.

verseText: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.
mdText: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.

verseText: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
mdText: Seest thou a man _that_ _is_ hasty in his words? _there_ _is_ more hope of a fool than of him.

verseText: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.
mdText: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become _his_ son at the length.

verseText: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
mdText: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.

verseText: A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.
mdText: A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.

verseText: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.
mdText: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth _it_ not.

verseText: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be safe.
mdText: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the [LORD]([/person/god_1324) shall be safe.

verseText: Many seek the ruler’s favour; but every man’s judgment cometh from the LORD.
mdText: Many seek the ruler’s favour; but _every_ man’s judgment _cometh_ from the [LORD.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.
mdText: An unjust man _is_ an abomination to the just: and _he_ _that_ _is_ upright in the way _is_ abomination to the wicked.

verseText: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,
mdText: The words of [Agur]([/person/agur_112) the son of [Jakeh,]([/person/jakeh_712) _even_ the prophecy: the man spake unto [Ithiel,]([/person/ithiel_651) even unto [Ithiel]([/person/ithiel_651) and [Ucal,]([/person/ucal_2887)

verseText: Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.
mdText: Surely I _am_ more brutish than _any_ man, and have not the understanding of a man.

verseText: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.
mdText: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.

verseText: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what is his name, and what is his son’s name, if thou canst tell?
mdText: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what _is_ his name, and what _is_ his son’s name, if thou canst tell?

verseText: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.
mdText: Every word of [God]([/person/god_1324) _is_ pure: he _is_ a shield unto them that put their trust in him.

verseText: Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
mdText: Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.

verseText: Two things have I required of thee; deny me them not before I die:
mdText: Two _things_ have I required of thee; deny me _them_ not before I die:

verseText: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:
mdText: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:

verseText: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the LORD? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my God in vain.
mdText: Lest I be full, and deny _thee,_ and say, Who _is_ the [LORD?]([/person/god_1324) or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my [God]([/person/god_1324) _in_ _vain._

verseText: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.
mdText: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.

verseText: There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.
mdText: _There_ _is_ a generation _that_ curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.

verseText: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.
mdText: _There_ _is_ a generation _that_ _are_ pure in their own eyes, and _yet_ is not washed from their filthiness.

verseText: There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.
mdText: _There_ _is_ a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.

verseText: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.
mdText: _There_ _is_ a generation, whose teeth _are_ _as_ swords, and their jaw teeth _as_ knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from _among_ men.

verseText: The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough:
mdText: The horseleach hath two daughters, _crying,_ Give, give. There are three _things_ _that_ are never satisfied, _yea,_ four _things_ say not, _It_ _is_ enough:

verseText: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not filled with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough.
mdText: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth _that_ is not filled with water; and the fire _that_ saith not, _It_ _is_ enough.

verseText: The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.
mdText: The eye _that_ mocketh at _his_ father, and despiseth to obey _his_ mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

verseText: There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:
mdText: There be three _things_ _which_ are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:

verseText: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.
mdText: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.

verseText: Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.
mdText: Such _is_ the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.

verseText: For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:
mdText: For three _things_ the earth is disquieted, and for four _which_ it cannot bear:

verseText: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;
mdText: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;

verseText: For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.
mdText: For an odious _woman_ when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.

verseText: There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:
mdText: There be four _things_ _which_ _are_ little upon the earth, but they _are_ exceeding wise:

verseText: The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;
mdText: The ants _are_ a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;

verseText: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;
mdText: The conies _are_ _but_ a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;

verseText: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;
mdText: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;

verseText: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces.
mdText: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces.

verseText: There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:
mdText: There be three _things_ which go well, yea, four are comely in going:

verseText: A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;
mdText: A lion _which_ _is_ strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;

verseText: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.
mdText: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom _there_ _is_ no rising up.

verseText: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.
mdText: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, _lay_ thine hand upon thy mouth.

verseText: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
mdText: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.

verseText: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.
mdText: The words of king [Lemuel,]([/person/lemuel_1817) the prophecy that his [mother]([/person/mother_of_lemuel_2110) taught him.

verseText: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?
mdText: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?

verseText: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.
mdText: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.

verseText: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:
mdText: _It_ _is_ not for kings, O [Lemuel,]([/person/lemuel_1817) _it_ _is_ not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:

verseText: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.
mdText: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.

verseText: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.
mdText: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.

verseText: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.
mdText: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

verseText: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.
mdText: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

verseText: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.
mdText: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.

verseText: Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.
mdText: Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price _is_ far above rubies.

verseText: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.
mdText: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.

verseText: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.
mdText: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.

verseText: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.
mdText: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

verseText: She is like the merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar.
mdText: She is like the merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar.

verseText: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.
mdText: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.

verseText: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
mdText: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

verseText: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.
mdText: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.

verseText: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.
mdText: She perceiveth that her merchandise _is_ good: her candle goeth not out by night.

verseText: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.
mdText: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.

verseText: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
mdText: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

verseText: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.
mdText: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household _are_ clothed with scarlet.

verseText: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.
mdText: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing _is_ silk and purple.

verseText: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.
mdText: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

verseText: She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
mdText: She maketh fine linen, and selleth _it;_ and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

verseText: Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.
mdText: Strength and honour _are_ her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.

verseText: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
mdText: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue _is_ the law of kindness.

verseText: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
mdText: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

verseText: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.
mdText: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband _also,_ and he praiseth her.

verseText: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.
mdText: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

verseText: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.
mdText: Favour _is_ deceitful, and beauty _is_ vain: _but_ a woman _that_ feareth the [LORD,]([/person/god_1324) she shall be praised.

verseText: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.
mdText: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.

verseText: The former treatise have I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach,
mdText: The former treatise have I made, O [Theophilus,]([/person/theophilus_2849) of all that [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) began both to do and teach,

verseText: Until the day in which he was taken up, after that he through the Holy Ghost had given commandments unto the apostles whom he had chosen:
mdText: Until the day in which he was taken up, after that he through the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost had given commandments unto the apostles whom he had chosen:

verseText: To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God:
mdText: To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of [God:]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And, being assembled together with them, commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which, saith he, ye have heard of me.
mdText: And, being assembled together with _them,_ commanded them that they should not depart from [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) but wait for the promise of the [Father,]([/person/god_1324) which, _saith_ _he,_ ye have heard of me.

verseText: For John truly baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence.
mdText: For [John]([/person/john_1676) truly baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost not many days hence.

verseText: When they therefore were come together, they asked of him, saying, Lord, wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?
mdText: When they therefore were come together, they asked of him, saying, [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?

verseText: And he said unto them, It is not for you to know the times or the seasons, which the Father hath put in his own power.
mdText: And he said unto them, It is not for you to know the times or the seasons, which the [Father]([/person/god_1324) hath put in his own power.

verseText: But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.
mdText: But ye shall receive power, after that the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) and in all [Judaea,](/place/judea_657) and in [Samaria,](/place/samaria_1022) and unto the uttermost part of the earth.

verseText: And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.
mdText: And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.

verseText: And while they looked stedfastly toward heaven as he went up, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel;
mdText: And while they looked stedfastly toward heaven as he went up, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel;

verseText: Which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.
mdText: Which also said, Ye men of [Galilee,](/place/galilee_433) why stand ye gazing up into heaven? this same [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.

verseText: Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is from Jerusalem a sabbath day’s journey.
mdText: Then returned they unto [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) from the mount called [Olivet,](/place/olivet_907) which is from [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) a sabbath day’s journey.

verseText: And when they were come in, they went up into an upper room, where abode both Peter, and James, and John, and Andrew, Philip, and Thomas, Bartholomew, and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon Zelotes, and Judas the brother of James.
mdText: And when they were come in, they went up into an upper room, where abode both [Peter,]([/person/peter_2745) and [James,]([/person/james_718) and [John,]([/person/john_1677) and [Andrew,]([/person/andrew_264) [Philip,]([/person/philip_2344) and [Thomas,]([/person/thomas_2851) [Bartholomew,]([/person/bartholomew_405) and [Matthew,]([/person/matthew_1971) [James]([/person/james_718) _the_ _son_ of [Alphaeus,]([/person/alphaeus_192) and [Simon]([/person/simon_2746) [Zelotes,]([/person/simon_2746) and [Judas]([/person/lebbaeus_1815) _the_ _brother_ of [James.]([/person/james_718)

verseText: These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.
mdText: These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women, and [Mary]([/person/mary_1938) the mother of [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) and with his brethren.

verseText: And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples, and said, (the number of names together were about an hundred and twenty,)
mdText: And in those days [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) stood up in the midst of the disciples, and said, (the number of names together were about an hundred and twenty,)

verseText: Men and brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before concerning Judas, which was guide to them that took Jesus.
mdText: Men _and_ brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, which the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost by the mouth of [David]([/person/david_994) spake before concerning [Judas,]([/person/judas_1760) which was guide to them that took [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: For he was numbered with us, and had obtained part of this ministry.
mdText: For he was numbered with us, and had obtained part of this ministry.

verseText: Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.
mdText: Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.

verseText: And it was known unto all the dwellers at Jerusalem; insomuch as that field is called in their proper tongue, Aceldama, that is to say, The field of blood.
mdText: And it was known unto all the dwellers at [Jerusalem;](/place/jerusalem_636) insomuch as that field is called in their proper tongue, [Aceldama,](/place/akeldama_43) that is to say, The field of blood.

verseText: For it is written in the book of Psalms, Let his habitation be desolate, and let no man dwell therein: and his bishoprick let another take.
mdText: For it is written in the book of Psalms, Let his habitation be desolate, and let no man dwell therein: and his bishoprick let another take.

verseText: Wherefore of these men which have companied with us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,
mdText: Wherefore of these men which have companied with us all the time that the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) went in and out among us,

verseText: Beginning from the baptism of John, unto that same day that he was taken up from us, must one be ordained to be a witness with us of his resurrection.
mdText: Beginning from the baptism of [John,]([/person/john_1676) unto that same day that he was taken up from us, must one be ordained to be a witness with us of his resurrection.

verseText: And they appointed two, Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
mdText: And they appointed two, [Joseph]([/person/barsabas_1720) called [Barsabas,]([/person/barsabas_1720) who was surnamed Justus, and [Matthias.]([/person/matthias_1972)

verseText: And they prayed, and said, Thou, Lord, which knowest the hearts of all men, shew whether of these two thou hast chosen,
mdText: And they prayed, and said, Thou, [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) which knowest the hearts of all _men,_ shew whether of these two thou hast chosen,

verseText: That he may take part of this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place.
mdText: That he may take part of this ministry and apostleship, from which [Judas]([/person/judas_1760) by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place.

verseText: And they gave forth their lots; and the lot fell upon Matthias; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.
mdText: And they gave forth their lots; and the lot fell upon [Matthias;]([/person/matthias_1972) and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.

verseText: And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.
mdText: And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.

verseText: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.
mdText: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.

verseText: And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.
mdText: And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.

verseText: And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.
mdText: And they were all filled with the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues, as the [Spirit]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) gave them utterance.

verseText: And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.
mdText: And there were dwelling at [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.

verseText: Now when this was noised abroad, the multitude came together, and were confounded, because that every man heard them speak in his own language.
mdText: Now when this was noised abroad, the multitude came together, and were confounded, because that every man heard them speak in his own language.

verseText: And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying one to another, Behold, are not all these which speak Galilaeans?
mdText: And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying one to another, Behold, are not all these which speak Galilaeans?

verseText: And how hear we every man in our own tongue, wherein we were born?
mdText: And how hear we every man in our own tongue, wherein we were born?

verseText: Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, and in Judaea, and Cappadocia, in Pontus, and Asia,
mdText: Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the dwellers in [Mesopotamia,](/place/mesopotamia_790) and in [Judaea,](/place/judea_657) and [Cappadocia,](/place/cappadocia_276) in [Pontus,](/place/pontus_956) and [Asia,](/place/asia_108)

verseText: Phrygia, and Pamphylia, in Egypt, and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and strangers of Rome, Jews and proselytes,
mdText: [Phrygia,](/place/phrygia_946) and [Pamphylia,](/place/pamphylia_918) in [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) and in the parts of [Libya](/place/libya_730) about [Cyrene,](/place/cyrene_317) and strangers of [Rome,](/place/rome_1013) Jews and proselytes,

verseText: Cretes and Arabians, we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of God.
mdText: Cretes and Arabians, we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this?
mdText: And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this?

verseText: Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.
mdText: Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.

verseText: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and said unto them, Ye men of Judaea, and all ye that dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and hearken to my words:
mdText: But [Peter,]([/person/peter_2745) standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and said unto them, Ye men of [Judaea,](/place/judea_657) and all _ye_ that dwell at [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) be this known unto you, and hearken to my words:

verseText: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it is but the third hour of the day.
mdText: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it is _but_ the third hour of the day.

verseText: But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel;
mdText: But this is that which was spoken by the prophet [Joel;]([/person/joel_1660)

verseText: And it shall come to pass in the last days, saith God, I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh: and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams:
mdText: And it shall come to pass in the last days, saith [God,]([/person/god_1324) I will pour out of my [Spirit]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) upon all flesh: and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams:

verseText: And on my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy:
mdText: And on my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my [Spirit;]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) and they shall prophesy:

verseText: And I will shew wonders in heaven above, and signs in the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke:
mdText: And I will shew wonders in heaven above, and signs in the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke:

verseText: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before that great and notable day of the Lord come:
mdText: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before that great and notable day of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) come:

verseText: And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.
mdText: And it shall come to pass, _that_ whosoever shall call on the name of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) shall be saved.

verseText: Ye men of Israel, hear these words; Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved of God among you by miracles and wonders and signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know:
mdText: Ye men of Israel, hear these words; [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) of [Nazareth,](/place/nazareth_878) a man approved of [God]([/person/god_1324) among you by miracles and wonders and signs, which [God]([/person/god_1324) did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know:

verseText: Him, being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, ye have taken, and by wicked hands have crucified and slain:
mdText: Him, being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of [God,]([/person/god_1324) ye have taken, and by wicked hands have crucified and slain:

verseText: Whom God hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.
mdText: Whom [God]([/person/god_1324) hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.

verseText: For David speaketh concerning him, I foresaw the Lord always before my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved:
mdText: For [David]([/person/david_994) speaketh concerning him, I foresaw the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) always before my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved:

verseText: Therefore did my heart rejoice, and my tongue was glad; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope:
mdText: Therefore did my heart rejoice, and my tongue was glad; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope:

verseText: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell, neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
mdText: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell, neither wilt thou suffer thine [Holy]([/person/jesus_905) One to see corruption.

verseText: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life; thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.
mdText: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life; thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.

verseText: Men and brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.
mdText: Men _and_ brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch [David,]([/person/david_994) that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.

verseText: Therefore being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh, he would raise up Christ to sit on his throne;
mdText: Therefore being a prophet, and knowing that [God]([/person/god_1324) had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh, he would raise up [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) to sit on his throne;

verseText: He seeing this before spake of the resurrection of Christ, that his soul was not left in hell, neither his flesh did see corruption.
mdText: He seeing this before spake of the resurrection of [Christ,]([/person/jesus_905) that his soul was not left in hell, neither his flesh did see corruption.

verseText: This Jesus hath God raised up, whereof we all are witnesses.
mdText: This [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) hath [God]([/person/god_1324) raised up, whereof we all are witnesses.

verseText: Therefore being by the right hand of God exalted, and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, he hath shed forth this, which ye now see and hear.
mdText: Therefore being by the right hand of [God]([/person/god_1324) exalted, and having received of the [Father]([/person/god_1324) the promise of the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, he hath shed forth this, which ye now see and hear.

verseText: For David is not ascended into the heavens: but he saith himself, The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,
mdText: For [David]([/person/david_994) is not ascended into the heavens: but he saith himself, The [LORD]([/person/god_1324) said unto my [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) Sit thou on my right hand,

verseText: Until I make thy foes thy footstool.
mdText: Until I make thy foes thy footstool.

verseText: Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly, that God hath made that same Jesus, whom ye have crucified, both Lord and Christ.
mdText: Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly, that [God]([/person/god_1324) hath made that same [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) whom ye have crucified, both [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) and [Christ.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: Now when they heard this, they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles, Men and brethren, what shall we do?
mdText: Now when they heard _this,_ they were pricked in their heart, and said unto [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) and to the rest of the apostles, Men _and_ brethren, what shall we do?

verseText: Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.
mdText: Then [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost.

verseText: For the promise is unto you, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, even as many as the Lord our God shall call.
mdText: For the promise is unto you, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, _even_ as many as the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) our [God]([/person/god_1324) shall call.

verseText: And with many other words did he testify and exhort, saying, Save yourselves from this untoward generation.
mdText: And with many other words did he testify and exhort, saying, Save yourselves from this untoward generation.

verseText: Then they that gladly received his word were baptized: and the same day there were added unto them about three thousand souls.
mdText: Then they that gladly received his word were baptized: and the same day there were added _unto_ _them_ about three thousand souls.

verseText: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.
mdText: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.

verseText: And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.
mdText: And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.

verseText: And all that believed were together, and had all things common;
mdText: And all that believed were together, and had all things common;

verseText: And sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all men, as every man had need.
mdText: And sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all _men,_ as every man had need.

verseText: And they, continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, did eat their meat with gladness and singleness of heart,
mdText: And they, continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, did eat their meat with gladness and singleness of heart,

verseText: Praising God, and having favour with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.
mdText: Praising [God,]([/person/god_1324) and having favour with all the people. And the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) added to the church daily such as should be saved.

verseText: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, being the ninth hour.
mdText: Now [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) and [John]([/person/john_1677) went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, _being_ the ninth _hour._

verseText: And a certain man lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the temple;
mdText: And a certain man lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called [Beautiful,](/place/beautiful_gate_163) to ask alms of them that entered into the temple;

verseText: Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms.
mdText: Who seeing [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) and [John]([/person/john_1677) about to go into the temple asked an alms.

verseText: And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, Look on us.
mdText: And [Peter,]([/person/peter_2745) fastening his eyes upon him with [John,]([/person/john_1677) said, Look on us.

verseText: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them.
mdText: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them.

verseText: Then Peter said, Silver and gold have I none; but such as I have give I thee: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk.
mdText: Then [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) said, Silver and gold have I none; but such as I have give I thee: In the name of [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) of [Nazareth](/place/nazareth_878) rise up and walk.

verseText: And he took him by the right hand, and lifted him up: and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.
mdText: And he took him by the right hand, and lifted _him_ up: and immediately his feet and ancle bones received strength.

verseText: And he leaping up stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.
mdText: And he leaping up stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And all the people saw him walking and praising God:
mdText: And all the people saw him walking and praising [God:]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple: and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.
mdText: And they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the [Beautiful](/place/beautiful_gate_163) gate of the temple: and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.

verseText: And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.
mdText: And as the lame man which was healed held [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) and [John,]([/person/john_1677) all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called [Solomon’s,]([/person/solomon_2762) greatly wondering.

verseText: And when Peter saw it, he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this? or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk?
mdText: And when [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) saw _it,_ he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this? or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk?

verseText: The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Son Jesus; whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to let him go.
mdText: The [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Abraham,]([/person/abraham_58) and of [Isaac,]([/person/isaac_616) and of [Jacob,]([/person/israel_682) the [God]([/person/god_1324) of our fathers, hath glorified his [Son]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus;]([/person/jesus_905) whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of [Pilate,]([/person/pilate_2365) when he was determined to let _him_ go.

verseText: But ye denied the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you;
mdText: But ye denied the [Holy]([/person/jesus_905) One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you;

verseText: And killed the Prince of life, whom God hath raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.
mdText: And killed the Prince of life, whom [God]([/person/god_1324) hath raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.

verseText: And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know: yea, the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
mdText: And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know: yea, the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.

verseText: And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye did it, as did also your rulers.
mdText: And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye did _it,_ as _did_ also your rulers.

verseText: But those things, which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.
mdText: But those things, which [God]([/person/god_1324) before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets, that [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.

verseText: Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord;
mdText: Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the [Lord;]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you:
mdText: And he shall send [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ,]([/person/jesus_905) which before was preached unto you:

verseText: Whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things, which God hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began.
mdText: Whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things, which [God]([/person/god_1324) hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began.

verseText: For Moses truly said unto the fathers, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you.
mdText: For [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) truly said unto the fathers, A [prophet]([/person/jesus_905) shall the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) your [God]([/person/god_1324) raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you.

verseText: And it shall come to pass, that every soul, which will not hear that prophet, shall be destroyed from among the people.
mdText: And it shall come to pass, _that_ every soul, which will not hear that [prophet,]([/person/jesus_905) shall be destroyed from among the people.

verseText: Yea, and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.
mdText: Yea, and all the prophets from [Samuel]([/person/samuel_2469) and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.

verseText: Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying unto Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.
mdText: Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which [God]([/person/god_1324) made with our fathers, saying unto [Abraham,]([/person/abraham_58) And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.

verseText: Unto you first God, having raised up his Son Jesus, sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from his iniquities.
mdText: Unto you first [God,]([/person/god_1324) having raised up his [Son]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from his iniquities.

verseText: And as they spake unto the people, the priests, and the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees, came upon them,
mdText: And as they spake unto the people, the priests, and the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees, came upon them,

verseText: Being grieved that they taught the people, and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
mdText: Being grieved that they taught the people, and preached through [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) the resurrection from the dead.

verseText: And they laid hands on them, and put them in hold unto the next day: for it was now eventide.
mdText: And they laid hands on them, and put _them_ in hold unto the next day: for it was now eventide.

verseText: Howbeit many of them which heard the word believed; and the number of the men was about five thousand.
mdText: Howbeit many of them which heard the word believed; and the number of the men was about five thousand.

verseText: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers, and elders, and scribes,
mdText: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers, and elders, and scribes,

verseText: And Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest, were gathered together at Jerusalem.
mdText: And [Annas]([/person/annas_269) the high priest, and [Caiaphas,]([/person/caiaphas_532) and [John,]([/person/john_1678) and [Alexander,]([/person/alexander_187) and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest, were gathered together at Jerusalem.

verseText: And when they had set them in the midst, they asked, By what power, or by what name, have ye done this?
mdText: And when they had set them in the midst, they asked, By what power, or by what name, have ye done this?

verseText: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,
mdText: Then [Peter,]([/person/peter_2745) filled with the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,

verseText: If we this day be examined of the good deed done to the impotent man, by what means he is made whole;
mdText: If we this day be examined of the good deed done to the impotent man, by what means he is made whole;

verseText: Be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye crucified, whom God raised from the dead, even by him doth this man stand here before you whole.
mdText: Be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) of [Nazareth,](/place/nazareth_878) whom ye crucified, whom [God]([/person/god_1324) raised from the dead, _even_ by him doth this man stand here before you whole.

verseText: This is the stone which was set at nought of you builders, which is become the head of the corner.
mdText: This is the stone which was set at nought of you builders, which is become the head of the corner.

verseText: Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.
mdText: Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.

verseText: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marvelled; and they took knowledge of them, that they had been with Jesus.
mdText: Now when they saw the boldness of [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) and [John,]([/person/john_1677) and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marvelled; and they took knowledge of them, that they had been with [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And beholding the man which was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.
mdText: And beholding the man which was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

verseText: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,
mdText: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,

verseText: Saying, What shall we do to these men? for that indeed a notable miracle hath been done by them is manifest to all them that dwell in Jerusalem; and we cannot deny it.
mdText: Saying, What shall we do to these men? for that indeed a notable miracle hath been done by them _is_ manifest to all them that dwell in [Jerusalem;](/place/jerusalem_636) and we cannot deny _it._

verseText: But that it spread no further among the people, let us straitly threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.
mdText: But that it spread no further among the people, let us straitly threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.

verseText: And they called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.
mdText: And they called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: But Peter and John answered and said unto them, Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God, judge ye.
mdText: But [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) and [John]([/person/john_1677) answered and said unto them, Whether it be right in the sight of [God]([/person/god_1324) to hearken unto you more than unto [God,]([/person/god_1324) judge ye.

verseText: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.
mdText: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.

verseText: So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people: for all men glorified God for that which was done.
mdText: So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people: for all _men_ glorified [God]([/person/god_1324) for that which was done.

verseText: For the man was above forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was shewed.
mdText: For the man was above forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was shewed.

verseText: And being let go, they went to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them.
mdText: And being let go, they went to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them.

verseText: And when they heard that, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, Lord, thou art God, which hast made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all that in them is:
mdText: And when they heard that, they lifted up their voice to [God]([/person/god_1324) with one accord, and said, [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) thou _art_ [God,]([/person/god_1324) which hast made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all that in them is:

verseText: Who by the mouth of thy servant David hast said, Why did the heathen rage, and the people imagine vain things?
mdText: Who by the mouth of thy servant [David]([/person/david_994) hast said, Why did the heathen rage, and the people imagine vain things?

verseText: The kings of the earth stood up, and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord, and against his Christ.
mdText: The kings of the earth stood up, and the rulers were gathered together against the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) and against his [Christ.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: For of a truth against thy holy child Jesus, whom thou hast anointed, both Herod, and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles, and the people of Israel, were gathered together,
mdText: For of a truth against thy holy child [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) whom thou hast anointed, both [Herod,]([/person/herod_1505) and [Pontius]([/person/pilate_2365) [Pilate,]([/person/pilate_2365) with the Gentiles, and the people of Israel, were gathered together,

verseText: For to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done.
mdText: For to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done.

verseText: And now, Lord, behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants, that with all boldness they may speak thy word,
mdText: And now, [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants, that with all boldness they may speak thy word,

verseText: By stretching forth thine hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of thy holy child Jesus.
mdText: By stretching forth thine hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of thy holy child [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And when they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were assembled together; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and they spake the word of God with boldness.
mdText: And when they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were assembled together; and they were all filled with the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, and they spake the word of [God]([/person/god_1324) with boldness.

verseText: And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and of one soul: neither said any of them that ought of the things which he possessed was his own; but they had all things common.
mdText: And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and of one soul: neither said any _of_ _them_ that ought of the things which he possessed was his own; but they had all things common.

verseText: And with great power gave the apostles witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus: and great grace was upon them all.
mdText: And with great power gave the apostles witness of the resurrection of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus:]([/person/jesus_905) and great grace was upon them all.

verseText: Neither was there any among them that lacked: for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold,
mdText: Neither was there any among them that lacked: for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold,

verseText: And laid them down at the apostles’ feet: and distribution was made unto every man according as he had need.
mdText: And laid _them_ down at the apostles’ feet: and distribution was made unto every man according as he had need.

verseText: And Joses, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas, (which is, being interpreted, The son of consolation,) a Levite, and of the country of Cyprus,
mdText: And [Joses,]([/person/barnabas_1722) who by the apostles was surnamed [Barnabas,]([/person/barnabas_1722) (which is, being interpreted, The son of consolation,) a Levite, _and_ of the country of [Cyprus,](/place/cyprus_316)

verseText: Having land, sold it, and brought the money, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
mdText: Having land, sold _it,_ and brought the money, and laid _it_ at the apostles’ feet.

verseText: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,
mdText: But a certain man named [Ananias,]([/person/ananias_258) with [Sapphira]([/person/sapphira_2472) his wife, sold a possession,
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: And kept back part of the price, his wife also being privy to it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
mdText: And kept back _part_ of the price, his wife also being privy _to_ _it,_ and brought a certain part, and laid _it_ at the apostles’ feet.
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost, and to keep back part of the price of the land?
mdText: But [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) said, [Ananias,]([/person/ananias_258) why hath [Satan]([/person/satan_2476) filled thine heart to lie to the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, and to keep back _part_ of the price of the land?
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: Whiles it remained, was it not thine own? and after it was sold, was it not in thine own power? why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart? thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.
mdText: Whiles it remained, was it not thine own? and after it was sold, was it not in thine own power? why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart? thou hast not lied unto men, but unto [God.]([/person/god_1324)
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: And Ananias hearing these words fell down, and gave up the ghost: and great fear came on all them that heard these things.
mdText: And [Ananias]([/person/ananias_258) hearing these words fell down, and gave up the ghost: and great fear came on all them that heard these things.
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: And the young men arose, wound him up, and carried him out, and buried him.
mdText: And the young men arose, wound him up, and carried _him_ out, and buried _him._
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.
mdText: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much? And she said, Yea, for so much.
mdText: And [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much? And she said, Yea, for so much.
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: Then Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husband are at the door, and shall carry thee out.
mdText: Then [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the [Spirit]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) of the [Lord?]([/person/jesus_905) behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husband _are_ at the door, and shall carry thee out.
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: Then fell she down straightway at his feet, and yielded up the ghost: and the young men came in, and found her dead, and, carrying her forth, buried her by her husband.
mdText: Then fell she down straightway at his feet, and yielded up the ghost: and the young men came in, and found her dead, and, carrying _her_ forth, buried _her_ by her husband.
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: And great fear came upon all the church, and upon as many as heard these things.
mdText: And great fear came upon all the church, and upon as many as heard these things.
eventsDescribed: Ananias and Sapphira lie to God

verseText: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people; (and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.
mdText: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people; (and they were all with one accord in [Solomon’s]([/person/solomon_2762) [porch.](/place/solomons_portico_1109)
eventsDescribed: Apostles work signs and wonders in Solomon's Portico

verseText: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.
mdText: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.
eventsDescribed: Apostles work signs and wonders in Solomon's Portico

verseText: And believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women.)
mdText: And believers were the more added to the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) multitudes both of men and women.)
eventsDescribed: Apostles work signs and wonders in Solomon's Portico

verseText: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets, and laid them on beds and couches, that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them.
mdText: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets, and laid _them_ on beds and couches, that at the least the shadow of [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) passing by might overshadow some of them.
eventsDescribed: Apostles work signs and wonders in Solomon's Portico

verseText: There came also a multitude out of the cities round about unto Jerusalem, bringing sick folks, and them which were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed every one.
mdText: There came also a multitude _out_ of the cities round about unto [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) bringing sick folks, and them which were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed every one.
eventsDescribed: Apostles work signs and wonders in Solomon's Portico

verseText: Then the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him, (which is the sect of the Sadducees,) and were filled with indignation,
mdText: Then the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him, (which is the sect of the Sadducees,) and were filled with indignation,
eventsDescribed: Apostles work signs and wonders in Solomon's Portico

verseText: And laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.
mdText: And laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.

verseText: But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,
mdText: But the angel of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,

verseText: Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.
mdText: Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.

verseText: And when they heard that, they entered into the temple early in the morning, and taught. But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.
mdText: And when they heard _that,_ they entered into the temple early in the morning, and taught. But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of [Israel,]([/person/israel_682) and sent to the prison to have them brought.

verseText: But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned, and told,
mdText: But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned, and told,

verseText: Saying, The prison truly found we shut with all safety, and the keepers standing without before the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.
mdText: Saying, The prison truly found we shut with all safety, and the keepers standing without before the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.

verseText: Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they doubted of them whereunto this would grow.
mdText: Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they doubted of them whereunto this would grow.

verseText: Then came one and told them, saying, Behold, the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple, and teaching the people.
mdText: Then came one and told them, saying, Behold, the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple, and teaching the people.

verseText: Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without violence: for they feared the people, lest they should have been stoned.
mdText: Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without violence: for they feared the people, lest they should have been stoned.

verseText: And when they had brought them, they set them before the council: and the high priest asked them,
mdText: And when they had brought them, they set _them_ before the council: and the high priest asked them,

verseText: Saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name? and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.
mdText: Saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name? and, behold, ye have filled [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.

verseText: Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.
mdText: Then [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) and the _other_ apostles answered and said, We ought to obey [God]([/person/god_1324) rather than men.

verseText: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.
mdText: The [God]([/person/god_1324) of our fathers raised up [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.

verseText: Him hath God exalted with his right hand to be a Prince and a Saviour, for to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.
mdText: Him hath [God]([/person/god_1324) exalted with his right hand _to_ _be_ a [Prince]([/person/jesus_905) and a [Saviour,]([/person/jesus_905) for to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.

verseText: And we are his witnesses of these things; and so is also the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.
mdText: And we are his witnesses of these things; and _so_ _is_ also the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, whom [God]([/person/god_1324) hath given to them that obey him.

verseText: When they heard that, they were cut to the heart, and took counsel to slay them.
mdText: When they heard _that,_ they were cut _to_ _the_ _heart,_ and took counsel to slay them.

verseText: Then stood there up one in the council, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law, had in reputation among all the people, and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space;
mdText: Then stood there up one in the council, a Pharisee, named [Gamaliel,]([/person/gamaliel_1277) a doctor of the law, had in reputation among all the people, and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space;
eventsDescribed: Gamaliel advises the counsel and Apostles freed

verseText: And said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.
mdText: And said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.
eventsDescribed: Gamaliel advises the counsel and Apostles freed

verseText: For before these days rose up Theudas, boasting himself to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered, and brought to nought.
mdText: For before these days rose up [Theudas,]([/person/theudas_2850) boasting himself to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered, and brought to nought.
eventsDescribed: Gamaliel advises the counsel and Apostles freed

verseText: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away much people after him: he also perished; and all, even as many as obeyed him, were dispersed.
mdText: After this man rose up [Judas]([/person/judas_1757) of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away much people after him: he also perished; and all, _even_ as many as obeyed him, were dispersed.
eventsDescribed: Gamaliel advises the counsel and Apostles freed

verseText: And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will come to nought:
mdText: And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will come to nought:
eventsDescribed: Gamaliel advises the counsel and Apostles freed

verseText: But if it be of God, ye cannot overthrow it; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God.
mdText: But if it be of [God,]([/person/god_1324) ye cannot overthrow it; lest haply ye be found even to fight against [God.]([/person/god_1324)
eventsDescribed: Gamaliel advises the counsel and Apostles freed

verseText: And to him they agreed: and when they had called the apostles, and beaten them, they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
mdText: And to him they agreed: and when they had called the apostles, and beaten _them,_ they commanded that they should not speak in the name of [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) and let them go.
eventsDescribed: Gamaliel advises the counsel and Apostles freed

verseText: And they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.
mdText: And they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.
eventsDescribed: Gamaliel advises the counsel and Apostles freed

verseText: And daily in the temple, and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ.
mdText: And daily in the temple, and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ.]([/person/jesus_905)
eventsDescribed: Gamaliel advises the counsel and Apostles freed

verseText: And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.
mdText: And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.

verseText: Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples unto them, and said, It is not reason that we should leave the word of God, and serve tables.
mdText: Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples _unto_ _them,_ and said, It is not reason that we should leave the word of [God,]([/person/god_1324) and serve tables.

verseText: Wherefore, brethren, look ye out among you seven men of honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.
mdText: Wherefore, brethren, look ye out among you seven men of honest report, full of the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.

verseText: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministry of the word.
mdText: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministry of the word.

verseText: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:
mdText: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose [Stephen,]([/person/stephen_2802) a man full of faith and of the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, and [Philip,]([/person/philip_2347) and [Prochorus,]([/person/prochorus_2371) and [Nicanor,]([/person/nicanor_2203) and [Timon,]([/person/timon_2862) and [Parmenas,]([/person/parmenas_2272) and [Nicolas]([/person/nicolas_2205) a proselyte of [Antioch:](/place/antioch_68)

verseText: Whom they set before the apostles: and when they had prayed, they laid their hands on them.
mdText: Whom they set before the apostles: and when they had prayed, they laid _their_ hands on them.

verseText: And the word of God increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.
mdText: And the word of [God]([/person/god_1324) increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) greatly; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.

verseText: And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.
mdText: And [Stephen,]([/person/stephen_2802) full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.

verseText: Then there arose certain of the synagogue, which is called the synagogue of the Libertines, and Cyrenians, and Alexandrians, and of them of Cilicia and of Asia, disputing with Stephen.
mdText: Then there arose certain of the synagogue, which is called _the_ _synagogue_ of the Libertines, and Cyrenians, and Alexandrians, and of them of [Cilicia](/place/cilicia_300) and of [Asia,](/place/asia_108) disputing with [Stephen.]([/person/stephen_2802)

verseText: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.
mdText: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.

verseText: Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, and against God.
mdText: Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against [Moses,]([/person/moses_2108) and _against_ [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And they stirred up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and came upon him, and caught him, and brought him to the council,
mdText: And they stirred up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and came upon _him,_ and caught him, and brought _him_ to the council,

verseText: And set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the law:
mdText: And set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the law:

verseText: For we have heard him say, that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the customs which Moses delivered us.
mdText: For we have heard him say, that this [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) of [Nazareth](/place/nazareth_878) shall destroy this place, and shall change the customs which [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) delivered us.

verseText: And all that sat in the council, looking stedfastly on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.
mdText: And all that sat in the council, looking stedfastly on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.

verseText: Then said the high priest, Are these things so?
mdText: Then said the high priest, Are these things so?

verseText: And he said, Men, brethren, and fathers, hearken; The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Charran,
mdText: And he said, Men, brethren, and fathers, hearken; The [God]([/person/god_1324) of glory appeared unto our father [Abraham,]([/person/abraham_58) when he was in [Mesopotamia,](/place/mesopotamia_790) before he dwelt in Charran,

verseText: And said unto him, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.
mdText: And said unto him, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.

verseText: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and dwelt in Charran: and from thence, when his father was dead, he removed him into this land, wherein ye now dwell.
mdText: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and dwelt in Charran: and from thence, when his father was dead, he removed him into this land, wherein ye now dwell.

verseText: And he gave him none inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on: yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when as yet he had no child.
mdText: And he gave him none inheritance in it, no, not _so_ _much_ _as_ to set his foot on: yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when _as_ _yet_ he had no child.

verseText: And God spake on this wise, That his seed should sojourn in a strange land; and that they should bring them into bondage, and entreat them evil four hundred years.
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) spake on this wise, That his seed should sojourn in a strange land; and that they should bring them into bondage, and entreat _them_ evil four hundred years.
