verseText: And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge, said God: and after that shall they come forth, and serve me in this place.
mdText: And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge, said [God:]([/person/god_1324) and after that shall they come forth, and serve me in this place.

verseText: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision: and so Abraham begat Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat the twelve patriarchs.
mdText: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision: and so _[Abraham]([/person/abraham_58)_ begat [Isaac,]([/person/isaac_616) and circumcised him the eighth day; and [Isaac]([/person/isaac_616) _begat_ [Jacob;]([/person/israel_682) and [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) _begat_ the twelve patriarchs.

verseText: And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt: but God was with him,
mdText: And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold [Joseph]([/person/joseph_1710) into [Egypt:](/place/egypt_362) but [God]([/person/god_1324) was with him,

verseText: And delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
mdText: And delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of [Pharaoh]([/person/pharaoh_2329) king of [Egypt;](/place/egypt_362) and he made him governor over [Egypt](/place/egypt_362) and all his house.

verseText: Now there came a dearth over all the land of Egypt and Chanaan, and great affliction: and our fathers found no sustenance.
mdText: Now there came a dearth over all the land of [Egypt](/place/egypt_362) and [Chanaan,](/place/canaan_272) and great affliction: and our fathers found no sustenance.

verseText: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.
mdText: But when [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) heard that there was corn in [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) he sent out our fathers first.

verseText: And at the second time Joseph was made known to his brethren; and Joseph’s kindred was made known unto Pharaoh.
mdText: And at the second _time_ [Joseph]([/person/joseph_1710) was made known to his brethren; and [Joseph’s]([/person/joseph_1710) kindred was made known unto [Pharaoh.]([/person/pharaoh_2329)

verseText: Then sent Joseph, and called his father Jacob to him, and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.
mdText: Then sent [Joseph,]([/person/joseph_1710) and called his father [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) to _him,_ and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.

verseText: So Jacob went down into Egypt, and died, he, and our fathers,
mdText: So [Jacob]([/person/israel_682) went down into [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) and died, he, and our fathers,

verseText: And were carried over into Sychem, and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor the father of Sychem.
mdText: And were carried over into [Sychem,]([/person/shechem_2588) and laid in the sepulchre that [Abraham]([/person/abraham_58) bought for a sum of money of the sons of [Emmor]([/person/hamor_1365) _the_ _father_ of [Sychem.]([/person/shechem_2588)

verseText: But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,
mdText: But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which [God]([/person/god_1324) had sworn to [Abraham,]([/person/abraham_58) the people grew and multiplied in [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362)

verseText: Till another king arose, which knew not Joseph.
mdText: Till another king arose, which knew not [Joseph.]([/person/joseph_1710)

verseText: The same dealt subtilly with our kindred, and evil entreated our fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end they might not live.
mdText: The same dealt subtilly with our kindred, and evil entreated our fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end they might not live.

verseText: In which time Moses was born, and was exceeding fair, and nourished up in his father’s house three months:
mdText: In which time [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) was born, and was exceeding fair, and nourished up in his father’s house three months:

verseText: And when he was cast out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.
mdText: And when he was cast out, [Pharaoh’s]([/person/pharaoh_2331) [daughter]([/person/daughter_of_pharaoh_988) took him up, and nourished him for her own son.

verseText: And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and in deeds.
mdText: And [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and in deeds.

verseText: And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel.
mdText: And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of [Israel.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: And seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged him that was oppressed, and smote the Egyptian:
mdText: And seeing one _of_ _them_ suffer wrong, he defended _him,_ and avenged him that was oppressed, and smote the [Egyptian:](/place/egypt_362)

verseText: For he supposed his brethren would have understood how that God by his hand would deliver them: but they understood not.
mdText: For he supposed his brethren would have understood how that [God]([/person/god_1324) by his hand would deliver them: but they understood not.

verseText: And the next day he shewed himself unto them as they strove, and would have set them at one again, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one to another?
mdText: And the next day he shewed himself unto them as they strove, and would have set them at one again, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one to another?

verseText: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us?
mdText: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us?

verseText: Wilt thou kill me, as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday?
mdText: Wilt thou kill me, as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday?

verseText: Then fled Moses at this saying, and was a stranger in the land of Madian, where he begat two sons.
mdText: Then fled [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) at this saying, and was a stranger in the land of Madian, where he begat two sons.

verseText: And when forty years were expired, there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush.
mdText: And when forty years were expired, there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount [Sina](/place/mount_sinai_855) an angel of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) in a flame of fire in a bush.

verseText: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to behold it, the voice of the Lord came unto him,
mdText: When [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) saw _it,_ he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to behold _it,_ the voice of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) came unto him,

verseText: Saying, I am the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. Then Moses trembled, and durst not behold.
mdText: _Saying,_ I _am_ the [God]([/person/god_1324) of thy fathers, the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Abraham,]([/person/abraham_58) and the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Isaac,]([/person/isaac_616) and the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682) Then [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) trembled, and durst not behold.

verseText: Then said the Lord to him, Put off thy shoes from thy feet: for the place where thou standest is holy ground.
mdText: Then said the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) to him, Put off thy shoes from thy feet: for the place where thou standest is holy ground.

verseText: I have seen, I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning, and am come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send thee into Egypt.
mdText: I have seen, I have seen the affliction of my people which is in [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) and I have heard their groaning, and am come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send thee into [Egypt.](/place/egypt_362)

verseText: This Moses whom they refused, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge? the same did God send to be a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush.
mdText: This [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) whom they refused, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge? the same did [God]([/person/god_1324) send _to_ _be_ a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush.

verseText: He brought them out, after that he had shewed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red sea, and in the wilderness forty years.
mdText: He brought them out, after that he had shewed wonders and signs in the land of [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) and in the [Red](/place/red_sea_986) [sea,](/place/red_sea_986) and in the wilderness forty years.

verseText: This is that Moses, which said unto the children of Israel, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear.
mdText: This is that [Moses,]([/person/moses_2108) which said unto the children of [Israel,]([/person/israel_682) A [prophet]([/person/jesus_905) shall the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) your [God]([/person/god_1324) raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear.

verseText: This is he, that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount Sina, and with our fathers: who received the lively oracles to give unto us:
mdText: This is he, that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount [Sina,](/place/mount_sinai_855) and _with_ our fathers: who received the lively oracles to give unto us:

verseText: To whom our fathers would not obey, but thrust him from them, and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt,
mdText: To whom our fathers would not obey, but thrust _him_ from them, and in their hearts turned back again into [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362)

verseText: Saying unto Aaron, Make us gods to go before us: for as for this Moses, which brought us out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.
mdText: Saying unto [Aaron,]([/person/aaron_1) Make us gods to go before us: for _as_ _for_ this [Moses,]([/person/moses_2108) which brought us out of the land of [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) we wot not what is become of him.

verseText: And they made a calf in those days, and offered sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.
mdText: And they made a calf in those days, and offered sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.

verseText: Then God turned, and gave them up to worship the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, O ye house of Israel, have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices by the space of forty years in the wilderness?
mdText: Then [God]([/person/god_1324) turned, and gave them up to worship the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, O ye house of Israel, have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices _by_ _the_ _space_ _of_ forty years in the wilderness?

verseText: Yea, ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch, and the star of your god Remphan, figures which ye made to worship them: and I will carry you away beyond Babylon.
mdText: Yea, ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch, and the star of your god Remphan, figures which ye made to worship them: and I will carry you away beyond [Babylon.](/place/babylon_151)

verseText: Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as he had appointed, speaking unto Moses, that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen.
mdText: Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as he had appointed, speaking unto [Moses,]([/person/moses_2108) that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen.

verseText: Which also our fathers that came after brought in with Jesus into the possession of the Gentiles, whom God drave out before the face of our fathers, unto the days of David;
mdText: Which also our fathers that came after brought in with [Jesus]([/person/joshua_1727) into the possession of the Gentiles, whom [God]([/person/god_1324) drave out before the face of our fathers, unto the days of [David;]([/person/david_994)

verseText: Who found favour before God, and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
mdText: Who found favour before [God,]([/person/god_1324) and desired to find a tabernacle for the [God]([/person/god_1324) of [Jacob.]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: But Solomon built him an house.
mdText: But [Solomon]([/person/solomon_2762) built him an house.

verseText: Howbeit the most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands; as saith the prophet,
mdText: Howbeit the most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands; as saith the prophet,

verseText: Heaven is my throne, and earth is my footstool: what house will ye build me? saith the Lord: or what is the place of my rest?
mdText: Heaven _is_ my throne, and earth _is_ my footstool: what house will ye build me? saith the [Lord:]([/person/jesus_905) or what _is_ the place of my rest?

verseText: Hath not my hand made all these things?
mdText: Hath not my hand made all these things?

verseText: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Ghost: as your fathers did, so do ye.
mdText: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost: as your fathers _did,_ so _do_ ye.

verseText: Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted? and they have slain them which shewed before of the coming of the Just One; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers:
mdText: Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted? and they have slain them which shewed before of the coming of the Just One; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers:

verseText: Who have received the law by the disposition of angels, and have not kept it.
mdText: Who have received the law by the disposition of angels, and have not kept _it._

verseText: When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with their teeth.
mdText: When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with _their_ teeth.

verseText: But he, being full of the Holy Ghost, looked up stedfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,
mdText: But he, being full of the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, looked up stedfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of [God,]([/person/god_1324) and [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) standing on the right hand of [God,]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And said, Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.
mdText: And said, Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the [Son]([/person/jesus_905) of man standing on the right hand of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Then they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and ran upon him with one accord,
mdText: Then they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and ran upon him with one accord,

verseText: And cast him out of the city, and stoned him: and the witnesses laid down their clothes at a young man’s feet, whose name was Saul.
mdText: And cast _him_ out of the city, and stoned _him:_ and the witnesses laid down their clothes at a young man’s feet, whose name was [Saul.]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: And they stoned Stephen, calling upon God, and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.
mdText: And they stoned [Stephen,]([/person/stephen_2802) calling upon _[God,]([/person/jesus_905)_ and saying, [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) receive my spirit.

verseText: And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge. And when he had said this, he fell asleep.
mdText: And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) lay not this sin to their charge. And when he had said this, he fell asleep.

verseText: And Saul was consenting unto his death. And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria, except the apostles.
mdText: And [Saul]([/person/paul_2479) was consenting unto his death. And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at [Jerusalem;](/place/jerusalem_636) and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of [Judaea](/place/judea_657) and [Samaria,](/place/samaria_1022) except the apostles.

verseText: And devout men carried Stephen to his burial, and made great lamentation over him.
mdText: And devout men carried [Stephen]([/person/stephen_2802) _to_ _his_ _burial,_ and made great lamentation over him.

verseText: As for Saul, he made havock of the church, entering into every house, and haling men and women committed them to prison.
mdText: As for [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) he made havock of the church, entering into every house, and haling men and women committed _them_ to prison.

verseText: Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word.
mdText: Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word.

verseText: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.
mdText: Then [Philip]([/person/philip_2347) went down to the city of [Samaria,](/place/samaria_1022) and preached [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) unto them.

verseText: And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.
mdText: And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which [Philip]([/person/philip_2347) spake, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.

verseText: For unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessed with them: and many taken with palsies, and that were lame, were healed.
mdText: For unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessed _with_ _them:_ and many taken with palsies, and that were lame, were healed.

verseText: And there was great joy in that city.
mdText: And there was great joy in that city.

verseText: But there was a certain man, called Simon, which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, and bewitched the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:
mdText: But there was a certain man, called [Simon,]([/person/simon_2752) which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, and bewitched the people of [Samaria,](/place/samaria_1022) giving out that himself was some great one:

verseText: To whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power of God.
mdText: To whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.
mdText: And to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.

verseText: But when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom of God, and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
mdText: But when they believed [Philip]([/person/philip_2347) preaching the things concerning the kingdom of [God,]([/person/god_1324) and the name of [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ,]([/person/jesus_905) they were baptized, both men and women.

verseText: Then Simon himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.
mdText: Then [Simon]([/person/simon_2753) himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with [Philip,]([/person/philip_2347) and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.

verseText: Now when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John:
mdText: Now when the apostles which were at [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) heard that [Samaria](/place/samaria_1022) had received the word of [God,]([/person/god_1324) they sent unto them [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) and [John:]([/person/john_1677)

verseText: Who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost:
mdText: Who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost:

verseText: For as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)
mdText: (For as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905))

verseText: Then laid they their hands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.
mdText: Then laid they _their_ hands on them, and they received the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost.

verseText: And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,
mdText: And when [Simon]([/person/simon_2752) saw that through laying on of the apostles’ hands the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost was given, he offered them money,

verseText: Saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.
mdText: Saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost.

verseText: But Peter said unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.
mdText: But [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) said unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of [God]([/person/god_1324) may be purchased with money.

verseText: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right in the sight of God.
mdText: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right in the sight of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.
mdText: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray [God,]([/person/god_1324) if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.

verseText: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and in the bond of iniquity.
mdText: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and _in_ the bond of iniquity.

verseText: Then answered Simon, and said, Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.
mdText: Then answered [Simon,]([/person/simon_2752) and said, Pray ye to the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.

verseText: And they, when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.
mdText: And they, when they had testified and preached the word of the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) returned to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.

verseText: And the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is desert.
mdText: And the angel of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) spake unto [Philip,]([/person/philip_2347) saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) unto [Gaza,](/place/gaza_446) which is desert.

verseText: And he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to Jerusalem for to worship,
mdText: And he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under [Candace]([/person/candace_916) queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) for to worship,

verseText: Was returning, and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet.
mdText: Was returning, and sitting in his chariot read [Esaias]([/person/isaiah_617) the prophet.

verseText: Then the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.
mdText: Then the [Spirit]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) said unto [Philip,]([/person/philip_2347) Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.

verseText: And Philip ran thither to him, and heard him read the prophet Esaias, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?
mdText: And [Philip]([/person/philip_2347) ran thither to _him,_ and heard him read the prophet [Esaias,]([/person/isaiah_617) and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?

verseText: And he said, How can I, except some man should guide me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.
mdText: And he said, How can I, except some man should guide me? And he desired [Philip]([/person/philip_2347) that he would come up and sit with him.

verseText: The place of the scripture which he read was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer, so opened he not his mouth:
mdText: The place of the scripture which he read was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer, so opened he not his mouth:

verseText: In his humiliation his judgment was taken away: and who shall declare his generation? for his life is taken from the earth.
mdText: In his humiliation his judgment was taken away: and who shall declare his generation? for his life is taken from the earth.

verseText: And the eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this? of himself, or of some other man?
mdText: And the eunuch answered [Philip,]([/person/philip_2347) and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this? of himself, or of some other man?

verseText: Then Philip opened his mouth, and began at the same scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.
mdText: Then [Philip]([/person/philip_2347) opened his mouth, and began at the same scripture, and preached unto him [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And as they went on their way, they came unto a certain water: and the eunuch said, See, here is water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?
mdText: And as they went on _their_ way, they came unto a certain water: and the eunuch said, See, _here_ _is_ water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?

verseText: And Philip said, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest. And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.
mdText: And [Philip]([/person/philip_2347) said, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest. And he answered and said, I believe that [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) is the [Son]([/person/jesus_905) of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.
mdText: And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both [Philip]([/person/philip_2347) and the eunuch; and he baptized him.

verseText: And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went on his way rejoicing.
mdText: And when they were come up out of the water, the [Spirit]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) caught away [Philip,]([/person/philip_2347) that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went on his way rejoicing.

verseText: But Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached in all the cities, till he came to Caesarea.
mdText: But [Philip]([/person/philip_2347) was found at [Azotus:](/place/azotus_132) and passing through he preached in all the cities, till he came to [Caesarea.](/place/caesarea_266)

verseText: And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,
mdText: And [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) went unto the high priest,

verseText: And desired of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues, that if he found any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem.
mdText: And desired of him letters to [Damascus](/place/damascus_322) to the synagogues, that if he found any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: And as he journeyed, he came near Damascus: and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven:
mdText: And as he journeyed, he came near [Damascus:](/place/damascus_322) and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven:

verseText: And he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
mdText: And he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him, [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) why persecutest thou me?

verseText: And he said, Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest: it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
mdText: And he said, Who art thou, [Lord?]([/person/jesus_905) And the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) said, I am [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) whom thou persecutest: _it_ _is_ hard for thee to kick against the pricks.

verseText: And he trembling and astonished said, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do? And the Lord said unto him, Arise, and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.
mdText: And he trembling and astonished said, [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) what wilt thou have me to do? And the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) _said_ unto him, Arise, and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.

verseText: And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.
mdText: And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.

verseText: And Saul arose from the earth; and when his eyes were opened, he saw no man: but they led him by the hand, and brought him into Damascus.
mdText: And [Saul]([/person/paul_2479) arose from the earth; and when his eyes were opened, he saw no man: but they led him by the hand, and brought _him_ into [Damascus.](/place/damascus_322)

verseText: And he was three days without sight, and neither did eat nor drink.
mdText: And he was three days without sight, and neither did eat nor drink.

verseText: And there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and to him said the Lord in a vision, Ananias. And he said, Behold, I am here, Lord.
mdText: And there was a certain disciple at [Damascus,](/place/damascus_322) named [Ananias;]([/person/ananias_259) and to him said the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) in a vision, [Ananias.]([/person/ananias_259) And he said, Behold, I _am_ _here,_ [Lord.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And the Lord said unto him, Arise, and go into the street which is called Straight, and enquire in the house of Judas for one called Saul, of Tarsus: for, behold, he prayeth,
mdText: And the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) _said_ unto him, Arise, and go into the street which is called [Straight,](/place/straight_1112) and enquire in the house of [Judas]([/person/judas_1758) for _one_ called [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) of [Tarsus:](/place/tarsus_1140) for, behold, he prayeth,

verseText: And hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in, and putting his hand on him, that he might receive his sight.
mdText: And hath seen in a vision a man named [Ananias]([/person/ananias_259) coming in, and putting _his_ hand on him, that he might receive his sight.

verseText: Then Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard by many of this man, how much evil he hath done to thy saints at Jerusalem:
mdText: Then [Ananias]([/person/ananias_259) answered, [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) I have heard by many of this man, how much evil he hath done to thy saints at [Jerusalem:](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: And here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name.
mdText: And here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name.

verseText: But the Lord said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles, and kings, and the children of Israel:
mdText: But the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles, and kings, and the children of [Israel:]([/person/israel_682)

verseText: For I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name’s sake.
mdText: For I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name’s sake.

verseText: And Ananias went his way, and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord, even Jesus, that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight, and be filled with the Holy Ghost.
mdText: And [Ananias]([/person/ananias_259) went his way, and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him said, Brother [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) _even_ [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight, and be filled with the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost.

verseText: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales: and he received sight forthwith, and arose, and was baptized.
mdText: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales: and he received sight forthwith, and arose, and was baptized.

verseText: And when he had received meat, he was strengthened. Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.
mdText: And when he had received meat, he was strengthened. Then was [Saul]([/person/paul_2479) certain days with the disciples which were at [Damascus.](/place/damascus_322)

verseText: And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.
mdText: And straightway he preached [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) in the synagogues, that he is the [Son]([/person/jesus_905) of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: But all that heard him were amazed, and said; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Jerusalem, and came hither for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests?
mdText: But all that heard _him_ were amazed, and said; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) and came hither for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests?

verseText: But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is very Christ.
mdText: But [Saul]([/person/paul_2479) increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at [Damascus,](/place/damascus_322) proving that this is very [Christ.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:
mdText: And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:

verseText: But their laying await was known of Saul. And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.
mdText: But their laying await was known of [Saul.]([/person/paul_2479) And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.

verseText: Then the disciples took him by night, and let him down by the wall in a basket.
mdText: Then the disciples took him by night, and let _him_ down by the wall in a basket.

verseText: And when Saul was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believed not that he was a disciple.
mdText: And when [Saul]([/person/paul_2479) was come to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) he assayed to join himself to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believed not that he was a disciple.

verseText: But Barnabas took him, and brought him to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.
mdText: But [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) took him, and brought _him_ to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at [Damascus](/place/damascus_322) in the name of [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem.
mdText: And he was with them coming in and going out at [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus, and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.
mdText: And he spake boldly in the name of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.

verseText: Which when the brethren knew, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.
mdText: _Which_ when the brethren knew, they brought him down to [Caesarea,](/place/caesarea_266) and sent him forth to [Tarsus.](/place/tarsus_1140)

verseText: Then had the churches rest throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria, and were edified; and walking in the fear of the Lord, and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, were multiplied.
mdText: Then had the churches rest throughout all [Judaea](/place/judea_657) and [Galilee](/place/galilee_433) and [Samaria,](/place/samaria_1022) and were edified; and walking in the fear of the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) and in the comfort of the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, were multiplied.

verseText: And it came to pass, as Peter passed throughout all quarters, he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.
mdText: And it came to pass, as [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) passed throughout all _quarters,_ he came down also to the saints which dwelt at [Lydda.](/place/lydda_741)

verseText: And there he found a certain man named Aeneas, which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.
mdText: And there he found a certain man named [Aeneas,]([/person/aeneas_106) which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.

verseText: And Peter said unto him, Aeneas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed. And he arose immediately.
mdText: And [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) said unto him, [Aeneas,]([/person/aeneas_106) [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed. And he arose immediately.

verseText: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him, and turned to the Lord.
mdText: And all that dwelt at [Lydda](/place/lydda_741) and [Saron](/place/saron_1063) saw him, and turned to the [Lord.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.
mdText: Now there was at [Joppa](/place/joppa_652) a certain disciple named [Tabitha,]([/person/dorcas_2810) which by interpretation is called [Dorcas:]([/person/dorcas_2810) this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.

verseText: And it came to pass in those days, that she was sick, and died: whom when they had washed, they laid her in an upper chamber.
mdText: And it came to pass in those days, that she was sick, and died: whom when they had washed, they laid _her_ in an upper chamber.

verseText: And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring him that he would not delay to come to them.
mdText: And forasmuch as [Lydda](/place/lydda_741) was nigh to [Joppa,](/place/joppa_652) and the disciples had heard that [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring _him_ that he would not delay to come to them.

verseText: Then Peter arose and went with them. When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them.
mdText: Then [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) arose and went with them. When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing the coats and garments which [Dorcas]([/person/dorcas_2810) made, while she was with them.

verseText: But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turning him to the body said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes: and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
mdText: But [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turning _him_ to the body said, [Tabitha,]([/person/dorcas_2810) arise. And she opened her eyes: and when she saw [Peter,]([/person/peter_2745) she sat up.

verseText: And he gave her his hand, and lifted her up, and when he had called the saints and widows, presented her alive.
mdText: And he gave her _his_ hand, and lifted her up, and when he had called the saints and widows, presented her alive.

verseText: And it was known throughout all Joppa; and many believed in the Lord.
mdText: And it was known throughout all [Joppa;](/place/joppa_652) and many believed in the [Lord.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.
mdText: And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in [Joppa](/place/joppa_652) with one [Simon]([/person/simon_2753) a tanner.

verseText: There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the band called the Italian band,
mdText: There was a certain man in [Caesarea](/place/caesarea_266) called [Cornelius,]([/person/cornelius_956) a centurion of the band called the Italian _band,_

verseText: A devout man, and one that feared God with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God alway.
mdText: _A_ devout _man,_ and one that feared [God]([/person/god_1324) with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed to [God]([/person/god_1324) alway.

verseText: He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him, and saying unto him, Cornelius.
mdText: He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of [God]([/person/god_1324) coming in to him, and saying unto him, [Cornelius.]([/person/cornelius_956)

verseText: And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God.
mdText: And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, [Lord?]([/person/jesus_905) And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And now send men to Joppa, and call for one Simon, whose surname is Peter:
mdText: And now send men to [Joppa,](/place/joppa_652) and call for _one_ [Simon,]([/person/peter_2745) whose surname is [Peter:]([/person/peter_2745)

verseText: He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.
mdText: He lodgeth with one [Simon]([/person/simon_2753) a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.

verseText: And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;
mdText: And when the angel which spake unto [Cornelius]([/person/cornelius_956) was departed, he called two of his household servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;

verseText: And when he had declared all these things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.
mdText: And when he had declared all _these_ things unto them, he sent them to [Joppa.](/place/joppa_652)

verseText: On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour:
mdText: On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour:

verseText: And he became very hungry, and would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance,
mdText: And he became very hungry, and would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance,

verseText: And saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth:
mdText: And saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth:

verseText: Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.
mdText: Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.

verseText: And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter; kill, and eat.
mdText: And there came a voice to him, Rise, [Peter;]([/person/peter_2745) kill, and eat.

verseText: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.
mdText: But [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) said, Not so, [Lord;]([/person/jesus_905) for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.

verseText: And the voice spake unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.
mdText: And the voice _spake_ unto him again the second time, What [God]([/person/god_1324) hath cleansed, _that_ call not thou common.

verseText: This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.
mdText: This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.

verseText: Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from Cornelius had made enquiry for Simon’s house, and stood before the gate,
mdText: Now while [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from [Cornelius]([/person/cornelius_956) had made enquiry for [Simon’s]([/person/simon_2750) house, and stood before the gate,

verseText: And called, and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.
mdText: And called, and asked whether [Simon,]([/person/peter_2745) which was surnamed [Peter,]([/person/peter_2745) were lodged there.

verseText: While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.
mdText: While [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) thought on the vision, the [Spirit]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.

verseText: Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.
mdText: Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.

verseText: Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius; and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what is the cause wherefore ye are come?
mdText: Then [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) went down to the men which were sent unto him from [Cornelius;]([/person/cornelius_956) and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what _is_ the cause wherefore ye are come?

verseText: And they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words of thee.
mdText: And they said, [Cornelius]([/person/cornelius_956) the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth [God,]([/person/god_1324) and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from [God]([/person/god_1324) by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words of thee.

verseText: Then called he them in, and lodged them. And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
mdText: Then called he them in, and lodged _them._ And on the morrow [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) went away with them, and certain brethren from [Joppa](/place/joppa_652) accompanied him.

verseText: And the morrow after they entered into Caesarea. And Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.
mdText: And the morrow after they entered into [Caesarea.](/place/caesarea_266) And [Cornelius]([/person/cornelius_956) waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.

verseText: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped him.
mdText: And as [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) was coming in, [Cornelius]([/person/cornelius_956) met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped _him._

verseText: But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.
mdText: But [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.

verseText: And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.
mdText: And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.

verseText: And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.
mdText: And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but [God]([/person/god_1324) hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.

verseText: Therefore came I unto you without gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?
mdText: Therefore came I _unto_ _you_ without gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?

verseText: And Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,
mdText: And [Cornelius]([/person/cornelius_956) said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,

verseText: And said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.
mdText: And said, [Cornelius,]([/person/cornelius_956) thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Send therefore to Joppa, and call hither Simon, whose surname is Peter; he is lodged in the house of one Simon a tanner by the sea side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.
mdText: Send therefore to [Joppa,](/place/joppa_652) and call hither [Simon,]([/person/simon_2753) whose surname is [Peter;]([/person/peter_2745) he is lodged in the house of _one_ [Simon]([/person/simon_2753) a tanner by the sea side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.

verseText: Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore are we all here present before God, to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.
mdText: Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore are we all here present before [God,]([/person/god_1324) to hear all things that are commanded thee of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Then Peter opened his mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:
mdText: Then [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) opened _his_ mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that [God]([/person/god_1324) is no respecter of persons:
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: But in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.
mdText: But in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: The word which God sent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ: (he is Lord of all:)
mdText: The word which _[God]([/person/jesus_905)_ sent unto the children of [Israel,]([/person/israel_682) preaching peace by [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ:]([/person/jesus_905) (he is [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) of all:)
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: That word, I say, ye know, which was published throughout all Judaea, and began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;
mdText: That word, _I_ _say,_ ye know, which was published throughout all [Judaea,](/place/judea_657) and began from [Galilee,](/place/galilee_433) after the baptism which [John]([/person/john_1676) preached;
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.
mdText: How [God]([/person/god_1324) anointed [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) of [Nazareth](/place/nazareth_878) with the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for [God]([/person/god_1324) was with him.
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they slew and hanged on a tree:
mdText: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in [Jerusalem;](/place/jerusalem_636) whom they slew and hanged on a tree:
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: Him God raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;
mdText: Him [God]([/person/god_1324) raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: Not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God, even to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.
mdText: Not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of [God,]([/person/god_1324) _even_ to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God to be the Judge of quick and dead.
mdText: And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of [God]([/person/god_1324) _to_ _be_ the [Judge]([/person/jesus_905) of quick and dead.
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.
mdText: To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.
mdText: While [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) yet spake these words, the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost.
mdText: And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with [Peter,]([/person/peter_2745) because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost.
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,
mdText: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify [God.]([/person/god_1324) Then answered [Peter,]([/person/peter_2745)
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?
mdText: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost as well as we?
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.
mdText: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the [Lord.]([/person/jesus_905) Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.
eventsDescribed: Peter preaches to gentiles in Caesarea

verseText: And the apostles and brethren that were in Judaea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.
mdText: And the apostles and brethren that were in [Judaea](/place/judea_657) heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,
mdText: And when [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) was come up to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) they that were of the circumcision contended with him,

verseText: Saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.
mdText: Saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.

verseText: But Peter rehearsed the matter from the beginning, and expounded it by order unto them, saying,
mdText: But [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) rehearsed _the_ _matter_ from the beginning, and expounded _it_ by order unto them, saying,

verseText: I was in the city of Joppa praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, A certain vessel descend, as it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even to me:
mdText: I was in the city of [Joppa](/place/joppa_652) praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, A certain vessel descend, as it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even to me:

verseText: Upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.
mdText: Upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.

verseText: And I heard a voice saying unto me, Arise, Peter; slay and eat.
mdText: And I heard a voice saying unto me, Arise, [Peter;]([/person/peter_2745) slay and eat.

verseText: But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.
mdText: But I said, Not so, [Lord:]([/person/jesus_905) for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.

verseText: But the voice answered me again from heaven, What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.
mdText: But the voice answered me again from heaven, What [God]([/person/god_1324) hath cleansed, _that_ call not thou common.

verseText: And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.
mdText: And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.

verseText: And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from Caesarea unto me.
mdText: And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from [Caesarea](/place/caesarea_266) unto me.

verseText: And the Spirit bade me go with them, nothing doubting. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man’s house:
mdText: And the [Spirit]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) bade me go with them, nothing doubting. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man’s house:

verseText: And he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter;
mdText: And he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to [Joppa,](/place/joppa_652) and call for [Simon,]([/person/peter_2745) whose surname is [Peter;]([/person/peter_2745)

verseText: Who shall tell thee words, whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved.
mdText: Who shall tell thee words, whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved.

verseText: And as I began to speak, the Holy Ghost fell on them, as on us at the beginning.
mdText: And as I began to speak, the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost fell on them, as on us at the beginning.

verseText: Then remembered I the word of the Lord, how that he said, John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.
mdText: Then remembered I the word of the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) how that he said, [John]([/person/john_1676) indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost.

verseText: Forasmuch then as God gave them the like gift as he did unto us, who believed on the Lord Jesus Christ; what was I, that I could withstand God?
mdText: Forasmuch then as [God]([/person/god_1324) gave them the like gift as _he_ _did_ unto us, who believed on the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ;]([/person/jesus_905) what was I, that I could withstand [God?]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.
mdText: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified [God,]([/person/god_1324) saying, Then hath [God]([/person/god_1324) also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.

verseText: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice, and Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only.
mdText: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about [Stephen]([/person/stephen_2802) travelled as far as [Phenice,](/place/phenicia_944) and [Cyprus,](/place/cyprus_316) and [Antioch,](/place/antioch_68) preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only.

verseText: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, which, when they were come to Antioch, spake unto the Grecians, preaching the Lord Jesus.
mdText: And some of them were men of [Cyprus](/place/cyprus_316) and [Cyrene,](/place/cyrene_317) which, when they were come to [Antioch,](/place/antioch_68) spake unto the Grecians, preaching the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number believed, and turned unto the Lord.
mdText: And the hand of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) was with them: and a great number believed, and turned unto the [Lord.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem: and they sent forth Barnabas, that he should go as far as Antioch.
mdText: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in [Jerusalem:](/place/jerusalem_636) and they sent forth [Barnabas,]([/person/barnabas_1722) that he should go as far as [Antioch.](/place/antioch_68)

verseText: Who, when he came, and had seen the grace of God, was glad, and exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord.
mdText: Who, when he came, and had seen the grace of [God,]([/person/god_1324) was glad, and exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the [Lord.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith: and much people was added unto the Lord.
mdText: For he was a good man, and full of the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost and of faith: and much people was added unto the [Lord.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus, for to seek Saul:
mdText: Then departed [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) to [Tarsus,](/place/tarsus_1140) for to seek [Saul:]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: And when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch. And it came to pass, that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church, and taught much people. And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.
mdText: And when he had found him, he brought him unto [Antioch.](/place/antioch_68) And it came to pass, that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church, and taught much people. And the disciples were called Christians first in [Antioch.](/place/antioch_68)

verseText: And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.
mdText: And in these days came prophets from [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) unto [Antioch.](/place/antioch_68)

verseText: And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the Spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar.
mdText: And there stood up one of them named [Agabus,]([/person/agabus_107) and signified by the [Spirit]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of [Claudius]([/person/claudius_947) Caesar.

verseText: Then the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in Judaea:
mdText: Then the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in [Judaea:](/place/judea_657)

verseText: Which also they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.
mdText: Which also they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) and [Saul.]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: Now about that time Herod the king stretched forth his hands to vex certain of the church.
mdText: Now about that time [Herod]([/person/herod_1506) the king stretched forth _his_ hands to vex certain of the church.

verseText: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
mdText: And he killed [James]([/person/james_717) the brother of [John]([/person/john_1677) with the sword.

verseText: And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also. (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)
mdText: And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) also. (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)

verseText: And when he had apprehended him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.
mdText: And when he had apprehended him, he put _him_ in prison, and delivered _him_ to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.

verseText: Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him.
mdText: [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto [God]([/person/god_1324) for him.

verseText: And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.
mdText: And when [Herod]([/person/herod_1506) would have brought him forth, the same night [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: And, behold, the angel of the Lord came upon him, and a light shined in the prison: and he smote Peter on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise up quickly. And his chains fell off from his hands.
mdText: And, behold, the angel of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) came upon _him,_ and a light shined in the prison: and he smote [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise up quickly. And his chains fell off from _his_ hands.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And so he did. And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.
mdText: And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And so he did. And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: And he went out, and followed him; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.
mdText: And he went out, and followed him; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: When they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which opened to them of his own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and forthwith the angel departed from him.
mdText: When they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which opened to them of his own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and forthwith the angel departed from him.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety, that the Lord hath sent his angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews.
mdText: And when [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety, that the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) hath sent his angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of [Herod,]([/person/herod_1506) and _from_ all the expectation of the people of the Jews.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: And when he had considered the thing, he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together praying.
mdText: And when he had considered _the_ _thing,_ he came to the house of [Mary]([/person/mary_1941) the mother of [John,]([/person/mark_1679) whose surname was [Mark;]([/person/mark_1679) where many were gathered together praying.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.
mdText: And as [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named [Rhoda.]([/person/rhoda_2439)
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: And when she knew Peter’s voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in, and told how Peter stood before the gate.
mdText: And when she knew [Peter’s]([/person/peter_2745) voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in, and told how [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) stood before the gate.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she constantly affirmed that it was even so. Then said they, It is his angel.
mdText: And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she constantly affirmed that it was even so. Then said they, It is his angel.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: But Peter continued knocking: and when they had opened the door, and saw him, they were astonished.
mdText: But [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) continued knocking: and when they had opened _the_ _door,_ and saw him, they were astonished.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go shew these things unto James, and to the brethren. And he departed, and went into another place.
mdText: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go shew these things unto [James,]([/person/james_719) and to the brethren. And he departed, and went into another place.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.
mdText: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of [Peter.]([/person/peter_2745)
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded that they should be put to death. And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea, and there abode.
mdText: And when [Herod]([/person/herod_1506) had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded that _they_ should be put to death. And he went down from [Judaea](/place/judea_657) to [Caesarea,](/place/caesarea_266) and _there_ abode.
eventsDescribed: An angel rescues Peter from prison

verseText: And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: but they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king’s chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king’s country.
mdText: And [Herod]([/person/herod_1506) was highly displeased with them of [Tyre](/place/tyre_1184) and [Sidon:](/place/sidon_1093) but they came with one accord to him, and, having made [Blastus]([/person/blastus_518) the king’s chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king’s _country._

verseText: And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.
mdText: And upon a set day [Herod,]([/person/herod_1506) arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.

verseText: And the people gave a shout, saying, It is the voice of a god, and not of a man.
mdText: And the people gave a shout, _saying,_ _It_ _is_ the voice of a god, and not of a man.

verseText: And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.
mdText: And immediately the angel of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) smote him, because he gave not [God]([/person/god_1324) the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.

verseText: But the word of God grew and multiplied.
mdText: But the word of [God]([/person/god_1324) grew and multiplied.

verseText: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their ministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.
mdText: And [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) and [Saul]([/person/paul_2479) returned from [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) when they had fulfilled _their_ ministry, and took with them [John,]([/person/mark_1679) whose surname was [Mark.]([/person/mark_1679)

verseText: Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers; as Barnabas, and Simeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
mdText: Now there were in the church that was at [Antioch](/place/antioch_68) certain prophets and teachers; as [Barnabas,]([/person/barnabas_1722) and [Simeon]([/person/simeon_2744) that was called [Niger,]([/person/simeon_2744) and [Lucius]([/person/lucius_1833) of [Cyrene,](/place/cyrene_317) and [Manaen,]([/person/manaen_1926) which had been brought up with [Herod]([/person/herod_1505) the tetrarch, and [Saul.]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: As they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.
mdText: As they ministered to the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) and fasted, the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost said, Separate me [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) and [Saul]([/person/paul_2479) for the work whereunto I have called them.

verseText: And when they had fasted and prayed, and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.
mdText: And when they had fasted and prayed, and laid _their_ hands on them, they sent _them_ away.

verseText: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.
mdText: So they, being sent forth by the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, departed unto [Seleucia;](/place/seleucia_1045) and from thence they sailed to [Cyprus.](/place/cyprus_316)
eventsDescribed: Barnabas and Saul go to Cyprus

verseText: And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John to their minister.
mdText: And when they were at [Salamis,](/place/salamis_1016) they preached the word of [God]([/person/god_1324) in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also [John]([/person/mark_1679) to _their_ minister.
eventsDescribed: Barnabas and Saul go to Cyprus

verseText: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar-jesus:
mdText: And when they had gone through the isle unto [Paphos,](/place/paphos_919) they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name _was_ Bar-jesus:
eventsDescribed: Barnabas and Saul go to Cyprus

verseText: Which was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.
mdText: Which was with the deputy of the country, [Sergius]([/person/sergius_2502) [Paulus,]([/person/sergius_2502) a prudent man; who called for [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) and [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) and desired to hear the word of [God.]([/person/god_1324)
eventsDescribed: Barnabas and Saul go to Cyprus

verseText: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.
mdText: But [Elymas]([/person/elymas_403) the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.
eventsDescribed: Barnabas and Saul go to Cyprus

verseText: Then Saul, (who also is called Paul,) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,
mdText: Then [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) (who also _is_ _called_ [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479)) filled with the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, set his eyes on him,
eventsDescribed: Barnabas and Saul go to Cyprus

verseText: And said, O full of all subtilty and all mischief, thou child of the devil, thou enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?
mdText: And said, O full of all subtilty and all mischief, _thou_ child of the devil, _thou_ enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the [Lord?]([/person/jesus_905)
eventsDescribed: Barnabas and Saul go to Cyprus

verseText: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.
mdText: And now, behold, the hand of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) _is_ upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.
