eventsDescribed: Barnabas and Saul go to Cyprus

verseText: Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.
mdText: Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the [Lord.]([/person/jesus_905)
eventsDescribed: Barnabas and Saul go to Cyprus

verseText: Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem.
mdText: Now when [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and his company loosed from [Paphos,](/place/paphos_919) they came to [Perga](/place/perga_936) in [Pamphylia:](/place/pamphylia_918) and [John]([/person/mark_1679) departing from them returned to [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.
mdText: But when they departed from [Perga,](/place/perga_936) they came to [Antioch](/place/antioch_69) in [Pisidia,](/place/pisidia_952) and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.

verseText: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, Ye men and brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.
mdText: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, _Ye_ men _and_ brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.

verseText: Then Paul stood up, and beckoning with his hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, give audience.
mdText: Then [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) stood up, and beckoning with _his_ hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear [God,]([/person/god_1324) give audience.

verseText: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with an high arm brought he them out of it.
mdText: The [God]([/person/god_1324) of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of [Egypt,](/place/egypt_362) and with an high arm brought he them out of it.

verseText: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.
mdText: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.

verseText: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan, he divided their land to them by lot.
mdText: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of [Chanaan,](/place/canaan_272) he divided their land to them by lot.

verseText: And after that he gave unto them judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.
mdText: And after that he gave _unto_ _them_ judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until [Samuel]([/person/samuel_2469) the prophet.

verseText: And afterward they desired a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, by the space of forty years.
mdText: And afterward they desired a king: and [God]([/person/god_1324) gave unto them Saul the son of [Cis,]([/person/kish_1784) a man of the tribe of [Benjamin,]([/person/benjamin_463) by the space of forty years.

verseText: And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them David to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.
mdText: And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them [David]([/person/david_994) to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, I have found [David]([/person/david_994) the _son_ of [Jesse,]([/person/jesse_903) a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.

verseText: Of this man’s seed hath God according to his promise raised unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus:
mdText: Of this man’s seed hath [God]([/person/god_1324) according to _his_ promise raised unto Israel a [Saviour,]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus:]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
mdText: When [John]([/person/john_1676) had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

verseText: And as John fulfilled his course, he said, Whom think ye that I am? I am not he. But, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes of his feet I am not worthy to loose.
mdText: And as [John]([/person/john_1676) fulfilled his course, he said, Whom think ye that I am? I am not _he._ But, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes of _his_ feet I am not worthy to loose.

verseText: Men and brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.
mdText: Men _and_ brethren, children of the stock of [Abraham,]([/person/abraham_58) and whosoever among you feareth [God,]([/person/god_1324) to you is the word of this salvation sent.

verseText: For they that dwell at Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilled them in condemning him.
mdText: For they that dwell at [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilled _them_ in condemning _him._

verseText: And though they found no cause of death in him, yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain.
mdText: And though they found no cause of death _in_ _him,_ yet desired they [Pilate]([/person/pilate_2365) that he should be slain.

verseText: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a sepulchre.
mdText: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took _him_ down from the tree, and laid _him_ in a sepulchre.

verseText: But God raised him from the dead:
mdText: But [God]([/person/god_1324) raised him from the dead:

verseText: And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses unto the people.
mdText: And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from [Galilee](/place/galilee_433) to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) who are his witnesses unto the people.

verseText: And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,
mdText: And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,

verseText: God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that he hath raised up Jesus again; as it is also written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that he hath raised up [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) again; as it is also written in the second psalm, Thou art my [Son,]([/person/jesus_905) this day have I begotten thee.

verseText: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he said on this wise, I will give you the sure mercies of David.
mdText: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, _now_ no more to return to corruption, he said on this wise, I will give you the sure mercies of [David.]([/person/david_994)

verseText: Wherefore he saith also in another psalm, Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
mdText: Wherefore he saith also in another _psalm,_ Thou shalt not suffer thine [Holy]([/person/jesus_905) One to see corruption.

verseText: For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:
mdText: For [David,]([/person/david_994) after he had served his own generation by the will of [God,]([/person/god_1324) fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:

verseText: But he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.
mdText: But he, whom [God]([/person/god_1324) raised again, saw no corruption.

verseText: Be it known unto you therefore, men and brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins:
mdText: Be it known unto you therefore, men _and_ brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins:

verseText: And by him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.
mdText: And by him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of [Moses.]([/person/moses_2108)

verseText: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the prophets;
mdText: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the prophets;

verseText: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish: for I work a work in your days, a work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.
mdText: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish: for I work a work in your days, a work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.

verseText: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath.
mdText: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath.

verseText: Now when the congregation was broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.
mdText: Now when the congregation was broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Barnabas:]([/person/barnabas_1722) who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God.
mdText: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy, and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.
mdText: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy, and spake against those things which were spoken by [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) contradicting and blaspheming.

verseText: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.
mdText: Then [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) waxed bold, and said, It was necessary that the word of [God]([/person/god_1324) should first have been spoken to you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.

verseText: For so hath the Lord commanded us, saying, I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.
mdText: For so hath the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) commanded us, _saying,_ I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.

verseText: And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.
mdText: And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of the [Lord:]([/person/jesus_905) and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.

verseText: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.
mdText: And the word of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) was published throughout all the region.

verseText: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their coasts.
mdText: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Barnabas,]([/person/barnabas_1722) and expelled them out of their coasts.

verseText: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.
mdText: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto [Iconium.](/place/iconium_590)

verseText: And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the Holy Ghost.
mdText: And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost.

verseText: And it came to pass in Iconium, that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.
mdText: And it came to pass in [Iconium,](/place/iconium_590) that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.

verseText: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.
mdText: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.

verseText: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
mdText: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

verseText: But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.
mdText: But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.

verseText: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and also of the Jews with their rulers, to use them despitefully, and to stone them,
mdText: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and also of the Jews with their rulers, to use _them_ despitefully, and to stone them,

verseText: They were ware of it, and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about:
mdText: They were ware of _it,_ and fled unto [Lystra](/place/lystra_742) and [Derbe,](/place/derbe_330) cities of [Lycaonia,](/place/lycaonia_739) and unto the region that lieth round about:

verseText: And there they preached the gospel.
mdText: And there they preached the gospel.

verseText: And there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked:
mdText: And there sat a certain man at [Lystra,](/place/lystra_742) impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked:

verseText: The same heard Paul speak: who stedfastly beholding him, and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,
mdText: The same heard [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) speak: who stedfastly beholding him, and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,

verseText: Said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped and walked.
mdText: Said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped and walked.

verseText: And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.
mdText: And when the people saw what [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.

verseText: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.
mdText: And they called [Barnabas,]([/person/barnabas_1722) [Jupiter;]([/person/barnabas_1722) and [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) [Mercurius,]([/person/paul_2479) because he was the chief speaker.

verseText: Then the priest of Jupiter, which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.
mdText: Then the priest of [Jupiter,]([/person/barnabas_1722) which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.

verseText: Which when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard of, they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,
mdText: _Which_ when the apostles, [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) and [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) heard _of,_ they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,

verseText: And saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:
mdText: And saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living [God,]([/person/god_1324) which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:

verseText: Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.
mdText: Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.

verseText: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.
mdText: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.

verseText: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.
mdText: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.

verseText: And there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium, who persuaded the people, and, having stoned Paul, drew him out of the city, supposing he had been dead.
mdText: And there came thither _certain_ Jews from [Antioch](/place/antioch_69) and [Iconium,](/place/iconium_590) who persuaded the people, and, having stoned [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) drew _him_ out of the city, supposing he had been dead.

verseText: Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and came into the city: and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.
mdText: Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and came into the city: and the next day he departed with [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) to [Derbe.](/place/derbe_330)

verseText: And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra, and to Iconium, and Antioch,
mdText: And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned again to [Lystra,](/place/lystra_742) and _to_ [Iconium,](/place/iconium_590) and [Antioch,](/place/antioch_69)

verseText: Confirming the souls of the disciples, and exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.
mdText: Confirming the souls of the disciples, _and_ exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And when they had ordained them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they believed.
mdText: And when they had ordained them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) on whom they believed.

verseText: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
mdText: And after they had passed throughout [Pisidia,](/place/pisidia_952) they came to [Pamphylia.](/place/pamphylia_918)

verseText: And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia:
mdText: And when they had preached the word in [Perga,](/place/perga_936) they went down into [Attalia:](/place/attalia_120)

verseText: And thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled.
mdText: And thence sailed to [Antioch,](/place/antioch_68) from whence they had been recommended to the grace of [God]([/person/god_1324) for the work which they fulfilled.

verseText: And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all that God had done with them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.
mdText: And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all that [God]([/person/god_1324) had done with them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.

verseText: And there they abode long time with the disciples.
mdText: And there they abode long time with the disciples.

verseText: And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren, and said, Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.
mdText: And certain men which came down from [Judaea](/place/judea_657) taught the brethren, _and_ _said,_ Except ye be circumcised after the manner of [Moses,]([/person/moses_2108) ye cannot be saved.

verseText: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.
mdText: When therefore [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Barnabas,]([/person/barnabas_1722) and certain other of them, should go up to [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) unto the apostles and elders about this question.

verseText: And being brought on their way by the church, they passed through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.
mdText: And being brought on their way by the church, they passed through [Phenice](/place/phenicia_944) and [Samaria,](/place/samaria_1022) declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.

verseText: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church, and of the apostles and elders, and they declared all things that God had done with them.
mdText: And when they were come to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) they were received of the church, and _of_ the apostles and elders, and they declared all things that [God]([/person/god_1324) had done with them.

verseText: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the law of Moses.
mdText: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them, and to command _them_ to keep the law of [Moses.]([/person/moses_2108)

verseText: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.
mdText: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.

verseText: And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Men and brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.
mdText: And when there had been much disputing, [Peter]([/person/peter_2745) rose up, and said unto them, Men _and_ brethren, ye know how that a good while ago [God]([/person/god_1324) made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.

verseText: And God, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even as he did unto us;
mdText: And [God,]([/person/god_1324) which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, even as _he_ _did_ unto us;

verseText: And put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.
mdText: And put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.

verseText: Now therefore why tempt ye God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
mdText: Now therefore why tempt ye [God,]([/person/god_1324) to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?

verseText: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.
mdText: But we believe that through the grace of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) we shall be saved, even as they.

verseText: Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul, declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.
mdText: Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) and [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) declaring what miracles and wonders [God]([/person/god_1324) had wrought among the Gentiles by them.

verseText: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Men and brethren, hearken unto me:
mdText: And after they had held their peace, [James]([/person/james_719) answered, saying, Men _and_ brethren, hearken unto me:

verseText: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.
mdText: [Simeon]([/person/peter_2745) hath declared how [God]([/person/god_1324) at the first did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.

verseText: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,
mdText: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,

verseText: After this I will return, and will build again the tabernacle of David, which is fallen down; and I will build again the ruins thereof, and I will set it up:
mdText: After this I will return, and will build again the tabernacle of [David,]([/person/david_994) which is fallen down; and I will build again the ruins thereof, and I will set it up:

verseText: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord, and all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called, saith the Lord, who doeth all these things.
mdText: That the residue of men might seek after the [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) and all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called, saith the [Lord,]([/person/god_1324) who doeth all these things.

verseText: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.
mdText: Known unto [God]([/person/god_1324) are all his works from the beginning of the world.

verseText: Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to God:
mdText: Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to [God:]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: But that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, and from fornication, and from things strangled, and from blood.
mdText: But that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, and _from_ fornication, and _from_ things strangled, and _from_ blood.

verseText: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.
mdText: For [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) of old time hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.

verseText: Then pleased it the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; namely, Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:
mdText: Then pleased it the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to [Antioch](/place/antioch_68) with [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Barnabas;]([/person/barnabas_1722) _namely,_ [Judas]([/person/judas_1759) surnamed [Barsabas,]([/person/judas_1759) and [Silas,]([/person/silas_2740) chief men among the brethren:

verseText: And they wrote letters by them after this manner; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:
mdText: And they wrote _letters_ by them after this manner; The apostles and elders and brethren _send_ greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in [Antioch](/place/antioch_68) and [Syria](/place/syria_1122) and [Cilicia:](/place/cilicia_300)

verseText: Forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, Ye must be circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave no such commandment:
mdText: Forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, _Ye_ _must_ be circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave no _such_ commandment:

verseText: It seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
mdText: It seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) and [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
mdText: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tell you the same things by mouth.
mdText: We have sent therefore [Judas]([/person/judas_1759) and [Silas,]([/person/silas_2740) who shall also tell _you_ the same things by mouth.

verseText: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;
mdText: For it seemed good to the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;

verseText: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Fare ye well.
mdText: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Fare ye well.

verseText: So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch: and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle:
mdText: So when they were dismissed, they came to [Antioch:](/place/antioch_68) and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle:

verseText: Which when they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.
mdText: _Which_ when they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.

verseText: And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed them.
mdText: And [Judas]([/person/judas_1759) and [Silas,]([/person/silas_2740) being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed _them._

verseText: And after they had tarried there a space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.
mdText: And after they had tarried _there_ a space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.

verseText: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.
mdText: Notwithstanding it pleased [Silas]([/person/silas_2740) to abide there still.

verseText: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.
mdText: [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) also and [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) continued in [Antioch,](/place/antioch_68) teaching and preaching the word of the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) with many others also.

verseText: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, and see how they do.
mdText: And some days after [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) said unto [Barnabas,]([/person/barnabas_1722) Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) _and_ _see_ how they do.

verseText: And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.
mdText: And [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) determined to take with them [John,]([/person/mark_1679) whose surname was [Mark.]([/person/mark_1679)

verseText: But Paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.
mdText: But [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from [Pamphylia,](/place/pamphylia_918) and went not with them to the work.

verseText: And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus;
mdText: And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so [Barnabas]([/person/barnabas_1722) took [Mark,]([/person/mark_1679) and sailed unto [Cyprus;](/place/cyprus_316)

verseText: And Paul chose Silas, and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.
mdText: And [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) chose [Silas,]([/person/silas_2740) and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.
mdText: And he went through [Syria](/place/syria_1122) and [Cilicia,](/place/cilicia_300) confirming the churches.

verseText: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra: and, behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timotheus, the son of a certain woman, which was a Jewess, and believed; but his father was a Greek:
mdText: Then came he to [Derbe](/place/derbe_330) and [Lystra:](/place/lystra_742) and, behold, a certain disciple was there, named [Timotheus,]([/person/timotheus_2863) the son of a certain woman, which was a Jewess, and believed; but his father _was_ a Greek:

verseText: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.
mdText: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at [Lystra](/place/lystra_742) and [Iconium.](/place/iconium_590)

verseText: Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.
mdText: Him would [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.

verseText: And as they went through the cities, they delivered them the decrees for to keep, that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem.
mdText: And as they went through the cities, they delivered them the decrees for to keep, that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: And so were the churches established in the faith, and increased in number daily.
mdText: And so were the churches established in the faith, and increased in number daily.

verseText: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia, and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia,
mdText: Now when they had gone throughout [Phrygia](/place/phrygia_946) and the region of [Galatia,](/place/galatia_431) and were forbidden of the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost to preach the word in [Asia,](/place/asia_108)

verseText: After they were come to Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia: but the Spirit suffered them not.
mdText: After they were come to [Mysia,](/place/mysia_865) they assayed to go into [Bithynia:](/place/bithynia_250) but the [Spirit]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) suffered them not.

verseText: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas.
mdText: And they passing by [Mysia](/place/mysia_865) came down to [Troas.](/place/troas_1182)

verseText: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night; There stood a man of Macedonia, and prayed him, saying, Come over into Macedonia, and help us.
mdText: And a vision appeared to [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) in the night; There stood a man of [Macedonia,](/place/macedonia_747) and prayed him, saying, Come over into [Macedonia,](/place/macedonia_747) and help us.

verseText: And after he had seen the vision, immediately we endeavoured to go into Macedonia, assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them.
mdText: And after he had seen the vision, immediately we endeavoured to go into [Macedonia,](/place/macedonia_747) assuredly gathering that the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) had called us for to preach the gospel unto them.

verseText: Therefore loosing from Troas, we came with a straight course to Samothracia, and the next day to Neapolis;
mdText: Therefore loosing from [Troas,](/place/troas_1182) we came with a straight course to [Samothracia,](/place/samothrace_1025) and the next _day_ to [Neapolis;](/place/neapolis_880)

verseText: And from thence to Philippi, which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia, and a colony: and we were in that city abiding certain days.
mdText: And from thence to [Philippi,](/place/philippi_942) which is the chief city of that part of [Macedonia,](/place/macedonia_747) _and_ a colony: and we were in that city abiding certain days.

verseText: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side, where prayer was wont to be made; and we sat down, and spake unto the women which resorted thither.
mdText: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side, where prayer was wont to be made; and we sat down, and spake unto the women which resorted _thither._

verseText: And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, which worshipped God, heard us: whose heart the Lord opened, that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul.
mdText: And a certain woman named [Lydia,]([/person/lydia_1837) a seller of purple, of the city of [Thyatira,](/place/thyatira_1160) which worshipped [God,]([/person/god_1324) heard _us:_ whose heart the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) opened, that she attended unto the things which were spoken of [Paul.]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought us, saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and abide there. And she constrained us.
mdText: And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought _us,_ saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) come into my house, and abide _there._ And she constrained us.

verseText: And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying:
mdText: And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying:
eventsDescribed: Paul casts demon out of soothsayer

verseText: The same followed Paul and us, and cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high God, which shew unto us the way of salvation.
mdText: The same followed [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and us, and cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high [God,]([/person/god_1324) which shew unto us the way of salvation.
eventsDescribed: Paul casts demon out of soothsayer

verseText: And this did she many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And he came out the same hour.
mdText: And this did she many days. But [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) to come out of her. And he came out the same hour.
eventsDescribed: Paul casts demon out of soothsayer

verseText: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught Paul and Silas, and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers,
mdText: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Silas,]([/person/silas_2740) and drew _them_ into the marketplace unto the rulers,

verseText: And brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,
mdText: And brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,

verseText: And teach customs, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, being Romans.
mdText: And teach customs, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, being Romans.

verseText: And the multitude rose up together against them: and the magistrates rent off their clothes, and commanded to beat them.
mdText: And the multitude rose up together against them: and the magistrates rent off their clothes, and commanded to beat _them._

verseText: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast them into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:
mdText: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast _them_ into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:

verseText: Who, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.
mdText: Who, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.

verseText: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed, and sang praises unto God: and the prisoners heard them.
mdText: And at midnight [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Silas]([/person/silas_2740) prayed, and sang praises unto [God:]([/person/god_1324) and the prisoners heard them.

verseText: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened, and every one’s bands were loosed.
mdText: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened, and every one’s bands were loosed.

verseText: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep, and seeing the prison doors open, he drew out his sword, and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had been fled.
mdText: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep, and seeing the prison doors open, he drew out his sword, and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had been fled.

verseText: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.
mdText: But [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.

verseText: Then he called for a light, and sprang in, and came trembling, and fell down before Paul and Silas,
mdText: Then he called for a light, and sprang in, and came trembling, and fell down before [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Silas,]([/person/silas_2740)

verseText: And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?
mdText: And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?

verseText: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.
mdText: And they said, Believe on the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ,]([/person/jesus_905) and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.

verseText: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord, and to all that were in his house.
mdText: And they spake unto him the word of the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) and to all that were in his house.

verseText: And he took them the same hour of the night, and washed their stripes; and was baptized, he and all his, straightway.
mdText: And he took them the same hour of the night, and washed _their_ stripes; and was baptized, he and all his, straightway.

verseText: And when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them, and rejoiced, believing in God with all his house.
mdText: And when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them, and rejoiced, believing in [God]([/person/god_1324) with all his house.

verseText: And when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.
mdText: And when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.

verseText: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul, The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore depart, and go in peace.
mdText: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore depart, and go in peace.

verseText: But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast us into prison; and now do they thrust us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.
mdText: But [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast _us_ into prison; and now do they thrust us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.

verseText: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates: and they feared, when they heard that they were Romans.
mdText: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates: and they feared, when they heard that they were Romans.

verseText: And they came and besought them, and brought them out, and desired them to depart out of the city.
mdText: And they came and besought them, and brought _them_ out, and desired _them_ to depart out of the city.

verseText: And they went out of the prison, and entered into the house of Lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.
mdText: And they went out of the prison, and entered into _the_ _house_ _of_ [Lydia:]([/person/lydia_1837) and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.

verseText: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:
mdText: Now when they had passed through [Amphipolis](/place/amphipolis_59) and [Apollonia,](/place/apollonia_76) they came to [Thessalonica,](/place/thessalonica_1158) where was a synagogue of the Jews:

verseText: And Paul, as his manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures,
mdText: And [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) as his manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures,

verseText: Opening and alleging, that Christ must needs have suffered, and risen again from the dead; and that this Jesus, whom I preach unto you, is Christ.
mdText: Opening and alleging, that [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) must needs have suffered, and risen again from the dead; and that this [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) whom I preach unto you, is [Christ.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And some of them believed, and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.
mdText: And some of them believed, and consorted with [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Silas;]([/person/silas_2740) and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.

verseText: But the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a company, and set all the city on an uproar, and assaulted the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.
mdText: But the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a company, and set all the city on an uproar, and assaulted the house of [Jason,]([/person/jason_742) and sought to bring them out to the people.

verseText: And when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;
mdText: And when they found them not, they drew [Jason]([/person/jason_742) and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;

verseText: Whom Jason hath received: and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, one Jesus.
mdText: Whom [Jason]([/person/jason_742) hath received: and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, _one_ [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.
mdText: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.

verseText: And when they had taken security of Jason, and of the other, they let them go.
mdText: And when they had taken security of [Jason,]([/person/jason_742) and of the other, they let them go.

verseText: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea: who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews.
mdText: And the brethren immediately sent away [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and [Silas]([/person/silas_2740) by night unto [Berea:](/place/berea_177) who coming _thither_ went into the synagogue of the Jews.

verseText: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, and searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so.
mdText: These were more noble than those in [Thessalonica,](/place/thessalonica_1158) in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, and searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so.

verseText: Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, and of men, not a few.
mdText: Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, and of men, not a few.

verseText: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea, they came thither also, and stirred up the people.
mdText: But when the Jews of [Thessalonica](/place/thessalonica_1158) had knowledge that the word of [God]([/person/god_1324) was preached of [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) at [Berea,](/place/berea_177) they came thither also, and stirred up the people.

verseText: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea: but Silas and Timotheus abode there still.
mdText: And then immediately the brethren sent away [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) to go as it were to the sea: but [Silas]([/person/silas_2740) and [Timotheus]([/person/timotheus_2863) abode there still.

verseText: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens: and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed, they departed.
mdText: And they that conducted [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) brought him unto [Athens:](/place/athens_118) and receiving a commandment unto [Silas]([/person/silas_2740) and [Timotheus]([/person/timotheus_2863) for to come to him with all speed, they departed.

verseText: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry.
mdText: Now while [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) waited for them at [Athens,](/place/athens_118) his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry.

verseText: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews, and with the devout persons, and in the market daily with them that met with him.
mdText: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews, and with the devout persons, and in the market daily with them that met with him.

verseText: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, and of the Stoicks, encountered him. And some said, What will this babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them Jesus, and the resurrection.
mdText: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, and of the Stoicks, encountered him. And some said, What will this babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) and the resurrection.

verseText: And they took him, and brought him unto Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, is?
mdText: And they took him, and brought him unto [Areopagus,](/place/areopagus_87) saying, May we know what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, _is?_

verseText: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.
mdText: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.

verseText: For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some new thing.)
mdText: (For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some new thing.)

verseText: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars’ hill, and said, Ye men of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.
mdText: Then [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) stood in the midst of [Mars’](/place/areopagus_87) [hill,](/place/areopagus_87) and said, _Ye_ men of [Athens,](/place/athens_118) I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.

verseText: For as I passed by, and beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you.
mdText: For as I passed by, and beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN [GOD.]([/person/god_1324) Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you.

verseText: God that made the world and all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;
mdText: [God]([/person/god_1324) that made the world and all things therein, seeing that he is [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;

verseText: Neither is worshipped with men’s hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;
mdText: Neither is worshipped with men’s hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;

verseText: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth, and hath determined the times before appointed, and the bounds of their habitation;
mdText: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth, and hath determined the times before appointed, and the bounds of their habitation;

verseText: That they should seek the Lord, if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far from every one of us:
mdText: That they should seek the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far from every one of us:

verseText: For in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.
mdText: For in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.

verseText: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art and man’s device.
mdText: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of [God,]([/person/god_1324) we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art and man’s device.

verseText: And the times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent:
mdText: And the times of this ignorance [God]([/person/god_1324) winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent:

verseText: Because he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men, in that he hath raised him from the dead.
mdText: Because he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by _that_ man whom he hath ordained; _whereof_ he hath given assurance unto all _men,_ in that he hath raised him from the dead.

verseText: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked: and others said, We will hear thee again of this matter.
mdText: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked: and others said, We will hear thee again of this _matter._

verseText: So Paul departed from among them.
mdText: So [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) departed from among them.

verseText: Howbeit certain men clave unto him, and believed: among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.
mdText: Howbeit certain men clave unto him, and believed: among the which _was_ [Dionysius]([/person/dionysius_1013) the [Areopagite,](/place/areopagus_87) and a woman named [Damaris,]([/person/damaris_972) and others with them.

verseText: After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth;
mdText: After these things [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) departed from [Athens,](/place/athens_118) and came to [Corinth;](/place/corinth_306)

verseText: And found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla; (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome:) and came unto them.
mdText: And found a certain Jew named [Aquila,]([/person/aquila_279) born in [Pontus,](/place/pontus_956) lately come from [Italy,](/place/italy_601) with his wife [Priscilla;]([/person/priscilla_2370) (because that [Claudius]([/person/claudius_947) had commanded all Jews to depart from [Rome:](/place/rome_1013)) and came unto them.

verseText: And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.
mdText: And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.

verseText: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.
mdText: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.

verseText: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia, Paul was pressed in the spirit, and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ.
mdText: And when [Silas]([/person/silas_2740) and [Timotheus]([/person/timotheus_2863) were come from [Macedonia,](/place/macedonia_747) [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) was pressed in the spirit, and testified to the Jews _that_ [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) _was_ [Christ.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And when they opposed themselves, and blasphemed, he shook his raiment, and said unto them, Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.
mdText: And when they opposed themselves, and blasphemed, he shook _his_ raiment, and said unto them, Your blood _be_ upon your own heads; I _am_ clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.

verseText: And he departed thence, and entered into a certain man’s house, named Justus, one that worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the synagogue.
mdText: And he departed thence, and entered into a certain _man’s_ house, named Justus, _one_ that worshipped [God,]([/person/god_1324) whose house joined hard to the synagogue.

verseText: And Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.
mdText: And [Crispus,]([/person/crispus_961) the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.

verseText: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:
mdText: Then spake the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) to [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:

verseText: For I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.
mdText: For I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.

verseText: And he continued there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
mdText: And he continued _there_ a year and six months, teaching the word of [God]([/person/god_1324) among them.

verseText: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia, the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul, and brought him to the judgment seat,
mdText: And when [Gallio]([/person/gallio_1275) was the deputy of [Achaia,](/place/achaia_16) the Jews made insurrection with one accord against [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) and brought him to the judgment seat,

verseText: Saying, This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.
mdText: Saying, This _fellow_ persuadeth men to worship [God]([/person/god_1324) contrary to the law.

verseText: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, O ye Jews, reason would that I should bear with you:
mdText: And when [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) was now about to open _his_ mouth, [Gallio]([/person/gallio_1275) said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, O _ye_ Jews, reason would that I should bear with you:

verseText: But if it be a question of words and names, and of your law, look ye to it; for I will be no judge of such matters.
mdText: But if it be a question of words and names, and _of_ your law, look ye _to_ _it;_ for I will be no judge of such _matters._

verseText: And he drave them from the judgment seat.
mdText: And he drave them from the judgment seat.

verseText: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. And Gallio cared for none of those things.
mdText: Then all the Greeks took [Sosthenes,]([/person/sosthenes_2772) the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beat _him_ before the judgment seat. And [Gallio]([/person/gallio_1275) cared for none of those things.

verseText: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while, and then took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence into Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila; having shorn his head in Cenchrea: for he had a vow.
mdText: And [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) _after_ _this_ tarried _there_ yet a good while, and then took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence into [Syria,](/place/syria_1122) and with him [Priscilla]([/person/priscilla_2370) and [Aquila;]([/person/aquila_279) having shorn _his_ head in [Cenchrea:](/place/cenchreae_281) for he had a vow.

verseText: And he came to Ephesus, and left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.
mdText: And he came to [Ephesus,](/place/ephesus_400) and left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.

verseText: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them, he consented not;
mdText: When they desired _him_ to tarry longer time with them, he consented not;

verseText: But bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if God will. And he sailed from Ephesus.
mdText: But bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if [God]([/person/god_1324) will. And he sailed from [Ephesus.](/place/ephesus_400)

verseText: And when he had landed at Caesarea, and gone up, and saluted the church, he went down to Antioch.
mdText: And when he had landed at [Caesarea,](/place/caesarea_266) and gone up, and saluted the church, he went down to [Antioch.](/place/antioch_68)

verseText: And after he had spent some time there, he departed, and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.
mdText: And after he had spent some time _there,_ he departed, and went over _all_ the country of [Galatia](/place/galatia_431) and [Phrygia](/place/phrygia_946) in order, strengthening all the disciples.

verseText: And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man, and mighty in the scriptures, came to Ephesus.
mdText: And a certain Jew named [Apollos,]([/person/apollos_276) born at [Alexandria,](/place/alexandria_46) an eloquent man, _and_ mighty in the scriptures, came to [Ephesus.](/place/ephesus_400)

verseText: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in the spirit, he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord, knowing only the baptism of John.
mdText: This man was instructed in the way of the [Lord;]([/person/jesus_905) and being fervent in the spirit, he spake and taught diligently the things of the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) knowing only the baptism of [John.]([/person/john_1676)

verseText: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue: whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard, they took him unto them, and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.
mdText: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue: whom when [Aquila]([/person/aquila_279) and [Priscilla]([/person/priscilla_2370) had heard, they took him unto _them,_ and expounded unto him the way of [God]([/person/god_1324) more perfectly.

verseText: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:
mdText: And when he was disposed to pass into [Achaia,](/place/achaia_16) the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:

verseText: For he mightily convinced the Jews, and that publickly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ.
mdText: For he mightily convinced the Jews, _and_ _that_ publickly, shewing by the scriptures that [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) was [Christ.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And it came to pass, that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus: and finding certain disciples,
mdText: And it came to pass, that, while [Apollos]([/person/apollos_276) was at [Corinth,](/place/corinth_306) [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) having passed through the upper coasts came to [Ephesus:](/place/ephesus_400) and finding certain disciples,

verseText: He said unto them, Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost.
mdText: He said unto them, Have ye received the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there be any [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost.

verseText: And he said unto them, Unto what then were ye baptized? And they said, Unto John’s baptism.
mdText: And he said unto them, Unto what then were ye baptized? And they said, Unto [John’s]([/person/john_1676) baptism.

verseText: Then said Paul, John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe on him which should come after him, that is, on Christ Jesus.
mdText: Then said [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) [John]([/person/john_1676) verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe on him which should come after him, that is, on [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
mdText: When they heard _this,_ they were baptized in the name of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them, the Holy Ghost came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.
mdText: And when [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) had laid _his_ hands upon them, the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.

verseText: And all the men were about twelve.
mdText: And all the men were about twelve.

verseText: And he went into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God.
mdText: And he went into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: But when divers were hardened, and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.
mdText: But when divers were hardened, and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one [Tyrannus.]([/person/tyrannus_2886)

verseText: And this continued by the space of two years; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.
mdText: And this continued by the space of two years; so that all they which dwelt in [Asia](/place/asia_108) heard the word of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) both Jews and Greeks.

verseText: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:
mdText: And [God]([/person/god_1324) wrought special miracles by the hands of [Paul:]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.
mdText: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.

verseText: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.
mdText: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) saying, We adjure you by [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) whom [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) preacheth.

verseText: And there were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jew, and chief of the priests, which did so.
mdText: And there were seven sons of _one_ [Sceva,]([/person/sceva_2480) a Jew, _and_ chief of the priests, which did so.

verseText: And the evil spirit answered and said, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?
mdText: And the evil spirit answered and said, [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) I know, and [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) I know; but who are ye?

verseText: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.
mdText: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.

verseText: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.
mdText: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at [Ephesus;](/place/ephesus_400) and fear fell on them all, and the name of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) was magnified.

verseText: And many that believed came, and confessed, and shewed their deeds.
mdText: And many that believed came, and confessed, and shewed their deeds.

verseText: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together, and burned them before all men: and they counted the price of them, and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver.
mdText: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together, and burned them before all _men:_ and they counted the price of them, and found _it_ fifty thousand _pieces_ of silver.

verseText: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.
mdText: So mightily grew the word of [God]([/person/god_1324) and prevailed.

verseText: After these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.
mdText: After these things were ended, [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through [Macedonia](/place/macedonia_747) and [Achaia,](/place/achaia_16) to go to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) saying, After I have been there, I must also see [Rome.](/place/rome_1013)

verseText: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timotheus and Erastus; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season.
mdText: So he sent into [Macedonia](/place/macedonia_747) two of them that ministered unto him, [Timotheus]([/person/timotheus_2863) and [Erastus;]([/person/erastus_1213) but he himself stayed in [Asia](/place/asia_108) for a season.

verseText: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way.
mdText: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way.

verseText: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, which made silver shrines for Diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen;
mdText: For a certain _man_ named [Demetrius,]([/person/demetrius_1007) a silversmith, which made silver shrines for [Diana,]([/person/diana_1008) brought no small gain unto the craftsmen;

verseText: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our wealth.
mdText: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our wealth.

verseText: Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they be no gods, which are made with hands:
mdText: Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at [Ephesus,](/place/ephesus_400) but almost throughout all [Asia,](/place/asia_108) this [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they be no gods, which are made with hands:

verseText: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.
mdText: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess [Diana]([/person/diana_1008) should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all [Asia](/place/asia_108) and the world worshippeth.

verseText: And when they heard these sayings, they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
mdText: And when they heard _these_ _sayings,_ they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, Great _is_ [Diana]([/person/diana_1008) of the Ephesians.

verseText: And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul’s companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.
mdText: And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught [Gaius]([/person/gaius_1269) and [Aristarchus,]([/person/aristarchus_306) men of Macedonia, [Paul’s]([/person/paul_2479) companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.

verseText: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.
mdText: And when [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.

verseText: And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre.
mdText: And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring _him_ that he would not adventure himself into the theatre.

verseText: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was confused; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.
mdText: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was confused; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.

verseText: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with the hand, and would have made his defence unto the people.
mdText: And they drew [Alexander]([/person/alexander_188) out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And [Alexander]([/person/alexander_188) beckoned with the hand, and would have made his defence unto the people.

verseText: But when they knew that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
mdText: But when they knew that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great _is_ [Diana]([/person/diana_1008) of the Ephesians.

verseText: And when the townclerk had appeased the people, he said, Ye men of Ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana, and of the image which fell down from Jupiter?
mdText: And when the townclerk had appeased the people, he said, _Ye_ men of [Ephesus,](/place/ephesus_400) what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess [Diana,]([/person/diana_1008) and of the _image_ which fell down from [Jupiter?]([/person/barnabas_1722)

verseText: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.
mdText: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.

verseText: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.
mdText: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.

verseText: Wherefore if Demetrius, and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are deputies: let them implead one another.
mdText: Wherefore if [Demetrius,]([/person/demetrius_1007) and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are deputies: let them implead one another.

verseText: But if ye enquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.
mdText: But if ye enquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.

verseText: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day’s uproar, there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse.
mdText: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day’s uproar, there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse.

verseText: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.
mdText: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

verseText: And after the uproar was ceased, Paul called unto him the disciples, and embraced them, and departed for to go into Macedonia.
mdText: And after the uproar was ceased, [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) called unto _him_ the disciples, and embraced _them,_ and departed for to go into [Macedonia.](/place/macedonia_747)

verseText: And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece,
mdText: And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into [Greece,](/place/greece_495)

verseText: And there abode three months. And when the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria, he purposed to return through Macedonia.
