mdText: And _there_ abode three months. And when the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into [Syria,](/place/syria_1122) he purposed to return through [Macedonia.](/place/macedonia_747)

verseText: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.
mdText: And there accompanied him into Asia [Sopater]([/person/sopater_2770) of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, [Aristarchus]([/person/aristarchus_306) and [Secundus;]([/person/secundus_2482) and [Gaius]([/person/gaius_1270) of [Derbe,](/place/derbe_330) and [Timotheus;]([/person/timotheus_2863) and of Asia, [Tychicus]([/person/tychicus_2885) and [Trophimus.]([/person/trophimus_2880)

verseText: These going before tarried for us at Troas.
mdText: These going before tarried for us at [Troas.](/place/troas_1182)

verseText: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days; where we abode seven days.
mdText: And we sailed away from [Philippi](/place/philippi_942) after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to [Troas](/place/troas_1182) in five days; where we abode seven days.

verseText: And upon the first day of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight.
mdText: And upon the first _day_ of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight.

verseText: And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together.
mdText: And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together.

verseText: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus, being fallen into a deep sleep: and as Paul was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.
mdText: And there sat in a window a certain young man named [Eutychus,]([/person/eutychus_1230) being fallen into a deep sleep: and as [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.

verseText: And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracing him said, Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him.
mdText: And [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) went down, and fell on him, and embracing _him_ said, Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him.

verseText: When he therefore was come up again, and had broken bread, and eaten, and talked a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.
mdText: When he therefore was come up again, and had broken bread, and eaten, and talked a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.

verseText: And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.
mdText: And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.

verseText: And we went before to ship, and sailed unto Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, minding himself to go afoot.
mdText: And we went before to ship, and sailed unto [Assos,](/place/assos_110) there intending to take in [Paul:]([/person/paul_2479) for so had he appointed, minding himself to go afoot.

verseText: And when he met with us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.
mdText: And when he met with us at [Assos,](/place/assos_110) we took him in, and came to [Mitylene.](/place/mitylene_808)

verseText: And we sailed thence, and came the next day over against Chios; and the next day we arrived at Samos, and tarried at Trogyllium; and the next day we came to Miletus.
mdText: And we sailed thence, and came the next _day_ over against [Chios;](/place/chios_296) and the next _day_ we arrived at [Samos,](/place/samos_1024) and tarried at Trogyllium; and the next _day_ we came to [Miletus.](/place/miletus_801)

verseText: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, because he would not spend the time in Asia: for he hasted, if it were possible for him, to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost.
mdText: For [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) had determined to sail by [Ephesus,](/place/ephesus_400) because he would not spend the time in [Asia:](/place/asia_108) for he hasted, if it were possible for him, to be at [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) the day of Pentecost.

verseText: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called the elders of the church.
mdText: And from [Miletus](/place/miletus_801) he sent to [Ephesus,](/place/ephesus_400) and called the elders of the church.

verseText: And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from the first day that I came into Asia, after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,
mdText: And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from the first day that I came into [Asia,](/place/asia_108) after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,

verseText: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind, and with many tears, and temptations, which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews:
mdText: Serving the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) with all humility of mind, and with many tears, and temptations, which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews:

verseText: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you, but have shewed you, and have taught you publickly, and from house to house,
mdText: _And_ how I kept back nothing that was profitable _unto_ _you,_ but have shewed you, and have taught you publickly, and from house to house,

verseText: Testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
mdText: Testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward [God,]([/person/god_1324) and faith toward our [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) [Christ.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:
mdText: And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) not knowing the things that shall befall me there:

verseText: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.
mdText: Save that the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.

verseText: But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry, which I have received of the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.
mdText: But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry, which I have received of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) to testify the gospel of the grace of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.
mdText: And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of [God,]([/person/god_1324) shall see my face no more.

verseText: Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I am pure from the blood of all men.
mdText: Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I _am_ pure from the blood of all _men._

verseText: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.
mdText: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God, which he hath purchased with his own blood.
mdText: Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of [God,]([/person/god_1324) which he hath purchased with his own blood.

verseText: For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.
mdText: For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.

verseText: Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.
mdText: Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.

verseText: Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.
mdText: Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.

verseText: And now, brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.
mdText: And now, brethren, I commend you to [God,]([/person/god_1324) and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.

verseText: I have coveted no man’s silver, or gold, or apparel.
mdText: I have coveted no man’s silver, or gold, or apparel.

verseText: Yea, ye yourselves know, that these hands have ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.
mdText: Yea, ye yourselves know, that these hands have ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.

verseText: I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.
mdText: I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.

verseText: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.
mdText: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.

verseText: And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul’s neck, and kissed him,
mdText: And they all wept sore, and fell on [Paul’s]([/person/paul_2479) neck, and kissed him,

verseText: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.
mdText: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.

verseText: And it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had launched, we came with a straight course unto Coos, and the day following unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:
mdText: And it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had launched, we came with a straight course unto [Coos,](/place/coos_308) and the _day_ following unto [Rhodes,](/place/rhodes_1000) and from thence unto [Patara:](/place/patara_924)

verseText: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.
mdText: And finding a ship sailing over unto [Phenicia,](/place/phenicia_944) we went aboard, and set forth.

verseText: Now when we had discovered Cyprus, we left it on the left hand, and sailed into Syria, and landed at Tyre: for there the ship was to unlade her burden.
mdText: Now when we had discovered [Cyprus,](/place/cyprus_316) we left it on the left hand, and sailed into [Syria,](/place/syria_1122) and landed at [Tyre:](/place/tyre_1184) for there the ship was to unlade her burden.

verseText: And finding disciples, we tarried there seven days: who said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.
mdText: And finding disciples, we tarried there seven days: who said to [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) through the [Spirit,]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) that he should not go up to [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: And when we had accomplished those days, we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way, with wives and children, till we were out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore, and prayed.
mdText: And when we had accomplished those days, we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way, with wives and children, till _we_ _were_ out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore, and prayed.

verseText: And when we had taken our leave one of another, we took ship; and they returned home again.
mdText: And when we had taken our leave one of another, we took ship; and they returned home again.

verseText: And when we had finished our course from Tyre, we came to Ptolemais, and saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.
mdText: And when we had finished _our_ course from [Tyre,](/place/tyre_1184) we came to [Ptolemais,](/place/ptolemais_959) and saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.

verseText: And the next day we that were of Paul’s company departed, and came unto Caesarea: and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, which was one of the seven; and abode with him.
mdText: And the next _day_ we that were of [Paul’s]([/person/paul_2479) company departed, and came unto [Caesarea:](/place/caesarea_266) and we entered into the house of [Philip]([/person/philip_2347) the evangelist, which was _one_ of the seven; and abode with him.

verseText: And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.
mdText: And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.

verseText: And as we tarried there many days, there came down from Judaea a certain prophet, named Agabus.
mdText: And as we tarried _there_ many days, there came down from [Judaea](/place/judea_657) a certain prophet, named [Agabus.]([/person/agabus_107)

verseText: And when he was come unto us, he took Paul’s girdle, and bound his own hands and feet, and said, Thus saith the Holy Ghost, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.
mdText: And when he was come unto us, he took [Paul’s]([/person/paul_2479) girdle, and bound his own hands and feet, and said, Thus saith the [Holy]([/person/holy_spirit_7400) Ghost, So shall the Jews at [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver _him_ into the hands of the Gentiles.

verseText: And when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place, besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.
mdText: And when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place, besought him not to go up to [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: Then Paul answered, What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.
mdText: Then [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) answered, What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) for the name of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) [Jesus.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.
mdText: And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) be done.

verseText: And after those days we took up our carriages, and went up to Jerusalem.
mdText: And after those days we took up our carriages, and went up to [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea, and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.
mdText: There went with us also _certain_ of the disciples of [Caesarea,](/place/caesarea_266) and brought with them one [Mnason]([/person/mnason_2102) of [Cyprus,](/place/cyprus_316) an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.

verseText: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.
mdText: And when we were come to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) the brethren received us gladly.

verseText: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.
mdText: And the _day_ following [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) went in with us unto [James;]([/person/james_719) and all the elders were present.

verseText: And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.
mdText: And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things [God]([/person/god_1324) had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.

verseText: And when they heard it, they glorified the Lord, and said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are which believe; and they are all zealous of the law:
mdText: And when they heard _it,_ they glorified the [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) and said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are which believe; and they are all zealous of the law:

verseText: And they are informed of thee, that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, saying that they ought not to circumcise their children, neither to walk after the customs.
mdText: And they are informed of thee, that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake [Moses,]([/person/moses_2108) saying that they ought not to circumcise _their_ children, neither to walk after the customs.

verseText: What is it therefore? the multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.
mdText: What is it therefore? the multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.

verseText: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;
mdText: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;

verseText: Them take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges with them, that they may shave their heads: and all may know that those things, whereof they were informed concerning thee, are nothing; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest the law.
mdText: Them take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges with them, that they may shave _their_ heads: and all may know that those things, whereof they were informed concerning thee, are nothing; but _that_ thou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest the law.

verseText: As touching the Gentiles which believe, we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing, save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols, and from blood, and from strangled, and from fornication.
mdText: As touching the Gentiles which believe, we have written _and_ concluded that they observe no such thing, save only that they keep themselves from _things_ offered to idols, and from blood, and from strangled, and from fornication.

verseText: Then Paul took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple, to signify the accomplishment of the days of purification, until that an offering should be offered for every one of them.
mdText: Then [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple, to signify the accomplishment of the days of purification, until that an offering should be offered for every one of them.

verseText: And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews which were of Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people, and laid hands on him,
mdText: And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews which were of [Asia,](/place/asia_108) when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people, and laid hands on him,

verseText: Crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man, that teacheth all men every where against the people, and the law, and this place: and further brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath polluted this holy place.
mdText: Crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man, that teacheth all _men_ every where against the people, and the law, and this place: and further brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath polluted this holy place.

verseText: For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)
mdText: (For they had seen before with him in the city [Trophimus]([/person/trophimus_2880) an Ephesian, whom they supposed that [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) had brought into the temple.)

verseText: And all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they took Paul, and drew him out of the temple: and forthwith the doors were shut.
mdText: And all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they took [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) and drew him out of the temple: and forthwith the doors were shut.

verseText: And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.
mdText: And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) was in an uproar.

verseText: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions, and ran down unto them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left beating of Paul.
mdText: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions, and ran down unto them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left beating of [Paul.]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: Then the chief captain came near, and took him, and commanded him to be bound with two chains; and demanded who he was, and what he had done.
mdText: Then the chief captain came near, and took him, and commanded _him_ to be bound with two chains; and demanded who he was, and what he had done.

verseText: And some cried one thing, some another, among the multitude: and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult, he commanded him to be carried into the castle.
mdText: And some cried one thing, some another, among the multitude: and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult, he commanded him to be carried into the castle.

verseText: And when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people.
mdText: And when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people.

verseText: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, Away with him.
mdText: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, Away with him.

verseText: And as Paul was to be led into the castle, he said unto the chief captain, May I speak unto thee? Who said, Canst thou speak Greek?
mdText: And as [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) was to be led into the castle, he said unto the chief captain, May I speak unto thee? Who said, Canst thou speak Greek?

verseText: Art not thou that Egyptian, which before these days madest an uproar, and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers?
mdText: Art not thou that Egyptian, which before these days madest an uproar, and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers?

verseText: But Paul said, I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus, a city in Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city: and, I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.
mdText: But [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) said, I am a man _which_ _am_ a Jew of [Tarsus,](/place/tarsus_1140) _a_ _city_ in [Cilicia,](/place/cilicia_300) a citizen of no mean city: and, I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.

verseText: And when he had given him licence, Paul stood on the stairs, and beckoned with the hand unto the people. And when there was made a great silence, he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue, saying,
mdText: And when he had given him licence, [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) stood on the stairs, and beckoned with the hand unto the people. And when there was made a great silence, he spake unto _them_ in the Hebrew tongue, saying,

verseText: Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defence which I make now unto you.
mdText: Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defence _which_ _I_ _make_ now unto you.

verseText: And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them, they kept the more silence: and he saith,)
mdText: (And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them, they kept the more silence: and he saith,)

verseText: I am verily a man which am a Jew, born in Tarsus, a city in Cilicia, yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers, and was zealous toward God, as ye all are this day.
mdText: I am verily a man _which_ _am_ a Jew, born in [Tarsus,](/place/tarsus_1140) _a_ _city_ in [Cilicia,](/place/cilicia_300) yet brought up in this city at the feet of [Gamaliel,]([/person/gamaliel_1277) _and_ taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers, and was zealous toward [God,]([/person/god_1324) as ye all are this day.

verseText: And I persecuted this way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.
mdText: And I persecuted this way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

verseText: As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate of the elders: from whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and went to Damascus, to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem, for to be punished.
mdText: As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate of the elders: from whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and went to [Damascus,](/place/damascus_322) to bring them which were there bound unto [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) for to be punished.

verseText: And it came to pass, that, as I made my journey, and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.
mdText: And it came to pass, that, as I made my journey, and was come nigh unto [Damascus](/place/damascus_322) about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.

verseText: And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
mdText: And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me, [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) why persecutest thou me?

verseText: And I answered, Who art thou, Lord? And he said unto me, I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.
mdText: And I answered, Who art thou, [Lord?]([/person/jesus_905) And he said unto me, I am [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) of [Nazareth,](/place/nazareth_878) whom thou persecutest.

verseText: And they that were with me saw indeed the light, and were afraid; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me.
mdText: And they that were with me saw indeed the light, and were afraid; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me.

verseText: And I said, What shall I do, Lord? And the Lord said unto me, Arise, and go into Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.
mdText: And I said, What shall I do, [Lord?]([/person/jesus_905) And the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) said unto me, Arise, and go into [Damascus;](/place/damascus_322) and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.

verseText: And when I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of them that were with me, I came into Damascus.
mdText: And when I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of them that were with me, I came into [Damascus.](/place/damascus_322)

verseText: And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there,
mdText: And one [Ananias,]([/person/ananias_259) a devout man according to the law, having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt _there,_

verseText: Came unto me, and stood, and said unto me, Brother Saul, receive thy sight. And the same hour I looked up upon him.
mdText: Came unto me, and stood, and said unto me, Brother [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) receive thy sight. And the same hour I looked up upon him.

verseText: And he said, The God of our fathers hath chosen thee, that thou shouldest know his will, and see that Just One, and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth.
mdText: And he said, The [God]([/person/god_1324) of our fathers hath chosen thee, that thou shouldest know his will, and see that Just One, and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth.

verseText: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard.
mdText: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard.

verseText: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.
mdText: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the [Lord.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And it came to pass, that, when I was come again to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance;
mdText: And it came to pass, that, when I was come again to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance;

verseText: And saw him saying unto me, Make haste, and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem: for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.
mdText: And saw him saying unto me, Make haste, and get thee quickly out of [Jerusalem:](/place/jerusalem_636) for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.

verseText: And I said, Lord, they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee:
mdText: And I said, [Lord,]([/person/jesus_905) they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee:

verseText: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting unto his death, and kept the raiment of them that slew him.
mdText: And when the blood of thy martyr [Stephen]([/person/stephen_2802) was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting unto his death, and kept the raiment of them that slew him.

verseText: And he said unto me, Depart: for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles.
mdText: And he said unto me, Depart: for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles.

verseText: And they gave him audience unto this word, and then lifted up their voices, and said, Away with such a fellow from the earth: for it is not fit that he should live.
mdText: And they gave him audience unto this word, and _then_ lifted up their voices, and said, Away with such a _fellow_ from the earth: for it is not fit that he should live.

verseText: And as they cried out, and cast off their clothes, and threw dust into the air,
mdText: And as they cried out, and cast off _their_ clothes, and threw dust into the air,

verseText: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, and bade that he should be examined by scourging; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him.
mdText: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, and bade that he should be examined by scourging; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him.

verseText: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?
mdText: And as they bound him with thongs, [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?

verseText: When the centurion heard that, he went and told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman.
mdText: When the centurion heard _that,_ he went and told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman.

verseText: Then the chief captain came, and said unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? He said, Yea.
mdText: Then the chief captain came, and said unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? He said, Yea.

verseText: And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. And Paul said, But I was free born.
mdText: And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. And [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) said, But I was _free_ born.

verseText: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him: and the chief captain also was afraid, after he knew that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.
mdText: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him: and the chief captain also was afraid, after he knew that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.

verseText: On the morrow, because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him from his bands, and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear, and brought Paul down, and set him before them.
mdText: On the morrow, because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him from _his_ bands, and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear, and brought [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) down, and set him before them.

verseText: And Paul, earnestly beholding the council, said, Men and brethren, I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day.
mdText: And [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) earnestly beholding the council, said, Men _and_ brethren, I have lived in all good conscience before [God]([/person/god_1324) until this day.

verseText: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.
mdText: And the high priest [Ananias]([/person/ananias_260) commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.

verseText: Then said Paul unto him, God shall smite thee, thou whited wall: for sittest thou to judge me after the law, and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law?
mdText: Then said [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) unto him, [God]([/person/god_1324) shall smite thee, _thou_ whited wall: for sittest thou to judge me after the law, and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law?

verseText: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God’s high priest?
mdText: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou [God’s]([/person/god_1324) high priest?

verseText: Then said Paul, I wist not, brethren, that he was the high priest: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.
mdText: Then said [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) I wist not, brethren, that he was the high priest: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.

verseText: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees, and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, Men and brethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee: of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question.
mdText: But when [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) perceived that the one part were Sadducees, and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, Men _and_ brethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee: of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question.

verseText: And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees: and the multitude was divided.
mdText: And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees: and the multitude was divided.

verseText: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: but the Pharisees confess both.
mdText: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: but the Pharisees confess both.

verseText: And there arose a great cry: and the scribes that were of the Pharisees’ part arose, and strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against God.
mdText: And there arose a great cry: and the scribes _that_ _were_ of the Pharisees’ part arose, and strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against [God.]([/person/god_1324)

verseText: And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them, commanded the soldiers to go down, and to take him by force from among them, and to bring him into the castle.
mdText: And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) should have been pulled in pieces of them, commanded the soldiers to go down, and to take him by force from among them, and to bring _him_ into the castle.

verseText: And the night following the Lord stood by him, and said, Be of good cheer, Paul: for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.
mdText: And the night following the [Lord]([/person/jesus_905) stood by him, and said, Be of good cheer, [Paul:]([/person/paul_2479) for as thou hast testified of me in [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) so must thou bear witness also at [Rome.](/place/rome_1013)

verseText: And when it was day, certain of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.
mdText: And when it was day, certain of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed [Paul.]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy.
mdText: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy.

verseText: And they came to the chief priests and elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul.
mdText: And they came to the chief priests and elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain [Paul.]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow, as though ye would enquire something more perfectly concerning him: and we, or ever he come near, are ready to kill him.
mdText: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow, as though ye would enquire something more perfectly concerning him: and we, or ever he come near, are ready to kill him.

verseText: And when Paul’s sister’s son heard of their lying in wait, he went and entered into the castle, and told Paul.
mdText: And when [Paul’s]([/person/paul_2479) sister’s son heard of their lying in wait, he went and entered into the castle, and told [Paul.]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him, and said, Bring this young man unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to tell him.
mdText: Then [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) called one of the centurions unto _him,_ and said, Bring this young man unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to tell him.

verseText: So he took him, and brought him to the chief captain, and said, Paul the prisoner called me unto him, and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath something to say unto thee.
mdText: So he took him, and brought _him_ to the chief captain, and said, [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) the prisoner called me unto _him,_ and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath something to say unto thee.

verseText: Then the chief captain took him by the hand, and went with him aside privately, and asked him, What is that thou hast to tell me?
mdText: Then the chief captain took him by the hand, and went _with_ _him_ aside privately, and asked _him,_ What is that thou hast to tell me?

verseText: And he said, The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council, as though they would enquire somewhat of him more perfectly.
mdText: And he said, The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) to morrow into the council, as though they would enquire somewhat of him more perfectly.

verseText: But do not thou yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, which have bound themselves with an oath, that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him: and now are they ready, looking for a promise from thee.
mdText: But do not thou yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, which have bound themselves with an oath, that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him: and now are they ready, looking for a promise from thee.

verseText: So the chief captain then let the young man depart, and charged him, See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me.
mdText: So the chief captain _then_ let the young man depart, and charged _him,_ _See_ _thou_ tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me.

verseText: And he called unto him two centurions, saying, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea, and horsemen threescore and ten, and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night;
mdText: And he called unto _him_ two centurions, saying, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to [Caesarea,](/place/caesarea_266) and horsemen threescore and ten, and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night;

verseText: And provide them beasts, that they may set Paul on, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.
mdText: And provide _them_ beasts, that they may set [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) on, and bring _him_ safe unto [Felix]([/person/felix_1257) the governor.

verseText: And he wrote a letter after this manner:
mdText: And he wrote a letter after this manner:

verseText: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting.
mdText: [Claudius]([/person/claudius_948) [Lysias]([/person/claudius_948) unto the most excellent governor [Felix]([/person/felix_1257) _sendeth_ greeting.

verseText: This man was taken of the Jews, and should have been killed of them: then came I with an army, and rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman.
mdText: This man was taken of the Jews, and should have been killed of them: then came I with an army, and rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman.

verseText: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council:
mdText: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council:

verseText: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.
mdText: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.

verseText: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man, I sent straightway to thee, and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him. Farewell.
mdText: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man, I sent straightway to thee, and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what _they_ _had_ against him. Farewell.

verseText: Then the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took Paul, and brought him by night to Antipatris.
mdText: Then the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) and brought _him_ by night to [Antipatris.](/place/antipatris_70)

verseText: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the castle:
mdText: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the castle:

verseText: Who, when they came to Caesarea, and delivered the epistle to the governor, presented Paul also before him.
mdText: Who, when they came to [Caesarea,](/place/caesarea_266) and delivered the epistle to the governor, presented [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) also before him.

verseText: And when the governor had read the letter, he asked of what province he was. And when he understood that he was of Cilicia;
mdText: And when the governor had read _the_ _letter,_ he asked of what province he was. And when he understood that _he_ _was_ of [Cilicia;](/place/cilicia_300)

verseText: I will hear thee, said he, when thine accusers are also come. And he commanded him to be kept in Herod’s judgment hall.
mdText: I will hear thee, said he, when thine accusers are also come. And he commanded him to be kept in [Herod’s]([/person/heber_1469) judgment hall.

verseText: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders, and with a certain orator named Tertullus, who informed the governor against Paul.
mdText: And after five days [Ananias]([/person/ananias_260) the high priest descended with the elders, and _with_ a certain orator _named_ [Tertullus,]([/person/tertullus_2844) who informed the governor against [Paul.]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: And when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,
mdText: And when he was called forth, [Tertullus]([/person/tertullus_2844) began to accuse _him,_ saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,

verseText: We accept it always, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.
mdText: We accept _it_ always, and in all places, most noble [Felix,]([/person/felix_1257) with all thankfulness.

verseText: Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words.
mdText: Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words.

verseText: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow, and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:
mdText: For we have found this man _a_ pestilent _fellow,_ and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:

verseText: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple: whom we took, and would have judged according to our law.
mdText: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple: whom we took, and would have judged according to our law.

verseText: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, and with great violence took him away out of our hands,
mdText: But the chief captain Lysias came _upon_ _us,_ and with great violence took _him_ away out of our hands,

verseText: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee: by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things, whereof we accuse him.
mdText: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee: by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things, whereof we accuse him.

verseText: And the Jews also assented, saying that these things were so.
mdText: And the Jews also assented, saying that these things were so.

verseText: Then Paul, after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I do the more cheerfully answer for myself:
mdText: Then [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I do the more cheerfully answer for myself:

verseText: Because that thou mayest understand, that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship.
mdText: Because that thou mayest understand, that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) for to worship.

verseText: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man, neither raising up the people, neither in the synagogues, nor in the city:
mdText: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man, neither raising up the people, neither in the synagogues, nor in the city:

verseText: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.
mdText: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.

verseText: But this I confess unto thee, that after the way which they call heresy, so worship I the God of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets:
mdText: But this I confess unto thee, that after the way which they call heresy, so worship I the [God]([/person/god_1324) of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets:

verseText: And have hope toward God, which they themselves also allow, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.
mdText: And have hope toward [God,]([/person/god_1324) which they themselves also allow, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.

verseText: And herein do I exercise myself, to have always a conscience void of offence toward God, and toward men.
mdText: And herein do I exercise myself, to have always a conscience void of offence toward [God,]([/person/god_1324) and _toward_ men.

verseText: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings.
mdText: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings.

verseText: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, neither with multitude, nor with tumult.
mdText: Whereupon certain Jews from [Asia](/place/asia_108) found me purified in the temple, neither with multitude, nor with tumult.

verseText: Who ought to have been here before thee, and object, if they had ought against me.
mdText: Who ought to have been here before thee, and object, if they had ought against me.

verseText: Or else let these same here say, if they have found any evil doing in me, while I stood before the council,
mdText: Or else let these same _here_ say, if they have found any evil doing in me, while I stood before the council,

verseText: Except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day.
mdText: Except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day.

verseText: And when Felix heard these things, having more perfect knowledge of that way, he deferred them, and said, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter.
mdText: And when [Felix]([/person/felix_1257) heard these things, having more perfect knowledge of _that_ way, he deferred them, and said, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter.

verseText: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul, and to let him have liberty, and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him.
mdText: And he commanded a centurion to keep [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) and to let _him_ have liberty, and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him.

verseText: And after certain days, when Felix came with his wife Drusilla, which was a Jewess, he sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ.
mdText: And after certain days, when [Felix]([/person/felix_1257) came with his wife [Drusilla,]([/person/drusilla_1024) which was a Jewess, he sent for [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) and heard him concerning the faith in [Christ.]([/person/jesus_905)

verseText: And as he reasoned of righteousness, temperance, and judgment to come, Felix trembled, and answered, Go thy way for this time; when I have a convenient season, I will call for thee.
mdText: And as he reasoned of righteousness, temperance, and judgment to come, [Felix]([/person/felix_1257) trembled, and answered, Go thy way for this time; when I have a convenient season, I will call for thee.

verseText: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul, that he might loose him: wherefore he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.
mdText: He hoped also that money should have been given him of [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) that he might loose him: wherefore he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.

verseText: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix’ room: and Felix, willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left Paul bound.
mdText: But after two years [Porcius]([/person/portius_2367) [Festus]([/person/portius_2367) came into [Felix’]([/person/felix_1257) room: and [Felix,]([/person/felix_1257) willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) bound.

verseText: Now when Festus was come into the province, after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem.
mdText: Now when [Festus]([/person/portius_2367) was come into the province, after three days he ascended from [Caesarea](/place/caesarea_266) to [Jerusalem.](/place/jerusalem_636)

verseText: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul, and besought him,
mdText: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) and besought him,

verseText: And desired favour against him, that he would send for him to Jerusalem, laying wait in the way to kill him.
mdText: And desired favour against him, that he would send for him to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) laying wait in the way to kill him.

verseText: But Festus answered, that Paul should be kept at Caesarea, and that he himself would depart shortly thither.
mdText: But [Festus]([/person/portius_2367) answered, that [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) should be kept at [Caesarea,](/place/caesarea_266) and that he himself would depart shortly _thither._

verseText: Let them therefore, said he, which among you are able, go down with me, and accuse this man, if there be any wickedness in him.
mdText: Let them therefore, said he, which among you are able, go down with _me,_ and accuse this man, if there be any wickedness in him.

verseText: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days, he went down unto Caesarea; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought.
mdText: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days, he went down unto [Caesarea;](/place/caesarea_266) and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) to be brought.

verseText: And when he was come, the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about, and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul, which they could not prove.
mdText: And when he was come, the Jews which came down from [Jerusalem](/place/jerusalem_636) stood round about, and laid many and grievous complaints against [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) which they could not prove.

verseText: While he answered for himself, Neither against the law of the Jews, neither against the temple, nor yet against Caesar, have I offended any thing at all.
mdText: While he answered for himself, Neither against the law of the Jews, neither against the temple, nor yet against Caesar, have I offended any thing at all.

verseText: But Festus, willing to do the Jews a pleasure, answered Paul, and said, Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these things before me?
mdText: But [Festus,]([/person/portius_2367) willing to do the Jews a pleasure, answered [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) and said, Wilt thou go up to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) and there be judged of these things before me?

verseText: Then said Paul, I stand at Caesar’s judgment seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou very well knowest.
mdText: Then said [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) I stand at Caesar’s judgment seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou very well knowest.

verseText: For if I be an offender, or have committed any thing worthy of death, I refuse not to die: but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me, no man may deliver me unto them. I appeal unto Caesar.
mdText: For if I be an offender, or have committed any thing worthy of death, I refuse not to die: but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me, no man may deliver me unto them. I appeal unto Caesar.

verseText: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, Hast thou appealed unto Caesar? unto Caesar shalt thou go.
mdText: Then [Festus,]([/person/portius_2367) when he had conferred with the council, answered, Hast thou appealed unto Caesar? unto Caesar shalt thou go.

verseText: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus.
mdText: And after certain days king [Agrippa]([/person/agrippa_111) and [Bernice]([/person/bernice_482) came unto [Caesarea](/place/caesarea_266) to salute [Festus.]([/person/portius_2367)

verseText: And when they had been there many days, Festus declared Paul’s cause unto the king, saying, There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix:
mdText: And when they had been there many days, [Festus]([/person/portius_2367) declared [Paul’s]([/person/paul_2479) cause unto the king, saying, There is a certain man left in bonds by [Felix:]([/person/felix_1257)

verseText: About whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, desiring to have judgment against him.
mdText: About whom, when I was at [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed _me,_ desiring _to_ _have_ judgment against him.

verseText: To whom I answered, It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die, before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face, and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him.
mdText: To whom I answered, It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die, before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face, and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him.

verseText: Therefore, when they were come hither, without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought forth.
mdText: Therefore, when they were come hither, without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought forth.

verseText: Against whom when the accusers stood up, they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed:
mdText: Against whom when the accusers stood up, they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed:

verseText: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition, and of one Jesus, which was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.
mdText: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition, and of one [Jesus,]([/person/jesus_905) which was dead, whom [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) affirmed to be alive.

verseText: And because I doubted of such manner of questions, I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these matters.
mdText: And because I doubted of such manner of questions, I asked _him_ whether he would go to [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) and there be judged of these matters.

verseText: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Caesar.
mdText: But when [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of [Augustus,]([/person/augustus_366) I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to [Caesar.](/place/caesarea_266)

verseText: Then Agrippa said unto Festus, I would also hear the man myself. To morrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.
mdText: Then [Agrippa]([/person/agrippa_111) said unto [Festus,]([/person/portius_2367) I would also hear the man myself. To morrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.

verseText: And on the morrow, when Agrippa was come, and Bernice, with great pomp, and was entered into the place of hearing, with the chief captains, and principal men of the city, at Festus’ commandment Paul was brought forth.
mdText: And on the morrow, when [Agrippa]([/person/agrippa_111) was come, and [Bernice,]([/person/bernice_482) with great pomp, and was entered into the place of hearing, with the chief captains, and principal men of the city, at Festus’ commandment [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) was brought forth.

verseText: And Festus said, King Agrippa, and all men which are here present with us, ye see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me, both at Jerusalem, and also here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.
mdText: And [Festus]([/person/portius_2367) said, King [Agrippa,]([/person/agrippa_111) and all men which are here present with us, ye see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me, both at [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) and _also_ here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.

verseText: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus, I have determined to send him.
mdText: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and that he himself hath appealed to [Augustus,]([/person/augustus_366) I have determined to send him.

verseText: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. Wherefore I have brought him forth before you, and specially before thee, O king Agrippa, that, after examination had, I might have somewhat to write.
mdText: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. Wherefore I have brought him forth before you, and specially before thee, O king [Agrippa,]([/person/agrippa_111) that, after examination had, I might have somewhat to write.

verseText: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner, and not withal to signify the crimes laid against him.
mdText: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner, and not withal to signify the crimes _laid_ against him.

verseText: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretched forth the hand, and answered for himself:
mdText: Then [Agrippa]([/person/agrippa_111) said unto [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) stretched forth the hand, and answered for himself:

verseText: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:
mdText: I think myself happy, king [Agrippa,]([/person/agrippa_111) because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:

verseText: Especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.
mdText: Especially _because_ _I_ _know_ thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.

verseText: My manner of life from my youth, which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem, know all the Jews;
mdText: My manner of life from my youth, which was at the first among mine own nation at [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) know all the Jews;

verseText: Which knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.
mdText: Which knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.

verseText: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers:
mdText: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of [God]([/person/god_1324) unto our fathers:

verseText: Unto which promise our twelve tribes, instantly serving God day and night, hope to come. For which hope’s sake, king Agrippa, I am accused of the Jews.
mdText: Unto which _promise_ our twelve tribes, instantly serving _[God]([/person/god_1324)_ day and night, hope to come. For which hope’s sake, king [Agrippa,]([/person/agrippa_111) I am accused of the Jews.

verseText: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that God should raise the dead?
mdText: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that [God]([/person/god_1324) should raise the dead?

verseText: I verily thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
mdText: I verily thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) of [Nazareth.](/place/nazareth_878)

verseText: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem: and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; and when they were put to death, I gave my voice against them.
mdText: Which thing I also did in [Jerusalem:](/place/jerusalem_636) and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; and when they were put to death, I gave my voice against _them._

verseText: And I punished them oft in every synagogue, and compelled them to blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted them even unto strange cities.
mdText: And I punished them oft in every synagogue, and compelled _them_ to blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted _them_ even unto strange cities.

verseText: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests,
mdText: Whereupon as I went to [Damascus](/place/damascus_322) with authority and commission from the chief priests,

verseText: At midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them which journeyed with me.
mdText: At midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them which journeyed with me.

verseText: And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew tongue, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
mdText: And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew tongue, [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) [Saul,]([/person/paul_2479) why persecutest thou me? _it_ _is_ hard for thee to kick against the pricks.

verseText: And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.
mdText: And I said, Who art thou, [Lord?]([/person/jesus_905) And he said, I am [Jesus]([/person/jesus_905) whom thou persecutest.

verseText: But rise, and stand upon thy feet: for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose, to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen, and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee;
mdText: But rise, and stand upon thy feet: for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose, to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen, and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee;

verseText: Delivering thee from the people, and from the Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee,
mdText: Delivering thee from the people, and _from_ the Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee,

verseText: To open their eyes, and to turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.
mdText: To open their eyes, _and_ to turn _them_ from darkness to light, and _from_ the power of [Satan]([/person/satan_2476) unto [God,]([/person/god_1324) that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.

verseText: Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:
mdText: Whereupon, O king [Agrippa,]([/person/agrippa_111) I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:

verseText: But shewed first unto them of Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the coasts of Judaea, and then to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, and do works meet for repentance.
mdText: But shewed first unto them of [Damascus,](/place/damascus_322) and at [Jerusalem,](/place/jerusalem_636) and throughout all the coasts of [Judaea,](/place/judea_657) and _then_ to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to [God,]([/person/god_1324) and do works meet for repentance.

verseText: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple, and went about to kill me.
mdText: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple, and went about to kill _me._

verseText: Having therefore obtained help of God, I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come:
mdText: Having therefore obtained help of [God,]([/person/god_1324) I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying none other things than those which the prophets and [Moses]([/person/moses_2108) did say should come:

verseText: That Christ should suffer, and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead, and should shew light unto the people, and to the Gentiles.
mdText: That [Christ]([/person/jesus_905) should suffer, _and_ that he should be the first that should rise from the dead, and should shew light unto the people, and to the Gentiles.

verseText: And as he thus spake for himself, Festus said with a loud voice, Paul, thou art beside thyself; much learning doth make thee mad.
mdText: And as he thus spake for himself, [Festus]([/person/portius_2367) said with a loud voice, [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) thou art beside thyself; much learning doth make thee mad.

verseText: But he said, I am not mad, most noble Festus; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness.
mdText: But he said, I am not mad, most noble [Festus;]([/person/portius_2367) but speak forth the words of truth and soberness.

verseText: For the king knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him; for this thing was not done in a corner.
mdText: For the king knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him; for this thing was not done in a corner.

verseText: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.
mdText: King [Agrippa,]([/person/agrippa_111) believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.

verseText: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian.
mdText: Then [Agrippa]([/person/agrippa_111) said unto [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian.

verseText: And Paul said, I would to God, that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, were both almost, and altogether such as I am, except these bonds.
mdText: And [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) said, I would to [God,]([/person/god_1324) that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, were both almost, and altogether such as I am, except these bonds.

verseText: And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:
mdText: And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and the governor, and [Bernice,]([/person/bernice_482) and they that sat with them:

verseText: And when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.
mdText: And when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.

verseText: Then said Agrippa unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Caesar.
mdText: Then said [Agrippa]([/person/agrippa_111) unto [Festus,]([/person/portius_2367) This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Caesar.

verseText: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius, a centurion of Augustus’ band.
mdText: And when it was determined that we should sail into [Italy,](/place/italy_601) they delivered [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) and certain other prisoners unto _one_ named [Julius,]([/person/julius_1763) a centurion of Augustus’ band.

verseText: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium, we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia; one Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.
mdText: And entering into a ship of [Adramyttium,](/place/adramyttium_29) we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of [Asia;](/place/asia_108) _one_ [Aristarchus,]([/person/aristarchus_306) a Macedonian of [Thessalonica,](/place/thessalonica_1158) being with us.

verseText: And the next day we touched at Sidon. And Julius courteously entreated Paul, and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself.
mdText: And the next _day_ we touched at [Sidon.](/place/sidon_1093) And [Julius]([/person/julius_1763) courteously entreated [Paul,]([/person/paul_2479) and gave _him_ liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself.

verseText: And when we had launched from thence, we sailed under Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.
mdText: And when we had launched from thence, we sailed under [Cyprus,](/place/cyprus_316) because the winds were contrary.

verseText: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.
mdText: And when we had sailed over the sea of [Cilicia](/place/cilicia_300) and [Pamphylia,](/place/pamphylia_918) we came to [Myra,](/place/myra_864) _a_ _city_ of [Lycia.](/place/lycia_740)

verseText: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy; and he put us therein.
mdText: And there the centurion found a ship of [Alexandria](/place/alexandria_46) sailing into [Italy;](/place/italy_601) and he put us therein.

verseText: And when we had sailed slowly many days, and scarce were come over against Cnidus, the wind not suffering us, we sailed under Crete, over against Salmone;
mdText: And when we had sailed slowly many days, and scarce were come over against [Cnidus,](/place/cnidus_304) the wind not suffering us, we sailed under [Crete,](/place/crete_310) over against [Salmone;](/place/salmone_1020)

verseText: And, hardly passing it, came unto a place which is called The fair havens; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea.
mdText: And, hardly passing it, came unto a place which is called The fair [havens;](/place/fair_havens_424) nigh whereunto was the city _of_ [Lasea.](/place/lasea_717)

verseText: Now when much time was spent, and when sailing was now dangerous, because the fast was now already past, Paul admonished them,
mdText: Now when much time was spent, and when sailing was now dangerous, because the fast was now already past, [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) admonished _them,_

verseText: And said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage, not only of the lading and ship, but also of our lives.
mdText: And said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage, not only of the lading and ship, but also of our lives.

verseText: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship, more than those things which were spoken by Paul.
mdText: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship, more than those things which were spoken by [Paul.]([/person/paul_2479)

verseText: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to depart thence also, if by any means they might attain to Phenice, and there to winter; which is an haven of Crete, and lieth toward the south west and north west.
mdText: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to depart thence also, if by any means they might attain to [Phenice,](/place/phenice_945) _and_ _there_ to winter; _which_ _is_ an haven of [Crete,](/place/crete_310) and lieth toward the south west and north west.

verseText: And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, loosing thence, they sailed close by Crete.
mdText: And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained _their_ purpose, loosing _thence,_ they sailed close by [Crete.](/place/crete_310)
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.
mdText: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: And when the ship was caught, and could not bear up into the wind, we let her drive.
mdText: And when the ship was caught, and could not bear up into the wind, we let _her_ drive.
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda, we had much work to come by the boat:
mdText: And running under a certain island which is called [Clauda,](/place/clauda_280) we had much work to come by the boat:
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: Which when they had taken up, they used helps, undergirding the ship; and, fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, strake sail, and so were driven.
mdText: Which when they had taken up, they used helps, undergirding the ship; and, fearing lest they should fall into the [quicksands,](/place/syrtis_1123) strake sail, and so were driven.
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the next day they lightened the ship;
mdText: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the next _day_ they lightened the ship;
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship.
mdText: And the third _day_ we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship.
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared, and no small tempest lay on us, all hope that we should be saved was then taken away.
mdText: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared, and no small tempest lay on _us,_ all hope that we should be saved was then taken away.
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have loosed from Crete, and to have gained this harm and loss.
mdText: But after long abstinence [Paul]([/person/paul_2479) stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have loosed from [Crete,](/place/crete_310) and to have gained this harm and loss.
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no loss of any man’s life among you, but of the ship.
mdText: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no loss of _any_ _man’s_ life among you, but of the ship.
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: For there stood by me this night the angel of God, whose I am, and whom I serve,
mdText: For there stood by me this night the angel of [God,]([/person/god_1324) whose I am, and whom I serve,
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: Saying, Fear not, Paul; thou must be brought before Caesar: and, lo, God hath given thee all them that sail with thee.
mdText: Saying, Fear not, [Paul;]([/person/paul_2479) thou must be brought before Caesar: and, lo, [God]([/person/god_1324) hath given thee all them that sail with thee.
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm

verseText: Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even as it was told me.
mdText: Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe [God,]([/person/god_1324) that it shall be even as it was told me.
eventsDescribed: Paul is shipwrecked by a storm
